column6: The best Peking Duck I've had in the city! Great food served with beautiful presentation.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

Everything was delicious!  We enjoyed a whole peking duck (served with duck soup), beef fried rice,  house fried rice, shredded beef noodle, deep fried mini buns and vegetable dry bean curd edamame.  The edamame appetizer was SO good!!!   The duck was one of the best I've had- nice thin pancakes and great presentation.    Our only complaint is that we weren't given the bones.   Mini buns tasted like freshly made funnel cake.  This place is definitely a must try.  Bathrooms are clean and servers are attentive.
Peking duck is amazing, and they offer many different serving sizes. However, I do wish when I order a whole dock, it could be cut table side.
No comment

This is a low key Chinese restaurant that serves the BEST Peking duck in the city. Everything we ordered are very good too. The place is clean and have a private dinning room with minimum spending requirement. Service is great. Highly recommended!

Authentic Chinese food with some interesting twist. One of the highlights was the fancy hand sanitizer. The duck was juicy but a bit cold. The lamb skewer was a bit chewy. Service could be improved but understand that they just opened recently.

Came here on New Year's day. Fantastic food! Had the Peking duck, beef skewers, beef stew with puff pastry, shrimp in mustard salad sauce (mayo). All were great! Staff are friendly and attentive but service a bit slow. Definitely coming back and recommending to everyone!
Very tasty.  Peking duck prepared perfectly.  Wish they would take reservations on weekends
No comment
No comment
Best pecking duck I've had in a long time. All the dishes are absolutely delicious and the prices are very fair. Would recommend over and over again
In general not bad. The source for Beijing duck tastes a bit weird to me. Ambiance is nice and service is good.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

Food was delivered late, it was ok, not great, beef was the same color as the chicken, ( was it veal or something else) lacked flavor , we had to doctor it up a bit with some soy sauce and sesame oil.

Solid spot for a weekday dinner. The ambiance is decent and service was great. The food was very tasty but portions ran a bit small. I'd def come back for this dish that reminds me of chicken pot pie meats Korean kalbijim

A very welcome addition to the culinary scene in the neighborhood. This was our second time in two weeks. I recommend going after the usual lunch crowd to avoid the crowd because the place is small and gets filled fast. The duck soup was excellent and really hit the spot. The Peking Duck was easily the star of the day. The Spicy Crispy Shrimp was quite good too. Service was fast and pleasant. A little pricey but well worth it. Was a little disappointed that they were out of the soup dumplings but I guess that gives us an excuse to come back another time.

This roast duck in Manhattan can be said to be the most authentic Beijing flavor. The pancake and roast duck are delicious after one bite. The crispness of beef ribs and the unique flavor of beef make people admire it. Other dishes are also very good. Next time, you will come again!
Absolutely ridiculous Peking duck. In fact, everything on the menu is outstanding. Go go go!

The Peking duck was amazing as well as the soup dumplings. The service was great as the food came out very quickly. We loved the unique, soapy volcano (not sure how else to describe it) which was meant for us to clean our hands.
Delicious food, particularly the beef ribs and the duck. Definitely recommend going there!

We've only been once but we were disappointed. Our smoked fish hors d'oeuvre ($13) was oddly sweet, bony and dried out. A fried chicken noodle dish had not much flavor and almost no chicken. Luckily, an order of pea shoots was delicious.
No comment
Good food and even better presentation. I was pleasantly surprised by how amazing the dessert looked.  Food, service and presentation was outstanding,   Five star from me
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had a great experience here a few weeks ago. First, make sure you make a reservation, because the wait seemed quite long when we got there for ours. The space is quite big and very nicely decorated, it almost makes it feel like a small village. There's a lot of attention to detail - from the design of the menu to the presentation of the dishes. Our server was friendly and attentive and helped us decide on what to order. We shared a bunch of dishes and very much enjoyed them all. Some of my favorites were Qianlong's Favorite Eel and the Steamed Yellow Croaker. I personally enjoyed trying some dishes I'd never had before and would definitely recommend checking it out!

No comment

My favorite Shanghainese restaurant town! I live the beautiful interior design and all the Chinese elements inside the restaurant. Great space and cozy seatings. There's usually a wait line but they always tell you the estimated wait time and you can leave the restaurant once you put your name + phone down. Food-wise I'm impressed. They've done a great job on food art and I love how they make sure most of the dishes are beautifully presented.

I hosted my birthday dinner here this weekend and it was an AWESOME experience. I had the private section for my party with 9 people total. I would say it fit 9 in a cozy way and more than that would've been too tight. We ordered a variety of foods and it was absolutely delicious! the soup dumplings, lo mein, and sliced pork were a hit! The staff was incredible and also extremely attentive. I have to call out the management, as they were extremely welcoming and even gave amazing desserts at the end. I would highly recommend this place for an event regardless of if you want to host a smaller or larger party. The team here will definitely take care of you and I was impressed with the food and interior. I will definitely come back again!!

No comment

I really wanted to like Cheli, especially given all the raving reviews I had heard from friends. Though the ambiance was incredible, I was not impressed by the food. The Longjing Shrimp was beautiful to look at with the dry ice but tasted so plain even with the sauce, while the Braised pork belly had pretty good flavor but wasn't anything too special. I will say that I generally enjoy dishes with stronger flavors, and that is just not usually the case for Shanghainese/Zhejiang cuisine.

No comment
Location and atmosphere was so nice. They offered great presentation as attached but food is average grade for me. Will try one more time.

this place is, what i would consider, pretty authentic! my favorite dish was the house special fish stew which was a numbing spice and also a little sour!! it was so good. we also got the braised pork belly but i thought it was just ok.
No comment

This was on my bucket list for my longest, and boy, am I glad I finally made it here. It was worth the wait. I am salivating thinking about the crab tofu, braised pork belly, garlic beans, and.... Drum roll... their soup dumplings! Everything was phenomenal so come with a big group, so you can try everything - duh, and a big appetite.

Absolutely fantastic experience with authentic atmosphere, knowledgeable and friendly service, and some of the best Szechuan Chinese food I've ever tasted. Weeks later, we're still talking about the food!

i love the Chinese food here so much, we order several dishes here. The food portion here is not large, but the tastes are excellent.
Great interior, excellent service, variety of choices, but not the best option regarding waiting time. The plates look nice but are expensive and not as delicious as expected.

The food was sooooo good. The squid was to die for, I highly recommend. Service was friendly and helpful. Overall restaurant ambiance was relaxing and quiet despite it being busy.

we had an amazing dinner here. service was phenomenal and the food was amazing. highly recommend making a reservation, we were seated right away. the food came out pretty fast. we tried the top recommended dishes and they did not disappoint. my favorite has to be the steamed prawns with glass noodles. the sauce was just divine, a lot of garlic but i love garlic. all the other dishes we tried were also exceptional; Qianlong 's Favorite Eel, braised pork, black Truffle Xiao. definitely coming back!
No comment

No comment
No comment

We tried a lot of different dishes since we had a big group, and it was nice that the menu had a wide range of dishes to choose from. My favorite was the braised pork belly that also came with quail eggs that had a soft yolk in the middle. We also got a shrimp dish that had beautiful plating with steam coming out of it, and the shrimp was nice and tender. The soup dumplings were good, but nothing super special about them. I felt like the price was a bit high for the portion of some of these dishes, but they were all really tasty and cooked well.
No comment

I arrived on a Sunday with a friend and we were able to get seated without reservation. The restaurant is quite big and most people seem to come here with bigger groups. If you only have a party of two, you might end up sitting by the windows, which has good lighting. The place is on the pricier side and my friend and I ordered their longjing shrimp, xiao long bao (truffle), house special fish stew, and stir fried water spinach. Their longjing shrimp was really unique and it was cool seeing the smoke come out. The xiao long bao was pretty decent. The portions for the stir fried water spinach was actually rather small but it was so good. Meanwhile, the fish stew was huge and we had to take it to go. Overall, the restaurant is doing a great job in how they present the food and the food is delicious!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came back with a larger party of 10. The staff and food were amazing! The waiter was super helpful and immediately got comfy with us which always makes the eating experience more pleasurable. My father who is like the pickiest child you have ever encountered wouldnt eat anything until he saw how much we were all raving and even he started to eat the scrumptious meals. This time around we ordered just about the whole menu trying new dishes. I'm hoping this is my new regular spot and hope to keep accompanying people here for yummy meals :)
No comment

Cheli is a little overrated. For a Friday night we had around a 2 hour wait so try to get there earlier or make a reservation for a weekday! All the food was pretty good and there's definitely a good amount of both Sichuan and Shanghainese type dishes but it's definitely a little overpriced for what you get.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had a few pretty stand out dishes in the pork belly and the house special eel. Found the XLB and the fish to be solid as well. We liked the yunnan beef ans the prawns and the golden fried rice and some of the veggie dishes but they weren't standouts. Service was good but docked a star as we were a group of 7, spent about $50 per person and left still a bit hungry
No comment
No comment

Came here for lunch on a weekday afternoon and there was no wait. The dishes were expensive considering how small each of them were. Between the two of us, we ordered four dishes and still wasn't full. Our favorites were the drunken chicken and spicy beef.
No comment

We got Sweet n' sour short pork ribs, longjing shrimp, snow pea shoots, and xiao long bao with crab meat. We got sour plum drink and pear drink as well. The presentation of longjing shrimp is amazing! The dry ice made it look really nice. I recommend all the dishes! It's actually one of the better Shanghainese restaurant I have been to in NYC!! It's always packed!! Super hard to get a table. Recommendation is put name down on waitlist as early as possible.
No comment
No comment

Oh. My. Goodness! This is the best ever Shanghainese restaurant I've ever tried. Kind of a long wait time but the servers did mention that and they were very attentive and kind. A little loud inside and once we got out the smell of the food is stuck in our shirts, but it was all worth it. We spent around $80 bucks and we are very willing to spent that much again. 10/10 !!!
No comment

In love with this place. The atmosphere in here takes you back to ancient China. I recommend their wine-soaked chicken. It's very flavorful and have a strong cooking wine taste. The sweet and sour short pork ribs is also very good, but I just wish the portion size could have been bigger for the price. I would recommend the mixed flavor cony meat if you like spicy food. I liked their white rice (perfectly cook, easy to digest). I finished the whole bowl myself!
No comment

The aesthetics at this place is AMAZING. I love the Asian theme, Chinese music and the menu is like a Chinese book! The food was fantastic. We got the fried fillet with sweet and sour sauce, snow peas and a dessert  (date stuffed with sticky rice). All of it was yummy!! I want to come back to try other items on the menu.

Soooo yum! Came with a group of 5 and was so impressed by the quality of the food and service. My favorite dishes were the Wine Soaked Chicken and Braised Pork Belly. The Wine Soaked Chicken portion is very generous and the wine isn't too salty or overpowering. The Braised Pork Belly has a perfectly sweet and savory sauce and I loved the quail eggs with it. I also enjoyed the Shanghai Style Fried Noodles. When it first came out, it looked just like any other typical "chow mein" you could get at a quick to-go Chinese spot, but the sauce/oil is actually super fragrant and I liked it a lot. Our server was so sweet and funny as well and definitely added to the overall experience. For sure will come back soon!
Really nice food and environment. Really authentic Chinese/ Zhejiang food. Would 100% recommend.
No comment

Everything was so delicious and authentic. I was so hungry and I couldn't wait to order. I especially loved the soup dumplings. They had lots of flavor and were very fresh. I really wanted to try the duck but they didn't have it when I went. Our servers were excellent, they took care of us well and helped us serve the soups that we got. We came here twice because it was so good. Nice presentation and very authentic flavor. Also great location with lots of other Asian food nearby. Definitely a great dining experience at CHELI

I wanted to love this place as I love spiced fried chicken. It is spiced but chicken is not moist. Always crowded so maybe it was a bad day. Nice staff

Excellent! Wonderful staff & excellent food. Great location, and cozy seating. Would go back. Suggest the crab soup dumplings!

I got scam. Very funny. I laughed. Gotta be kidding me!!!!!!!!  Photo attached. Called the restaurant never give any solutions.
Great food and ambiance and service! Highly recommend, but go early to score a table.

Delicious Shanghainese/Zhejiang cuisine! Standout dishes were the eel, longjing shrimp, and smoked fish. The interior decor is very fitting as well. Only downside is that I wish they had more chinese liquor options. This kind of food is best with chinese white liquor... not beer or wine.

TIP- Worth the wait. Get in early if you can! It's no joke. Everything is good- only catch: they run out of a lot of the menu by late afternoon, early evening. Now moving on to the goodies- smoked fish, mushroom tea rice, eggplant with garlic sauce, sticky rice cake (dessert)! That's all I've tried so far and every one of those, I'd get again in a heartbeat. Reservations are only for 6 people and up btw.

No comment

My ALL TIME favorite Shanghainese place in the city. The xiao long bao was relatively soupy and the skin was perfect. I would definitelt recommend the crab flavor xlb! The pork belly with quail eggs were so delicious. Perfectly soft and savory, but with a hint of sweetness. The duck was also super soft and tasty! Finished off the meal with an osmanthus dessert - the flavor was super light and cleansing while also having a mochi like texture. I probably come here once a month

Overall the food is amazing. I would highly recommend you try it out if you are interested in Shanghainese food. For dessert, my favorite is the osmanthjs rice cakes. They come in three pieces and had the perfect amount of sweetness. For entrees, I would recommend steamed yellow croaker and Qianlong's favorite eel.  A couple things I wish they had done better on: the duck blood in Mao Xue Wang was terrible (they probably used the frozen ones). For some dishes, the serving size appeared to be large but it was actually just a huge bowl of broth with little actual food.

The food was very, very good and the vibe is on point -- but the real stand out was the service. It was excellent -- the menu is a bit overwhelming at first but our waiter walked through it very well and asked us about our tastes to help guide us. And all of the suggestions were on point.
As a shangahinese, I don't think the food is the typical jiangnan food. The service is bad and food delivery is slow compared with other Chinese restaurant.

If I could leave negative stars I would. The sole positive thing I will say, is that the food was enjoyable, not mind blowing, but enjoyable. That is where the positive review starts and stops. Now for the experience: truly terrible. Not only were we made to wait nearly 3 hours (yes, hours) for a table, but we were made to do so as we watched parties that arrived after us get seated (no, they did not have reservations either). As if this wasn't bad enough, we were rushed out of the restaurant 30 minutes after being seated as "the chef was going home" 1 hour and 30 minutes before the posted closing time. The icing on the cake however, was that although we left a 15% tip on a $200+ bill, the waitress had the audacity to return to our table and demand more tip money (yes, demand). So no, I would not recommend this place, and no I would not go again.
They asked for service dog identification which is against the law. Managers rules above the law apparently.

Just delicious. The spicy lobster, the wine soaked chicken, the Hunan sliced beef, the sponge gourd, etc etc. One of my favorite places in the city!!
No comment
Best Chinese food in town! Delicious food, great service, and interesting desert selections
No comment
Great place for some classic authentic Chinese food! We had to wait on a MONDAY, but it was totally worth it
Portions are way small, there is no rice that comes up the steak and fish we ordered, instead, they  charge extra $3 for a bowl of rice, which is unexpected in Chinese restaurant.

Long and terrible waiting time. They keep telling you the table is almost ready, but in reality, you wait for an hour like a fool. Overpriced food and definitely don't worth the waiting. Won't recommend it.
Amazing food, great atmosphere, superb service.  Felt a thousand miles away when I came inside.  Just great.
They are small portion but very yummy. On weekend, you need to be there before 4:30 to avoid waiting in the line.
This is what happens every morning.  I feel nauseous every morning with a terrible stench.  The hygiene and moral level of this restaurant are unfortunately low. Isn't this illegal disposal?

No comment

This restaurant came highly recommended during my most recent trip to NY for my cousin's bachelorette. Thankfully we were able to make a reservation for our large party of 9 at 5pm. We called to try to push back the reservation on the day of but they were already fully booked. When we arrived for our reservation, the restaurant was packed. The ambiance was amazing. The decor truly made me feel like I entered Asia. We ordered several dishes to try family style, including: braised pork belly, eggplant in garlic sauce, wine - soaked chicken, fried sliced pumpkin w/ duck egg yolk, shanghai style fried noodle, Xiao long bao, and so much more. These are just some of my favorites. This was the best meal of the trip and I will definitely be back.

The most excellent Chinese south restaurant I have tried in the U.S. The food is really Chinese taste. Not as orange chicken and other American Chinese food. It's totally 99.9% very traditional Chinese food. Because some food is difficult to get in the US, so they very difficult to maintain Chinese taste. They did very very perfect job!!!
Overpriced, overhyped, overrated. Half-full and not sure how I dropped nearly $100. Pass.
No comment

Stayed in Queens, NY (Flushing- Chinatown) before heading back to San Diego and found this gem of a place. This place was open til' 11p on Sunday and the staff is real helpful and friendly. The food was amazing along with the sake. Also, get the dish that comes wrapped in foil sitting on a plate of alcohol. They light it on fire as it makes the beef sizzle and steam is noticable. I highly recommend this establishment if ever in NY or Queens area.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: probably the most authentic East China cuisine in NYC! Feel like home! Reasonable price too

The food here is excellent.  The sine soaked chicken (though very bony) the eel, kidney, frog legs, Song Dynasty steam bun, and xiao Long bao were all very good as was the service.  We tried the yellow wine which was a bit like sake.  Total meal was about $70 per person.  Expect long lines, except if you arrive between 3-6 pm or around 11:30.

Cheli has a Chinese fine dinning setup but with a  very reasonable price. Their aesthetics represents the typical water towns in Southern China. The dishes are not only presentable but truly delicious and authentic. We had the LongJing shrimp, Qian Long's fav eel, smoked fish, mushroom braised rice, water spinach, and crab soup dumpling xiao long bao. Each and every dishes were so good, and the eel, smoked fish and soup dumpling even exceeded our high expectations. We were impressed by the meal and convinced that the long wait time (~2hrs on a Sunday night) was totally worth it. We will certainly come back for more flavorful surprises.

This is one of the best Chinese restaurants I've ever been to in NYC and one of the best meals I've had recently. The dishes are really good bang for your buck, they're aesthetically BEAUTIFUL, and the flavors are on point. The decor of the restaurant is lovely and plating is exquisite. Extensive menu (made with rice paper??) that has really unique and interesting dishes. I wish I knew about this place earlier - would definitely go back so I can try other menu items!
No comment
Great service, great food, great environment, highly recommend! Everything we ordered is excellent! Waited 1hr to get in. Will go back.
No comment

No comment
No comment
The food is spicy,Tofu is recommended, and the taste is unique.If you like spicy food, I will try it with the recommendation. Maybe you will like it here.
No comment
I am so obsessed with this place its authentic shanghainese food to the max and the employees are great! Our waitress was a grade A comedian and was also very helpful!

The wait was 2 hours and this business does not know how to turn business around. For a party of five we have waited 2.5 hours when told only an hour. Other clients were just so called "chilling" my question is: do you even turn the tables and make extra business? The wait is not worth it to be honest
Great authentic Shanghainese food. The decor inside is like traditional China. The menu is very creative. One star off because the seats are very very uncomfortable (they tried too hard in this one).
No comment
This place is amazing. The decor is exquisite. Every dish I had there was delicious. The pork liver with clam was superb. Pork intestine with chicken was also great.
Dirty, food never came, no service and bad attitude!!! Wasted 1hour of my time. Don't come here!

Great atmosphere with interesting Chinese local decor. Love their dishes especially the Longjjng shrimp, Yang Zhou meat ball and smoked fish. Homemade dim sums are delicious. I love their sticky rice cakes. Service is good. A perfect place to have meals with friends!

Yummy and beautifully presented food, great service and cosy atmosphere. Our large group enjoyed every bite. Crab, fish, veggies, shrimp-everything was good. We also loved the rice wine and the lovely dessert. I'll be back!
No comment

Great Shanghainese restaurant .   Most of the dishes are authenticate shanghai style dishes.  Some Sichuan dishes also on the menu.  Taste is very close to what would been served in Shanghai. Thumbs up.
Amazing food, atmosphere and service! The only complaint is the wait time and can't make reservation. But will be smarter at timing next time we go.

Really wonderful! The decorations, the taste of dishes, the music are all wonderful! My family had been there twice in 2 days during traveling. The same taste as in China. If you hope to try original South Chinese food, you should try this restaurant. I strongly introduce you, and you will not feel disappointed.

As a native Shanghainese, I can vouch that this is one of be best Shanghainese food I've had on the east coast. Some of the dishes remind me of my grandma's cooking. The service was great as well. Highly recommend!
No comment

So! Good! Arrived on the early side, a little before 5, which was perfect for securing a table before the rush really hit around 5:30. Started with the original Xiao long bao (4 total, pork filled) and the fried sticky rice pancake (peanut and brown sugar filling). Both were delicious! The bao brought the more savory flavors, with a unique and tasty sweetness from the rice pancakes with peanuts and sugar (these came in the form of 6 good sized pieces). Even the tea they bring at the start of the meal is lovely--it has an airy, refreshing, soothing quality that was wonderful to have before, during, and after eating. After the dim sum, I got the puer tea soaked rice with sea urchin. It was perfection. There was a lightness yet warmth/hominess to the dish that was incredibly satisfying. I've never tasted something quite like it, and each element of the dish was great and worked together to create a perfect bite with each spoonful. The service was efficient and staff were all helpful and kind. Making this a must visit each time I come to NYC going forward!

Happened upon Cheli after going to two places that were closed... thank god we did! The decor is so beautiful, and really makes me miss China. We waited 30 minutes for a table of 2 around 9:15pm. Service was wonderful, and we were served delicious green tea to start. Our orders were the Wine Soaked Chicken, Braised Pork Belly, and Xiao Long Bao. The Wine Soaked Chicken was a delicious cold appetizer; salty and ever so slightly sweet. The belly in the Braised Pork Belly was cooked to perfection, and I loved how the quail eggs soaked up some of the flavor of the sweet red sugar sauce so it was like 茶鸡蛋. I was a surprised by how good the soup dumplings were! Definitely better than some other very popular names in Manhattan. I hope this place gets more popular!

There's a charming tea house ambiance in this bustling restaurant. Large and small groups streamed in pretty much nonstop during the two hours we dined here. The amuse bouche gourd pickles and soy beans dressed in light sesame oil had a pleasant crunch. The xiaolung bao's skin was delicate and the soup filling, flavorful. Next to arrive was the urchin rice in pu-erh tea, which was surprisingly mild in flavor and a good contrast to the sweetly flavored smoked fish. The vegetable medley called Moonlight included asparagus, lotus root, carrots, and wood ear mushrooms. Our final dish was braised eel, scallions and cucumbers to wrap up mushu style in thin rice pancakes. The pancakes were problematic because they were too thin and brittle to use without tearing. Overall we enjoyed this restaurant and will return to try other dishes. One point off because of slow seating after we were called and slow bringing of the check after we requested it.

As someone born and raised in Shanghai I have somewhat of a high standard of Shanghainese cuisine. I had yet to find a decent Shanghainese restaurant in North America and was skeptical about this one, but decided to give it a try when we walked by. And it wow'ed me. The interior decor, service, presentation and taste of the dishes were top notch even for NYC standard. I've gone back for 5 times, and my must orders are: wine soaked chicken, wine soaked crab, cold fish, kaofu, long jing shrimp, stir fry beef, braised rice, and 3 crisp/glutinous dessert. This place is the best representation of Shanghainese cuisine. 精致，you know what I mean?  Forget about the greasy fried noodles and rice (from the alley ahem), try some real authentic shanghainese food yall
We need more Chinese restaurants like this. Modern, clean and authentic. So many choices yet every one of them are still very delicious. Great service too.

Asparagus in the Moonlight (荷塘小炒--mixed vegetables) was not fresh, yellow in color, tough to chew, and whole dish was just tasteless, good thing the serving size is so small because I couldn't eat more. Unfortunately that means it is over priced. The braised pork belly has only a few pieces of meat which was overwhelmed by the sweetness with a little sticky gooey sauce.
No comment
Very authentic Chinese food and great decor. Would recommend and go back.  Loved the fried rice cake.

I loved the interior design in this place. The wait time for my table of 3 was only 10 minutes and the food was great. I think the soup dumplings could be better in terms of the flavors within - I couldn't quite pinpoint what was missing in it but it could definitely be better with a tinge of something. Loved their chicken soup though! Tasted just like home~

If you want truly authentic Shanghainese cuisine, then look no further than Cheli. I am writing this review after eating here for the fifth time, and every time my experience has been wonderful. The dishes are truly authentic and taste as good if not better than what I have had in Shanghai. Notable dishes include the xiao long bao, wine soaked chicken, and the fried eel. The xiao long bao is by far the best xiao long bao I have had in America. It blows din tai fung's attempts out of the water. The wine soaked chicken is incredibly flavorful and is not lacking in alcohol taste. Finally the fried eel came as a bit of a surprise but the crunchiness of the eel makes the dish great. One dish that might be overhyped though the the red braised pork belly. When I ordered it, the dish came out a little bitter as if they had burned the sugar when cooking it. Other than that though Che Li is probably the one of the most authentic Shanghainese spots in Manhattan and is definitely worth a try. Just make sure you go early as there is always a line during lunch and dinner hours.
No comment
The restaurant is an authentic and great place to stop bye for lunch. All the servers are kind. The service was very good. The best part was the food obviously.

the atmosphere is good but the wait time is insane. i came here on a saturday and they're supposed to open at 11:30am but employees showed up at 12:30pm. we had to wait over 1 hr and people were seated in no particular order

Outstanding meal and exceptional hospitality! When we dined here we had Jason serve us and he explained his personal favorite dishes and recommended us a beer. You can tell the restaurant cares about the customer's experience as they never push you to order more than you need to; they want you to have a great meal and a great time.

Over-priced and very small portions.  We had the steamed fish with wine which was $32 but the fish was very small and not much to eat.  The music was loud and we had to yell over the music.  we asked them to turn it down a little but they did nothing.

Came here for dinner, service was amazing.  Also the food was great! We enjoy everything we ordered.  Everything was very flavorful and tasty.  My favorite was the tofu with uni dish, also the smoked fish was very good.
No comment

I highly recommend people who want to have authentic Shanghainese food in US, to give a try at this restaurant. I cannot vouch for every dish in this place being great but I have to say the ones we tried were not disappointed. We ordered wine-soaked chicken (although I wish chicken was little bit tender), smoked fish, spicy sliced pork kidney (Never had this in Shanghai), braised pork belly, LongJing shrimp (EXCELLENT), QianLong's favorite eel (First, ate eel this way. I still prefer the traditional way of Shanghainese cooking), PuEr tea soaked rice with sea urchin, Xiao Long bao with crab meat, snow pea shoots with Chinese liquor sauce, sweet osmanthus rice cake, and MeiLing congee. Of course we had the leftovers but I still wished to try more. I will definitely come back to this place again and again. One word of caution: I heard that there was always a long wait during the regular dinner time. So either come here for lunch or early for dinner. The restaurant is not very big but I really love their decoration.

Lived up to the hype on New York Times and the New Yorker! Since we can go to China these days, this place delivers an amazing taste ... and feel... of home. The decor is nostalgic and trendy all at once, and the service is impeccable. I've always wondered why so many Chinese restaurants in NYC don't match the standards of hospitality in China, but this place finally does. Food was also very authentic (no brown sauce!) And tasty. Standouts in my opinion we're the XLB, smoked duck app (be prepared for authenticity - bones) lion's head meatball, and the green beans with house shrimp paste was a sleeper hit! Will definitely be back to try more of the menu.
The food was amazing and our waitress was very funny and engaging. Loved the atmosphere! The only negative is the reservation system (we almost didn't get seated!)

One of the best Chinese restaurants I've been to in a long time, extremely authentic.  I am very picky and they made every dish perfectly, would not change a thing.  Five star food and service.  Worthy of a "last supper"
A restaurant that has pretty good authentic Shanghainese food, nicely decorated in a old world style, hard to read menu and terrible service. Many items on the menu were out, not great experience.

Very tasty and well-crafted menu as well as interior decor. I do find their music a bit too much--probably too orientalist for a metropolitan like New York. I do think they can calm down a bit with their soundtrack. Anyway, I went there with five other friends and order a variety of food, and none of us is disappointed. The portion is a bit small, though. And definitely don't order steamed dishes during lunch. We did, and we are noticed that since this is their first steamed dish during the day it takes extra time. We ended up waiting for an hour for one dish to come--and it's not good. Don't ever order the yellow croak with meat patty thing.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Food was good and a bit better in quality, however, its a bit pricy. Definitely a must try if you're looking for something with a wide variety. Would not recommend getting any of the uni dishes. They only give 1 small piece for the price of 5 pieces if you were to get it in a store.

This is the most disrespectful restaurant I have ever experienced. My party of 4 showed up at 6:40 requesting a table, they said the wait will be 1-1.5 hrs, so we put our names down and waited just like everyone else. This 1.5 hr wait turned into 3 hrs long. After calmly approaching the front desk asking how much longer for our table they said, "you are the next table to be seated." We yet again, patiently waited an additional 25 minutes while watching 2 other parties get seated at a table of 4 in-front of us. Unfortunately, this is not where it ended. We FINALLY get seated, and order several plates of food including a bottle of wine.Throughout us eating our dinner we were given our ticket right after the food was provided as they mentioned they were closing in the next 30 minutes, giving us only about 20 minutes more to eat our meal.. so, we pay, leave a generous tip (although the service and wait time at this point was garbage). THEN, moments later, a waitress approaches our table as we are wrapping up our meal aggressively demanding us to leave more money in a tip after we have already given 15%.. Due to this woman's aggression and behavior we left an additional and might I add very generous tip in cash because her behavior was astonishing. I am appalled at the service of this restaurant and the behavior of its employees. I do not recommend eating here unless you want to be disrespected. That's all.
Very poor service. We ordered 3 courses, it took them 45 mins to server them. I basically don't see an waiter around our table.

The most authentic Zhejiang cuisine I've had in the States!  We were a big group of 6 people and got to try many different dishes, all of which were really really delicious!  My favorites ones include the wine soaked chicken, steamed yellow fish, sweet and sour ribs, and soy sauce fried rice.  We also tried three different types of house made drinks and liked them all. Highly recommended!

Go back in time but at st marks this time around. Prob the best interior decor on st marks. Shanghai dishes are on the sweeter side.  Presentation is cute, thoughtful. Service is excellent, but seems bit awkward at times. If around the area maybe its a nice cozy spot for a nice lunch. But thats about it.

Great atmosphere. It felt like I got transformed to an old time kung fu movie. I thought only the decor was great but the food doesn't dissapoint. All 6 of us love every single dish and will absolutely come back. We ordered the sliced chicken, the spare ribs, the mixed vegetables and the 1/2 duck for apps. We ordered 2 crab xia long pao, a triple crisp, a triple soap for dim sum. For entree, we got braised pork belly, longqian shrimp, crispy eel, stew tofu with sea urchin and water spinach as the vegetables. Price is affordable and very worthy. Thank you for an amazing experience.

Food was tasty but very overpriced. The interior and even the menu looks traditional and pretty cool. Had the pork belly and black truffle xiaolongbao-the pork belly has an amazing consistency and the xiaolongbaos were actually quite small.

Overall the experience of dining here was okay, but not great. I went at 5:45pm and was seated immediately after the hostess checked my ID and vaccination card. The restaurant was clean and ambiance was good, however, the menu was quite disappointing. It is not the easiest to read and offers no pictures. Not only that but, many things on the menu was not available (ie. wine soaked chicken, wine soaked Atlantic blue crab, moonlight vegetable stir fry...) it was very disappointing to hear that most of the things I wanted to order were not available, especially at 5:45pm being quite early for dinner service. I ended up getting 1) stir fried water spinach ($14), 2) beef stew with pickled cabbage and chili (we couldn't even find it on the menu and ordered through a google picture), 3) seasoned half duck ($18) - honestly I would say stead clear of the duck, it was almost meatless and very tough to chew, also portion size looks much smaller than picture. For the price, I recommend going elsewhere.

NYTimes wrote an article that mentioned Cheli and it looked amazing, but we were very disappointed. We ordered almost all the specials, but they were generally underwhelming. The only noteworthy dishes were the Braised Pork Belly & Puer Tea Soaked Rice with Sea Urchin. Also the wine-soaked chicken was basically inedible since it was super tough. When we mentioned this to our server, they said it was old chicken & supposed to be tough. This should have been mentioned when we ordered. Overall we were in NYC for 5 nights and this was our worst meal of the trip.
Mundane taste, extraordinarily long wait time, very small volume of dishes and quite expensive. Not worthy.
A perfect dining experience: nostalgic ambience, tasty and creative food, friendly and attentive service! Everything we had was amazing. Every detail is being taken care of.

column3: マンハッタン, New York, NY
column6: I've ever had this type of food before, but the first time tried in nyc but really liked. The taste is authentic. The whole restaurant is like an ancient old town, feels like back to hundred years ago. Ver
No comment
Authentic dishes from my hometown area, Jiangsu-Zhejiang-Shanghai. Sophisticated cooking, presentation, and decor. It's the best Chinese restaurant in New York City, hands down.
Amazing food like: shrimp, soup dumplings, and lovely Chinese wine. For a difficult time like 2020, it is great to see new food and style in the market.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Pretty good food but super slow service. Nice decor inside!

The best Shanghainese food in US so far. Visited five times during my seven weeks staying in New York this spring. Great food, service, ambience just like eating in Shanghai should be. The quality standard is definitely chef's standard- not ordinary home cooked- many dishes I would recommend. Tasted all sweets and all appetizers- all are very good!

Tucked away on the second floor of St Marks, this restaurant has a nondescript entrance. But what a find! Beautiful decor, great service, and delicious (non-Americanized) food! We had a birthday lunch here and the staff were gracious with us taking time to enjoy the food and chitchat. I particularly liked the sweet/ sour fish and the duck with hoisin sauce.

Wait for very long time! They let others jump in the line. They told me I would wait for 30-40 min. However, I actually waited for more than 1 hour. I checked several times with waitress on how long I would wait. They just told me to wait!! Already get very upset before start to eat. Very very disappointing experience.
The food is sooooo good here! The plating is exceptional too! There are very few places that I dream of constantly coming back with new friends and brag about the gem I found. This is one of them.
The food is good. Atmosphere is ok. Staff is friendly definitely a good place to have zhejiang food

Hands down the best and most authentic Shanghainese food in NYC.  Very refined.  The service was amazing and given the quality and the ingredients of the dishes, the food at Cheli is reasonably priced.  Loved the pork belly with abalone, the west lake fish, the soup dumplings and the chicken lettuce wrap.  I wish we could have ordered more dishes (like the sweet and sour eel and the shrimp), but it was just the two of us.  Will definitely be back to try more dishes!

Came here for a late Sunday lunch. We had an excellent meal. The interior design and decor are beautiful, the design team out a lot of work into the small details, from the serving pieces, to the lighting and artwork. The food was good and reasonably priced, we got the Xiao long bao, braised rice and green peppers, and braised porkbelly and had a really good meal.
amazing amazing chinese food. come eat here and be happy. we ordered the xiao long bao which were plump and juicy, as well as the braised pork belly which was delicious.

All about impressions but it's actually inauthentic and overhyped thanks to a well written NYTimes review by someone who didn't grow up eating Chinese and knows the cuisines. This idea of being authentic might come from its decor that reminds me of how out of the way restaurants would go to look as Chinese as possible to cater to non Asians. It is pretty. The fancy menu options that outsiders will assume is authentic because "just fake it til you make it" works I guess. As I said impressions. Now the Xiao Long Baos were really good but the menu was all over the place. One beef plate resembled a Sichuan style dish and had an abundance of garlic. Chicken bits with rice pieces and lettuce wrap is the chef's own creation possibly inspired by PF Chang's. My review isn't as charming as The NY Times but it's real. I was appalled at the idea of pairing "triple sweet" with some delicacy my friends were all trying to guess what it was which i recognized from tasting - coconut creme. Totally incompatible. And the other dessert we ordered turned out to be... *drums rolling* .. congee. Plain congee. The stuff Chinese eat for breakfast or when they're sick. I consider this restaurant more fusion than authentic. The service was fine and taste of food was decent but not worth the price.
Went there for lunch last weekend. Superb service, exquisite plating, terrible food quality. My friend had abdominal pain after eating the shrimps, heard a customer got food poisoning.
As a shanghainese I think this is the best Xiao long bao I've had in Manhattan. Everything was good! Would highly recoo

Very nice environment - traditional Asian style design. Mostly serve (Jiangzhe taste) Chinese food such as wine crab, Xiao Long Bao, pork belly, steamed croaker (fish). You can also see some spicy Sichuan style cuisine. Food are tasteful and some of them are special that we tried first time. Service is sooooo good! Personnel is friendly and nice, thank you! in general, we liked it!
Love the restaurant interior, the food is SO good, and service is great. Can't wait to come back
Heard people got food poisoning but still had a try. Okay food but awful service. It'll be difficult to survive by having ignorant staff serve your customers.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really cute and delicious Busan cuisine! The raw scallops and the sea urchin dol sap were my favorite. Definitely a must try! I do wish the portions were larger because of how these dishes were priced but overall was satisfied. Service was great as well!

column6: No comment

This tapas style restaurant was absolutely divine. While the dishes doesn't necessarily remind me of busan, each plate was so good and bursting with flavor. The beef tartare had fried onions and chewy baby octopus bits with a sesame sauce. My favorite was the pork soup and glazed eel. The soup was comforting and the meat was so tender, perfect with some white rice. The glazed eel was crispy, spicy, and sweet but watch out for the little bones inside. I wish there were more avails for reservations because it takes about 3 weeks to get a table that's not at 9 or 10pm.
No comment

I really like the vintage yet modern feel of this restaurant. I was really hyped to come here after seeing it everywhere on social media. It definitely did not disappoint! We got the scallop diy gimbap to start and it tasted so fresh and I loved the apple kimchi that went with it. We also got the yook hwe and the flavors were great but the portion was so tiny. The dol sot al bap was good but I probably wouldn't get again. The spicy pork and squid was great, super tender pork and crispy squid paired together was amazing. Overall I think their food is really tasty and really fresh. However, my only complaint is that the portion sizes are pretty small for the price you're paying. I would go with a larger group next time so that I can try more dishes!

I made reservations about a week before I came. I liked the dolsot which is creamy rice with fish roe and the corn creme brûlée dessert. I thought that the eel eggplant was good but it was too fried for my taste. The portions are on the small side for the price. They also give a complimentary salad. I would recommend the corn creme brûlée the most. The service is great and it's a small restaurant with a dark ambiance. I could see why this place has four stars because of the uniqueness of the food and the service is good, but the food is not extraordinary.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The service is exceptionally friendly. The dishes came out at lightning speed. There were no misses in anything we ordered. The decor really does remind me of a hometown restaurant in Korea. Chefs kiss to this new addition to EV! I would gladly come back for more.
No comment
No comment

Ariari is a new staple restaurant that features Korean food from the Busan region. I loved everything I ate here! The seafood soup was soothing and reminded me of a home cooked meal. My favorites of the night were probably the seafood pancake and soft shell crab. I know you can't really go wrong with seafood pancake but it was extra fresh, fluffy and crispy here. The soft shell crab was light and airy, paired perfectly with the sauce. I also recommend getting the octopus as a starter because it was refreshing. I would probably skip the sea urchin cream bibimbap next time, I found it lacking in flavor. For drinks, I got the Maesil (more fruity) and my boyfriend got the Gochugaru (like a spicy marg). We both loved it! Service was great as well and I'll definitely be back to try more things on the menu.
No comment

Be sure to make a reservation if you want to try this place out! My friend and I came right when they opened at 5 as walk-in customers and they only had a table open for 45 min before the next reservation so we really hurried through the whole meal. Despite that though, the staff were all very attentive and all the food we ordered came out so fast - we were shocked by the speed! Food was delicious and I'm a huge fan of the mak-hwe and yook-hwe. My friend and I hope to come back again one day for a slowed down meal and really enjoy the drinks and food!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

Ariari definitely lives up to its hype. Stellar service and good ambiance, they played old kpop songs which brought me back to my childhood. Food is also great of course. We ordered fried soft shell, beef soup, egg dol sot and scallop DIY roll. My favorite was the egg dol sot and scallop roll. It was so fresh. I would definitely come back to try out other dishes as well. It is a tapas place so per person, it was recommended to order 2 dishes which adds up $$$ but honestly it was worth the price.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I will dream about the fried chicken here every night from here on out  so glad we happened to get a table because we didn't have a reservation, but we figured we would ask. Every dish was divine, but my favorites were the fried chicken, seafood soup, and raw fish appetizer over ice. Cocktails were great too! A gem, anyone who loves seafood/Korean food should give it a try!
No comment

No comment

My friend made a Thursday night dinner reservation for ARIARI after seeing the dolsot al-bap dish on TikTok (lol), but I was happy to join after hearing it was from the team behind Palpal and LittleMad (both delicious!). Stepping through the door, I was instantly transported out of East Village and onto a train to Busan - the brown leather chairs, dark-wood wall paneling, and narrow street-facing window were clever design touches that created a handsome vintage vibe. With Busan-inspired seafood food I had never encountered, every single dish we ordered was uniquely umami and strikingly sharp. I loved the mak-hwe, which was thinly sliced raw fish (amberjack, yellowtail that night) served as ssambap lettuce wraps. We also ordered the lotus root salad, salmon hwe-muchim, spicy pork with fried squid, seafood stew, and pork soup. Both soups had harmonious layered flavors, and were comforting on a cold winter night. Since the secret of how delicious this place is already out, I cannot wait to take others to this new East Village spot and try the rest of the menu.

First time visiting Ariari and it was great! A great place to try a bunch of different dishes and drinks with some friends. The staff is incredibly attentive and kind, they even explain what everything is if you're not too familiar with the dishes like me. Would definitely come back and recommend to anyone in the area that wants to try some creative takes on Korean food.

Very cute Korean tapas spot in East Village. We didn't have reservations on Tuesday at 7pm, so I was thinking if there's possibility, if we got lucky,  if, if, if..... So... when we talked inside, the girl who was host I believe, super sweet and told us if we can finish by less than one hour, there was a table available, so my fast eater mode was on. We sat down and ordered like bomb, the service was very fast and the staffs were super friendly. We got 5 dishes, they're definitely enough for 2 ppl. I also liked their cocktails, very cute and delicious, I like the Korean features in them. My favorite dish was soft shell crab, so juicy and yum. Only one thing I wasn't really love is the sweetness in pretty much all the food, I mean maybe that's the Busan flavor, I'm sure who love sweet would love the food, but don't get me wrong, I do enjoy the food and drinks, and we finished less than hour. Next time I'll make sure we have a reservation lol...
No comment
No comment

Honestly the best Busan cuisine I had in the states. I'm born in Busan and they really did an amazing job of recreating the dishes. The raw sashimi was straight from Korea which made me feel like I was actually in Korea. Other hot pot and side dishes like soft shell crab was the best fried food I had in nyc. From all the hot pots, I recommend the pork soup because it taste just like soup you will have in Busan. I'm literally going to ariari every two weeks because I live their food. Seriously I recommend this place with my heart:

My family and I were so excited to try this restaurant! I never got a chance to try Taj Campton restaurant before it shutdown so I was excited to hear that Chef  was going to work a new project! I love this food and it's cool seeing it highlighted with fine dining.

My friend and I made an early dinner reservation for opening weekend and we're so glad we did. Our whole experience was amazing - the greeting, prompt service, food taste/presentation, and vibes. They play really OG Korean music and the ambiance is perfect for a date or girl's night out. My top picks for the seafood were the salmon hwe-muchim and the fried soft-shell crab. We mainly tried to stick to the seafood items but the unexpected winner of tonight's meal were the chicken skewers. Soooo juicy, soft, and flavorful. They had so many fun cocktails to choose from and we ordered the Omija and Maesil. Perfect if you want something on the sweeter side. I loved that I felt full but the food didn't feel heavy. We'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu. Make sure to RSVP - the restaurant is small and gets busy very quickly!
Had the uni cream rice, soft shell, shrimp soba, oysters and beef tartare. Overall good taste but portions were small. Great service and really cute decor!

We had a good experience at Ariari! We really enjoyed their cocktails and the food was also good. The waiters were very friendly and pointed out one of the guest's food restrictions. I recommend for dates or gatherings with friends!
No comment

I wish I tried the whole menu ! My top 3 were : the beef tartare, followed by the beef soup & eel. Service was quick & very attentive. The corn crème brûlée was honestly one of my favorite desserts ever!
Best fried chicken ever!!! Amazing service. So great how nice the staff is. Delicious food. And loved the music.

Such an amazing experience and easily now my favorite restaurant in nyc. The vibe and atmosphere is warm and inviting and the music is SO VIBEY, i love it. But most of all what took my breath away was ALL the dishes we ordered. Although I've been to a lot of variations of Korean restaurants, there's noting like this that comes close. The food is fresh, unique, new, and feels like I transported to Korea. The mak hwe - so fresh and the pairing with ssamjang and chojang is perfection. The lotus root salad and octopus hwe - the flavor in these are just amazing. The white kimchi on the octopus hwe goes so well together. I normally don't eat yukhwe but my friends ordered it and I tried it and it was SO GOOD. The fried dishes were great and the batter is so light with delicious dipping sauces. We got the spicy pork and grilled eel for the main and wow...! The grilled eel is my favorite and it's a must try. The dolsot Al bap goes without saying. It's creamy, has the right enough umami and can taste the creamy flavor of the uni cream. For the soups we got seafood and pork and you can tell they aimed to make these the star of the show. The broth is so refreshing and probably one of the best Korean soups I've had. For dessert, both the corn crème brûlée and bingsoo was amazing - loved the white chocolate on top of the corn crème brûlée and loved the consistency. The bingsoo was refreshing and the best way to end the meal. This place is alllll worth the hype. 10/10!

I went with my friend for dinner on the grand opening day, and our expectations were exceeded! The food is amazing - reminds me of the food back in Busan. You can't find anything like this at any other restaurant in NYC. The atmosphere is cozy and aesthetic, and the service is also amazing. The waiters and waitress explained the dishes thoroughly and attended to our needs frequently. My friend and I felt welcomed. I've been raving about this restaurant to all my friends and I will personally be coming back!

Aside from having great service, this Busan inspired spot serves flavorful, fresh dishes that make you want to come back for more. The stars of the show for me were the Yook-Hwe (Beef Tartare), Glazed Jang-eo (Fried Sea Eel) and Corn Crème Brûlée. Will definitely be returning for round 2!!

This is more like a 3.5 than a 3. We had high expectations and left feeling like we didn't order the right things. Some dishes like the spicy pork and soft shell crab were amazing but others like the pork soup and lamb stuffed pepper was just ok. The waiter encouraged us to get a soup so we were disappointed at how unflavorful it was. Maybe it was an off day? I think the hype made us expect more but overall it was still a good dinner!

Great service and ambiance but the food overall was WAY too sweet. I've tried quite a number of their menus to conclude it, and it's definitely too hyped up. It's alright to visit once but I personally wouldn't go back for the food. It's still worth trying if you're curious about Busan food!
One of our favorite brunch place in NYC. Came back for the second time. Food is absolutely lovely.

Wait staff was kind and attentive and the food was so good! My friends recommended the fried soft shell crab and the dolsot albab which were both delicious. I also had the lamb stuffed peppers and the octopus. There were some open tables for walk-ins when I was there but I still recommend making a reservation as it's not a very large space.

Came during the soft opening week. The vibes in this place are very chill, cozy and welcoming. My friend and I loved the ambience and sets the mood for the amazing meal you will have. Every dish was presented beautifully, and tasted as good as it looked. Started with Yook Hwe (beef tartare), Seafood Pancake, and Fried Chicken, which the fried chicken was super juicy with a delicious sauce. For mains, we had the Steamed Monkfish and Seafood Stew- both phenomenal choices. Monkfish was meaty, tender and flaky with perfect aromatic sauce. The seafood stew was flavorful with a nice kick, and was light without being overwhelming. They gave us a huge lobster claw, which cooked to be the most tender lobster I've ever had. For dessert, we had the Omija Bingsoo which was unique but a little too sweet for my taste. I felt this meal in my soul. It took Korean food to another level for me and it was so comforting.
Go to this restaurant. You will be rewarded. The food is one of a kind. The service is warm and informative. The atmosphere is ideal. My new favorite place in New York.
THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. Great service, kind staff, amazing food. The drinks are delicious as well as the  dishes. 10/10 recommend. You MUST try the corn crème brûlée!
This place is a gem. Unbelievable food and incredibly fresh. The service is fantastic as well. I'll be back for sure.
Their fries and broth are another level. I also loved their yook-hwe beef tartar with octopus. And the lotus root salad was surprisingly good too. A MUST TRY.

This place shows the breadth of Korean cuisine. The lightness as well as the rich palette in the Soy Braised Lotus Root Salad was my favorite recommendation by Jon! Great service! He was gentle and kind. I'd also recommend the Yuk-Hwe then grabbing the Omjia cocktail to start. The Beef Soo Yuk and Mak-Hwe - (prepared fluke from Jeju-do) are definitely worth trying, definitely a shareable-size
No comment

My friends and I had a great dining experience at ARIARI! We went during their soft opening, and it was really easy to make our reservation online. We ended up adding one person to our table around an hour before our arrival, but they were super accommodating! The staff was welcoming, and our server answered all the questions we had about the menu. My friends and I ended up eating the food before I could get a good picture, but everything was beautifully plated! Will definitely be going back soon :)

Amazing food. Amazing service - our server was super friendly and attentive. Amazing interior. Everything is AMAZING. Yook-hwe was my favorite, but everything was really good. Best place to eat and hang out with friends. Will be back very SOON!

For a group of 4, we were able to try most things on the menu.  You can't go wrong with anything you order here!  Service was also impeccable, with the food well paced and multiple folks focused on us.

LOVE this new restaurant in East Village!! This was my first time trying to Busan food, I regret I haven't explored this cuisine so far. It was very different from I usually eat at K town, very fresh seafood and not too spicy. We tried Mak-Hwe (raw fish with lettuce wrap), Yook-Hwe (beef tartar), Fried soft shell crab, fried sea eel, Dolsot Al-Bap (bibimbap with sea urchin !!!), and seafood stew. Everything was excellent but especially beef tartar and sea urchin bibimbap!! Beef tartar was another level, and sea urchin bibimbap I didn't wanna share with my friends. I wish they serve lunch as well. Highly recommend!
It was a really nice place for new flavor of Korean food. I like their shrimp noodle.

Ironically, it's the steak that let this restaurant down.  The rest of the food we had was really great. However, the steak was very average and is literally twice the price it should be. Staff were very nice! Although the wine "sommelier" had little interest in his job. Unlikely we'll revisit.

Food was great. Definitely get the chicken liver pate for appetizer. The pork pot pie is very good. I'm from the South so the fried chicken didn't hit it for me. Wife got the steak, it was good. The kimchi and kale as a side is very good. It will be hard but try and save room for dessert. Their pastry chef is highly regarded and if a special is offered take it.  We had several and they were fantastic. Like, make your tongue feel special type good. The ambiance is very cool considering it's one of the oldest restaurants in Brooklyn.

What a fun spot! Located kind of down a dark alley, this restaurant was packed and full of customers! Our waiter was very attentive and helpful giving us his recommendations. We ordered a lot of their specials, the full fish, and the baked Alaska which was DELICIOUS. 10/10 would recommend.

I stayed in Brooklyn for work and decided to check out Gage and Tollner. I made a reservation two days in advance, but I also dined on a weeknight. Upon entering Gage and Tollner, you can't help but notice the amazing retro decor and ambience. The bartenders were mixing up cocktails, and the crowd was buzzing in conversation. I sat down at a small table and ordered a whiskey sour. When I received my drink, I was initially taken aback by the ice in my cocktail. Ice in a whiskey sour?? It still tasted good. I ordered a New York strip and a side of mashed potatoes. The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare and had a good char. The steak was so flavorful with the garlic, it was almost too powerful when paired with the mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were also very rich and delicious. The steak was a little chewier than I'd hoped for, but all in all this was a good meal.

This is such a quintessential New York restaurant. My Dad went to Gage and Tollner in the 80s, back when he was dating a girl from Fort Greene. My Aunt went to Gage and Tollner on her last day on the job when she worked in downtown Brooklyn more than 20 years ago. I'm sure others could find similar stories if their family members spent time in Brooklyn and were fortunate enough to visit. What I'm saying is that Gage and Tollner is one of those iconic restaurants. That means something. The landmarked interior is gorgeous, the food is good (the desserts are absolutely phenomenal), and it feels like a special event, even if it's just a Tuesday (and they save tables for walk-ins: try your luck any night of the week).
No comment
No comment

I finally got a chance to dine here and I gotta say... the hype is real. First, the space is beautiful, full of history, and quite lively. Service was excellent - friendly and attentive at all times. We enjoyed every single dish we had. Out of all the appetizers we had, my favorites were the clams and the beef tartare. The steak was perfect and the sides complemented it very well. The Baked Alaska was a fun way to end our evening and surprisingly enough to share between 4 of us. It seems like you really can't go wrong with anything here. Wonderful place for a special night!
No comment
