This place is amazing. The artistry behind each dish was magic. The  Parmesan artichoke spectacular. The ragu and skirt steak truly one of a kind. We had a sampling of many different dishes and each one just kept blowing our minds. We finished off with the creamiest NY cheesecake I have ever had. This place is top notch
No comment
No comment

Um, why haven't I come here until now?! My boyfriend and I celebrated an anniversary here on a Friday evening and couldn't have had a better experience. With exceptional service, we were greeted with two glasses of champagne and friendly congratulations. To start, we ordered a bottle of red and their new funghi misti bruschetta. OMG - please get this! With a butternut squash fall twist, the mushrooms, ricotta, and crispy sage, I could have ordered four. To follow, we shared the pappardelle and veal parmesan. The veal was a hefty portion for two people and the pappardelle was rich with flavor. My ONLY complaint about the meal would be to go a little lighter on the salt for the pasta. To top off the meal, we ordered their creamy cheesecake and espresso martinis. If you like a rich espresso martini with cream, this one was fabulous. I really would love to take my parents here as it is a bit pricier than other options in the area.
No comment

Sat at the chefs counter. Good service and great food. Meatballs are a bit small to buy one each but still good. The only thing I was like eh about was dessert, Olive Oil Cake. Pastas were absolutely divine though! Had the foie gras pappardelle and the Porcini Butter Gnocchi
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cute cozy place in the west village. Place is nestled in a quiet street. The service was excellent. I had gone with a friend for dinner and we wanted to order everything on the menu. The appetizers were delicious - we got the PB&J bombolone and oysters. For our mains we got the gnocchi and scallops with red shrimp. Wished the scallops were bigger but other than that both great dishes.
No comment
Da Toscano did not just survive the Pandemic, it thrived. Better than ever. Da Toscano is clearly a New York classic in the making. Go now before it is impossible to get in.

I've eaten here several times and it's consistently delicious. This time my fiancé and I had the grilled artichokes, prosciutto di parma, garganelli verde with bolognese, and gnocchi with crab. The pasta was cooked perfectly and everything was incredible. The service was well-paced and we had a lovely dinner.

Da Toscano in Greenwich village is a cute Italian restaurant with a modern home cooking feel. For dinner we ordered the Agnolotti with Lamb Neck and drippings which were pillowy and rich with flavor. We also ordered the Italian Sausage Orecchiette flavored with Broccoli pesto which was some of the best pesto I've had in awhile. As for dessert, we got the Apple Crostata which was downright delightful and topped with a healthy scoop of ice cream

OUTSTANDING. Great food, great service in a relaxed atmosphere. Every single dish was unique and delicious.  The pastas we're great. Especially enjoyed the pork chop and the fluke braciole. The menu is not very descriptive but this was not a problem. The waiter, Chris, was very knowledgeable and we enjoyed consulting with him on what we would enjoy most. Luca, the Italian sommelier, also regaled us with history of European wine regions. You'll find some real gems on the wine list. The only thing I didn't love was the cocktail menu, but that won't stop me from returning. The after dinner espresso martini was very special. And don't skip dessert! We ordered all 4 and we argued over which was the best for a half hour! Highly recommend.

Da Toscano is one of the more unique Italian restaurants I've been to in the West Village. Almost everything on the menu was something I hadn't seen before. I had the focaccia and meatballs to start. Both of which were phenomenal. The pastas we had were good, but definitely not the best in town. The agnolotti wasn't my favorite, but we really enjoyed the orecchiette and the garganelli verde. I wasn't the biggest fan of the broccoli rabe side. Overall I enjoyed my experience here and thought it was a decent spot to start visiting more often.

The food and service here is terrific. Small, pretty casual. But some truly great dishes. Coolest thing was the octopus carpaccio - you need to see it to believe it, but incredible taste as well. Great pasta (we had the orecchiette) and both veal chop (pounded and breaded Alla parm) and sides all were terrific as well. Great little spot. Btw noticed they had a little bar that seats 6-8 or so. Was empty, if considering showing up early for a drink. One complaint: while wine list looks reasonably broad, it's insanely overly marked-up, with mostly very mediocre European wines.

I have never been inside of Da Toscano, but I had an delicious al fresco meal here back in October. Four of us shared 2 roasted oysters, 2 linguini with blue crab, an olive oil poached halibut, and the gnocchi dish. Everything was basically melt in your mouth perfect, but if I had to rank the textures and flavors of the dishes it would be as follows: #1 olive oil poached halibut (I still drool thinking about this dish), #2 roasted oysters (you can't pass on this), #3 gnocchi (delicious af pillows), and #4 blue crab linguini (al dente done right and light in flavor). Overall a really great experience and I can't wait to dine here again.

Adjusting my review based on last  couple of experiences. Food is decent. Mostly comes down to the service sadly. It's meant to be attentive but everyone is quite rude and I don't know if they're discriminating against us but was not happy for such an expensive place
No comment
No comment
No comment
Darling interior with a great menu! Ended up ordering the sausage orecchiette and it did not disappoint. Paired it with a happy hour glass of rose -- just lovely!
No comment
No comment
Amazing discovery in New York City, amazing food, great service and beautiful place in west village!

This was our first time dining here. Every bite was exceptionally delicious! In fact, it was so good that it brought me to tears... this is what NYC is all about... food, service, ambiance and hospitality... AND Madeline certainly is the most gracious and welcoming. We will be back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Discovered Da Toscano a couple of weeks ago and have eaten there multiple times since. The waitstaff is absolutely lovely and so knowledgeable about the menu and pairing appetizers with entrees with a cocktail. The cocktails are truly works of art! Every menu item I've had has been a perfect mix of classic and inventive- and all extremely delicious. Have a celiac gluten allergy and they catered to it specifically- and I never got sick from eating here.

I never try to use my yelper status to exert any kind of influence... until now. I call on everyone of you to order the fucking fideos at da Toscano. Better if you have someone to share it with. It is spicy, creamy, faintly sweet, and still somehow al dente. Angel hair is not an acceptable pasta shape except in a limited set of circumstances, and this is one of them. Don't mind those making a fuss about the angel hair francese at anton's. This is the true mvp of nyc dining 2020.
No comment

The last time we visited this restaurant was when it was La Perla. Our experience was absolutely phenomenal! A 10/10 experience. The food was delicious and the wine pairing matched perfectly. A standout part of the experience was the fantastic service by our host and Guillermo. Thank you for a wonderful and special night!

Absolutely fabulous! Delicious focaccia bread and olive oil to start, and the vibe is both cozy and trendy, including a chic open kitchen. Started with the octopus carpaccio (bright and flavorful), one meatball (divine) and the roasted oysters (warm in a flavorful tomato sauce). For the main course, we split the lasagna and orchiette, which complimented each other perfectly. One on the heavier side, one with a kale pesto. All that plus a glass of Pinot Noir and a slice of carrot cake and cheesecake, and you've got a wonderful evening!

Would have loved to give this restaurant and our experience 5 stars.  I used to go to Perla Cafe a few years ago and I was happy when the chef came back to NYC and opened Da Toscano.  I returned to Da Toscano for indoor dining for the first time about 10 days ago after checking on Resy that the staff wore masks.  The meal and service were going wonderfully until our server, who was UNmasked,  said he was not vaccinated.  We cringed and could not wait to leave.  On our way out, we noticed that no employees at the restaurant were wearing masks.  My friend sent an email to the restaurant but 10 days later, they still have not replied.

Amazing wine program, affordable and sincere! Great recommendations from the Bev director and Bar management staff! Very savvy! Attentive service, detailed, my water glass was always filled, plated bussed! I can see this being a great industry hang spot!

Sabrina , Jorge , and Madeline.. thank you thank you and thank you. Our experience last night was unparalleled and your service and hospitality was above and beyond . From the moment we walked in we felt so welcome . The staff here is absolutely incredible especially during these challenging times . You guys just don't skip a beat . We were dining with two hospital workers who have been on the front lines fighting this battle . You really made this night special . Thank you again so much and the next time we see you I will just let you order for us . You obviously can do no wrong . True professionals . All the best . We loved it .
This place is amazing! Ordered via Caviar and became addicted. I can't wait for them to reopen.

They are serious about the food. And it shows.  We sat at the bar and watched the staff as they created each dish and did quality control to make sure each was good enough to put on the table. Roasted oysters, orecchiette  and branzino were all outstanding. On list of favorites now.

This lovely Italian restaurant has the friendliest staff and most awesome food. We are so happy to have this charming eatery in our neighborhood! The chicken alla diavola is the best that you will find anywhere. This a our favorite in the West Village!

Wow what a fantastic restaurant!!! Chef Michael and his team are truly some of the most hospitable in the industry. The GM Zac is a consummate host, working the room making sure everyone feels the restaurant's warm embrace! Michelle's cocktails are unbeatable, Matilda's wine advice and service are top notch, server Danny took incredible care of us from start to finish, and now on to Chef Michael's cuisine...quite possibly the best Italian'ish food in all of NYC! Oysters, Crudo, Octopus, Liver Crostini, Tajarin, Lumache, Agnolotti, Fideos, Veal Head Parmigiana, Porchetta, Cheesecake, Carrotcake!!! All stupendous!!! Can't wait to go back for the other half of the menu!!!
Perfect neighborhood spot, never disappoints. Everything from start to finish is ideal, especially the service. The cacio e pepe is the highlight of my week!
Fantastic service and the food was to die for. The lasagna and the orichetti were both some of the best we've ever had. Highly recommend.

*This place is racist* you would think they would be more away of what's going lately. I hate to leave a review like this during this tough time for restaurants but I'm not going to holdback when a restaurant exhibits such RACIST behavior.  It needs to stop. This happens to people of color all too often at trendy restaurants and they need to be held accountable.  Long story short, we told the host we didn't want the worst table facing a busy 6th ave street and we would be willing to wait for a two-top table closer to the restaurant.  The nicest two-top table opened up and it was given to another couple (white) that walked in after us.  We asked the host why we couldn't have that table and he reverted with the most condescending answer. We didn't designate that table so it went to someone else. Wouldn't it make sense to give it to the people that were waiting 30 mins for their reservations (next in line)?  Anyways, this happens all the time. White privilege wins again. Thought this restaurant would be more socially aware with what's going on. Been here 3 times and not worth going back.

The service was outstanding - from water the moment being seated, to the sommelier's patience and great recommendation, and the pleasant waitress. The food was very good, we had the octopus carpaccio, roasted oysters, little gems salad, meatball, beef tongue sandwich, lambs neck agnolleti, and the veal head Parmesan. The pasta was subpar, but everything else was great, I hope they work on their pasta menu a bit, because it's an amazing spot.

GREAT SPOT.  10 out of 10. Just had an amazing dinner at Da Toscano! The pastas were fresh and authentic- delicious. Rib eye was cooked to perfection.  Deserts were 10 out of 10.  Cheesecake was a standout! I recommend coming here and experiencing NYC at its finest.  Madeline, the Sommelier and the entire staff made us feel at home.  Knowledge, kind, and personable.  It was my last meal before the shutdown and my first meal as the city starts to open up. I have never written a review before but had to let people know-- you have to go!!!!!

I never leave reviews. Da toscano is chic like Perla (same owners) but the increased focus on pasta is insane - it's ridiculously good. The giblet pasta should be immortalized - do not take this off menu! The crab pasta - I am from Maryland so I'm a snob. If you don't want carbs (use it as a reset it's worth it) everything else is fab....trout, steak. I just love this place. It's heavenly food, I'm addicted! And this should be first, the team there makes it the best (Zach, Maddie!)I live in the neighborhood and they go out of their way to make this elite place (make a ressie!) super friendly and chill, but totally Covid safe.

The tucked away location and the private entrance thru velvet curtain lets you know you are in for something special. The front house was pleasant and welcoming. The service was outstanding and the food was exceptional. We particularly enjoyed the veal head parmigiana and the porchetta chop wrapped in crispy pork belly. A treat to be met at the door by NYC's talented  actress Janet Krupin and the restaurant manager Zac made our night most enjoyable. It was a 5 Star night!

My husband and I had a magical night at Da Toscano. Zach is a master of customer service and made our night. The food was delicious. We started with pasta and moved onto the rib eye ans halibut. All super. Go!

Fabulous evening from start to finish.  We were 8 friends gathering for an impromptu reunion from across the country- came to da Toscano via recommendation. Convivial atmosphere. Maddie (front manager &  sommelier) made us all feel at home right away & got the liquids flowing.  Selected two beautiful wines for us that made white & red drinkers very happy.   After a short conversation Maddie perfectly nailed the all-impotant red!  Sabrina served the table with great care & effort, and much fun.  All of her recommendations were spot on. With 8 people we were able to sample much of the menu.  Appetizer standout were the roasted oysters with crab fat butter, but the artichokes & beets were also delicious.  Best focaccia any of us have ever had.  All pastas were amazing:  gnocchi, agnolotti, tortelli, orrechietti. A couple of mains too: phenomenal lamb chops, perfectly seared diver scallops.   More sides:  English peas, broccoli rabe.  All wonderful.  Olive oil rhubarb cake & sour cream cheesecake  nearly did us in but we persevered!  Da Toscano will be a regular stop on all NYC trips from now on!

Went there the other day for a work dinner.  Excellent meal.  Every course delivered.    Def get the artichoke app.   Clams were amazing.  All pastas were very good and I can't think of another restaurant that is making Veal Head Parm they way Da Toscano does.   Might get my vote for best parm dish of the year.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Five stars for me for this fabulous neighborhood place. You'll want to eat at the bar, not only because it has a lovely vibe and excellent bartender, but also because there are several bar-only special such as the burger. Do. Not. Miss. the. Burger. I look forward to trying the bar-only steak frites next time. We had a scrumptious potato appetizer and the soda bread, both are amazing. I had a martini and a Manhattan, both excellent. It's a great spot for the hood and reminds me a lot of the late great James. If you want your meat done right, along with a stiff cocktail like they did in the olden days, don't hesitate on popping in to Gus's.

Sat at the bar for a Friday night meal and am happy to report the hits definitely hit. The pork shoulder was out of this world, melted like butter. The leeks a la wedge was a total flavor explosion, definitely the most surprising. The smoked trout hash brown was great, really comforting and the bites with the roe were perfect. The chocolate olive oil cake was pretty light and airy and the hazelnuts gave it a nice crunch - solid dessert. And of course the drinks, the penicillin particularly, were well done. Only miss was the burger which was a special of the night - kind of was more like a meatloaf on a bun - skip it. Great evening all around!
No comment
No comment

We went for the new Sunday Roast menu and it was terrific. The tri tip was our fave but the lamb was also excellent. All the sides were delicious. Our server Natasha was a STAR and we want to be friends with her. Finished off with the crème brûlée and also the pavlova and they were spectacular. Wine list is impressive and Natasha helped us navigate it beautifully.

I had an amazing meal at Gus's Chop House this weekend! I emailed them in advance to see if I could eat there due to having celiacs disease. They sent me the loveliest thorough email back, so I went that night with my mom. She had a great cocktail and their wine selection was specific and not overwhelming. The Nebbiolo Boniperti was perfect for my meal. We had the shrimp cocktail, Carrots, Chèvre, Chili, Hazelnuts, Citrus, Brussels Sprouts Fondue, Fries and Aioli (gf fryer!), and the stars were the two meats- Pork Porterhouse and Pork Shoulder. SO good. All of it. The service was excellent and great about letting me know what I could and could not eat. A nice addition to the neighborhood - I look forward to becoming a regular!
Steak house in Brooklyn. Nicely renovated simple and chic with outside seating area. Staff is super friendly, attentive and very helpful. Food is creative with great flavor.
No comment

Awesome spot for a nicer dinner that doesn't *have* to break the bank. Steak was great but the pork porterhouse was out of this world. Also recommend the hash browns with roe and the soda bread. Carrots were solid but could've been a bit more roasted.

Here's another popular Brooklyn dream restaurant team branching out not into another borough, but into another type of cuisine.  Unlike Popina, their initial restaurant known for American-Southern and Italian collaboration, Gus's draws from old school European chophouse and casual bistro focused dishes. Again with a more price and atmosphere approaching motif, it's a place that can satisfy all types of eaters, whether steak, seafood, vegetables, or just coming in for a happy hour drink. Of course, classics come with a twist, like the leeks à la wedge, but also something tried and true like a roasted chicken that is a simple protein still difficult to master perfectly. The cherry top tables and chairs give off a steakhouse aura, but the reassurance that even vegetarians don't need to rely on just sides to become full.
No comment
Excellent food, great service and fantastic value. Somewhat of a gem in NYC's dining scene and will look to become a regular.

Don't let the understated exterior tucked into the neighborhood let you overlook Gus's, the meat was excellent as was the service. Will absolutely be back soon, probably the best steak I've had without venturing into Manhattan.
This was the best meal I've had in a looong time. Wow. The meat was delicious, great sides and dessert. I can't wait to go back

Staff is very friendly and the decor is clean but a little too dark. For a place that calls itself a chophouse not serving complimentary bread is a major turnoff, having it on the menu at $9.50 is a joke. My chicken was not very good, very little meat, plenty of bones and difficult to cut. For $30, I expected more. Overall, this was a place to try once and not to come back to.
Wonderful new steak and seafood restaurant in Carroll Gardens. Food was terrific and ambiance is great. Excellent new addition to the neighborhood!

Gus's is by far our new favorite restaurant - in all of Brooklyn! Everything we ordered (flat iron steak, hashbrown with trout roe, wax beans with garlic side and fig pavlova for dessert) were all so delicious and perfectly seasoned. Flavors were incredible. Chef Chris greeted us and sent out a cold tomato soup - like a deconstructed gazpacho - that was actually my favorite of all. Sarah the bartender was so friendly and talented with cocktails. Truly, this new restaurant is an absolute gem.

This restaurant is one that you wanna try, if you have never had Albanian food and you are in NYC and if you want an authentic experience this is the place, I highly recommend this place and it's in my rotation of restaurants that I enjoy

Cozy little spot for delicious, home cooked Albanian dishes! My partner lives nearby and we never noticed this spot until we stumbled by one night. Everything was amazing--the mantia (served with fresh yogurt sauce), the lamb, the tava kosi (lamb and rice cooked with yogurt. Wonderful ambiance and service as well. Our little gem!
Good food if your looking to try something new! They also have a great outdoor garden thats nice in the summer. This place is a hidden gem
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was my first time trying Albanian food! I was happy to try out so many different things. My friends and I tried a collection of different foods. My favorite was probably the mantia which are like little pan fried dumplings. These were sooo good! We also had the Mixed Grill Platter which featured the sausages and other different meats. It was all seasoned really well. The table also came with complimentary bread that was so fluffy and delicious. We also got the sausage teva which was sausage in a cheesy sauce - great to dip in the bread. The waitress seemed like she didn't really want to be there haha but she warmed up when we asked how to pronounce the restaurant name and the meaning. The ambiance was amazing and cozy! We were in the back room and it felt like we were having dinner in a nice home. I'm glad I got to try this place!
No comment

While the food was ok to good, they had a private event with tons of people walking around.  We had people standing over us while we ate and the place was mobbed.  They should have closed the restaurant for the event..

Great Albanian restaurant, very good home made food! I came here one night after work with my friend because I wanted her to try traditional Albanian food and we both really enjoyed it! We got cheese and ajvar along with cevapa with mantia with yogurt everything was absolutely delicious and we finished with baklava. Will definitely visit again!
I had never tried Albanian food before, but this was absolutely delicious. The bread was some of the best I have ever had. The yogurt/cucumber dip and the mixed grill are must haves. We will be back!
Incredible food and even better service! Third time here and will definitely be back. Great job to their entire staff!
No comment

My friend asked to go here for dinner. It's only a block away from my work so I was shocked I had never seen it before or noticed it. It's delicious, lots of very affordable small plates so I recommend ordering a few for everyone to share.

If you're in Manhattan, you must try this spot!! We are Albanian and were so happy there's a restaurant that takes us back to our country. Everyone is so nice and the food is amazing. The bread is SPECTACULAR. I was blown away by how fresh and light it was! If you've never tried Albanian cuisine, definitely check it out. It's so worth it!

A+ food. Never had Albanian food before. Reminds me of Mediterranean cuisine with subtle eastern/central Asian influences. Grilled chicken and vegitable stuffed pepper were excellent, also the Semolina flan and Albanian coffee.
No comment
No comment

What a cute place and cute atmosphere!! Servers are attentive and service was fast. The 3 star is due to how salty the food was. It was not palatable after a couple bites. We only had the sausage here. Hopefully their other dishes are more seasoned appropriately because this place is adorable.

Great food, gorg decor & great service! Came here w the pulsd deal! First time trying this type of cuisine & everything was well seasoned & amazing had 4 different dips w bread, 2 glasses of wine, a meat platter & salad! Finished everything w an Armenian tres leches cake. Such a great dining experience!

No comment

This is a very special restaurant! We had never eaten Albanian food, and were at a loss of where to begin.  Our servers were very helpful in guiding us.  Wow. We were just blown away- everything was beautifully cooked, perfectly seasoned- this is my idea of the ultimate comfort food. Make sure you try the Raki (pronounced rakia), which is their National liquor. It's very aromatic and although it comes in a shot glass it is lovely to sip.  The servers made us feel like very welcome guests and I can't wait to return and eat more.

No comment

Charming and interesting to visit. A treat to try Albanian foods. We had stuffed peppers and beef dumplings (mantia, tava style) - yum on both counts. Would be a nice first date place because of the romantic ambiance and foods that would be new to many Americans. I loved this place!

I've never had a worse dining experience during my five years in New York. The food itself is fine (not great), however - what made our experience truly dreadful was the insect infestation and the staff response (see video for first round).  The service was very slow to start, so we went ahead and ordered our entire meal at the same time, which was unfortunate, considering ten minutes in we saw a giant roach. When the staff was alerted, we were welcomed with a "welcome to New York". We then saw two more in steady succession. We were eventually moved and were apologized to, but I cannot recommend.

Since I'm Albanian, my friend wanted to try our food before he moved out of town so I brought him here and everything tasted amazing. There is no vegetarian menu but there are vegetarian options such as "Fli", "petull e fshir" and more.., or you can eat their warm and amazing bread with a dip. My friend loved every single dish but his favorites were the bread (which was complimentary btw) and fli. The bathroom was super clean and smelled good. The decor was also pretty interesting. I'd definitely go back to try more dishes or take other friends to eat Albanian food.
Great ambiance and hospitality. The food was very good as well. I have to go back soon.

Absolutely amazing.  This cozy, quaint Albanian spot has become our go-to dinner spot.  Interiors are beautiful especially in the back area, staff are very attentive and friendly (shoutout to our awesome waitress Griselda!), and food consistently never disappoints.  Make sure to get their special Albanian coffee to end your meal!

A great date night or place to catch up with old friends. The staff was friendly and had good suggestions from the menu. The design and music set up the expectation of an authentic meal and the food meets that expectation. The Fasul with sausage (front in picture) was very flavorful and stuffed pepper (back in picture) was great. The freshly baked bread was amazing as well.

This restaurant was so adorable, with stone walls and exposed ceiling beams it had a lot of old world charm. They bake their own bread so you can smell when you walk in then you can have as much as you'd like with all their dips. We enjoyed all of the food which for our meal included bread, dips, salad, grilled meats, and tres leches for dessert. Overall, my friend and I went for a nice little date night and enjoyed the slower pace and delicious food, highly recommend!
Nice Ambiance, good service, quality food, and good value. A great addition yo the neighborhood.

Po jua shkruaj shqip qe ta kuptojn vetem pronari ose menaxheri. Te shtunen dat 13 mbasdite trajtimi nga personeli ose me sakt ajo vajza kamariere ishte fyes nga fillimi deri ne fund. . Nuk krahasohet me personelin e location ne Bronx. Erdhem nga Virginia per pun dhe mund te hanim kudo po me mir po shkojm edhe pse 45 minuta larg te restoranti shqiptar. . Nuk do kthehem me kurr ktu po ne Bronx patjeter po
No comment

Amazing food, ambience and super friendly staff. My party of two shared a few dishes and everything was delicious. The Mantia and the Tava Kosi were our favorites. Also, kudos for friendly and helpful waitresses!!!  Definitely coming back to try the Skanderbeg and have some more Tava.

Saw this place on pulsd and figured I'd check out since it's in my neighborhood! I was not disappointed. The staff was super friendly and the food came out fresh and fast. Also make sure to sit in the back patio you will feel like you are transported to old world Europe. The pulsd came with 4 dips,bread, mixed grill and dessert. The sausage dip was my favorite, the bread was phenomenal, the mix grill was fantastic the spicy meat was delicious! And for dessert we tried to baklava and the tries lech cake. The baklava was okay but the fries lech was delicious the coconut notes really set it off! Don't wait try this place out!

I came here for the first time last week during Memorial Day weekend and the staff was so polite and caring. The food was delicious. I'm told I ordered authentic Albanian food by other restaurant goers and I will definitely be back again to have another go round. The place is clean and the environment made me feel very comfortable and welcomed. Thank you to the two gentlemen, Gzim and Xhevo,  who took care of my friend and I. You made our experience most memorable and enjoyable!

Tried the new restaurant on 31st street and thought it was really excellent. The interior feels very European and like you are stepping into another country. It is perfect for a more intimate date or small group dinner. They give you warm bread for starters and we ordered a yogurt dip appetizer to go with it. For our entrees we tried the mixed meat platter for one and the Mantia veal dumplings served in a tava. We also ordered glasses of red wine. For dessert we got the trelice and Albanian coffee. The food was all incredibly delicious and the menu was very unique. Would highly recommend trying this restaurant out for something different!

Excellent food, great ambience. Tried Albanian food for the first time and turned out great! The Qofta Shari is a must try, all of their ground veal pretty much hits the spot. They also gave us a dessert on the house which was really nice! Would definitely recommend if you're around midtown East and want to try a different take on Mediterranean food.

I looked forward to trying this place. I had high expectations. What happened? We waited 1 hour and 15 minutes for our food. I was charged a HIGHER price for an item that differed from the QR Menu they directed me to. The excuse "Oh there's a Mistake on the Menu".  Then to top it off they put an automatic tip of 18% on the bill. Guys we are NOT in Albania or Europe. Let us know beforehand you will adding a tip to the bill.

I had such a good time here the servers were absolutely great they were so friendly and so much fun. The food was great I tried so many things and they were all very good. They shop salad was fresh and tasty, the fli tasted so good and it was fresh. I also had the tradita mixed grill platter was so good I enjoyed everything on the platter. The mantia with meat was so good I would have eaten more if I didn't have so much other good food. The sarma was so good I loved it. I also tried all their desserts and i enjoyed all of them.

This is my first visit to the Downtown Branch of this amazing restaurant (uptown is in de Bronx) my friend had the mixed grill her favorite along with the pepper dip we both like. I don't know what I ordered. See picture but it was excellent. The place looks great, so many doorways I got lost.  the staff was great and very accomadating. I am looking for excuses to go back.

Fantastic food, service, and atmosphere. Food was filling and flavorful. We got the mixed grill platter. Also, their bread is baked as soon as you order it, so it comes out hot and fresh. Definitely recommend this spot!

I've been meaning to try this place out for quite some time. The menu is an exactly easy to understand if you are not from the Baltics however the quality of the meat and the grills is incredibly good. Would highly recommend trying this at least once.
Delicious food!!! Have to get the fli and the sarma, the best I've ever had! And the waitress was so nice too. Definitely will be back soon.

Wonderful space with a beautiful back garden. Great for groups or on a date. The food was fantastic and the service  was unparalleled. Xhon guided us on our order- absolutely looking forward to going back. Highly recommend the skenderberg and mixed grill platter

Great food and amazing ambiance. We came on a pulsd deal and this was one of the best ones I've been on. We got 4 dips, salad(which was extremely fresh), grill platter, and baklava to end the night. We also had 2 glasses of wine. Expect to dine for at least 3 hours as  the foods not brought out when it's ready but when you request the next course. Staff was amazing.

Delicious food and great service! I joined my sister and her friend last minute and I was pleasantly surprised. The bread and pepper dip was amazing and I will definitely try to go back and try even more things from their menu.

Popped in after doing some shopping at the market and let me tell you, the food was amazing. My fiancé and I just got the qebapa and my parents got a tav. great service and great food, I had yet to find a good place with good authentic Albanian food. I'll definitely be going back next time I'm in town!
No comment

My son in law is from Albania, therefore, I had no worries about menus and decisions. It seems like he ordered us about one of everything, and everything was fantastic!  In particular we loved the yogurt with peppers and the one with garlic (not sure if there were others too). We loved everything! He did sneak in 2 dishes that had liver, not my thing, but I tried them both. Not. My. Thing. But, nothing against them, I would never have ordered liver, and it wasn't that awful liver texture you'd expect. We loved the meatball things, burek (maybe?), the rice pudding like stuff, all of the apps. Sorry I can't be more specific, but everything was delicious. The grilled platter had a grilled liver on it. This was hard for me, it was hard to tell it was liver, it wasn't bad, but I wouldn't have ordered that had I known. The place was rustic Lu decorated, felt very old world and we loved the ambiance as well. Lovely staff that spoke Albanian with my son in law, and he was in heaven, like he was back home for dinner.
No comment
Delicious food, great experience. Very cozy, I loved the nice music with local ethnic costumes. Would go again.

As an Albanian, I am very picky with mediterranean food, especially from my own country but I absolutely fell in love with this restaurant. It was everything I imagined it to be and I was definitely not let down. It's very hard to find authentic Albanian food in America and at some point I even had tears in my eyes because it reminded me so much of my country- felt like I was there, not in nyc. The restaurant is beautiful & all the food was fresh & at really good prices for such good quality. Definitely will be coming back. Ju lumtë dora!

I had a great time at this restaurant. The art work and decor inside is beautiful. The waiters were pleasant especially Gzim who took time to explain the dishes to us as this was our first time having Albanian food. I only went with one friend however this setting is perfect for a family as well. The meat platter was delicious and for desert had the trileqe which was perfect and tasted very similar to a tres leche. Thank you for a great time :)
plenty of options to choose, delicious fli and mantia. Unique place with great service
No comment

This was my first time here. The food and hospitality was outstanding. The bread was out of this world amazing and fresh and hot. The meat platter was tasty fresh and a great variety. The tres leches was great as well. Most unique experience in NYC. They truly care and make you feel so comfortable. A very relaxed environment and you can wind down after a long day. Also, they do not rush you and you can actually enjoy. Highly recommend for good food and a unique experience.

Loved the decor and food here, and especially the service- our waiter Jimmy was the absolute best, definitely ask for him if you go here, he really knew his stuff and had the best recommendations for food and wine and really makes you feel at home
Charming place with great food and friendly staff. I ordered fli, cobani salad and qebabe. Delicious food and great ambiance will definitely go back.

My girlfriend and I originally fell in love with their Bronx location, but given its remote location were shocked and ecstatic to hear of them opening a very convenient location in Manhattan. It is a genuinely incredible restaurant with a fantastic authentic and welcoming feel. The food is very unique and the staff is very helpful with suggestions. Also a plus that their Manhattan location serves booze! An absolute must for New Yorkers and visitors alike.

Really charming neighborhood spot and the food is great. Highly recommend the manti in garlicky yoghurt and the grilled platter - and i could not get enough of the steaming hot bread. The service was lovely too!

Delicious food, very similar to Greek but with a Balkan twist (more spicy and cheesy). The ambiance is great too, definitely committed to the theme. We tried the Pulsd deal and it was fantastic (tons of food+dessert+wine for $49) but the menu is generally reasonable too. One of the better meals I've had recently in NYC.

Absolutely phenomenal food and atmosphere. I've been to the Bronx location a few times and was thrilled that they opened up a location in the city. It looks small at first but there is a whole back and outdoor area. The food is perfect and authentic and the service excellent. You will always see Albanian patrons, which means the place is a gem. I fine myself craving it every so often. Highly recommend everybody who lives in NYC try some of the best the Albanian community has to offer. I'll be back again and again.

The food was well worth the visit to this modest but charming restaurant. I didn't know Albanian food could be so tasty and even smell so delicious upon arrival. To top it off the good prices make it hard not to love it.

This place is incredible! Beautifully decorated interior that is cozy, romantic, and upscale all at once. We ordered a ton and the food was all delicious. The waitress was friendly and attentive but not overbearing. This was undoubtedly the best food of our trip. I did see in some of the other reviews that people had encounters with cockroaches in the restaurant...we did see one while in there (fortunately far away on a wall), but the whole restaurant was spotless and unfortunately I think it's a casualty of being in New York...the city's system of leaving trash on the sidewalks assuredly attracts such pests...anyway, it did not seem like a cleanliness issue with the restaurant at all. I'm sure most restaurants in the city have this issue, and again had I not seen that one bug I would have thought the place was flawlessly clean. I only wish they would open up a location in Washington DC so I could go all the time!
Very good! I think we made the mistake to order too much because we were very full when we left. Delicious food and very well priced.
Kababs, bread to die for and fresh salad. What more can one ask for. Great addition to the neighborhood.

Great food but very very poor customer  service . Waiters on their phones while I'm waiting to order , not cool and disrespectful. Wanted to order dessert and a coffee after dinner however after trying to flag someone down I changed my mind . I shouldn't have to wait 15 mins to order dessert especially when the restaurant is nearly empty ...waiter should ask if we would like anything for dessert or even offer / suggest . Nope - not here .  Literally felt like I was pulling teeth trying to order . Will come back for the food  , hopefully more attentive staff .

From selling bún đậu and other dishes at popup events to opening their own place, Mắm has come a long way. And I cannot be happier that now I can go get bún đậu any weekend I want. They still have the best fried tofu, and the blood sausage (dồi) is a lot better than before. They recently add some appetizer dishes and my favorite is the chả chem chép.o

came here on a weekend so the wait was about 40 minutes but well worth the wait. went to the pop up at di an di in greenpoint last year and so glad to see they have a permanent location now. One of my favorite items were the grilled intestines and blood sausage. Definitely a unique viet spot
Authentic bun dau mam tom. The fried tofu was homemade, the taste so much different and so delicious , we ordered extra bun and fried tofu. We all finished them

I don't write reviews often but I am writing this because I want this restaurant to prosper. As a Vietnamese person who's been to Vietnam and ate Vietnamese food in Cali and Houston, Mam can compete with the best of them. Their bun dau is incredible and as close to authentic you can ask for. Order the bun dau with all of the options. From the tofu, to the pork roll, to the intestines, to the blood sausage, and to the pork belly... it's all executed well. It tastes fresh without a greasy taste. I do notice they hold back some of mam flavor from their dipping sauce but it's still very good to me. I can eat at this place all the time. The bun dau here is a top viet dish for me in the US

What a treat! The bun dau was delicious, and sharing a platter of it on seats by the park was a delightful way to spend a summer evening. I can't wait for them to come back and see what they have for their winter menu.

Bullshiet! Put my name down and was told the host was goona call me after 45 mins but NEVER. We came back after 1 hour, found out that he had crossed my name out and was out of food. Don't know how good the food is, but service is not great.
No comment

What a great find?! This is not your Vietnamese food menu. So don't expect pho here. This is your Anthony Bourdain-esque Vietnamese street food. Cute place and very very friendly staff. I can't say enough. Food is amazing!!
Felt like I was in Vietnam. The chair, table, chopstick holder and everything. The servers were super nice. Got a special bun dau mam tom and drinks.
I had the most beautiful meal here. I haven't been transported by a meal in a long time. This place does it right. Chef's kiss. Kudos to the team for bringing this menu to nyc.
The best Vietnamese food in NY!!  Snails, tofu, blood sausage and everything else is superb.  The owners and staff are sweet and welcoming!
It's just very good Vietnamese food, it reminded me of Vietnam street food. Service was also great, def a must try

A wonderful addition to NYC's VNese dining scene! The food is super authentic and delicious, and I especially appreciated the "expert level" fish sauce. The service is friendly and prompt, and the plastic dining chairs transported me straight back to VN. Will definitely come back!

My friend and I ordered the chef's omakase tasting ($150 for 18 courses) and we were very disappointed with the food. The food was very average and nothing stood out. A lot of the dishes were salty in my opinion.

Came here for dinner with a group of 4 and sat at the counter around a corner.  The food and the service was fantastic.  They were able to accommodate my husband's and our friend's gluten allergy with no issues.  For me, they were also able to substitute items for uni/sea urchin due to a preference.  With the food and drinks, it came out to about $250-$300 a person, which for the amount of food and drinks we received was worth it (we did order some extra pieces and added the toro tasting).  I would definitely return.

Amazing dinner! A lil different from traditional omakase, they had lil trio of appetizers and soba with uni along with a lil mushroom soup & kimbap roll. Everything is so fresh and delicious with warm friendly service!

Delicious omakase with a lot of add-on options. The price point is pretty great considering the quality of fish, the location, and the variety of bites.

We came on a weekend at 5pm and there was a lot of tables open. The service and ambiance really felt like I was back at Japan. The appetizers and drinks we got were delicious but the sukiyaki and duck breast soba was a bit disappointing. Will be back to try the Omakase!

Great spot! Super clean, simple food. The eggplant, duck soba, and futomaki (a personal favorite) were all amazing. Would go back! They also aren't too crowded which is great!

The service is very attentive. Everything we ordered taste good, the ingredients are very fresh. My favorites are vegetables tempura and king crab legs. The only complaint I have is the portion of the food is very small considering how much you are paying for it. The ambiance is good too, it's a small restaurant but they make it work. The restaurant is very nice to give my friend who celebrates her bday a complimentary dessert.

Wonderful seafood with attentive service. We tried the  omakase 9 course. It didn't disappoint. There are monk fish liver, king crab, Hokkaido  uni, sea eel, ebi, king salmon, fatty tuna, sea bream, scallops, soba, fish broth soup, orange ice-cream. I was totally stuffed ! Great value with the amount of food given

we did the tasting menu. the portions are admittedly small but so delicious. highlights were the mushroom broth egg, wagyu, monkfish hotpot and unagi rice rolls. the service was impeccable. the restaurant is not big and the noise level is moderate so you can actually have a conversation.
No comment

Towa is a new Japanese restaurant with a wide selection of fried, broiled, boiled, noodle, sushi and other dishes. While the sushi is good, you can get better sushi elsewhere. Towa's cooked dishes are delicious and you should stick to that side of the menu. Still waiting for their liquor license, so BYOB for now.
No comment

I made reservations for my cousin's mini bachelorette and oh my, what an incredible omakase experience. We had a small party of 2 so it felt intimate even when sitting next to strangers at the bar. We sat back and trusted our chef for a delicious food journey! The chefs and staff were incredibly talented and attentive. There was a family with 2 kids seated next to us and the chef went out of his way to make sure they were enjoying their pieces and tailoring different recommendations for ones they were unsure of. I also enjoyed the sake tasting pairing. Highly recommend this place! Totally worth the price (if anything it's on the more affordable omakase pricing for what we got!)

The service and food quality is top notch! They even noticed that we didn't finish our cocktail and asked for feedback. Most places these days just want you to pay for the bill regardless if we liked it or not. Thank you Towa for caring and making us feel special. We will back next time!

Great restaurant and excellent service. All the dishes we tried were fantastic. We didn't try the omakase, a la carte was sumptuous! Great experience ! The staff are very attentive, ingredients are very fresh and high quality.

Towa opened about three months ago and given the good reviews so far, decided to try it out since it's close to where we are staying. Super friendly service. Not loving sitting at a table with benches but at least there wasn't another party next to us on this communal table. We ended up ordering a bunch and sharing all the plates so the courses came one by one and it took a while, but we didn't really mind, as it allowed us to digest and look forward to the next course. Highlights for me were the truffle croquettes, shrimp rolls, Wagyu ishiyaki, and the desserts (all three --honey cheesecake, watermelon sorbet and hojicha panne cotta, were fantastic!).

My husband and I recently celebrated our anniversary at Towa and decided to go all in with their full omakase tasting. It turned out to be a truly great culinary experience from start to finish, and one that actually filled us up a lot more than other omakase restaurants we have visited. The price point is also on the more affordable side: $120 per person. We added a toro trio tasting and, of course, some sake. The head chef, Masaya Shirai, clearly cares deeply about his craft and excels at it. He is mesmerizing to watch in action and comes across as a very kind and friendly person (funny as well). We enjoyed talking with him and tasting the fruits of his labor! The omakase itself is a nice mix of nigiri and other dishes (both hot and cold), and each course is thoughtfully prepared and beautifully presented. My favorites were the toro tasting and the sea scallop. At the end of the meal, they brought out their seasonal sorbet selection and wrote a cute anniversary message on the plate, which was a nice touch. I would definitely return to Towa and hope to do so soon, either for the omakase or for their regular menu options, which looked amazing as well.
Delicious omakase!  Wonderful staff greeted us at the door. We sat at the bar and watched the talented chefs handcraft our courses. Definitely coming back here.

My friend and I came here for the dinner menu since it was hard to get a reservation for the omakase since there are only a few available seats. Most people booked for the omakase table since those were all filled by the time we started ordering. We tried a couple of dishes and we were pretty content with everything we ordered. The nigiri set was solid, and would highly recommend the ebi mazamen!
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Did the omakase and everything was delicious. The plating was beautiful as well. Definitely a fun experience with a date or a friend. I would say the omakase is worth the price at Towa. Also get the stone wagyu if you still have stomach space afterwards!
My wife and I celebrated her birthday at Towa. It was a wonderful experience and the food was impressive.
No comment

Maybe aggressive to call a place that has only been in existence for a month a gem already - but there's not one bad thing I could think of to speak of Towa! Right across street from Flatiron Room, has a great selection of Japanese dishes, not exclusively sushi or omakase - I especially recommend one of the grilled options. Interesting, and fantastically presented dishes, ton of options if you don't like or want sushi and staff is very caring and great service overall. They also have their liquor license now so a pretty solid cocktail list and a sake menu as well. Will definitely come back and try more of the menu - hope they keep this up and earn themselves a 5 star rating soon!

Amazing food. Each dish was packed with flavor. Got the dumplings, fish, lamb, chicken, eggplant, tuna. Every dish as good as the last.  Go here!!!

We took a chance and walked up with no reservation. We were seated right away. The space has great decor and comfortable distance between the tables. The Frena Bread is a must have. The fish feeds 3 but our party of 2 devoured it. Note that your bill already has gratuity included.

Amazing food and drinks. Loved the family style options. The chicken was stellar. I wish I had more. The mushroom appetizer plate was just as tasty. All staff members were fully versed on the menu, offering a breakdown of the plates, sharing recommendations and answering all questions. The ambiance was a perfect vibe for the night. Overall loved the experience and am looking forward to going again.

My wife and I went to Mesiba during their first week and were blown away by the food, drinks, and vibe. The whole crispy fish was a show stopper - I haven't tried anything like it before and it was delicious! The cocktails were super creative and beautiful, I loved how fresh the limonana was. All the servers had great attitudes and were really helpful in explaining the menu. The design of the restaurant is beautiful and helped to create the super lively atmosphere. There's really nothing like Mesiba in Williamsburg - Moxy Williamsburg is a great add to the neighborhood and we can't wait to go back.

Sooo yummy! Absolutely loved this place and want to come back soon. We order 3 things for the table: the duck salad, vegetable fried rice, and the short ribs. All were amazing and packed with flavor. The kale in the salad is kept crispy, I have no idea how they do that but it's such a great pairing with the duck. The vegetable fried rice may *sound* plain, but it definitely isn't. It's super fragrant and is the perfect carb-y dish to go with any of the mains! The short rib sat on a creamy coconut curry sauce and came with a small side of crispy rice on the plate. The short rib was insanely tender and the meat fell right off the bone. Everything was delicious and this is easily at the top of my favorite Thai spots in the city now.

found a new lunch spot in soho!!! So goodddd southern curry over rice is my favorite. So rich and spicy . Tom Yum noodle soup is very authentic as well. Well I love spicy when they hit the spot I definitely recommend. Service is always attentive and friendly. Now I found a new spot to hang in soho. Love WanWan

When I saw that Erika Chou, owner of Wayla and Kimika, was opening a Thai restaurant, I had to make a reservation! It claims to be "Old-Phuket style," blending local Thai and immigrant Chinese cooking, which resulted in delicious flavors I had never had before. The restaurant has a cozy upscale vibe, with gorgeous art deco chandeliers and velvet pillowed seating. We ordered the marinated spare ribs, duck salad, crab curry noodles, and wagyu thin rice noodles. All the dishes had complex, well-balanced flavors, but were on the smaller portion and pricier side. The crab curry was so rich and tasty, but much spicier than I expected - it was a masochistic experience where I was crying but couldn't stop myself from taking more bites. The coconut rice pudding was a refreshing dessert to finish off the meal. TL;DR don't come here expecting typical Thai food, come here for an experience!

We came here for drinks and it was awesome!! The pandan colada and Tom Numb were really unique and delicious drinks! The food looked amazing so I definitely want to come back and try it

Amazing newcomer to the area! Mood lighting, yummy cocktails, and delicious well priced noodz. Lovely experience here. The food came out quickly and the menu consists of elevated takes on classic favorites plus some that are more difficult to find at your basic pad thai place (there's no pad thai on the menu). The appetizers were fantastic--shrimp tempura, short ribs and beef steamed buns were fantastic starters for our mains--the pad kee mao and beef broth noodles were great for a cold day, as was the ba mee pu moo yang (worth memorizing the name for), which has amazingly springy yellow noodles and comes with a side of broth to ease the chill of nyc winter.

Literally the best Thai food I have ever tasted in my entire life!!!! I got the pad kee mao and it was DELICIOUS!!! It had the perfect amount of spice and everything just tasted so FRESH. The basil it was topped with was so crunchy. If I lived closer, I would have already gone back. However, when I'm in the area, I'll definitely stop by!! I recommend wan wan for sure!!!

Having been to Wayla, I had a pretty good idea of what the vibe might be here, but this spot actually surpassed my expectations. Food was incredible and perfectly spicy. Saw Chinese Thai fusion dishes that I've never heard of before too which is always exciting! Good atmosphere and decor as well. Because it's a newer restaurant, it was easy to snag a res, but I imagine that soon this place will be packed every night.
Came here with family to try. Everything was either too sweet or salty. Appetizer were okay. But the entree were where it failed. Never coming back here.

Came here for dinner on a Sunday and I felt everything was subpar. We got fried pork belly, spare ribs, steamed branzino, and duck broth and nothing to write home about. However, we all enjoyed our drinks and it was happy hour at the time which was a nice surprise - $4 off all of our cocktails
Not sure what the hype is for thai diner bc this place is way better and closeby! Creative flavorful dishes, good vibe, great /friendly service, boozy cocktails with thai ingredients

Came with a friend to grab dinner on a rainy day. The place is pretty spacious so getting a table wasn't too hard. They're still waiting on the liquor license so they only had non alcoholic drinks available. We tried the duck salad, fried pork belly, and the Guay Tiew Kua Gai (rice noodle with chicken). Overall, the felt like the food was okay, but the flavors and textures were a bit unexpected and didn't really work well together. The fried pork belly was heavy and a bit dry. The rice noodle and duck salad both had baked/fried kale that add a strange texture into the dishes. The chicken in the noodle dish was cooked nicely but the noodle to chicken ratio was off. We would have liked more noodles for a noodle dish.

LOVE!!! Everything we ordered was amazing, especially the crispy chicken skin. Will def be coming back!

While I'd like to say this place is great (because the food is). I had a BAD experience here. For starters I booked a table in the basement, I was told my table wasn't ready yet so they sat me at the bar (it was after my reservation time). After ordering at the bar I was brought to an upstairs table. With every gust of wind we were hit with freezing air. Our drinks were brought up from the bar downstairs after we had to ask again where they were and one was wrong. We had to track down our waiter for everything and he was too busy to assist us. Our meal was almost two hours and we desperately were ready to go.
No comment

From the good folks that brought you Wayla, Wan Wan does NOT disappoint. Service was impeccable and oh, the flavors, all the dishes were so simple yet complex at the same time. For starters we got the Moo tod nam pla (pork belly), taw hu tod (fried tofu), and ped krob salad (crispy duck salad). Just wow...you can't fail with any of these. Pork belly is obvs a no-brainer, the fried tofu was coated with almost a mochi-like exterior which was very unique and worked so well, and whoever thought to add crispy kale chips in that duck salad is a genius. The Guay tiew nua (wagyu beef noodle soup) had some of the tenderest slices of beef I've ever had, and the broth was just divine. Make sure to leave room for the pandan coconut pudding dessert, because I would eat that every day if I could. Wan wan if you're reading this, PLEASE sell this dessert for takeout because I will legit come by every day *please*

Enjoyed a meal with a friend here recently, where we sampled a couple small dishes and a noodle dish. The tofu had a sticky/gooey quality to it which was pretty cool, though I think the peanut sauce could have been a little more flavorful or maybe I just needed more of it in general. The ribs were really great, sitting in a delicious sauce, and actually fairly easy to eat, tender and not too many bones. The crispy pork belly was good but I was expecting bigger pieces. On the other hand, the small pieces allowed for more chili sauce to pork belly bite ratio which was worthwhile. Finally we had the noodles with roast chicken, which I was hesitant about since I rarely order chicken dishes at restaurants, but the chicken skin here was so crispy and good, and the rest of the flavors and vegetables in the noodles were quite good together. Overall pretty solid food, great service, and with no liquor license yet, the bill stays pretty low!

Super duper delicious. Complex, rich, deep flavors. The curry was kick-you-in-the-face spicy. Didn't have anything that I thought was less than a 10/10. I can't wait to return.

Really nice intimate spot for dinner with kind servers who provided great recommendations for dishes. The Guay Tiew Kua Gai (9/10) and fried tofu (8/10) were our favorites. Crispy chicken skin tasted burnt (5/10) and fish dish with broccolini was small and lacking flavor (4/10).
LOVE. Every dish we got was incredible. Particularly recommend the Guay Tiew Kua Gai dish.

Not worth a visit for Thai food. Limited menu; mostly fried food that looks like it came out of a Trader Joe's frozen dinner box; and a mostly noodle centric main course menu that is not authentically "Thai." Seasoning didn't "pop" like Thai food is supposed to do when it hits your tongue. Menu super small. No liquor license. They don't permit BYOB either. A total "miss" for Thai cuisine. Two starts because they were nice but the kitchen is a rudderless ship.
Food was excellent and authentic. Portions were small so you can try many different dishes. Service was great. Highly recommend.

Absolutely loved the overall dining experience here at Wan Wan! Everything from the food, the decor, the staff was excellent. Also, the location couldn't be better with it being so centrally located in the center of trendy Nolita. I felt the food was very authentic and the menu had a great selection of dishes you don't see at your basic Thai restaurant. I would highly recommend Wan Wan!

Loved the speakeasy entrance vibes. We got the dumplings, noodles, fish and steak. Everything was good but given prices and portion sizes I expected more. The biggest disappoint was perhaps the cocktails, we tried a few and they all fell flat. While this was overall an enjoyable meal, it's not worth the trek down here and there's much more affordable Asian food for less in nyc.

The service and ambiance were top-notch. Our staffer and other staff members constantly checked- in on us to ensure we enjoyed the food and drinks. They explain the order in which the food would be delivered to the table. I especially enjoyed the streamed black sea bass with ginger, red chili, peppers, and scallions. I would be returning to House of the Red Pearl, just on the hospitality alone!

Went on a food crawl throughout this food hall for dinner and this was our first stop. Definitely make reservations here on the weekend because everywhere was pretty full, especially this spot. We split the cumin lamb and dumplings here and both were very good. The dumplings were tasty, but a bit overpriced for the quantity. The cumin lamb was great and a better portion. Never had cumin lamb like this before, which I'm pretty sure was deep fried at some point giving it a nice crunch with each bite. Probably would not go out of my way to come back, but if ever at a show at Pier 17 I'd consider it.

Review for the bar and drinks only. My friends and I stumbled upon the bar when we were wandering around the Tin Building, and we were lucky to snag a table in the small lounge area to chill and chat. Drinks were alright, maybe just a tad bit more on the sweeter side than expected. I wouldn't come out of my may to stop by here, but it's a nice small bar if you're looking for a drink in the area.

What a great way to end our NYC trip! It was so fun to find this little secret in the Tin Building (on the second floor). The service was LIGHTENING quick. The food was so delicious! (Chinese fusion and we loved all the dishes!) This would be our biggest "must-do" for anyone because it's such a fun, unique and delicious experience!!
No comment

The house of the red Pearl is meant to be a speakeasy within the Tin building. Located on the second floor through the mercantile shop, you go through a curtain on the back left to a dimly lit entryway that open up to a beautiful bar area. The main dining room has globe lights on the ceiling that resemble peeled lychees. The tables are predominately round booths that can comfortably seat up to 6 people. There are stylish touches everywhere, from the cut of the red menus to the matching outfits of the wait staff. They do have a cocktail list but we chose to try the sodas- I recommend the patriot chili soda. Our table of 4 overprder a bit but we wanted to try many of the dishes. The spare ribs were phenomenal. The meat basically melted off the bone in my mouth. The sauce that comes with the cabbage and shrimp rolls is rather spicy so just be aware. The main dish section is meat heavy so I recommend adding a green (we added the pea shoots but the cucumbers would've worked). The monkfish was probably the best dish on the menu. I don't see it often and it was beautifully done. I believe it was lightly breaded and mixed in with bok choy. The chili chicken was predominately chilis. We've encountered this every time we've ordered a similar dish. I would say it's a dish I recommend  anywhere. Each person is given their ow bowl of white rice with the main dishes. We opted for the fortune cookie desert and it was not at all what I expected. It has a fudge base, and then a layer of orange meringue, as well as vanilla ice cream and finally the giant cookie. There was one other gelatin like ingredient to it that I can't name. It was very fun but not my favorite. Overall you cannot discount the aesthetic. I'd recommend for a date night. Or you can visit the bar for drinks and apps.
No comment

Interesting menu.  Shared type of selections.  All quite small .  Got the chicken and it was 90%  mini hot peppers.  It was good but way to many peppers. Not necessary.  Great service.  Food was good .

We went for my friends birthday dinner we had to ask for everything twice because staff was rude and slow , charged us for things we didn't even order then claimed the bar was closed at 10 and that they didn't have any ice?? Absolutely disgusting wait staff manner, food is decent , tried to feed my vegan friend, a shrimp, spring roll, and they said it was tofu it was not she could've had a serious allergic reaction. Staff was not up to par.
Absolutely loved our dinner last night for my partners birthday. Their house sodas, spring rolls, fried rice, and fortune cookie dessert were delightful!
No comment
No comment
A cool "speakeasy" vibe with exceptional ambiance and food to match. If you can get a table, get the chicken and lamb!

Even if my server and the kitchen hadn't gone so far out of their way to accommodate my allergies, I would have been absolutely in love with House or the Red Pearl, just based on the incredible food and the retro-chinoiserie... The steamed sea bass was so tender and delicate, the ma la chicken was so fresh and crispy, the monkfish with bok-choy was so zesty and smoky, the lamb with cumin was so wonderfully layered & textured... And the heavenly broth on the lobster noodles was beyond superb... Sichuan is my second favorite cuisine (ISAN THAI FTW), and over the years I have had hundreds of lunches & dinners at 'authentic' restaurants in Flushing Chinatown and Manhattan Chinatown and Brooklyn Chinatown, and I am being very honest when I say that this is EXCELLENT cooking. Is it authentic? Ish. It's influenced, but most importantly, it's INSPIRED. This is actually beautifully cooked food, with respectful nods toward the originals but it is in no way "watered down." Yes, the menu prices are a bit steep initially, but I've paid nearly as much other places and wasn't as satisfied.

Beautiful decor, fast service, excellent drinks and good food. The ginger margarita and sea bass were my favorite.  However, the only thing I didn't like was sitting by the kitchen which had bright light. I would suggest asking for a table farthest from the kitchen when making reservation or sit at the bar.

Nice place to dine. Hard to find the place though which actually adds to the experience. Love the staff. Good vibes. The reason why I gave it 4 stars is the food falls off a little bit. Pretty unique flavors that taste on the healthier side. The bacon fried rice was a bit of the let down with all the Brussels sprouts and there flavor over powered the huge chunks of pork. Will be back again this week for sure though.

The service was outstanding! We tried various dishes and they were all delicious. Looking forward to coming back. It was a pleasure to meet Tanasia, whom I believe was the manager. She was very sweet.
Beautiful restaurant. Decor and ambiance are definitely amazing and the service was great, though the food was a little disappointing, the restaurant should and need to improve the menu.
No comment
Service and the ambiance are great but the food - even in its inspired version- is just not delicious or worth the visit.
No comment

I hope Jean George gets to read this review, we actually saw him at the tin building right before we ate at Red Pearl. While the decor is stunning, the service and quality of food is subpar. My husband and I travel a lot of visit JG restaurants but this one is extremely disappointing. I'd say even PF chang is far better and that's such a crazy thing to say. We had a lot of apps and the monk fish and spicy chicken and some sides. I wouldn't re- order anything. I hope they get to fix the quality of the food because the place has a lot of potential given the hidden speakeasy vibes and decor.

I really wanted to like this place more.  It's a beautiful space, ambience, music and noise level all good.  My husband and I live about a 5 minute walk away and he loves Chinese food (I'm more of a Thai fan) so I though this Chinese inspired restaurant would be a nice compromise for us and close to home.  We had a 6pm reservation and could have been out the door at 630- that's how fast pace the service was- way too fast.  The drinks were good- I had yuzu drop and he had ketel/cran- no complaints  - very good.  We ordered egg drop soup (very good), veg spring rolls (tasteless), 3 nut noodles (gloopy mess- reminds me when I make sesame noodles at home and forget to rinse the noodles before adding them to the sauce), monk fish (I thought this dish was quite good- chunks of fried monkfish with bok choy and a bean sauce- my husband hated it).  Service was nice and I'm sure we'll intentioned but the kitchen was way too fast. I'll come back for soup and a drink at the bar but I don't think I'll be able to drag my husband back...

Some hits and some misses - the gumbo and rice with octopus were both pretty salty, and the yellowtail crudo could've used a little more seasoning on the fish itself instead of on top of it. The favorite of the night was the corn dumplings! Super interesting and different

Food was pretty good! Everything was unique and flavorful. The corn dumplings were delicious. Overall, everything was really good but it was super expensive for small portions. Would consider going back for a special occasion.
No comment
No comment

Mokyo - the sister restaurant to thursday kitchen - is phenomenal. The service was extremely friendly and attentive. We were seated right away for our reservation on a Saturday evening. There is a spacious room in the back of the restaurant with beautiful, rustic decor. Our waiter suggested ordering 2-3 plates per person - each plate was shared with the table. We had the corn dumplings, beef tartar, wagyu oxtail spring roll, scallop (served with a yummy creamy purée), gumbo, and noodle (best one) - and we loved every single dish. Each dish is small but the food was fresh, flavorful and beautifully plated. Overall, great service and food, will return!

LOVE this spot! Every dish is so delicious and unique. Especially love the oxtail spring rolls, lobster roll, and yellowtail crudo.

Went to dinner there with my son based on a recommendation from someone on my flight to Manhattan. So glad I went there. We had the corn dumplings and 5 out of 5, beef tartare 4.5 out of 5, yellowtail crudo 4 out of 5, lobed roll 4.5 out of 5, gumbo 4.5 out of 5, rice with octopus 5 out of 5, and lastly injeolmi mousse 4.5 out of 5.  Top 5 best meals in the past year.

Mokyo is the sister restaurant to Thursday Kitchen, but I definitely enjoyed Thursday Kitchen more.  The food here was delicious, but the portions are extremely small for the price.  I know they serve tapas, but I think I could have used a little more in each plate.  The best dish here was the Octopus with Rice.  That is definitely a must get, and the most worth it.  The ribs are also very good - fall off the bone, juicy, and flavorful.  The corn dumplings are sweet and creamy with a little citrusy kick to them - delicious!  Every dish is very creative and delicious.  I just wish the portions were a bit bigger.  Definitely come here if you want just a snack, not a meal.

Really cute spot, come with friends and share a bunch of things, or a cute spot for a date night! They have cocktails in capri sun bags. The mango lychee was really good! Also they give welcome sake shots which is a nice touch. For food def do the oxtail spring rolls and cauliflower, both were amazing. Noddles are good, and we got the scallops which were also amazing! Would def come back to try more of the menu.

Super similar to their sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen. A different menu offered with a slightly different spin on fusion. My favorites were the corn dumplings and wagyu

Drinks, food, ambiance are similar to Thursday kitchen. Their apps such as ceviche and dumplings are prime!! The strawberry soju is a must! Enjoy your time here to relax. The staff is attentive and food phenomenal.

Everything was so inventive and delicious. The corn dumplings and jambalaya were incredible. Cocktails were delicious and great value too.

There is no debate when it comes to Mokyo. Not only did i thoroughly enjoy my meal but i RETURNED BACK a week later because I could not stop thinking about the truffle corn dumplings and oxtail spring rolls. Those are by far the 2 best menu items. I also got the rice and octopus which was incredible. I typically don't enjoy octopus but I enjoyed this so much I got it again on my return. The plantains were just average but I am confident they were the only "average" thing about the menu. The steak was incredible as well: juicy and served medium rare. I can't wait to return back to Mokyo because the food is to die for and the ambiance just makes the experience that much better.

Came with a party of 5 and we decided to order everything on the menu. Our server started us off with a round of complimentary sake shots, and they were also gracious enough to accommodate an extra person (we had made the resy for 4). All the dishes were great, but some standouts were the Cauliflower, Corn Dumpling, Lobster Roll, Scallop, and Noodle!

A bit disappointed in MOKYO. Their sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen, is better in my opinion. The dishes at MOKYO are overpriced for what they are worth. Their hints of Korean flavor are miniscule. Walk-ins have to sit at the bar even when tables are empty.

Mokyo is a gem! It is a sister restaurant from Thursday kitchen which is one of my favorite restaurants. They have some similar menu items and new ones as well. It would be a little bit better if it had more different items than Thursday but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu

Really cute and fun experience! The small plates were great and super tasty - loved the little lobster rolls and the corn dumplings. The cocktails were also so fun and cute. My only complaint is that the portions were so small - we unfortunately left a little hungry!

Must try everything in the menu! The tastes, flavors and presentation makes you feel like you're at a Michelin restaurant! Also the service was wonderful! 10/10 will definitely come back soon!

Nice service and decor. The food was a bit of a hit or miss. We ordered 8 dishes for the 3 of us. I enjoyed the corn dumplings, scallops and wagyu steak. The yellowtail, plantains, spring rolls and lobster rolls were ok. The steak was too chewy and we had to spit it out. Overall it was a nice experience but way overpriced for the quality and quantity. Not likely to return

Really excited to see so many modern Korean places pop up around the city, and Mokyo lived up to the hype! Out of what we ordered, the corn dumplings, oxtail spring roll, and cauliflower were the standouts. I was tempted to get another order of the corn dumplings - they weren't what I expected and unlike anything I've tried before, but the combination of the savory corn and parmigiano with the truffle salsa was a touch of genius. We also got the rice with octopus which I thought I'd love since I'm a huge congee/juk fan but found a bit bland. The injeolmi mousse was honestly one of the best restaurant desserts I've had -- definitely don't skip it, it was a perfect ending to the meal.

Sister restaurant of Thursday kitchen. Quaint eating environment with friendly staff and free sake. Food was great and came quick, was expecting a bit more for the price but would come back again
No comment

The entrance of the restaurant looks small but they actually have plenty of space in the back. We ordered the spring roll, octopus with rice, and corn dumpling and honestly it's enough for two people. The corn dumpling tastes similar to Thursday Kitchen's edamame dumplings but my favorite dish has to be the octopus with rice. It is flavorful and the rice is well prepared. 10/10 would come back to try the tartare and scallops

One of the best meals I've ever had. I would give recommendations for what to order but we honestly tried so much and it was all spectacular. I'll make this place a regular visit when I'm in New York. Try it asap
