They give you a complimentary shot of sake before you even order! We are two two tiny girls and we ordered 5 dishes and we were pretty stuffed. The order of tasty dishes was 1) octopus rice 2) scallops 3) ribs 4) gumbo 5) beef tartare. We also ordered the hazelnut mousse and it was amazing. Overall, the presentation and taste was on point. It was about $200 in total. Service was attentive and food came out fairly quickly. Would recommend and dine again!
No comment

Wow, this place was incredible! My husband and I are still in conversation days later about how fantastic the food was. From arrival, our expectations were far exceeded. Everyone working here was kind and the service was superb. We tried a bunch of different dishes from the menu and liked everything but one dish (the cauliflower was kind of basic). The server recommended 2-3 per person and he was definitely right. Each dish was a small tasting and had its own distinct flavor profile. The corn dumplings were complex and delicious. The texture was smooth and it just had such a wonderful umami taste. The beet tostada was also interesting and had so many different textures in each bite. The food on the menu seemed simple, but each bite was so much more complex than it appeared. I can't wait to return on my next visit to the East Village!

Quality, creative, and delicious Korean fusion dishes. We really enjoyed all the dishes we ordered including dessert. The octopus rice was especially wonderful with melt in your mouth octopus. Service was attentive.

An amazing Korean fusion small plate restaurant, Mokyo, the sister restaurant of Thursday Kitchen, presents an elevated experience of comfort Korean fusion. Everything on their menu was excellent, but standouts include the lobster roll, corn dumplings, and octopus rice. Would def nut again
No comment
No comment

Portion are small but it's essentially Thursday Kitchen 2.0. If you're familiar with their first restaurant then you'll enjoy Mokyo too. The food is good and the drinks are fun (if you get the adult capri-sun soju cocktails). Restaurant is small, not as dark as Thursday Kitchen and not as loud. Food is good but nothing was out of this world.

Thursday and Mokyo both have me at a chokehold. They're both so good and I always have trouble deciding which one to go to. If I can have a subscription to come once a month or two a month I definitely would. Corn and edamame dumplings by far my favorites. Only thing I would consider for space is expanding!

The food was very good. There are definitely a lot of unique flavors. The corn dumplings, The noodles and the cauliflower were my favorite. do not try their cocktails. They don't have a liquor license so many of the drinks are unusual. The vibe is good. The wait staff was nice but a little bit hard to understand. The water was refilled every few minutes. I do think it's a little too pricey for the portion size.
The food is to die for. I love this place and have been twice. Definitely make reservations cause they are fairly busy.

Cozy, clean find on St. Marks. Korean traditional flavors mixed with a modern spin and it works!! Each tapas/dish was carefully crafted and prepared. The food was excellent and surprisingly filling. We had three people and seven plates. Our favorites were: corn dumplings, octopus and rice, and sweet plantain katsu. Service and servers are so excellent!! Definitely recommend it!

this korean fusion restaurant is very delicious. each plate was very unique and full of flavor.

I finally got to try mokyo after wanting to go for so long. I am a huge fan of Thursday's kitchen so when mokyo opened up, I had no doubt that it would be amazing as well. The food was so delicious and everything that I expected. We had a total of 6 dishes between two of us( they are small tapa style dishes) and we finished every last bite. We left full and content. My favorite was definitely the pork jowl. It was super tender and had a buttery texture. The corn dumplings reminded me of Thursday's kitchens truffled Mac and cheese which is my favorite dish from Thursday's so that was amazing. The mini lobster rolls and the gumbo also did not disappoint. Other than the amazing food, our server Sophie was such a joy to be around and gave us the best experience. Bernard also took great care of us. I would definitely recommend and will be bringing all of my friend back!

No comment

Super fun spot with some amazingly creative and tasty dishes! The menu is all small plates, so it's a fun spot for a date and an even more fun spot to dine with a group. Then you get to try more! The restaurant is lively, making it a fun spot for a weekend night. Our waiter was incredibly kind, guiding us through the menu and checking in between dishes. The drinks were served in giant adult Capri sun pouches with a light on the bottom, which amused us to no end. On top of the silly but cute presentation, the drinks were great! I recommend the pure strawberry and the mojito. But the stars of the night were there dishes, specifically the cauliflower, oxtail spring roll, Berkshire rib, and noodle dishes. I would also recommend the sweet plantain and and crudo. The beet tostada was good, but I'd be fine skipping it, and the pink lady apple was the least favorite of the bunch. But overall, every member of our party had a different favorite dish- the mark of a great night enjoyed by all!

Got a couple of different tapas here and the lychee reach rich. I'm normally not a huge fan of cocktails but the lychee drink was really good and was served in a transparent pouch with a small light inside, which was fun. The tapas themselves were pretty overpriced in my opinion. The server said 2-3 tapas is reasonable per person but I was not really full after 3 and I have a smaller appetite than most people. The ambiance was also nothing to write home about in my opinion - I thought it was too loud to hear the people I was eating with. This would have been ok had the prices been a bit more reasonable.
No comment

Mokyo is the sister restaurant of Thursday Kitchen. We came here on a Wednesday night and were able to be seated quickly. The menu is very similar to Thursday Kitchen as in it's all tapas but with very different flavors. The chef is the same in both locations and she's so talented. We ordered 6 dishes to share between two people and we were stuffed! Everything was delicious but I think the gumbo was my favorite. I loved the corn dumplings as well, its taste was nothing like I've ever had before but in a good way. Bernard took care of us that night and he is amazing! Such great customer service. He even gave us some sake tastings. Great food, great cocktails as always and great company. What more can I ask for? 100% recommend for a date night or even to catch up with some friends. They do have a larger table now that indoor dining is available.

This place is absolutely divine. I took a friend here for an early dinner and we left feeling full and happy. We were catching up after several months of distance and having a delightful meal to pair with our reunion was bliss. I cannot recommend the corn dumplings enough. I also think the noodle are not to be missed. My friend has an allergy to nuts so the waiter explained what dishes had nuts before we ordered. Unfortunately the noodles are made with a peanut sauce, so I got them all to myself. The service and the food were perfect. Phenomenal experience.
No comment

Managed to get a walk in 2-ppl table on a Sat night - a bit lucky in fact as the place quickly get more crowded. Very unique Korean fusion food with wild ingredients that surprise your palate. Loved the pork jowl - the strong taste is balanced so well with the squash. The oxtail spring roll is an exciting creation of a modern comfort food. Would love to come again.

This place is awesome! Super cozy vibe, very LES style layout and decor. The cocktails come in cute bags with light up cubes and are delicious. The service is wonderful and the food is sooo tasty. We got the spring rolls ( so good), corn dumplings ( very rich and very good) the noodles and the ribs. All the food was so flavorful and our server took great care of us, we even got a little welcome shot! Highly recommend this place, make sure to book a reservation ahead of time!
No comment

one of the cutest restaurants i've been to in the city! fav dishes were the lobster time and oxtail spring rolls (not pcitured) drinks were really pretty and a little on the stronger side. even if you come with just two people, you can get ~5 dishes. i'd def come back to try their other items like the dumplings which look really good! best part was the amazing service-the waitress (or maybe she was the owner) was super genuine and was patient when she was explaining her recommendations.
No comment
Can get expensive if you are ordering to be full at the end of the meal. Recommend the corn dumplings and steak. Food was extremely good!

Great food and great service at the right price. I actually enjoy every dish on this menu and love the pace/flow here. Some favorites are the ribs, lobster rolls, oxtail and dumplings but as I said, you can't go wrong with anything.
No comment
No comment
UPDATE: went back to Mokyo for Valentine's Day.  Ordered the pork jowel - MUST have, the dish is divine
No comment

I think Mokyo might be my favorite Korean restaurant in all of NYC! We ordered 5 dishes and at the end were debating which one we liked the most (hint: they were all absolutely delicious but it was the corn dumplings for me). They do have a strict reservation policy, but the food just doesn't disappoint. Highly recommend this place to anyone who wants a punch of flavor with every bite!
No comment
Was able to taste multiple dishes, all very flavorful. Friendly staff, cozy vibe, great food & drinks.
No comment

Amazing food, cocktails and friendly staff! The corn dumplings are a must have! They burst open in your mouth, and the truffle accent flavors were divine. I also loved the plantains and yellow-tail sashimi. So delicious and excellent. If you like spicy things, get the cauliflower. It seriously tasted like spicy Buffalo crispy chicken. Perfect temperature and texture. The lychee-mango cocktail  brought back memories drinking Capri Sun, served glowing from inside oh and I forgot the shot of sake they brought to welcome me. So fun.
No comment

This is by far my favorite restaurant, the customer service and the food is absolutely amazing. Without a reservation they sat my friend and I down during a busy dinner time AND where able to give us a bigger table when our third friend arrived. They proceeded to give us complimentary sake shots and complimentary shots of their nicest vodka. The food here is something I have never tasted before, I literally cannot get enough. If I could give this place 11 stars I would.

Delicious food, refreshing drinks and amazing service make Mokyo worth a visit! We ended up coming here because the sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen, had a 2 hour walk-in waiting list. So glad we did! Ordered a grapefruit beer - fresh draft Sapporo mixed with grapefruit for only $6. We also ordered the corn dumplings, spicy noodles and octopus with rice, which was plenty for two people. The service was really polite and excellent too, and I appreciated that the servers explained each dish as they set it down. Happened to come here on the night of the flash storm, and they even quickly reconfigured the umbrellas to help us stay as dry as possible. I want to come back and try everything else on the menu!

I had a dream the other night about the corn dumplings here and honestly I don't even like dumplings in general that much. Or corn. Low key and intimate atmosphere added to the experience. Every item on the menu is  you cannot go wrong. Go with the server recommendations. Complimentary sip of sake at the beginning of the meal too, nice. Try Thursday kitchen too right around the block if you love this place!

This place was absolutely delicious!!! When we ordered we asked the waitress what the best dishes were and she suggested the lobster roll, corn dumplings, and pork jowl and they did not disappointed! Each of those dishes were so flavorful and tasty it was like an explosion of goodness in my mouth with each bite. The corn dumplings were incredibly unique in their flavor profile, it is hard to describe. The sauce was slightly sour and balanced well with the starchy flavor of the corn filling inside the dumpling. The pork jowl was so soft, it practically melted in your mouth, and was incredibly well seasoned. The lobster roll was my personal favorite as the bread was so soft and the lobster was perfectly cooked with a wonderful sauce to top it off. The other items we ordered were definitely not as good as the first three. The plantain katsu was boring compare to those other dishes and it just didn't have as much flavor. The pistachio sauce definitely helped with the flavor but overall it was not as good. The oxtail spring rolls were fairly average and the sauce didn't add much flavoring to it. The meat was very soft and cooked well but it lacked seasoning in my opinion. My least favorite item was the gumbo as I just didn't liked the seasoning and it tasted the most generic to me. I enjoyed the pop rocks dessert though as the ice cream wasn't too sweet but had a thick texture that paired well with the fun pop rocks. Overall, I would definitely order those first three dishes, maybe even a couple of each because they will impress.
No comment

Lovely spot with attentive service. All the dishes we ordered were amazing, no complaints. My favorite would have to be the super tender and flavorful pork jowl. Every other dish was great too, butternut squash toast with the steak was really smooth and buttery, corn dumplings were creamy and delicious, lobster roll had amazing flavor, and the spring rolls were perfectly crispy. Dishes are small so I would recommend at least 5 dishes to share for two people.

Possibly my favorite restaurant in the entire city. It's even better than Thursday Kitchen which I thought would be unbeatable. The food is like no other you will ever eat anywhere else. Every single dish we had was phenomenal.

Went for a post-date snack and drink, and I loved it. They have a large menu of sake and soju; we ordered a carafe of sake ($22). The small-plate style was super conducive to sharing food. We had these fusion dumplings ("corn dumplings" on menu) that seemingly combined Korean and Tuscan cuisine (the dumplings had truffles and parmesan cheese). I then went again for a proper dinner and it did not disappoint. We ordered 6 plates for 3 people, which was perfect portion-wise. Oxtail spring roll, lobster roll, gumbo, and pork jowl were divine and highly creative. Octopus and wagyu were okay and not super exciting.

Great food and great dinner date location. Tapas - small portions, told to order 2-3 per person. Small portions and it being slightly pricy matches the slightly upscale atmosphere. Corn dumplings: A+ creamy, milky, and complimented perfectly with truffle flavor. Would definitely order again. Pork Jowl and steak: both were cooked well with excellent flavor. Chicken: average, powerful sriracha flavor, worth skipping. Noodles: not chewy, flavor okay, do not recommend. Had fun cocktails, including a lychee drink and a mojito. On the sweeter side which I actually enjoyed.
Love this Korean tapas-style restaurant.  Amazing, flavorful, and creative creations!

Mediocre and a rip off. It's the kind of place where they serve 20 cents worth of plantain for $12. Literally 6 slices of plantain! I left hungry and got a second dinner in the east village after ordering everything on the menu with a party of 4.
Love this place. Fantastic food. Fantastic service. This restaurant is now on my rotation of places that i will happily visit monthly.

Fantastic restaurant. I've previously been to Thursday Kitchen and was thrilled to be able to get a seat at Mokyo. I went with a party of four and it was an amazing time. Their plates are simply explosions of flavor and brilliantly created. The attention to detail and service is top-notch. Definitely gives off Michelin star-rated atmosphere. Hope they can keep up their consistency with the food and service being exceptional. Look at their menu before hand, order all the tapas, fun drinks and lastly, have a blast.

Yooo! This place is SOOO dank, some of the best quality food I've had, such a fun atmosphere and such good service, Sophia was our server and she was amazing  like I'm not kidding I fully wanted her to stop working and just come eat dinner with us, such a eccentric person who seemed to be just so herself. she made dining here just that much better. Give that girl a raise

phenomenal food and service. in two weeks i've gone three times and find every opportunity to go again. the environment is boisterous yet intimate and the servers are so hospitable. i always have an amazing time. when you're eating, all you want to do is close your eyes and take it all in.

Second time dining here and I can't wait to fo back! The corn dumplings are sooo good I could eat 3 bowls of just these - the combination of a creamy truffly dumpling in the cilantro sauce is outstanding. The Rice w/ Octopus and the Noodles w/ Brazilian nuts were delicious too.
Straight up one of the best spots in all of NYC. The food is amazing and the wait staff is wonderful. Huge thank you to Bernard and David for making my dinners here amazing

Came here for my friend's birthday and had a grand time. We all got soju shots on the house since we were returning customers. The service were on point and each dish was so interesting, but with familiar Asian flavors. You won't go wrong with anything, but the truffle dishes are especially great!
No comment

The service was amazing, each dish was unique and delicious, and the outdoor seating was cozy and warm. Highlights were the oxtail spring rolls, the cauliflower, the corn dumplings, and the octopus. Hurry out to support this local business! We will be back!
No comment

This place is truly excellent! All of the dishes are innovative and delicious, the service is impeccable and considering how good the food is, the prices are reasonable. You must get the corn dumplings, yellowtail, pork jowls and pop rocks dessert (best dessert I've ever had at an Asian restaurant)! Oxtail spring rolls, steak and lobster rolls were also great. We can't wait to try the sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen now.

Absolutely delicious. Ordered about half the menu and one dish was more impressive than the next. We especially loved the lobster rolls (incredibly flavorful) and the corn dumplings. Mushroom and cabbage was on point. Noodle dish was a party in our mouth.  Service was also friendly and super attentive. Don't miss out!

Got delivery, and the items were OK to our taste. Most of the dishes- Gumbo and octopus rice, were a bit too sweet for our taste. Would like the texture of octopus to be firmer. pork jowl was fatty, but that's probably what pork jowl usually is. Oxtail spring roll was heavy and salty. Dumplings were interesting but filling was mono textured. Maybe this kind of food can only really be truly enjoyed it in person at the restaurant.

If I had to choose between Thursday Kitchen or Mokyo, I would pick Mokyo everyday. The food here is carefully thought out and just hands down delicious. I was able to order everything on the menu, except for the persimmon and gumbo (they were out of the gumbo). I would highly recommend the noodles, corn dumplings, and korean steak. The mushrooms weren't my favorite, but still fairly decent.
No comment
Incredible food! Each dish is so unique. The dumplings and yellowtail were the best and must try!

Ordered the pork jowl, corn dumplings, gumbo, potato crisps and calamari. The pork jowl in particular was really good -- it literally melts in your mouth!! Would definitely get this if ordering here for the first time. The potato crisps were also a hit. Very attentive staff. Also I accidentally forgot my credit card on the table when I left, and a helpful staff ran after me for more than a block to return it. Was super grateful and wished I had thanked him more, but he ran back to the restaurant in a flash. Great place!

The food here was amazing! Came here on a Saturday night without reservations and we were seated inside. Our waiter, Bernard was friendly and helped us decide on how many dishes to order for my fiance and I since these plates were small. We got the Lychee Soda, Oxtail Spring Roll, Corn Dumplings, Rice with Octopus, Pork Jowl, Noodle and the Wagyu Steak. Of all the dishes we ordered, we both really liked the Corn Dumplings, Rice with Octopus and the Noodle. Will definitely come back!
No comment

Sort of disappointed :( My table ordered one of everything (except for the fish) and we only really enjoyed the pork jowl (absolutely delicious!). The other dishes were alright in our opinion. Cauliflower was drenched in the sauce (way too strong), steak had no sear, the rice with octopus was super salty and we couldn't finish it, etc. Portion sizes were really small for the price. Also I didn't like how there was such a long waiting period between getting served each dish - for a while we thought we were finished with our food since nothing came for ~15 mins but then 4 plates suddenly made their way through, so I wish they could've all been served at the same time/with not that long of a waiting period. The indoor seating area was also very hot and the water they served had no ice lol. Also, we had a birthday cake and they said it was $3/pp for the cake fee but when they took it out they didn't provide us with plates, forks, or cut it (which is usually the standard if you're paying the cake fee?) In the end I don't believe they charged us but I feel like if you're not "serving" the cake then $3/pp as a cake fee (esp for a large party) seems a bit much for simply keeping it in the fridge. Other than the food and service, the waiters were very nice and the drinks were good! For 6 people we spent $400 including tax and tip - so like $67 per person :( Not worth especially when everyone was still hungry in the end.
No comment

The service here was absolutely top notch, expect great service, comfortable atmosphere and chats with the waiters. Food was exceptional as well. Highly recommend if you have a small party and looking for a great small bite restaurant!
No comment

I love Thursday Kitchen and Mokyo did not disappoint. We especially enjoyed the corn dumplings and the beef tartare. It's fun and affordable! Don't skimp on dessert, the "pop rocks" dessert was surprisingly delicious and delicate. No reservations, so come early - we only waited for less than an hour

I went with my boyfriend on the weekend and omg I have to come back.  The food and the vibe is perfect for a night out with a couple of drinks. I got a little bit of everything on the menu like the dumplings and the beef tartar. I will definitely be back!

Literally Thursday Kitchen part 2 !!! Amazing flavors in every bite ! Corn dumplings , spring rolls , melt in your mouth steak , gumbo, duck fried rice ..... nothing is bad ! This place is phenomenal and I am so happy we have another option besides Thursday kitchen !

Now they do soft opening Tuesday through Sunday Pm 6:30-9:30 in heart of saint marks place. We went to last night and most of dishes are so amazing. Pretty presentation and great quality of foods. I'm a huge fan of Thursday Kitchen so I had high expectations but they never disappointed me. Similar tapas concept but so much different flavors of foods. Nice customer service and the servers knows about foods very well. I suggest visit them asap when they do soft opening because they will be busy very soon !!

I never give Yelp reviews, but this place is amazing.  Food is on point and the staff are the kindest in the industry.  Ambience is great and it is a hidden gem in the neighborhood.  Me being a selfish guy would like to keep this place a hidden gem, but everyone should have a chance to come here

Went here with a couple of friends last night and was pleasantly surprised by the meal. It's a small plates restaurant so we ordered about 12 dishes for the group. My favorites were the truffle dumplings and lobster rolls. Overall the flavors were really good but the dishes were quite small. I was surprised that we ordered 12 and I was stuffed. Definitely worth a try though!

Went here for a friend's birthday since we love Thursday Kitchen and we were intrigued by its new sister restaurant. Beautiful and unpretentious interior design, lots of small tables ideal for couples and small groups. Everything we tried was delicious and exciting. The big stand outs for me were the corn dumplings, scallop ceviche & injeolmi hazelnut dessert. Cocktails were refreshing and garnished served with the cutest tiny clothespin. Would highly recommend!
Such a wonderful experience with an innovative menu and excellent friendly service. Everything we ate was fantastic and unique. Highly highly recommend

We ordered the dumplings, ceviche, ox tail spring rolls, chicken, fried rice, steak, and lobster rolls, everything was amazing. Heard about this spot while dining at their sister restaurant Thursday Kitchen, it's safe to say I'm in love with the whole family at this point. Highly recommended for date night

Enjoyed my meal here last night! Everything was presentable and tasty. My favorites were the Korean steak and pork jowl. My friend and I were moderately full after ordering 5 dishes. Will be back to try more.
Great place for drinks small plates and good vibes. The hosts and staff will really take care of you. Highly recommend!
Went last Friday night and had a great experience. Both the food and service was truly amazing! Oxtail egg rolls and pork jowl with zucchini were my favorites
No comment
I had an amazing time! The food was better than heaven. Yaani I dont believe in gd but if heaven existed it would be better for sure.

This spot was just perfect!  Our server Bernard was beyond amazing!  He was so knowledgeable and informative and we felt like we were at 11 Madison.  His recommendations were spot on.  The corn dumplings were a flavor explosion, the peach salad was divine and the steak was amazing as well.  We tried the Seoul Soju and it's very rare and it was really unusual and special.  This place is a must try!

If I could, I'd give Mokyo 10 stars! My roommate and I lucked out and moved very close to this lovely Korean tapas restaurant, where the food and service are always impeccable. As a Korean I'm used to very traditional Korean dishes, Mokyo, however, never ceases to amaze with their contemporary spin on Korean flavors. We've become regulars now and have never received a bad meal. The steak, cauliflower, octopus risotto, and pop rocks dessert are some of our favorites, though you can't go wrong with any dish on the menu!  The service is amazing -- the staff are very attentive and extremely kind. We love Mokyo! 11/10 recommend.
Truly spectacular meal with great service and creative small plates. Our favorites were the corn dumplings, oxtail spring rolls and octopus fried rice.

This is going to be my new favorite restaurant in Saint Mark's! My friend and I had dinner here last night for their soft opening. We ordered 9 dishes, and everything we ordered was incredible. The food was unique, creative and incredibly delicious. Plus, the service was friendly, professional and really helpful. Definitely will go back again.
No comment

Holy moly this place is delicious. I had high expectations knowing how good Thursday Kitchen is and it did not disappoint. The pork was one of the best things I have ever eaten. The dumplings were incredible of course. The lamb as well is not to be missed.

Excellent neighborhood restaurant with a wide variety of options. The corn dumplings and the Taiwanese noodles were standout dishes followed by a perfectly cooked hanger steak and duck fried rice. The lamb and chicken both have potential but were unremarkable. Sally the waitress and David the manager split duties bring out dishes and explaining them in great detail. Charming EV location and worth a visit!

Was very excited to try this is new sister restaurant of Thursday Kitchen in East Village with my friends however sadly it didn't live up to the hype. One of us got there early to put our name down and the host said 45 min and logged us in on his ipad. Which was interesting because there were tables open. Then once we all arrived we checked back with the host again and we saw his ipad just had our name and a timer next to it showing how much time our of 45 min its been. So we were waiting for an ipad timer instead of which tables we're clearing up. We were sat at a table that we'd been starring at since we walked in that was free the entire time. The menu was great and the idea of small korean tapas is fun but I don't recommend going there with a big appetite. We had 9 plates between the 3 of us and were still hungry. The plates we're delicious though... Some of our favorites were steak, duck rice, and dumplings. Atmosphere wasn't anything special..

Great place - we had the Korean steak, the noodles, the mushrooms, the lobster roll and the lamp chops. Everything was just the right portion and delicious. Very friendly staff and great service. Would recommend
A sister restaurant of Thursday kitchen, mokyo delivers on food. The dishes are unique. The corn dumplings are amazing. Keep going back often. Definitely recommend!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Since its opening day, I've been so pleased that Casa Nono has joined the Myrtle ave strip. When I first saw the menu, I was looking forward to having more taco options in the neighborhood but then I actually tried the tacos and I was blown away by the portion size and the flavor. The tacos were amazing and ::whispers:: you are definitely getting MORE than what you pay for. So far I have had the fish taco, shrimp taco, birria taco, and steak taco and not one of those has disappointed me. The margaritas are also delicious ... there's an entire menu dedicated to them :). I know it's early but I'm really loving this spot and I would highly recommend Casa NoNo for anyone looking for great tacos.

Casa Nono is a hidden oasis in Clinton Hill. The food is delicious and flavorful. The atmosphere is calm but unique considering the area you are in. It was such a nice experience and the service is Top Tier. They catered to my love of mocktails and I even tried the beef tongue taco! It was soft and with the salsa verse, was amazing! Can't wait to go back!
No comment

Casa Nono is a Mexican restaurant in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn. It is from the same owners of Osteria Brooklyn nearby. The vibe is casual and the food is traditional with a modern twist. The staff was friendly and attentive. We started off with complimentary mini quesadillas served with their homemade salsa trio. It was a good start to a tasty meal. Casa Nono's drink menu consists of special reserve tequila, margaritas, beer, cocktails, mezcalitas, red, white and sparkling wine. The mezcalita de pina with 30 Banhez mezcal, grilled pineapple, jalapeño, cilantro, fresh lime served in a pineapple for two caught my attention. It's the sole alcoholic drink we ordered. I'm not usually a fan of mezcal, but this was palatable. We tried their traditional guacamole made with habanero salsa, avocado, tomato, onion, cilantro,  and serrano peppers. It was creamy with the perfect spice kick. We also had the camarones tiradito ceviche to start with shrimp, sesame salsa , avocado cilantro, basil, served with a corn tostada. It was very fresh and flavorful. Casa Nono has several taco options. We tried the birria with four hour braised chuck roasted beef, marinated onion, served with consumé, the chorizo and the pescado taco baja style with crispy cod fish, spicy jicama slaw, and guacamole. All of the tacos were delicious and I definitely recommend ordering them if you go here. We also tried their burrito. I believe it was pork inside of it. Everything was flavorful and filling. Next up, we had the paella nono with red mexican rice, shrimp, mussels, clams, chorizo, chicken, and sweet green peas. It was not the best paella I ever had, but was delicious nonetheless. We all really enjoyed it. For dessert we ended with the tres leches cake and coconut cake. Both were really good. I preferred the tres leches, but the coconut cake was moist (hate that word) and exceeded my expectations. I recommend trying both of them. Overall, this is a great restaurant to gather with friends over drinks and delicious Mexican eats. Definitely check it out if you're in the area.
So absolutely delicious!  From the margaritas to the tacos.  Delicious!  Guacamole and chips was massive and so fresh!  Yum!
I really enjoyed going to this place. Nice setting, excellent customer service, the food is fresh drinks and desserts super. The waiters are very friendly highly recommended.
No comment
No comment

Took myself out to dinner and was in the mood for Mexican food so I walked into this little gem! They start you off with a small warm cheese quesadilla on the house! The fish tacos were delicious; the margaritas were right!  The servers are very attentive and polite. I loved the space and the food! I will definitely be back.

Another winner for Chef Raffaele! A friend and I had dinner there Friday night and just WOW! We had the octopus w/chorizo, birria taco, ceviche, and their Casa Nono Paella and to finish off, their coconut cake. Everything from start to finish was delicious! Their drinks were also tasty. Will be returning back again and again.

Recently renewed, clean, and stylish on the inside. We brought our 6 month old in the stroller and there was plenty of space. Service was professional, food came quickly, and both tacos were delicious and well seasoned. The desserts looked great! But we were only in for a quick drink and snack. We will definitely be back.
Food was awful. Ordered taquitos and got 3 taco shells, one empty, one with just salad filling and one with cheese all burnt. Worst experience ever.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: This was a great dinner. Very creative and tasty Mexican food. Best Fajitas with steak and shrimp. Enchiladas were perfect. Mexican corn was incredible flavoring. Unbeatable guacamole presentation. Yum! Highly recommended!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Small Spanish tapas bar in Greenpoint. We stopped by for Happy Hour, just ordering one drink, and ended up spending the evening there, getting several dishes in the menu. It's simply delightful. Everything was so delicious from the bread to the olives and pimentos. The standouts for me were the chorizos and the scallops. The cheesecake is a traditional basque one and a must try!
No comment

Let me tell you, it's the perfect bar. Don't bother coming here if you just want a drink, because this gem will be wasted on you. The staff are as knowledgeable as they are passionate abt food; and they really care that you enjoy what you're eating or drinking. I love this place so much I stopped taking dates here because why TF would I speculate with fire?
No comment

AMAZING cocktails, but definitely not somewhere I would get food. It's expensive and honestly just not good. My "cheese platter" was two chunks of bread, 3 slices of manchego, nuts. and a lil piece of jam. Absolutely not worth the price! For $4 a shrimp I shouldn't have to devein it myself. Bartenders were great and I'll be back for drinks but definitely stay away from the food
No comment

The service was a bit awkward and was bumbled a bit. I'm not sure the situation there, but it was offset by one of the best martini I've ever had and very good tapas food. I will also note that for happy hour oysters, they were delicious and quite big. The setting was quite moody and cozy as well, which lent to a nice experience even at the bar and by myself, but would likely serve as a very nice date evening without the full meal commitment.

Came here on a solo date for myself and had a lovely time. Came for their happy hour, had the oysters and a vodka martini. Sat outside and enjoyed the lovely weather and the views of the apartment buildings, quintessential Brooklyn. The service was great as the waiter was knowledgeable of the menu and had a good energy. Would love to come here with friends and enjoy the park next-door looking at the Manhattan skyline.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

El Pinguino in Greenpoint is a Spanish tapas and seafood bar serving up some of the freshest seafood towers in NYC. We ordered the seafood tower for dinner which included a dozen oysters, bass ceviche, scallop ceviche, and crab salad. The oysters were among the best we've had in NYC and the scallop ceviche and crab salad were particularly excellent as well. We paired the raw bar with a mineral-forward Txakoli wine from the Basque Country in Spain. Still feeling peckish, we ordered the chorizo and roasted red peppers. Each came with fresh sourdough bread from Shewolf Bakery to mop up the delicious juices. El Pinguino is a must-try for some of the best raw bar in NYC. Be sure to show up during happy hour for half off oysters
No comment
Finally a chance to try conservas! Guided by our waiter's suggestions, we greatly enjoyed our tinned fish and oysters.

This Spanish seafood bar has excellent drinks and I love the food options. From the extremely fresh oysters with perfect mignonette to a curated conservas list alongside She Wolf Bakery bread, I would highly recommend making the trip to this restaurant. I would be sure to get the cheesecake. Not to mention, it's got great decor including an AM radio in the bathroom!

What a business model - most of the food is tinned/canned so non-perishable and little-to-no preparation work. And delicious to boot. I love seafood in general, especially tapas from Spain. I had an incredible, dry Basque cider. Fun wine list. The waiter was super helpful and friendly. Cozy, low-key vibe, great for a date or a soft conversation with an old friend. The garlic aioli was a nice touch. The only dish that was underwhelming were the warm peppers - but such is life.
No comment
Can't think of a better way to spend a late afternoon than this happy hour.

What an absolute lovely addition to the neighborhood! In the past,  fancy seafood is typically served alongside some smug attitude- but not at El Pinguino! This quaint bar serves excellent seafood like their mango ceviche (insanely delicious) and oysters (the one's we had from Canada were incredible) alongside perfectly made martinis (don't sleep on that happy hour from 4-7!). The staff here is extremely helpful and friendly and we made fast friends with Euan and Michael, both of whom had excellent suggestions and made our experience even that much more enjoyable. Perfect for a date night or just a night out with a friend, El Pinguino is the best way to start out your night, end it or just stay way too long and get very drunk on the sheer bliss of this place. Either way, you'll enjoy every moment of this delightful little bar. Can't wait to come back!
No comment
Wonderful Spanish seafood tapa. Great bar and good food with friendly staff. Get there early for happy hour.
No comment

No comment
Soooo cute. The back yard has a different menu compares to the inside, if I remember correctly
No comment

Small spot robust flavors! My second time here in five days. Came alone on 1/8 then again with the bf  on 1/14. We were welcomed, they remembered me, that was very special. On 1/14 Saturday late dinner (9:30pm reservation), we ordered the prix fixe from the bar, everything on the menu. We were not disappointed. Starter was salad w miso dressing and an injera type roti bread; it was light and delicious. Then we had a fresh baked sour dough with fresh soft in house made sea salt butter (Amazing). For dinner we had the tile fish and beef shoulder, both delectable and full of flavor. Tried the wizard's comb cocktail and loved it. At dessert we shared the passion biscuit and chocolate situation. Both were wonderful. So for $65 prix fixe it's a deal. High quality, bright flavors and 5star service! (We ended with hot espressos, also great)

Visited a friend in NY who raved about this restaurant and said we had to go while I was here to experience their 9 course meal. Ohhh and what an experience it wasThe ENTIRE staff is welcoming from the moment you enter the restaurant. Our server was amazing in helping me to choose my wine selections for the evening and the restaurant was able to accommodate my dietary restrictions within the menu for the evening. I love the collaborative approach of the staff in the serving each course. I loved everything with the exception of the desserts. I preferred one dessert more but neither were my favorites however that didn't take away from my overall experience. Each course built upon the next. Everything was exquisite. If you're in NY specifically Brooklyn and want a one of a kind dining experience, I highly recommend Oxalis.

Nice ambiance and service. The food was good but not enough to justify $165 price tag. We dine out every weekend and try to sample restaurants on "best" lists, so have a good reference point. If  you do pre-fix with no choice of substitute for this price, it has to be special. It was not. Scallop dish was good but I had a few gritty pieces. Meat had nice sauce and flavor, but a bit tough. We went to Nura last week and the dishes were more imaginative and tastier for more then 30 % less. I would give it solid 3.5 stars, because it doesn't meet expectations of what it should be.

This place was great! We did the bar prefixe menu and it was $65 per person. The service was great and I loved their cocktails and that they had seasonal cocktails as well. Everything was so fresh and flavorful!

First of all, we were welcome by warm hospitality. We ordered tasting menu for $125 ppl. Food is exceptionally creative, a beautiful combination of Eastern and Western elements. One of dish is tasted like fried Chinese turnip cake but with a twist of truffle that tickles your taste buds. Every course is definitely a surprise. Overall, the dining experience is enjoyable and worth every penny.
Sophisticated menu, service and venue worth Michelin's appreciation. Check for the fixed price menu in the veranda which offers nice fusion cuisine delicacies..

Went to get fine dining from this Michelin-Star-owned restaurant. We got the Carte Blanche platter, which was $70 each. The food was admittedly very delicious, many of the bites were amazing and the flavors burst in your mouth. The tuna with squid ink was good. However, I have one huge gripe with this restaurant, and it was that we were here from way too long, from evening to nighttime. This is because the dishes came out super slowly despite finishing our portions very fast. The ambiance of the restaurant was excellent though.
No comment

Oh boy this place is delicious!!! I'm so happy that I made the time to come here and try a lot of great food. Went to the back garden where they do their a la carte menu as opposed to the prix fixe within the main restaurant where you can see the kitchen. The service was impeccable as everyone was greeting me and all the staff was super friendly. We ended up eating with a chef of the restaurant as someone in our party knew her, so that was cool to get a glimpse into Oxalis' style and learn more about what we were eating. We ended up ordered... everything on the menu! My highlights were certainly the sourdough bread (which it seems like everyone and their mother is talking about); that butter was special!! But more than that, I loved the tomato spread with the rosemary lavender bread; I could have eaten that all up! I think the mushroom kebab (which just isn't a kebab at all) fell a bit flat, but still - all in all, this was a SPECIAL meal. The buttermilk dessert + the peach tart really rounded it all out. And my orange wine cocktail was delicious and served in the perfect glass. I know they have a more rotating menu here, so I'd love to come back sooner rather than later to try some great food. It came out to a bit less than $100/person, so considering it is a 1 Michelin-star place and we got everything on the menu, I think that's great; each dish isn't quite expensive so you can come in for a drink and some food and not break the budget. Enjoy!

Beautiful, delicate presentation. Food took our taste buds on a journey. Only offers tasting menu.
No comment

Very unassuming exterior. One of the best dining experiences we've had in a while. The service was amazing, the food was impeccable and unique but in the best way possible. We did their tasting menu on Saturday and left completely satisfied.
No comment

Delicious and able to accommodate vegetarian diets for the course meal. Always great to see Oxalis's take on the season's ingredients

They try hard and they succeed.  Most of the people there are very young, including the chef, and I very much am looking forward to seeing how they evolve and mature. They're really good right now and they're only going to get better, unless success and ambition makes them think there is something bigger and better than Prospect Heights waiting for them.

No comment

column3: South Kansas City, Kansas City, MO
column6: Had an outstanding meal at Oxalis. We opted for the carte blanche menu, which offered 9+ courses thoughtfully created by the chef.  Husband has the non alcoholic beverage pairing which he thoroughly enjoyed. I had the pineapple cocktail which was one of the tastiest cocktails I've had in awhile. Every course was delicious but we especially enjoyed the potato and seafood stew. I'm not sure how to describe it but to say it was savory and delicate and so rich in flavor. We also loved the flounder dish which was so fresh and both the cherry blossoms and green strawberry added so much to the dish. Staff was friendly and informative. Don't miss out on this excellent restaurant.

I visited Oxalis on a night when they had an event with Suntory Whiskey so there were some extra items on the menu. The food was delicious and drinks were amazing. My husband and I both had drinks from the special menu, and also tried the special dessert the cherry blossom roll. The rest was from their regular menu and we loved all of it, but the lamb collar was slightly underwhelming especially considering it's the most expensive item on the menu. Not as tender as one would expect for meet that has been cooked for 16h. I still give it a 5 star because, overall it was a 5 star experience!

There are some hits and misses with the carte blanche. Their sourdough was truly phonomenal - crispy on the outside, warm and soft on the inside (it's SO GOOD). Some of the food was simply way too salty for my liking. Flavors at oxalis tend to be bold, and sometimes not matching. One star off for the taste of some of the dishes. But their service is amazing! Their mocktail pairing was also super nice!
No comment

The menu here was surprisingly complex and insanely flavorful! I'd booked dinner here on a lark, not knowing what to expect, and was so glad I'd found Oxalis. Upgrade for the truffle supplement, you will not regret it!

Truly exceptional service. I've been to a number of "top" restaurants and the service here outshined it. Our waitress, Laurel, made the experience one of a kind. The food was also unique and tasty. We especially liked the golden beets and grilled tilefish. The chamomile dessert was also not to be missed. Thank you for a special evening

Outstanding service!  The danger of a prix fixe brunch menu that changes every few days is that you might show up to worse than an unknown quantity--but rather something you definitely don't like!  This was our problem.  The kitchen was good spirited about it: they were happy to prepare a few items ala carte, and between that and some sides we made out very well.  The potato rosti was filling, with a great pesto sauce, with a crispy outer layer, and not greasy.  The bacon was perfectly prepared.  The French 75 and Corpse Reviver cocktails were strong but had an excellent mixture of flavors.  When we first sat down I felt very self-conscious about the menu options, but we left very well fed and happy.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Oxalis features a la carte and tasting menu seatings, and we opted for the latter.  The experience was truly unique as dishes were composed of ingredients, sauces and technique I don't often see together.  One standout was the pumpkin tempura (perfectly fried) with miso sauce (which had a nice spicy kick!).  I also loved the hake with a lovely herbal sauce.  The restaurant is particularly proud of their sour dough starter and feature it in a handful of dishes too.  The bread with butter was phenomenal.  Fermented sauces and ingredients are also used throughout which ties the meal together in a thoughtful way.  The vibe at the restaurant is comfortable and welcoming.

Absolutely outstanding. I have been to Oxalis no fewer than three times for their tasting menu and they do not disappoint. Yes yes the sourdough is, in fact, out of this world but so are the thoughtful, ingredient-driven preparations of the other dishes. The technique and talent of the staff shines in each bright and flavorful bite. Oxalis is far and away my favorite restaurant in New York City right now, its inventive but plainly delicious food bolstered by an amazingly friendly and welcoming staff (a rarity in this city).

The pre fixe menu here is well worth the $105 per person carte blanche.  There were 12 dishes.  Each one was beautiful to look at.  Some of the items could have been more tasty, such as the aged black bass..  Some dishes fell flat like the grape Ceylon cinnamon, buckwheat.  This might sound interesting and perhaps tasty, but it wasn't.  On the other hand some of the dishes were quite good like the bread and butter, the grilled chanterelles, grilled Berkshire pork, the fruits and caramels.  Service was quite good.  One receives a hardy welcome at the door and multiple goodbyes and hope you enjoyed everything upon the departure.  Also the sommelier was quite knowledgeable.  There is an bar and  outside area for their snack menu.

5-star experience from the food to the staff to the atmosphere. This just might be my new favorite restaurant in the city. We did the carte blanche with some cocktails. Every course was excellent and so were the drinks. Plus, the playlist had me vibing. I'll definitely be back here, total gem!

Great service and lovely atmosphere. The wine and food were delicious, but limited menu. I really enjoyed the salad and butter. This is a great date night spot and not far from the museum.
No comment

Oxalis was on point! Service, vibe, taste and drinks were excellent! Had the $65 menu and everything was very good, couple of items were outstanding. The food here tasted better than what I ate at Le Bernardin. I was totally full after 4 courses so I probably won't go back for the 11 course option but I'm confident everything is good there as well. Right across from the Brooklyn Museum and Prospect Park. Give this place a try!
