No comment

The preset brunch was simple and elegant.  If you appreciate fine food and first class service it's easy to see the time and dedication that is spent on ensuring guest satisfaction, comfort, and quality put forth in each dish.  When our food arrived, I couldn't help but savor and marvel at the presentation, taste, and texture of each dish.  As a cook it really inspired me to rethink certain ingredients and preparations within my own style of cooking.  This is a place that has an experienced staff and a desire to give you a great dining experience that you will remember.

Garden room is gorgeous. Constantly shifting menu that's always interesting. Drinks complement the menu very well. Typically a little too fancy for me (you will be provided an ASMR description of your food upon being served), but everyone who works there is very chill. A tight ship whose baked goods, drinks, and entrees manage to all be top notch.

Mom took me and the fiancé here to welcome her new son-in-law to the family. This place didn't disappoint at all. The outside of the shop wasn't very impressive but once you walk in, it definitely felt very warm and inviting. My mom unfortunately made a mix up and didn't notice she put herself on the waitlist instead of getting the confirmed reservation. The staff did their best and offered their a la carte menu to us along with some free champagne (Obi Wine Keno Blue - cute play on Star Wars). Luckily as we were considering whether we should stay or not (not saying their a la carte wasn't appealing but mom wanted the big welcome for the new son-in-law), the general manager, Adrienne. stepped in and informed us someone cancelled. We were very lucky. (They usually have a set amount of ingredients and courses set for reservations so if you don't have reservations, from what I was told, they don't squeeze people in.) Everything was exceptional from presentation to taste. Service was wonderful and if I could come back more often for date night I would. Later, we found out their head chef (and owner) were originally from the West Coast (West Coast is the best coast - makes perfect sense why the food was so bomb) and moved out to New York to start his business here. Compliments to the chef and thank you to the wait staff for the wonderful service they provided.
No comment
No comment

During Covid, this restaurant does temperature checks when you enter, tables are very spread apart, and they change the paper covers on the tables after every guest. We started off with stone fruit on ice, which was topped with coriander seeds. This was a great refreshing start to our meal there. We also got the sourdough bread with the most amazing softened butter ever! We even used it as a dip at one point haha. I then got the tomato tart which had a delicious dressing on top. The shishito peppers came with a "teriyaki" flavored sauce, which added a variety of flavors to the peppers. The cocktails here came in cans, which I liked because the restaurant is taking Covid precautions seriously. The vegetarian main entree portions were a bit small, but I still felt very satisfied afterwards! Definitely worth the Michelin rating.
No comment
No comment

I went to Brooklyn with my partner to see an exhibit at the Museum and came across Oxalis. I have to echo the same sentiment that the service was poor / hosts were rude and incompetent. F+ at best. I called ahead of time (5:09 pm) to confirm if walk-ins were available for the tasting menu--which I was told yes. After stopping by in person, my partner and I were told we would wait 25-30 minutes at most and would receive a call. An hour and a half later I called again to see where I was in the queue and was told I'm next in line (7:30 pm). So my partner and I walked to a nearby bar to get a drink and chat. At this point (8:15 pm), we made a quick reservation for a 9:00pm slot (under the belief we would get an option for the tasting menu like promised) and walked over at 8:45 pm and spoke to the hosts. My partner and I were surprised by the passive aggressiveness and catty comments from the staff, and were told if we canceled we would be charged. Despite what we were promised verbally when we initially called 3.5 hours ago! We decided to take our business elsewhere. For how "upscale" this establishment is portraying itself to be I am surprised by the rudeness and lack of empathy my partner and I experienced interacting with this business / staff.
No comment

Amazing experience. Laid back atmosphere, which was wonderful after a long day - cocktails were inventive and excellent. Sat at the bar for dinner and bartender Sarah was engaging, attentive and made excellent drinks. The menu at the bar was simple, yet elegant and delicious. A gem of a find. Will be back to try the tasting menu.

I love this new neighborhood spot! It is now a Michelin starred restaurant which I am not surprised about at all! They have a prefix tasting menu but they are very flexible with food allergy accommodations. I came when I was pregnant and there were several items on the menu that I could not eat. Our waiter communicated efficiently with the chef and was able to accommodate every one of my wishes. It is a pretty big spacious space inside. It is great for an intimate date or a night out with girls. I had brunch there and it was delicious as well. They have a big outdoor space that I can't wait to try in the summer. It is very close to Brooklyn Museum and Brooklyn Botanic Gardens so it would make for a nice day to visit them and get a meal.
Amazing! Courteous, knowledgeable, attentive staff. Gorgeous plates. Interesting cocktails. Reminds me a lot of Olmsted.
No comment
No comment

Yummy prix fix with thoughtful wine pairings. Most of the pairings landed, some didn't, but all were creative and I felt like I had learned a little more about wine at the end of the meal. All of the courses were delicious! The trout with bergamot was incredible. This will be a place where I bring my visiting friends/family.
No comment
Brilliant, inventive, thoughtful, intentional restaurant.  Just absolutely fabulous.  We all had the tasting menu.  Can't recommend it more highly.
Lovely meal: Maitake kebab" on roti, yellow rice with cream and chard, asparagus with trout roe and smoked butter. Chamomile tart for dessert. Yum.
No comment

Oxalis was good, but for the price of the menu I didn't feel like anything I had really blew me away or was memorable. I tried the a la carte items and they were all pretty good, I think the bread with butter was the standout here. I would be open to trying the pre fixe if I go back, as I believe that's what they're really known and rated for. I do remember the service was wonderful though!
No comment
No comment

We've come here twice already (once for pre fixe menu and another for the a la carte menu.) Both times the food has been amazing! Lots of fermented + cultured dishes and creative use of ingredients. The service is also always impeccable. Definitely order the sour dough bread and the kebab, you will not regret it.

This dinner was one of the absolute best of our lives! The food was spectacular - every bite was mind-blowing and memorable. What was perhaps more surprising, however, was the impeccable service. Every single person we interacted with made us feel so special. An incredible experience all around.
Great food and discovered this restaurant has one Michelin Star  - would love to visit again around December for different dishes

Amazing food, staff, and service! Every dish from the tasting menu was unique and well executed. My only complaint, which is more of personal taste, was that I found the food to be a tad salty. The highlights for me was the dessert! The orange creamsicle was beyond anything I've ever tried.
No comment

Why didn't I find you earlier!!! Perfection! Just go to this place...but if you need to know why keep reading. Went for dinner and sat in the back courtyard. This is the more casual Al la crate setting. Still a lovely setting. But let me start with the greeting. You walk in the door and the kitchen is right there. Open and inviting. Smells of the amazing good greet you. A cook says hello and asked for our name. Even though there are hosts it was a nice way to be welcomed. We are led to our table. Every member of the friendly staff saying hello. Now let's get down to the main event. The drinks and meal! Every dish was heaven. The sourdough (fresh and warm with fresh butter.) Jambon! Totally different then plain old ham or prosciutto. The tuna carpaccio. Wow. Balanced and light. Sweet potatoes (lovely and light.) Next was the trout. This was the star of the show! I could eat this dish every minute of every day. And the beef was fantastic too. Drinks were fantastic and the wine selection is solid too. I will be back for the indoor set menu soon!

We made reservations for a party of 10. Our prefix dinner was $70pp. The service was amazing. This restaurant is more American rather than French based on the food we had. If you're looking for French food this is not the place. I felt the quality of the food was very fresh and dishes were unique and creative. I love the open kitchen as you walk in. I would've preferred to see the regular menu however our meal started promptly when our party arrived. I didn't realize we had an option to try other items on their menu until we were done with our meal. This was not necessarily the restaurants fault but rather me not asking as I was content with the meal that was previously arranged by my party. I was curious as we left the restaurant what else we could've tried while we were there but did not get a chance to try. If you have a big appetite this prefix dinner would not have been enough to fill you up. This is definitely a quality over quantity type of place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing food and even better service! The entire staff is so friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable. The food is always delicious and unique. I've been here a few times and have always been blown away. It has a very chic but urban vibe, perfect for date nights, GNOs, bdays/anniversaries or just a Tuesday dinner. My husband and I both love it here and will be back soon for brunch (which we've heard great things about)!!

Been tryin to post this review since last week cuz this place is def worth goin to cuz they do everything right. the food aint that expensive and they have most of the things people would eat. we sat outside and it was cool cuz you sit like in a space that has walls but its outside. the people was nice too.  To keep it real with u i thought the place was oxtails cuz i like jamaican food, but instead its like fancy regular food. My girl had a tasteing menu and I ordered the regular type of food. This place is also very careful with the covid.
No comment

My husband and I got the tasting menu. It was very good overall, but to be honest, it wasn't as amazing as I had expected. But I appreciate how well they made each dish, and the uniqueness of the ingredients. My favorites were the smoke trout and fall squash. The fish was cooked perfectly, but the sauce was a bit too salty. I also enjoyed my glass of pinot blanc. Service was wonderful.
No comment

Went to Oxalis for my wife and my first anniversary. Unfortunately the restaurant did not have room for us to take on the carte blanche menu, which we really wanted, but the food was nonetheless outstanding. In particular we loved the mushrooms, snails and coffee dish. I will absolutely be returning for that tasting menu!
No comment

Dined here back in December and was blown away by everything. Ordered the carte Blanche with the wine pairing so that I wouldn't have to decide a thing and dish after dish fascinated my palate and left me energized to try and run home to recreate what I had tasted. The space is comfortable and non-stuffy. Will be back soon.
No comment

I went here on Sunday night for a nice dinner with my girlfriend for our anniversary and it was fantastic! The food, service, atmosphere, drinks, everything was so so good. I also loved how not only was amazing but the servers were so warm and friendly that I didn't feel like I was in a stuffy fine dining environment. They truly made it a wonderful experience!
No comment
Amazing food, sophisticated and attentive. We went there 4 times , every time we left with fulfillment feeling. Testing menu with wine paring made my birthday complete.
No comment

Highly recommended for an adult evening out, special date night, or an occasion to celebrate. You'll enjoy an excellent meal, carefully crafted and conceptualized, from start to finish. I'd also suggest, if you're a duo, that you request the table with front row seats of the kitchen and the chef at work. I thoroughly enjoyed the added bonus of a show and it was really neat to see the composition and plating of each dish making its way to us. Oxalis offers a prix fixe dinner service (offerings change nightly) with optional wine pairing at an additional cost. My spouse and I elected to go all in and we loved the complete experience of everything being expertly selected for us - what a fun and delicious treat! We also relished in being surprised with the menu offerings for the evening when we sat at our places (hidden but neatly placed under our napkin and bread plate). Don't be afraid to ask questions - the staff, even the chef, are very friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes, the creative ingredients as well as the wine pairings. I was also shocked by my favorite course of the evening; glancing at the menu I knew I was looking forward to the soft shell crab and while everything was excellent, I was absolutely blown away by the potato, ramp, and kombu spring stew. It was so unexpected for me, I loved every bite. Both flavor and texture variety were perfect. That said, be open to being pleasantly surprised. Oxalis will come through in an amazing way and provide a very memorable dining experience. The hubby and I will absolutely return, we're already set to try the separate bar menu in the back of the establishment.
Not worth the time or $$$! Local wanna be, over salted food, super slow service, ton of bugs

If I could give this amazing restaurant 10 stars, I would. Chef Nico and his staff are top notch. We had a party of 4, expecting great things and they exceeded expectations in a very big way! The meal was truly the best I've ever had. Each of the 11 dishes were works of art, with flavors that were out of this world. The Kampachi, the first course was so savory, like nothing I've ever tasted. Literally, each bite, I closed my eyes to experience the incredible blend of flavors. We had two more appetizers that were equally fantastic. We also did the wine pairing which had perfect choices for all the courses. I added caviar to the fluke, which was outstanding. The beef with walnut miso, and black garlic melted in my mouth with the greatest flavors. Three different desserts put this evening over the top. Chef Nico and the phenomenal staff made us feel so welcome. Chef Nico, you truly love what you do and it shows in your creative food ideas, presentations and phenomenal food. This Michelin star restaurant is a real gem. Bravo, Nico and we will return! Thank you all!
No comment
This place is incredible--the food was outstanding and the service was the cherry on top. Definitely coming back. Vibes 10/10 and elite cocktails
No comment

Oxalis is one of the best places in town . Very good selection of cocktails and wines . Food is seasonal and delicious I would recommend the kebab but also the carte Blanche . Awesome  place love it !!!

Came after few days of their re-opening.  Obnoxious temp checking. Outside seating with zero ambience in some parking lot. No tasting menu and the a la carte one was extremely limited, not a single meat entree and  by 8 pm they ran out of the only non-carb non-veggie offering- fish. Then they right away ran out of bread and tarts... i am being kind giving them 3 stars. If you're not ready then don't hastily re-open. We had to go eat somewhere else afterwards. Hopefully they are able to get back to the previous standards.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had been wanting to try this place for dinner but had an opportunity to check it out as a brunch option while in the neighborhood as part of pre-museum plans. There are other places nearby that offer brunch but I had already been to them and wanted to try some place new. Reading other reviews highlighting the "elevated" brunch experience, i thought to try it out. So yes, it is pricey for brunch but the pre fix brunch menu is unique - not your run of the mill brunch dishes but still "brunch-like" enough...and definitely filling and delicious. If you love has browns or anything potato - Do yourself a favor and order the potatoes as an add on if they aren't part of your pre fix - even if you don't live has browns, this dish may convert you. The staff also is amazing. This restaurant is all about quality service and making the diner feel like all attention is on them (in a good way), so friendly, pleasant and cordial. It is all perfection. Will definitely be coming back for dinner.

This place is amazing! Best butter/bread combo I ever had. Every dish was made well. Considering I'm a picky eater, I gobbled down everything on the menu. I can't find one thing to complain about other than why isn't this place more popular!? Would totally come back to eat here :)
No comment
No comment

SO GRATEFUL not only to have the opportunity to eat this incredible food again but for this establishment's respect for the health and safety of their patrons and staff. My friend and I ordered four dishes and split them and were perfectly full. It was hot out and the food hit the spot- light, fresh and delicious!! The canned cocktails were fantastic, I had the Rose one and one with sparkling wine which were incredible and paired perfectly with the food we ordered. The staff was impressively diligent with following safety procedures as well as spacing the tables well beyond 6 ft which made me feel completely safe dining here, so much so that I would feel comfortable taking my high-risk parents here for dinner.
Great restaurant. Food was delicious and service was spectacular. Make sure to get both desserts in the bar area.
No comment

One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Creative, delicious, and consistently well executed. They pay attention to all the details, which elevates even simple things to be really memorable (for example, sounds silly, but the bread and butter is SO good). Service is friendly and attentive, and it is clear that the staff is proud of the food, but it never gets stuffy or pretentious. Plus it is a reasonable price for a tasting menu (and they have an a la carte option if that isn't your thing). If you haven't tried it yet, you're missing out. We are very lucky to have this place in Brooklyn.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Update; their box this weekend was also delicious as hell. The sausage was to die for and the grits and waffle were good too. Great value for the cost
This French restaurant Going to blow your mind . Food and service over the top. Must try mushroom in broth dish , OMG . And now when they got  Liquor license Add  this place on Bucket list !#oxalis #

Really impressive meal and service. The very first bite blew us away and I thought to myself "they've set a really high bar here" and much to our delight, they sustained it throughout the meal. So much so that we are already planning when we can return

Seven of us ate at Oxalis last night. We shared the caulilini, little gem salad, asparagus, heirloom beans in fish broth, mushroom tart, wild rice fricassee, rainbow trout, cream puffs and gateau basque, plus an amazing potato pancake amuse bouche  with black caviar. It may have been the best meal I have ever eaten. Every dish was cooked to perfection and served with grace and finesse. Also impressive was the wine selection that included a delicious, inexpensive white. The only dish that was less than stellar was the gateau, which was a little cold and dense, albeit tasty. All of us were blown away by this outstanding dinner.

WOW - just wow.  It's been a long time since we have been blown away by a meal the way we were at Oxalis.  They somehow manage to present beautiful and DELICIOUS (next level) food without any level of pretension.  This is a very special meal and I would highly recommend it.  Incredible!
Oxalis is a TREASURE. The food has no business being this good at this price. I think about their tuna at least once a day. Service is exceptional. Also the most Covid-compliant set up out there.

Came here to celebrate my partners birthday, had a magical evening. Food, service, and ambience well all 10/10. Don't say that lightly, Having spent my share of time at Per Se, Blue Hill, French Laundry, Le Bernardin, Daniel... rivals all without feeling stuffy or forced. Every dish had something new, unique and special to it. Even the Swiss Chard course was mind blowing. The habanero sauce under our fluke might be the most delicate hot sauce I've ever tasted. Water glasses never hit the halfway mark. One of the owners checked in on us several times throughout the night, when he wasn't carrying dishes, pouring wine, or folding napkins. Beyond the compulsory candle on the dessert, a note was hand-written, a large dollop of caviar was added to a dish, owners and waiters alike poured extra glasses and checked in often to ensure we were having a good celebration. It had the air of a place where people love what they are doing, and are excited to share it with others. Can't more highly recommend.
No comment
Excellent. Great food, reasonably priced and the service is second to none. Wine was great, and the food was definitely top class. This place is a hidden gem. Hopefully it survives for a long time.

Absolutely exceptional meal.  Sat outside here this past weekend - although it was cold, we cozied up near the heat lamp and devoured a truly superlative meal.  We felt very lucky that they are staying open and willing to serve us in times like this.  Service was lovely too.  I will be a regular at this spot.  Highly recommend.

Doesn't look like much from the outside but once you're inside, this little Brooklyn fighter packs a punch. You are met by a charming brigade of cooks shouting "wi chef" with attentiveness to each order at the pass. The hostess, equally charming but with less ferocity welcomes you with care and ushers you to your seat with charm. The service is impeccable, with each dish and wine pairing coming at precisely the right moment. You feel the passion that earned this restaurant a Michelin Star right from when you walk through those doors up until you're out of them. The attention to detail was felt and my only complaint about the food was I wish there was more! Well done!

First couple of times we went when they did not have a liquor license. They also did not let you BYOB, which was super weird. The food and service were both good. We went again recently, and while the experience was much enhanced by a solid drink menu, the food quality has gone downhill. Some of the dishes were OK. A couple, like a rubbery seafood dish, were not.
Very interesting food! Very tasteful! Good crowd. ! Good atmosphere !something unique! Recommended to try!

Came here for a quick brunch before heading to the museum. The set brunch menu was balanced and good by itself but the merguez sausages that our waiter recommended we add on were definitely the highlight for me. The staff here were very attentive and professional. Our waiter was able to pick up on the fact that we were running late to our exhibition and put in an extra effort to get our dessert and check to us in a timely manner. I definitely want to come back here to try their dinner menu at some point.
Long due review. We went there in a group of 4 people. I didn't leave hungry but I was not impressed. The food qualities didn't justify the price tag. They over-seasoned almost all dishes.

I loved my experience at Oxalis. They are taking COVID seriously, taking temperatures, social distancing and not compromising on the food or experience. The best dining out experience I've had since March!

This is one of the most pretentious and childish menus I've ever seen.  Ridiculous food at exorbitant prices. Exactly the reason why the urban American food scene is so decadent, overpriced and deplorable. Experiments with food for ignorant rich kids. I would not eat at this place if you paid me, and I live in San Francisco

After reading rave reviews about the tasting menu, we booked a reservation through Resy, that explicitly said it was dining room seating. When we got there, we were seated in a back room and were told we couldn't order the tasting menu there. They weren't able to accommodate us in the dining room, so we left and went elsewhere. It was pretty disappointing, considering we had driven an hour for our reservation there.

Meh, not impressed. Had dinner here recently and while I understand tasting menus are not usually meant to fill, for the price we paid for what is billed as a "4-6 course meal", I left quite hungry and disappointed. While I wouldn't say anything necessarily tasted bad (besides the espresso we ordered at the end which was completely undrinkable), I'd say most every dish had at least something wrong i.e. duck not cooked well, entire dish being just one (wet) texture, etc. I do just want to point out that the "snack" course which, to be frank, was basically a singular tater tot sliced into 4 pieces with a dot of mayo on top (serves 2!) was totally unacceptable. Maybe I'm being a bit nitpick-y but in a tasting menu restaurant that additionally is only doing a handful of courses (also charging $100+ pp once you factor in tax+tip+drinks), they should all be perfect or close to it.
No comment
Its a new restaurant for the neighberhood and I've already gone twice.  The food was superb and the service even better.

We had a wonderful dining experience at Oxalis last night. We opted for the carte blanche ($70) and beverage pairing ($40). All of the dishes we had were good, with a few being outstanding. I was impressed with the attention to detail, thoughtfulness, and innovation with which the chef approached each dish. Service was very attentive, and the atmosphere was both warm and casually elegant. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great meal with impeccable service.

My husband and I ate here on February 15th, and we are still talking about the food four days later. We opted for the $60 six-course carte blanche menu and were blown away by the delicious and unique flavor combinations. We felt like we were getting all of the service and quality of a Michelin star restaurant without any of the stuffiness or pretension. This is an incredible addition to the neighborhood, and I know we will be coming back soon. Make your reservation now before it becomes impossible to get one.
No comment

One of the best meals I've had in Brooklyn in a while. The eclectic wine list was great, the service was gracious, the vibe is modern and understated, the music is fun and the food is beautiful, inventive and well executed. Thanks for a fun night.

We came in for some drinks and maybe an app or two in the back room. What a delight! The cocktails were interesting, maybe a bit quirky, but each one a delicious surprise. After a few different appetizers we were so intrigued by the food that we asked for a table and stayed for dinner. What a beautiful experience.  The food was subtle, balanced and well conceived. I'll say it again, what a delightful experience. My one caveat is that because the flavor profiles are so subtle you might miss out on the beauty of the dishes if you don't slow down a focus on the food, but if you do.... What a treat.

In the 5 years I've lived in New York, probably the best meal I've had. If you like surprises, not having to choose anything about the meal is fun, and the wine pairing was the perfect complement to each dish.
This is the best fine dining in the neighborhood. Bright, airy, not too expensive. It's just so great; fresh and seasonal food, creative plating. I'm so glad it's there for special occasions.
No comment

I would like to review the food at this restaurant but I have been unable thus far to actually eat there. Reservations are as of now not hard to get, but they've canceled me twice. They promised to accommodate me in the future, but it's getting frustrating. I will amend this review to include the food if I ever get to eat it.

I dined at Oxalis shortly after the NY Times review. My Gf was finishing up a sales meeting nearby and she suggested that we try Oxalis. We rarely make reservation's, but we arrived early enough to be seated. The space is very attractive, and it has a very nice vibe. The nabe is full of ues transplants, and on this particular evening it appeared that every one of them had invited their parents to dinner. I thought that I was in La Goulue for a minute. The food is good not great. The wines by the glass were terrible, but the staff were all polite, and very gracious. I guess that they need some time to age and I hope to try Oxalis again in the future.

A superb restaurant with wonderful service and a unique menu featuring inspired use of unusual herbs. It's the perfect place for a romantic dinner for two or a night of fine dining and drinking with old friends. Memorable things: the beautiful greenhouse-like dining area in the back of the restaurant, the herb-infused cocktails, the extraordinarily delicious food, the fact that we could get a table immediately, the prompt and friendly service. Frankly, I'm surprised this place isn't completely overrun by reservations weeks in advance; the food is on par with that of the ever-booked Olmsted around the corner, and in several ways more interesting.

We went for New Years and had an incredible experience. The food was amazing - especially the beef tartar and the poached oysters and the dessert - and the service was superb. The space was beautiful. A world class restaurant in Brooklyn!

First date night away from the baby for the husband's birthday and it was everything. We were treated like royalty just because I let them know we were celebrating- the service was tremendous and one of the owners is right there alongside the staff talking to all the guests. We reserved the dining area where it's tasting menu only- every course was so unique and delicious. As an added bonus, they throw in a couple things not listed. We can't wait to get back and check out the bar room which looked beautiful. Great addition to the neighborhood food scene!

Holiday spirit indeed.  I got food poisoning over thanksgiving and had to cancel my reservation, did so in advance but was told there was a $60 fee.  I explained the situation and this was not a last minute cancellation but no budging.  Would have been nice to get a heads up when I canceled.  Was really looking forward to dining here but a restaurant with no budging/heart is not one I want to support.
No comment

Absolutely best dining experience I have had in a long time. Every dish was amazing and my friends and I could not stop talking about it afterwards. For this price point, you have to go. I will definitely be back and bring many people with me. We talked to the chef afterwards and he was so kind and really cannot wait to see the growth of this fabulous restaurant.

My mother and I stumbled into this gem after visiting the Brooklyn Museum. The prix fixe menu is a bargain for $70. This restaurant would be at home in Manhattan for twice the price. The staff were wonderful and the service was among the best I've experienced in a long time. Every course was a small masterpiece. We loved it and would go back!

Such a great place. Whether you come for the amazing tasting menu which is truly delicious  or to just sit outside and enjoy a cocktail in the garden, Chef Nico, Steve and the amazing staff make this  an unbelievable experience! This place just flows from the moment you are seated to saying goodbye, everything just works beautifully!
No comment
The Thanksgiving fixed menu was a bit pricey but worth it, the service was excellent and friendly.

Way overpriced for a fine brunch. With so many delicious, well-priced brunch options in the 'hood, we were disappointing here (though staff was all lovely). From past reviews, sounds like dinner is the way to go at Oxalis.

The food was exceptional, the service was impeccable and I highly recommend going for the pre-fixe dinner.  We had both non-alcoholic and normal drink pairing and both were unique and delicious. The duck breast was probably the best I've had.

GO! As simple as that. But in the interest of elaborating: probably the most creative, imaginative and unique combinations of food and tastes; wonderful, smiley staff, great cocktails, and totally reasonable. I think this place should be on most people's lists, and hope it is around for a long time.

Service is super attentive, the food is great, (first course needs a little work, the carrots aren't functional with the toothpick), the n/a beverage tasting is insane. Every one that they give, they gave 4 drinks, went absolutely perfectly with the dish. Kinda wished the sesame cookie was given before dessert because it's really strong and lingers for a long time in your mouth. But seriously, don't sleep on this place. It's going to do great things.

Oxalis was a superb experience from the moment I walked in. Friendly staff (from the open kitchen chefs to host and bartender), pleasant & relaxing ambiance, and delicious food throughout the whole tasting menu. Highly recommend this spot for those that are open to unexpected tasting menus and unique beverage pairings, all for a reasonable price. I definitely plan on bringing more friends here, you don't want to miss this experience!

Best dinner date/restaurant for a special occasion in Brooklyn by a landslide. When we have friends visiting and we are trying to show them the best spots in town, Oxalis ranks at the very top. If you're not a big drinker, they have an *excellent* non-alcoholic drink pairing with the tasting menu. Makes dinner much more accessible when you're with a group of drinkers and non-drinkers. Couldn't recommend Oxalis highly enough.
No comment

Creative menu with lots of unexpected flavors. The tasting menu is a gastronomic feast topped only by the quirky and delicious wines. Excellent staff who really love what they do and enhance the experience with their knowledge and story telling. Truly a gem of a restaurant.

Great vibe and great service. I went here post proposal and my soon to be wife loved it!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND 'NON-ALCOHOLIC' pairing with the meal! In-house sodas were actually better than wine pairing... sounds crazy but one must try to understand what i am saying! So worth it

Behind the frosted glass facade at 791 Washington Ave is Oxalis, where wonderful things are being made and served. This restaurant works perfectly for the part of Brooklyn it's in, which you kind of feel before you even open the door. The quality of the dishes the Oxalis team serve will astound you and are worth every dollar. They do rotating tasting menus, but also offer food and drink off an ala carte menu in the back half of the restaurant. You can tell that Nico and Co. know what they are doing, and also, most importantly, that they care. Being able to watch the chefs and cooks working so diligently in the open kitchen is quite humbling, but also inspiring. I think we could all learn a thing or two about delicious, fresh, new ways of approaching food and it'll be fun to see it happen here. Aspiring chefs, foodies, and regular people of all walks of life, in and out of Brooklyn, should give Oxalis a try. Maybe you'll learn something new, see something great, or just enjoy a nicely prepped and prepared meal, served to you by their nice staff. The last time I ate there, I tired the pig trotter and it was my favorite. I also had a dessert made with cream cheese ice cream, which brought out my inner fat kid, for sure. I'm going backwards now, but the brioche bread was amazeballs. I am really excited for Oxalis in 2019 and can't wait to see what is on the way!
Best restaurant in Brooklyn.  Not to be missed. Beautiful spot, delicious food, lovely and knowledgable staff.  Seriously, go.

I have been to some of the best restaurants in NYC (Eleven Madison Park, Per Se, Le Bernadin, Aska ...) but I was blown away by the inventiveness and quality of the food at Oxalis.  So delicious course after course it is hard to even pick the best.  The creamy farro with snails was unforgettably mouthwateringly creamy and verdant and unique.  The beef tongue was perfectly salty, crispy, crunchy and meaty all at the same time. And the goat cheese dessert was a wonderful end to a memorable meal that I will definitely want to repeat.

We just went to this place for a special anniversary, and we absolutely loved it. Upon making a reservation and noting my dietary restrictions, the manager wrote an email to confirm that they would be preparing a special menu. When we arrived, there was a beautiful table set with a personalized note wishing us a happy anniversary. They poured us delicious bubbles to celebrate (twice!), and the food was fabulous. It was an amazing meal and the warm and attentive service made us feel right at home. We're excited to go back with friends and family!

Oxalis' food, asthetic, and playlist are incredible!!! I've been here several times and most recently tried the set menu. There was a mushroom dish that was absolutely divine- the broth was incredible I could've had ten bowls of that alone. As of the last time I visited they didn't have s liquor license yet but their non-alcoholic drinks are all so amazing I didn't even care. My favorite drink was the sparking jasmine tea.

We came here on a friends rexommendatjon and w had a fantastic experience. Creative menu, friendly staff and an overall relaxing, but not too quiet, ambiance. The music was also top notch. At the end of the meal we couldn't decide which dish was our favorite and we each nominated two different ones as our personal favorites - which is always a good sign. We will definitely be coming back!

So delicious! We did the $60 tasting menu with the $15 non-alcoholic beverage pairing it was so unique and incredible. On top of amazing food there service was on point, so professional and enthusiastic!  Highly recommend!

I've been lucky enough to eat at many incredible restaurants in New York and while they're great, not many are standouts among the rest. Oxalis is without a doubt, the most pleasant, refreshing and jaw-droppingly delicious meal I've had in years. The food was otherworldly. We had the prix fixe and each dish was better than the last. The service was fantastic as was the atmosphere. I have a ton of food allergies to raw whole fruits and vegetables (I know, my life sucks) and they were so accommodating and created two entirely different dishes for me (though what my family ate for those courses was apparently also fantastic). To top it all off, the dessert (goat milk with honey and thyme - trust me, totally different than what you're probably imagining right now) was perhaps the best dessert I've had in my life and I've come to to the realization that was the peak of my dessert journey and I'm fine with that. Overall, a magical, warm, inviting, flavorful, surprising experience. Side note: try their Jasmine Tea Soda (WOW!).

Amazing Rijsttafel! Went with a group of people and there was more than enough food to go around. Very clean and lively atmosphere. Excellent service, kept checking in to make sure we had everything we needed. Will definitely go back on my next trip!

I lived in Indonesia for six years and I have been waiting to find a place that has authentic Indonesian food. Java Indonesian restaurant in Brooklyn was like a homecoming for me. We ordered "ayam goreng" or fried chicken, beef rendang and chicken satay. The "ayam goreng" was a crispy chicken breast that came in a rich sauce of kecap manis (dark, sweet soy sauce) over a bed of lettuce. The beef rendang was incredibly flavorful - I could easily taste the lemongrass and spices. It was stewed perfectly with fall-apart beef cubes in a coconut milk based sauce. The rice was perfect to soak up to juices from the rendang and the fried chicken. The chicken satay was tender and absolutely covered in a savory peanut sauce. I also recommend asking for a side of homemade sambal and kecap manis to dip your goodies into. Please come through and support this wonderful business!

We've been wanting to try the tapas for 2 here and finally were able to experience it. I've always had good food and experience here but for whatever reason the beef is always a hit or miss. With the tapas for 2 at $65, it was so worth it. You start off with a flavorful soup, 2 salad appetizers and a corn fritter. It was amazing and flavorful. Then comes the heated tray with satays, fish, shrimp, vegetables, chicken, and beef. All delicious but the beef was a bit tough. The pandan pudding was delicious and refreshing to end with along with the jasmine tea. Definitely would come again.

Oh by the way, the restaurant was really hot inside but I honestly didn't mind as the decor and heat allowed me to pretend like I was in Indonesia!

Cute little authentic Indonesian place. Food is pretty good, it taste very home made. Not overly seasoned. We had the 17 dishes course for 2 but it was enough for us 4. It's tapas style, small tasting dishes. Good if it's your first time trying Indonesian food or if you're like me that can't decide and want to try everything. We had the bakwan (corn fritter), terong belado (a crispy eggplant) and the beef rendang, and we got way too excited and stuffed ourselves. Then we also ordered dessert (Coconut Pandan Pudding) because why not. It was a great texture and not too sweet with a strong pandan flavor - great ending to the meal! We live nearby and enjoyed eating outdoors. Everything was fresh out of the kitchen and still crispy even though it was covered in sauce. Delicious food and very friendly, hardworking staff. I had the Mie Goreng with beef and vegetable Bakram, and both were well portioned and very tasty and flavorful. I'll definitely be back here. For the price, the portions and quality exceeded my expectations.

Appetizers tend to be decent so maybe for me, I'll just stick to those and the sate when I want a big cheap meal.

I ordered the bakwan, which tastes like latkes made of eggs & veggies, the lumpia, which taste like a form of delicious fried dumplings, and the kare ayam, which is a slightly spicier less coconutty- massaman curry. All different flavor profiles and all classics of the restaurants!

I've eaten a lot of malysian, singaporean or what I though was indonesian food. But I have to say this place was legit. I love dessert so I have to say that I really enjoy the Jasmine tea at the end of the meal and the coconut pandan pudding. Seriously, you have to try it.

My husband and I came here for lunch one afternoon. We were the only ones there. The adorable woman who opened the place right when we got there was cooking and serving. She was so kind and hospitable and wanted to make sure we had everything we needed and were happy. The iced coffee was delicious and I had the rice really spicy and I loved it. Its a real adorable spot!

Amazing traditional Javanese food. The place is run by native Indonesians and it shows. The whole experience reminded me of home and my Indonesian mother's cooking. Portions of the entrees are big, as if you are being fed by a real family in Jakarta or Bandung and the prices are very good for New York City standards. Highly recommended if you want to experience what Indonesian cuisine can offer as it is the only Javanese restaurant I am aware of in Brooklyn.

The place is a bit quiet during the weekday but pretty good food and service. My favorite was the pineapple drink the ordered the 17 dishes combo to share. A wide range of variety of curry and meats. Good experience to try a little bit of everything so next time you know which main entree you will like.

Being Indonesian, I am well aware of the deliciousness that is Indonesian food. That being said, I am a little biased. However, I know many non-Indonesians who will agree that Indonesian food is mind-blowing. I was struck by how few Indo restaurants there are in NYC, and after my favorite one closed down, we decided to come here. We came in at about 9pm on a Saturday night, and we were the only ones in the place. I knew it was the real deal when I saw traditional Indonesian art on the walls, along with traditional music playing in the background. Even the seating is in an almost communal style, with individual seat cushions that give the place a very cozy, home-like feeling. We were promptly greeted by our waiter. For a beverage, we ordered the Garuda, which was incredibly fresh, fruity, and delicious. I could be mistaken, but I do not believe I saw any alcohol on the menu--this is very typical of many Indonesian restaurants, as majority of the population is Muslim and alcohol is forbidden. Regardless, the meal was still an incredible experience. Of course we had to get the $50 Rijstaffel, which comes with 15 different small dishes. I wanted my boyfriend to be able to try a variety of different foods, so this was a good choice. It started light, with Soto Ayam, which is a flavorful soup filled with chicken (ayam), scallions, and more. After this came the corn fritters, veggies in a tangy, vinegar-y sauce, satay, and fried veggies in peanut sauce. Then came the large platter which contained the rest of the meat dishes. What is great about Indonesian food is how they combine a variety of sweet, island, coconut flavors with savory and salty flavors such as peanut sauce. Then some dishes are more tangy. Your palate will always be guessing, and it will always be satisfied. My favorite dish was the Kari Ayam (chicken curry), which was thick, rich, and had a plentiful amount of potatoes. I'm getting hungry right now just thinking about it. The one thing I would change is the rendang--traditionally, it is supposed to be slow cooked for hours to the point where it is very tender and almost falls apart--this rendang was a bit too chewy. Other than this, every thing was perfect. The dessert is fantastic as well. The food was well worth $50, and I would definitely come back!

Enjoyed the food. Started with Bakwan Vegetable Corn Fritters for appetizer. Had Mie Bakso Soup with Fish Ball. Dinner entree was Kare Ikan curry cod fish fillet with coconut milk.  Total bill came to $29.40.  Culinary adventure dinner was fresh & flavorful.  Highly recommended. Service was excellent, staff very warm & friendly.

Tiny little restaurant. We walked in for an early dinner and were seated immediately. Ordered gado-gado, chicken sate, acar, telor tahu (omelet), kare ayam (chicken curry), beef rendang (braised beef) and sambal goreng udang (spicy fried shrimp). The gado-gado hit the spot, with a good mix of tofu and boiled veggies under a sweet peanut sauce. Chicken & beef we're over cooked and stringy but the flavors were good, although toned way down from authentic Indonesian cuisine. The fried shrimp was a surprise hit, shrimps were fried perfectly and seasoned just right as well. Omelet was unlike anything I've had in Indonesia but still delicious, although over salty. Overall an ok restaurant, worth checking out if you've never had Indonesian cuisine before. Those familiar with the cuisine will likely be disappointed.

This place is not good. The food was flat out terrible. They forgot to put potatoes into my curry dish. Unapologetically the chef came out and dropped raw potatoes into my dish. Disgusting!
Delicious & abundant quality food & wonderful friendly service. Amazing. We ordered the 17-piece special & each was better than the last, but my faves were the two shrimp dishes.

It's my cheat day and i had to get their fried rice! Please please please order their fried rice!! I love supporting small businesses. One of the reasons I love living in this neighborhood is because of all the small businesses. My money isn't going towards another vacation home for a CEO, but towards sending their child to dance class or to college. Hell, even to take a day off to spend with their family! I mean I can't imagine working 7 days a week like they do. For that, I'll support them any day I can.

So we came here to try something new. When you walk in, there is a lot of art work and traditional music playing. As starters, get the fried calamari and one of the exotic drinks from the menu, you won't be disappointed. I got the 15 dishes for two. They start you off with a soup and to be honest, it wasn't that great. The lamb and the chicken were pretty good, I thought the soy sauce tasted a bit like chocolate sauce for some reason. They also had shrimp and I didn't enjoy that too much. Some dishes were sweet, some were mild, nothing was really too spicy. The waiter was very nice and he was very honest. The dessert was terrible!! I didn't like it at all, the jasmine tea was nice though. Parking around here isn't so bad either. If you're looking for a good time and a new place to try, this is the right place.

We were looking for Asian restaurants that were still open during the covid-19 (coronavirus) shelter in place and came across Java. We got the Mie Goreng, Mie Bakso with beef balls, and Gulai Kambing. Everything was bursting with flavor and wonderful texture. We cannot wait to order from here again!!
Great casual eat. Awesome place to try a whole bunch of different Indonesian food. I like spicy but there are non-spicy dishes as well, so there is something for everyone. Beef rendan is a favorite.

We went in to try something new and we left with a newfound appreciation of Indonesian food. When we walked in, it was nearly empty and rightfully, we got a little nervous. Placed our orders, twiddled our thumbs, and after a good wait, we were graced with the most amazing dishes - appealing with it's enticing aroma, beautiful presentation, and delectably delicious meals. Goodness gracious, why aren't more people here and when will flight prices to Indonesia drop? Definitely pleased and will  return tomorrow morning for brunch.

I love this place.  I'll admit, I don't know Indonesian food, nor do I know if this is authentic. But I've been to Southeast Asia before, and I understand the complexities of the flavors.  If nothing more, the food here is delicious and out of this (typical) world.  The first time I ordered delivery there was a major screw-up, but since then they've restored my confidence, and the only compliant I could make is the puddle of drool in anticipation of the food's arrival.

Nice, intimate restaurant in South Slope. The rice table of 15 dishes is a good deal, with some strong highlights and some misses. On weekends it is only open for dinner. Staff is friendly and helpful, especially if this is your first experience with Indonesian food.

As out-of-towners, almost every restaurant in the South Slope neighborhood of Brooklyn is new and untested. Indonesian cuisine -- among the most flavorful in the world -- cannot be found in many American cities, so Java appealed to us more than the other "New American" eateries nearby, and we decided to try as many dishes as our small appetites could handle. We started with the corn fritters appetizer. It was delightful, especially in the peanut sauce. Then we had nasi goreng and lamb saté. The latter was one of the best things we've eaten in years, and the nasi goreng was wonderful. So much great flavor! The restaurant is small, but we will be back as often as we can before we return home to North Carolina. We hope Java thrives for years to come.

A family owned restaurant that is well worth the trip. The host was very accommodating and selected vegetarian dishes for us from the traditional rijsttafel. We were stuffed to the gills by the time we finished. Everything was unique and delicious and the cost was reasonable

I don't know how I'd never been here before tonight. I really enjoyed the food and fully expect to be a regular moving forward. We Got two vegetarian dishes, one vegetable curry and one fried eggplant dish, the latter which was sort of like eggplant pakoras with a spicy tomato  sauce with tofu in it. Both dishes were fantastic and super flavorful. Can't wait to go back and try everything vegetarian they have! Oh and the Garuda drink was so good. Creamy tropical juice situation. Yum

Loved the dishes. Felt all warm and fuzzy after eating the delicious curry. Will be back again if I am in the neighborhood :)
Great authentic Indonesian cuisine. Traditional Indonesian art on the walls, warm atmosphere, friendly and helpful wait staff. Hours are a bit sketchy so call in advance.

This place has been around for a long time, the menu hasn't changed much over the years, but the food has gotten better and better. Absolutely fantastic. Get the 15 course tasting menu. Each course is so different and so yummy, we had a hard time choosing a favorite. Top spot in park slope. Slightly slow service, but such a pleasant place to sit and relax. Has beer and wine.

Tiny jewel box of a restaurant and very friendly staff. Great find in South Slope!
The waiter is so nice! The food is not that bad either. Some of the food is too salty, some just too blend. I enjoyed my dinner here.

Saw this restaurant accidentally as we were driving past, in route to find dinner elsewhere on 7th Ave.  A quick Google search revealed great reviews and a splendid menu so we turned around and decided to give it a go! So glad we did!  The restaurant was small and cozy, excellent service and the food was delicious!  I ordered the chicken and potato in coconut milk and had the  sweetened Jasmine Tea (served in a carton).  It was honestly, phenomenal and reminded me of my time in Bali. I can't wait to go back when im super hungry so I can try the 15 dish sampler!

Oh my gods!  Worst take out meal of the last 12 months, hands down!  Super mushy, super bland, super generic and super expensive.  Are you all insane?  This place was just awful!  Bad Chinese would have been better.  Listen to me - I eat at Asian restaurants at least twice a month around NYC.  This place is BAD.

Cozy place with great food! The owner is so sweet, she makes you feel right at home. She also always accommodates for my food allergies without hesitation. I had a pretty large size dinner party once  and everyone loved their dishes. Both meat and non - meat eaters were satisfied.  One of my favorite dishes is the sayur lodeh, vegetables in coconut milk soup. This soup is so tasty and filling. It comes with rice on the side. I've tried other rice and noodle veggie dishes and I'm always happy and satisfied. My husband really enjoys the fish dishes. My brother has eaten both the chicken and beef dishes and said they were very tasty. Overall, my family and I highly recommend this place.

Took a friend to Java for her birthday dinner.  We ordered the Rijstaffel, and loved most of the dishes.  The lady who is the owner was super sweet and waited patiently as it took us a while to work our way through the dishes.  Would definitely return!
No comment

Really yummy authentic Indonesia Restaurant in Brooklyn. Staff made us feel as if we stepped into her home. Great romantic spot, and exotic for date night, catching up with friends, or dinner alone-lovely place with good food that's reasonable.
Food was great and priced reasonably. The food was as close as the real thing you can find in New York. I will no doubt make this joint a regular for me.
No comment

So I decided to make the trek out to Brooklyn with my wife and friends for this place and I was not disappointed. Great service, the owner a very nice lady, waited on us and was happy to answer any questions we had about the food.   We ordered the Rijsttafel which is a multi-course meal. Was about $38 for two and was delicious. They start you off with soup which was tasty, a bit salty but good for a cold night.  Next was my favorite, the salad covered with peanut sauce.  This was absolutely delicious! Finally they bring out a hot metal plate with many different small dishes to sprinkle on your rice.  Lamb, Chicken, Cabbage, and Cod, and other goodies.  Great Experience, would love to go back. Only reason why it isn't five is because of the wine selection (they had like 4 bottles in stock).
This is a delicious, home-y neighborhood spot, offering something out of the ordinary. We'll be back.
Freaking amazing.... This is one of the best restaurants in park slope. Everyone should try real good authentic Indonesian food like this at sometime!
No comment
No comment

After having rijstaffel in Amsterdam a few times, we had a hankering and found Java in Brooklyn. The chef/proprietor is the sweetest tiny Indonesian woman who is fierce in the kitchen. All the flavors are right on, hot sauce is amazing, service is phenomenal. This restaurant is going in our regular rotation!!!!
No comment

Great food but a terrible experience. A few minutes after we sat down, the host greeted a group of friends of hers that included two screaming children. They persisted to scream and jostle each other around the very cozy restaurant for about fifteen minutes. Half-hearted shushing and two shrugged apologies were the most the staff could offer. When they eventually left, we were able to actually enjoy our food. But the evening and nearly been spoiled and we will never go back.
No comment

Absolutely loved this place! Four of us dined on two of the 15 item dinners and every dish was amazingly flavorful and unique from one to the next. Veg, beef, shrimp, cod, lamb (which I loved, and usually don't like lamb) chicken, great light soup to start, really cool unique coconut pudding for dessert. Great jasmine tea. Their homemade hot sauce is a knockout. I'm someone who usually overdoes it on hot sauce (and I would with this hot sauce in other circumstances) but the food was so carefully flavored that it stood up on its own. Nonetheless I purchased some of their hot sauce to take home...I'm sure it'll be gone quick. Nicest people you could ever meet who run the place. Beer and wine too. A great experience. The courses arrive sequentially and you can stretch out the meal, making yourself many little bowls of whatever combinations you fancy. Been in Brooklyn a while and have known about this place the whole time....wish I hadn't waited so long to try it!

We came here on a Tuesday evening at 7pm.  There was nobody there.  Our party of 5 was the only group there.  We came to try the rijstaffel.  The Rijstaffel, I hear, is actually a Dutch tradition, not Indonesian.  My friends tried rijstaffel at an Indonesian restaurant while in Amsterdam.  The rijstaffel is an order of 17 small dishes including starters like soup, salad, pickles and bakwan (corn fritter) which was delicious.  Next came a bunch of main dishes all small sized, which included saucy sauteed and stick dishes. My favorite dish was the Udang Tumis which is sauteed shrimp with mushrooms in Java's sauce. The brown Java sauce is deliciously sweet and savory.  You could put it over any meat and rice.  It's lick the plate good.  We also tried the fried chicken.  I wasn't a fan.  The flavor wasn't all that and it came out a little dry.  And we also tried the Mie Goreng. That was quite good.  It's like a cross between filipino pancit canton and chinese take out lo mein.  The rijstaffel also included tea for everyone and dessert. That night it was a green coconut custard like dessert. Texture wise it was somewhere near a custard with the firmness of a jello.  It reminded me of haupia that we got while in Hawaii.  Overall I was satisfied with the meal.  The bathroom was nice and clean and had funny art work.  The place, though dark, was small but cozy.  We lucked out on being the only party for the night so the staff was available whenever we needed them.  I would go back there again if a friend wanted to try.
Nice small restaurant, family run. The good was delicious and the staff very friendly!

After reading all the wonderful reviews, we were curious about this place and besides...I have never had Indonesian food. The place was fantastic! Its a small restaurant, and you sit pretty close to other people, luckily, we did not have any obnoxious people near us! They have nice big windows and the curtains are nice. They also have interesting artwork on the walls, I am assuming of Indonesian origin. Of course, this place is known for their "rijstaffel," and it was so much fun to eat. The meal came with soup, which was good. The main course is many small dishes and all placed on a hot plate, including beef and chicken satay, sauteed cabbage, a lamb dish, a few chicken dishes (some in a coconut base), achaar (pickled veggies but different than Indian achaar), salad with peanut sauce, and of course rice. It was so yummy and filling! We really, really liked this place :) We opted out on coffee and dessert, but apparently it was included in the meal! This place is family owned, and I think the mom was our waitress, the son was the cook and the husband was the delivery guy :)
No comment

This used to be one of my favorite places, I'd go at least twice a month. If you have a group of 4+, get the rijsttafel. It's what the place is named after and it's just a giant sampler platter of most of the food here. You get an overview and then you'll actually know what you like. My favorite used to be Empal Goreng (I think, matching memory to menu), but that was 2 years ago.

We used a groupon for this place and didn't get any problems or lesser service, so I appreciated that very much.  Sometimes groupons have negative stigmas and fortunately this was not the case.  We went to the restaurant on a Sunday night, it wasn't crowded but had a decent number of folks dining.  The place is on the smaller side, its more for intimate dates and not so much for large groups.  I haven't had much Indonesian cuisine before so I didn't go in with much expectation.  The food was okay, but i must say nothing stood out in my mind.  Without the groupon, it would have been quite pricey.  $5 for two tiny eggrolls.. I wouldn't go out of my way to go there again.
No comment

My friend and I wanted to try a new cuisine so we opted for Indonesian. The restaurant was very nice and cozy; they probably had around 10 tables max. The staff is extremely friendly and tentative - usually how it is at smaller restaurants. We tried the BEEF SATE, which is beef skewers with some Indonesian peanut sauce. It wasn't anything special... tasted like how any other skewers would at a barbeque. We also tried Kambing Goreng, which was disappointing. The lamb was drenched with such salty sauce that I had to chug my drink. I don't remember what the name of my drink is, but it was green... it was delicious! It was still a good experience, but I would not go there again unless there is nothing else available in the area.
Its just not good. I'm sorry little old nice lady server/owner. Chicken and beef are so tough I couldn't even cut through them. It wasn't good. I won't say bad, but I won't say good.

My husband and I got take-out from this restaurant tonight and we both thought it was just OK. We had the pastels for an appetizer, which were dry and not that flavor. For our entrees, we tried the Opor Ayam, which was quite good, and the Sate Bali. The sauce that came with the Sate Bali had a really weird sauce flavor that tasted like a mixture of cocoa, coffee, and ashtray. Overall, we were happy that we tried something new, but probably won't be back.
No comment

JIR, it's not the greatest Indonesian restaurant I have ever been to, but it's good enough. Service was great, and the uber cute restaurant made a great dining experience. I love how it's dark inside, and how they place candles and a stem of rose on each table. Kinda romantic, but I don't come here for a romantic experience. I come to experience food from Indonesia, where I used to reside for 16 years! What I have noticed about JIR is how some of their meat were previously frozen so it sometimes has that frozen taste to it. Not the best idea when trying to market themselves as a great authentic Indonesian restaurant. If you come here, I highly recommend their corn fritters, tahu isi, and nasi uduk as a meal.

JIR serves up heapfuls of flavor. solid dutch indonesian cuisine. comparable to that which ive tasted in bali and amsterdam. super friendly service. i came hungry and left in pain w/boxes of leftovers...

Ditto what david M said in terms of comparison to Rijsttafel in Holland. This was my first Rijsttafel experience and I thought it was great. My dining companion, however, had it in Amsterdam and had different expectations. It is a fun dining experience though and the flavors are good. I would definitely go back.

It's been two years since I've eaten at Java (because it's kind of out of the way for me) but I had a really enjoyable dining experience. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. My friend and I started off with a chicken sate appetizer. I ordered Mie Goreng (stir fried noodles) and my friend ordered Nasi Goreng (Indonesian fried rice) which was SO delicious. I found my fork meandering over to his plate numerous times during the meal. It's a really nice place, loved the great atmosphere, and I would definitely venture back there sometime this summer!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The gf and I were exploring Park Slope and ventured into this restaurant more for the warmth than for hunger. The atmosphere was cozy and we were seated promptly by a very welcoming woman who set down a basket of complimentary shrimp chips. I haven't had shrimp chips in over 15 years and it took me back to my younger self, eagerly awaiting my father to take those lightly tinted pinks, yellows and blues out of the sizzling wok. I ordered the empal: seasoned slow cooked beef which is then pan fried. It reminded me of the empal I used to sneak from my college roommate whenever she came back from visiting her mother. It was tender, flavorful, plentiful and came with tons of rice. My gf ordered the vegetarian stir fried noodles which were good but tasted too similar to the Chinese equivalent. If I return, I would definitely try the rijstaffel.
Very low key spot. My first Indonesian food experience. DELICIOUS!!

Java is one of my favorite restaurants in Park Slope. The food is absolutely amazing!! Tired of boring Thai and Chinese food, Indonesian is savory and delicious! The staff is friendly and the space has a nice charm to it. This place is a gem!
No comment
Loved the rice table we did the vegetarian and everything was great. We first went in Amsterdam to a rice table and loved it. Would definitely come back to this Park Slope gem!

We trekked out here for a friend's birthday this weekend specifically to try the Rijsttfel. I've never had Indonesian before, so this was the perfect way to sample a wide range of dishes on the menu. Loved the Garudas, and the crazy green coconut pudding. The Rijsstafel, which I loved, is not vegetarian/ vegan friendly, but the menu itself is, although most veggie dishes include loads of soy, which my poor vegan roommate happens to be allergic to. She made do with the acar, a sweet and tangy cucumber dish which she was really pleased with. Service was incredibly friendly and speedy, and the restaurant, although small, is cute inside.

This is the best Indonesian restaurant in the city. Granted, I don't eat meat, so I really enjoy the coconut milk-based soup made with tempeh (I think?). The hot sauce is really good, too (I think they make it). Java is owned by a lovely family. I lived down the street for years and went on a regular basis. I haven't been back since I left NY, but I will make a point to stop there when I visit.
No comment

My wife and I have been coming to Java for years.  It's one of our favorite local restaurants.  Everyone here is friendly, there's a nice selection of Indonesian food, and there's a lovely ambience, with lots of beautiful artwork.   Java is a neighborhood treasure.

I read a review referring to this place as having the vilest food the reviewer had ever put in his or her mouth.  While I think that is absurd, I cannot give this spot more than two stars.  It's entirely possible we didn't order correctly, but after an hour and fifteen minutes of waiting for delivery, the food was not satisfying.  We had the egg roll appetizer, chicken with potatoes and spices in coconut milk and chicken satay.  None of these dishes could be confused with being delicious and frankly did not even look remotely appetizing coming out of the containers.  From what I gather, there is a big difference between ordering in and going to the restaurant.  For us, there are plenty of other spots in the neighborhood and we probably will not be checking out Java again, and definitely not for delivery. That said, the food wasn't so bad that I would discourage people from checking out the restaurant itself based on what other reviewers have described.
No comment

Very homey feel and friendly service.  The food is fresh and carefully prepared.  There's lots of meat on the menu, but my girlfriend was able to substitute tofu for chicken.  Interesting and reasonably priced food.
I went to this restaurant with my mom, who grew up in Indonesia. She and I agreed that the food was not good and still had the frozen food taste. Service was good though
Very very homey. The owner is so sweet and generous. You feel as if you're eating in her peaceful little house. Reasonable prices and wonderful food.

I absolutely love the food and excellent service. It's my favorite neighborhood place.

Amazing service!  Italian food is authentic and delicious!! Elegant decor and great ambiance.
Great service.  Friendly staff. Excellent food.   Marvelous place to eat and enjoy the atmosphere.

Came here to celebrate my 1 year "in person" wedding anniversary. From the bread to the dessert and after dinner complementary lemoncillo everything was absolutely delicious! Highly recommend especially the burrata appetizer. Wonderful waitstaff with great recommendations, and cozy atmosphere. We'll definitely be back, it was a wonderful experience.

Gorgeous ambiance- check, candles and romantic setting - check, small family owned - check, HEATED OUTDOOR COVERED PATIO- check !, from scratch Italian food- check, large portions- check, reasonable pricing - check, an incredible manager who makes you feel at home and taken care of CHECK!  For a true local experience especially during COVID - it's a must !!

We really enjoyed the place. The food, wine, desserts and the vibe were amazing. I especially loved the bass with white wine. Tiramisu was very soft and sweet, I would have it again with coffee or dry red wine next time. The staffs were kind. 4 stars because the seating was not so comfortable even though we made a reservation. We sat on the 3rd floor(?) in the center where all the people including the waiters passed and bumped into our chairs, and the wooden floor would shake everytime anyone walks by. Loved everything except for the tight seating.

Great midtown East restaurant. Menu has solid Italian offerings and all the dishes were delicious.   Solid Caesar salad with shaved parm on top.  For entrees around the table was their Atlantic salmon, raviolis stuffed with spinach and ricotta, fried calamari and a pasta dish with veggies.  All were tasty and not over sauced.   Again, solid Italian restaurant with excellent service by the waitstaff and team.

Found Barolo East when looking for a good Italian place near our hotel. Both the food and service were excellent! I had the mesclun avocado salad and the salmon w/ sautéed (grilled?) veggies along with potatoes. Had it cooked medium (my pref). It was excellent! My son (20yo) had the penne with zucchini. Also excellent! Really wanted to try the tiramisu b/c it looked SO good, but was just stuffed my the salad and entree. Highly, highly recommend this place. We'll definitely be back. Including a $20 tip, we spent $99 on the 3 items.
No comment
Ambiance was very nice, but loud. The service was impeccable... the food was ok. I would go again for drinks & maybe an appetizer.

The food and vibe combined is pretty mediocre. Not bad, not bad at all. But very average. And given that in Midtown you are surrounded by other Italian restaurants costing a comparable price, you'd be better off with a different place. They do not have many vegetarian options from what I remember. I got the linguine with clams, and there were quite a few small pieces of shells hidden throughout.

Really nice patio, nice staff. The minestrone was excellent. The sautéed mushrooms were ok, the salmon was excellently cooked but the side vegetables a little uninspired. Pastas we got we're also fine. Totally solid but not the best Italian you can get in NYC.

We had an excellent dinner at Barolo. The other Yelp reviews were on point. I had a very good carpaccio appetizer but the star of the show was the entree course. My friend had the veal parmigiana on the bone. He said it was outstanding. I loved my linguine with clams. It's one of my favorite dishes and Barolo's version was excellent. We will be back!

Barolo was a great spot for fine Italian cuisine and is relatively more on the $$$ end from a price point. I absolutely loved their wine collection and the  entree I ordered which was a Fresh Filet of Sea Bass, Lemon, Capers & White Wine. Since I went with a big group, we did order multiple courses all the way from two apps, to an individual entree and two desserts along with bottle(s)of wine. So maybe I'll visit next only for an occasion for which I'm willing to dish out a good chunk of dollar bills for a refined, Italian plate of goodness! Also, a special shout-out to their complimentary bread served at the beginning which was also some of the best I've had around here. I would absolutely recommend this spot to someone looking for a "fine" grade Italian meal!

We came in for dinner on Saturday and they are following all of the Covid guidelines, limited capacity, tables are spaced out and taking temperatures. We were a group of six and for starters we ordered the melon & prosciutto, calamari, burrata, octopus, and mussels. My favorites were the calamari and the mussels. The burrata was underwhelming and I was expecting the grilled octopus however it was very thin slivers of octopus with a really good arugula salad. For the main course we all got fish, either the branzino, salmon and the sole. I really enjoyed the branzino, it was cooked perfectly with crispy skin and seasoned well.  For the dessert we ordered the molten chocolate cake and a sponge cake. The molten chocolate cake was so good! The staff here is very attentive and accommodating and made us feel very welcomed.
No comment

Great food, attentive service, welcoming ambiance, and all around good time. Food was solid. Love the outdoor seating. Felt comfortable with the plastic partitions. Not only do they offer protection from COVID, or they also gave us some privacy.

Incredibly disappointed!  Dinner there last night with 3 other people. 39 minutes wait for my nartini while the table has their bottle of wine already. Not off to a good start. The sole was delicious the veal salten- bacca was inedible.  Took 2 bites and spit both of them out. The person that I shared it with also found it inedible. We did not eat it. An absolute waste of money. To top the evening off, when the waiter came to clear the dishes he spilled a drink all over the front of my new silk blouse!!! He was so unaware of his surroundings he didn't even realize what he had done. I will definitely think twice before I go back here again.

It was so good and cute! All the staff was so kind, and a great lil NY stop! I loved everything I ate!
Tonight my wife liked her chicken. My pasta dish was only ok. Last time was really good which is why we tried this place again.

We went to Barolo for a pre-theatre dinner.  The place is very small and cute.  They also have a very lovely parklet with plants and flowers.  We sat inside, at the quaint window seat.  We explained that we were in a bit of a rush, due to the theatre time.  While the food was excellent (steak and seabass), the service was very slow.   Despite explaining our rush, the food did not come for 45 minutes, which turned the mean into somewhat of a stressful event, unfortunately.

Came here for dinner with my family and it was pretty good. small selection of wines by the glass but the ones that were available were very good. All of pasta dishes are handmade but the chef was a little heavy on the salt that night

After having dinner at Il Buco on our previous trip this Barolo was just OK and not really worth the very high cost.  The bartender really didn't make great $20 martinis.  The specials with $50 and $52 each and while the veal was excellent I don't think the price was worth the experience.  Decent wine list.  Yes it's NYC but there are better price to experience values to be found.

The ambience in the back patio is sooo beautiful! Perfect to go with a date or with a group of friends. Heaters were very warm (but once they turned off one out of the three, it got way too cold and we had to leave unfortunately). Had the gnocchi and mushroom risotto and both were delicious. Burrata was light but good. Staff was very nice. Would definitely come back

Great Italian spot! Being an Italian born and raised, I can tell! Delicious food, great service, amazing wine list winner of Wine Spectator award! The owner, Dino, is a great guy! Highly recommended! Cheers!

Much delayed review... Fantastic restaurant -- ate here twice during the depths of COVID last November. Beautiful outdoor covered patio in the backyard complete with heat lamps and dividers between tables. Food was delicious and portions were hearty. Can't say enough about the friendly staff.   Thank you!

Great spot. Excellent food and service. We had 2 pasta dishes for mains and there wasn't anything left in the dish and they give you a generous portion. Great Bolognese. We'll be back

Dinner date with my fiancé. The food was okay and the service mediocre. I think my server left without letting us know so we were confused. Pricing is affordable. The hostess was kind. My favorite part was the sundried tomato spread. I had the ravioli for dinner which was not cooked well, not al dente, undercooked.

Welcoming outdoor seating in front on the street as well as a very lovely private outdoor courtyard in the back. My food & the service was fantastic! I was so glad I walked by today.
