My family of 5 went to dinner, which included my 3 boys: 13, 10 and 7 years old.  The food was very good! We had the mussels and calamari to start. Both excellent! I had the pasta Bolognese (good), my 13 year old had the orecchiette (okay- not much flavor- would be better with sausage in it than shrimp) and my husband had the short rib pasta special. My other 2 sons had pasta with butter. Other than the orecchiette, everything was great! The staff was super friendly and attentive. I'd go back again!
A place that definitely I  recommend to the lovers of Italian cuisine.  The food was amazing and the staff very welcoming.  I will definitely go back  server Gustavo thanks
Delicious food great staff went with a group about 10 friends very reasonable prices . Highly recommended. Definitely I will be back .

Great outdoor patio dining space, had an amazing lunch on a sunny day. Ordered the calamari, mushrooms, and burrata for the table, and the fish of the day for the entree. Portions were an impressive size, while not feeling overly heavy.

No comment

I'm not a big fan of restaurants in general but Barolo just may change that. The room is lovely -- with a pretty patio in back -- the food is DELICIOUS (I had arugula salad and the gnocchi-- ate ALL of both) and the service spectacular. Our server Gustavo was hands down the best: he was knowledgeable, friendly, funny and provided fantastic service. Maitre D, Benny runs a tight ship and is a consummate pro. Can't recommend Barolo more highly. If I still lived in NYC, I'd eat here weekly.

Very good edition to the midtown east dining scene.  Comfortable and nicely appointed dining room sets the tone for a good time.  The bistecca on the menu is satisfyingly flavorful and the wine list is full of enough excellent and well priced bottles, to find one to go along with it.
Everyone was very polite and knowledgeable of the menu. We sat in the back, beautiful tree and very cozy. Also COVID precautions were in place. The food was delicious!!

Reservation was perfect, they gave us a nice outside table. Service is good too: the  waiter went all the way to make us comfortable. The food was average, nothing exceptional. I ordered a pear and walnuts, as appetizer,it was ok. Linguine alle vongole  (one of my favorite dishes) was a bit disappointing: small clamshells, watery and flavorless, but I was hungry and ate. Small details to note. The bread was cold, the sparkling water came warm. I hope they come right after the re-opening, since the ambiance is really nice

We enjoyed our appetizers, entrees , and dessert..server Endri was precise and welcoming from start to finish.  Venue is intimate with a classic Italian decor.  Will be back.
Awesome place with incredible wine selection and great food. Staff is friendly and very attentive. Worth trying it, especially if you can sit outside.
Best Italian spot in midtown! Perfect food and great wine selection! Will come back for sure

Delicious Italian restaurant with fresh pasta! They have a lot of vegetarian options and the service is great. I like the cozy feel with the bricks and dim lighting. It seems like there is an outdoor space which would be nice in the summer or when it warms up. The prices are reasonable. I had the Gorgonzola gnocchi and I also tried the spinach ricotta ravioli. I really enjoyed the gnocchi and would definitely come back for it. Something about the ravioli sauce was off to me but my boyfriend liked it. They serve bread with marinara prior to the meal which was good. The ricotta cheesecake was light and sweet. There are a lot of dessert options which are not listed on the menu, the server lists them for you. This is a cute date night spot and I would be happy to go again.
Although it doesn't feel Italian the food it's good !  Service needs some improvement but like I said before the food it's good so go for the food

Spinach Ricotta Ravioli and tiramisu bomb! Nice and easy walk from my hotel and the inside is classy romantic and beautiful

Went here on vacation in nyc and was absolutely blown away. The service was amazing, the restaurant was clean, and the food was delicious. There was not a single thing I did not like! Definitely recommend for a fancy dinner that won't break the bank. Has a very classy but relaxed ambiance.

Great ambiance and good food. The calamari was excellent. Pasta was good. Solid experience for the price.

Found this little family owned restaurant via Yelp.  The food was delicious and service was perfect.  They let you dine at your own pace, provided excellent wine & entree recommendations.  If concerned about Covid, Barolo East has taking precautions of separating tables, but not feeling trapped or closed off.  Loved the covered back patio for dinning.  Nice Italian wine list at reasonable prices.

Went here for dinner for 4 last night. Had a weird interaction with the restaurant when I called to ask if the table we reserved was indoors (it was raining) and they said that just because my reservation was in open table didn't mean they had it...not even sure what that means. Anyway - the good: the wine list is EXTENSIVE with prices ranging from $50-$1000 bottles, and the ambience is perfect for a group that wants to converse. The bad: the food is just ok (as a table we had the salmon, bolognese, risotto, and chicken scarpariello) and the service was wicked slow.

What a wonderful restaurant and service! The appetizers (fried calamari and the grilled octopus and the entree specials (Seared Bass and the Gnocchi with shaved Truffle) was incredible!

Came here on a Friday night for dinner, last minute, but we were able to get reservations for 7pm.  We enjoyed an appetizer of calamari and a salad. Both were well prepared and delicious.  The linguine with clams was tasty and fresh. I had the pasta with bolognese sauce -homemade, al dente and flavorful. My daughter's orrechiette pasta was good but a little lacking in flavor, the only dish that we found to be slightly disappointing. Also had the chocolate mousse for dessert - a nice finish to a lovely dinner. Service is friendly and efficient. It's not the best Italian restaurant, but it has a nice ambiance without being uncomfortable, has very good food and a fair price point (not inexpensive, but not exorbitant). It's a decent walk for us so I imagine we'll be back to enjoy more meals here.

Service was excellent every where we turned at Barolo.  Host, waiter and bartender were all fantastic!  The food was good and all came out piping hot from the kitchen.  I would not hesitate to return soon.

Myself and three college friends reunited over a delightful socially distanced feast in the lovely back garden  of Barolo East.  Service was attentive and well-masked, area was clean and safe.  We had the mushroom appetizer, an avocado and shrimp salad (special) and the Caesar salad to start.  All were delicious and well prepared, fresh, mushrooms were best.  For entrees, we ordered gnocchi in a gorgonzola sauce and orecchiette with broccoli rabe and shrimp.  All the pasta is homemade and so fresh, sauces were not heavy and so tasty.  As others have said, reminded me of Italy.  Highly recommend, esp in covid restrictions if you want a fabulous dining experience
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't blow me away with your sauces and flavor either. Came here with some friends for dinner and was seated outside at first try but when asked to move indoors got seated at a drafty table. The server was pleasant and moved us a second time away from the door. Drinks and food were sub par and wished it was one step better. We were two couples all who work in the service industry and also food business owners. Disappointing food for the prices given and the server also gave us a wine in alternative to what we ordered (he said they were out but saw it down stairs when waiting for the bathroom). Felt slightly like the book was judged by its cover (casual versus old school upper East sider) and it showed in service. Cheeky but not entertaining.
No comment
Really beautiful back garden. The waiter was attentive and helped us make a fabulous wine selection. Everyone really enjoyed their dinners... very delicious food. Highly recommend!
The food was amazing. Service was great and social distancing conscious. I've never had better tiramisu in my life. Definitely my new go to Italian spot in Midtown.
No comment

I had the three course meal  it was amazing and affordable! I also had the caprese which was delicious. It was empty when we came and it was nice we felt we had the restaurant to our selves. Customer service was also great! I'm not from here so if you are it's a must try out
No comment

I enjoyed my meal here. Had the 3 course meal as part of NYC restaurant week. Good value, food and service. The Caramel semifreddo was delicious. The absolute highlight is the pleasant and zen garden terrace in the middle of midtown east. Definitely enjoy a meal al fresco before summer ends.

Outstanding!  can't say enough good things about it, food, service, ambiance, a real gem.  Our waiter, Fame (or perhaps his name was Thame) was wonderful, recommended a great Italian wine at a good price.

My new favorite restaurant in NYC. Phenomenal service. Seafood is fresh and the pasta has a homemade bite and texture. Amazing assortment of wine and cocktails. I got the White Russian and it was great. Will be back
AMAZING Italian food!! They have a gluten free pasta (penne) which I got with the chicken and it was amazing. My bf ordered the veal and it was also amazing. 10/10 great place.
Amazing. Great wine selection, fantastic food (at very reasonable price points) & a great backyard patio!  Definitely adding to my favorites list.

Amazing food for a great price! They sat us right away even though we didn't have a reservation. The waiter was very attentive the entire time and didn't make us feel rushed even though it was indoor dining. Such a lovely restaurant!
Amazing restaurant with great service. I'd definitely recommend. Came here for my wife's birthday and it's everything we could've ask for and more.

My family and I ate here yesterday. The food was delicious, best calamari I've ever eaten. My son, who is a picky eater gobbled up his pasta dish. I had the Pappardelle with chicken and my husband had a shrimp dish, both were wonderful. The waiter was very polite and efficient. Definitely will be returning.
No comment
The food is great the outdoor okay. However the drinks were sort off sloppy. Wish I can say more but it was okay.
Excellent Italian for power lunch or business dinner.  Very good food and service. Nice atmosphere. Don't dress like a bum. Wear a collar shirt, it won't kill u it's a classy place.

Went here for the first time last night on a drinks date. It was a spur of the moment decision to go there instead of 2nd avenue, as we walked by it was an obvious choice given how nice it looked on the street, white tablecloth and flowers outdoors by the tables. So much cleaner and nice than all the 2nd ave bar options and wine bars, and better spacing. The food is really what brought me to write a review though, we only had 1 appetizer to share with drinks but the Burrata we had was incredible! It was also served with bread and their signature side of some sort of magical crushed tomato sauce for dipping which I'll be craving until I go back. 4 Stars for my experience with drinks outside, but if I go back to eat and everything else is good I'll consider 5 stars.
No comment

First, the service.   Fantastic service from start to finish.  My water glass was never low.  The food is excellent.   The clams and mussels are first rate.  Portion sizes are good and prices are on the lower end  given the service and location.  Highly Recommend!! A+++++ I'll be back.

Stopped here for a late lunch and it was a great find--the staff was very friendly and professional and everyone enjoyed their food. We all ordered from the price fixe menu, 3 courses for $25 which could not be beat. Nice atmosphere.

Super cute date spot! The restaurant is very cozy upstairs with a bar downstairs. Tons of delicious items on the menu - the beet salad and burrata were amazing. For the entre, the salmon was  - perfectly cooked with a beautiful sear. Highly recommend this place!!

Just found this wonderful Restaurant on 49th just east of 3rd in midtown. In an area with ok Italian, this is a gem!!  The ambience is lovely, the staff very friendly, and the food is "wow"!  I was getting take out for a very tired husband and had a glass of superb Pinot noir while waiting. The recommended wine was a great find!  Not much Pinot noir is produced in Italy's Piedmonte and this one was magnificent!!  The food came and I was reluctant to leave the lovely conversation. Food ( pasta with fresh red sauce and basil, steamed mussels and clams, and eggplant parmigiana ) were truly wonderful !!  We will return often!!  Wholeheartedly recommend!!

Cozy neighborhood spot with deliciously flavorful plates! A little noisy but the chatter added to the ambience. We started with the calamari and carpaccio - both amazing. Then arugula salad and Caesar, also tasty. Main courses  - daily special gnocchi, gnocchi w/Gorgonzola, salmon and fruiti di mare pasta. Great choices, authentic & delicious. Scrumptious tiramisu for dessert. Warm January evening - perfect walk from hotel in Times Square. Great experience. Will be back!!
No comment

We stopped here for lunch while in the city for a vacation.  The scampi and beef carpaccio were very good.  The veal saltimbocca did not didappoint, nor did my fresh fettucini with ragu. Decent wine selection and dessert menu.  Service was very timey but not intrusive.

Now that the good citizens of Manhattan have been partially handed the keys in this long-standing covid lock-down we can start re-discovering some of the eateries that had been here before but that for some reason got lost in the millieu .  Barolo East is one such establishment.  I have returned to this restaurant twice in the past 10 days.  One should check out their rear garden when the weather is still agreeable.  I did see several heat lamps in the ready for the cooler weather,  They do have a fairly large well-approximated and welcoming indoor dining space.  Some menu items stand out.  Their  tomato-based "dip" which accompanies their bread is the best I have tasted.  Their home-made bread is fine as well.  Their desserts are amazing and are also created in-house as the owner told me.  Also to be noted is the quality of service, which during these times of stressful business ownership, can put one's patience (with customers) to a test, these people have met and surpassed any client's needs.  This can not be said of all restaurants I have tried since late August 2020.  Come to Barolo East and give your palette something to sing about :-)
No comment
No comment

Fabulous place!  Everyone was pleased.  Reasonable prices.  Lasagna specials was delicious and the basic Italian dish of linguine with clams was the best I've ever had.  Highly recommend this lovely restaurant.

Fantastic little Italian gem! We went in off of the yelp reviews and were blown away by the food, ambiance & service. Not only was Pacy from Dawson's Creek our waiter, they had delicious wine, mushroom soup to die for and spectacular Branzino. And I live in Little Italy so I'm pretty choosy! Think we are going back tomorrow to try some of the pastas and meat dishes. Yum!!

Ordered takeout, although on the pricey side (it was date night) it was worth every penny. Chicken was delicious.  Food arrived fast, piping hot.  A++. I am looking forward to stopping by and checking out the actual restaurant.

My girlfriends and I did girls dinner here. It was super cute. Service was great. Having been a server and realizing that there are thousands of restaurants in NYC, I feel like service and food are both super important. This exceeded my expectations in both departments. Will definitely be back!
No comment
No comment
Great meal. Great staff. Great restaurant. Everything was great from food to service. We had a great table outside in their garden. Highly recommend.

This place is the perfect date night. The restaurant was funky lit, to perfection. The grilled octopus starter was above and beyond what I'd expected, and the filet mignon was one of the best I've ever experienced! The service was excellent and they were always making sure we were completely satisfied with our experience. I will be back, that is for sure.

column3: Hackensack River Waterfront, Jersey City, NJ
column6: Really delicious food and awesome service. The wine was amazing and our server Gustavo made the experience very warming.
No comment

I was afraid that because of restaurant week which I  didn't know about at the time that it could be disappointing. But that couldn't be farther from the truth. The staff, especially John the manager, were attentive but not intrusive, friendly and engaging. We had the buratta- 10 stars, as an appetizer. The entrees- 2 pasta, 1 seafood were delicious. The atmosphere was relaxed  and cozy yet you didnt feel cramped. Hands down we will be back.
No comment

Had a pretty decent experience here. The space is very beautiful and bright. A good spot for big groups in the midtown area. The wait staff was a bit inattentive. Several other tables who came after us got served first and attended to more carefully. The food was pretty good though I think a bit overpriced. In a city rich with amazing Italian places you really need to have fresh home made pasta to stand out.
No comment

This is a hidden gem on the east side. My boyfriend and I made a last minute decision to get dinner on a Saturday night and stumbled upon this place. They had a back patio for seating space that was very quiet and almost felt as if you weren't in Manhattan (which is a great thing every once in awhile). On top of this, the service was excellent and our waiter was more than friendly. The food was delicious and all for a great price. This is now currently my favorite restaurant in the city, I will be returning for another bite soon.
Excellent service , ambiance, wine and food. Great neighborhood vibe. I love the attention to detail and experience. This is a definitely a must try.

I used to come to this restaurant before it became Barolo east and wanted to try it as there has been a big buzz around the neighborhood about them, and I'm very happy I did. I absolutely love what the new owners did with the place, it truly is a gem as some have noted on their reviews. We started with the fried calamari and had the veal chop Milanese and the home made pappardelle with file-mignon and sun dried tomatoes. All I can say is WOW!! The wine list was extensive and the prices were very reasonable all around, I now see what the buzz was all about. Huge thumbs up!

Service was terrific and the buffalo mozzarella dish superb. We had a divine Brunello di Montalcino that the waiter recommended and my husband's Chicken Parmigiana was the best he has ever had- a tough thing for him to admit since he prides hImself on making a great chicken parm.  My gnocchi was outstanding but I'd recommend splitting it with someone else and ordering something else with vegetables, since it's a heavy dish.

Sorry to say our food from here was mediochre at best. We ordered Seafood Risotto and Salmon Fettucini. And a salad with avocado. And barrata and tomato. To start with, the avocado was brown. We had to pick most of it out of the salad. The buratta was good. The two entrees were both very bland. Expensive for what it was.

We made a reservation on yelp and were very impatiently told upon arrival that the kitchen will be closed in a minute or two, and it's our problem that we made the reservation. It was entirely inappropriate to dismiss and fault the client when in fact you put the available time slots there. Shame on them for the attitude and the bullying!

Date night. This place delivered. We went all out with the gnocchi special with shaved truffles and it was the best gnocchi I've ever tasted. Servers were friendly and the food was delivered in a timely manner.  Cozy atmosphere. Fresh cut rose in the table. Come and enjoy yourself.
Good food and a nice and cozy place. I believe it was the owner that greeted us and sat us down. He was very nice! When in NYC I will be returning to  eat here.

Very cute restaurant! I ordered carpaccio and steak. The  carpaccio and steak was fantastic! This is the best steak i have ever had! Perfectly cooked and juicy! My mother got a salad and it is very fresh! 10/10 definitely recommend and 100% going to come back.
I just love this place ! Food amazing , great bartender Dunja , and menagment more then welcoming  for sure my place number 1. In town

We went for a safe outside birthday dinner and the staff from Benny to all the wait staff were FANTASTIC!  They were so accommodating (even let us bring out cake) and the garden was beautiful.  The pasta dishes and salads were delicious. Everyone loved their meal. We will be back!

The ambiance and service was pretty good but the entrees were lackluster. The saving grace was the bread paired with the tomato/oil combination. Carpaccio was tasty but overwhelmed by arugula, skimpy on the beef. There was none of the homemade essence in the pasta that I've come to expect from really good Italian restaurants. The fruti de mare and orecchiette were simply ok. Nothing special. I would not return and I'd continue to search elsewhere for Italian in the area.
An absolutely amazing dining experience. Service is so on point. It was my first stop in nyc after a long flight and it didn't disappoint. Can't wait to come back.

We stumbled into this restaurant and it exceeded all expectations! The staff was friendly, efficient, and accommodating. So professional but also felt like we knew them forever. We started with an order of calamari which was probably top 3 best I've ever had, crispy yet extremely fresh! Both pasta dishes were amazing truffle mushroom risotto and bolognese were outstanding. Great wine selection and the desserts sounded amazing however we were far too full thanks to the portion size. Awesome experience all around!

Had an amazing experience at Barolo during the coldest weekend of the year and never felt uncomfortable!! Love NYC restaurants and Barolo goes above and beyond during tough times !! Great heated dining option !!
No comment
This place is outstanding!  We had drinks, appetizers, and dinner!! Absolutely delicious!!! The waiters were great...very friendly!!!  Limoncello complementary!!

Tried this for the first time with a friend last night.  Used to dine at the Barolo in Broadway and never realized it closed and moved uptown.  Very pretty restaurant with an outdoor garden.  Appetizers of tuna tartare and lentil soup were both tasty.  Pasta and sea bass entrees also very good.  The only drawback was that the a/c was barely working and it was close to 90 degrees and humid.  I kept on complaining and neither our server or manager acknowledged that it was broken until we left.  Will try it again after the Summer.
I came here with my husband and another couple. It was a nice atmosphere and pretty good service. The food was just ok.
Incredible food and awesome staff. 10/10 would recommend to anyone looking for a spot to eat in midtown. They have a great outdoor dining set up too!

This was my first time at Barolo, and will definitely be back. The service was impeccable, the food was absolutely delicious.  With a cozy and charming environment you can't miss this excellent dining experience.

Came here for  lunch and our expectations weren't quite met. The staff is immensely courteous except for the bigger gentleman who was likely the manager. As for the food I ordered the burrata and my friend got the avocado salad. Burrata was good but the salad was way too sour! For the entrees, I had the branzino and my friend had the chicken. The fish was dry and it wasn't cleaned properly (see pics for scales and a small bone). You can imagine how unsettling that was. Chicken had a strange taste that I can't quite place my finger on. I was counting on the desserts to blow me away. Tiramisu at an Italian place- it had to be good right? Sadly not so much. The ricotta cheesecake actually was better.

This is one of my favorite spots in the neighborhood. If you are looking for an elegant place to dine outside, you can eat outside in the garden. I highly recommend this restaurant if you are craving Italian food and looking for something special.
Great food, even better service. Got the Veal Scallopini in the brown sauce and it was great.
Wow, stumbled into this place and it was amazing! Great food, good service, nice value. The mushroom app was really good along with the veal. Will be back for sure!

Great new Italian in mid town. Single diner, I ate at the bar. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Maitre D/Owner explained the specials, took his recommendation for homemade papardelle in meat sauce. Delicious. Paired with a great house Barolo. Reasonable prices. Won't hesitate to return...

Excellent in every way. They have a really nice outdoor patio in the back of the restaurant which definitely meets safety standards. My friend and I shared a calamari appetizer and we both got halibut as a main dish. Both were outstanding. The service was also excellent. We were not rushed but they were very attentive at the same time. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Excellent restaurant from the service to the food. The waiter recommended wine to match our dinner that was not even on his list and it was fantastic. At end of the meal they gave us a complimentary limoncello to just continue teasing our pallets.  The salmon tartare was the best I have ever had. The Beefsteka was cooked just right and was amazing. I have had it in many places but this was one of my favorites. Enjoy.

Excellent dinner, both food and service. No problem getting a table as a solo diner instead of being relegated to the bar. Great wine suggestion from the server to start. Minestrone soup was served piping hot, much appreciated with the weather outside. Lambshank special was something unique and executed well, definitely worth the extra cost. Almost didn't need the knife.  Tiramisu to go, along with complementary freshly made biscotti for the next day, and a glass of limoncello. As an out of towner looking to unwind from a long week, this was exactly the experience I hoped for!
Amazing find around the corner from our hotel. Great service, amazing food and wine selection. Linguine with clams and veal were to die for!!

What a wonderful find! Beautiful setting and garden. The food equals the setting - great. Very attentive staff. Owner circulated to make sure everything is perfect. We really appreciated that level of care.
No comment

High hopes for high prices.  Ultimately...disappointing mediocre food for twice the price of mediocre food. Minestrone soup, clear bland broth (brodo) with lots of cubed fresh vegetables missing classic ingredients like tomatoes, beans, herbs, and any depth of flavor ... should be listed as salt free vegetables in broth.  Arugula salad...fresh greens, shaved parmigiana, and an excellent balsamico vinegar...best part of the meal. But the entree was bland, oil, manilla clams, small portion of linguine with a few slices of garlic. But no acid, no green herbs, no flavor, no passion, no skill, and quite possibly no Italians involved.  Some classics are usually too easy to mess up.  After spending over $50 my advice...try harder, alot harder.

I thoroughly enjoyed my meal at Barola East the other evening. I was dining alone and sat at the bar. The bartender was very nice, the service was first rate and the food was excellent. I felt comfortable having dinner there and the other patrons were friendly. The menu was filled with many of my favorites. To start out they bring warm fresh bread with a dipping sauce that is irresistible. I highly recommend this restaurant.

This has become my favorite restaurant in New York. I had planned a beautiful romantic dinner at another restaurant, when when we got there we found it was too noisy. But they had the perfect meal. After walking around a bit, we stumbled onto Barolo and was welcomed in, given a romantic table, and the maitre d' had the chef make the meal I was after - only better! I ate there the next night too and plan a couple more nights next week. Loved everything and highly recommend! Just don't take my table

This was my first time visiting Barolo and wow.  That's all I can say.  Wow.  From the minute we walked in, we felt like honored guests.  The owners attended to our table the entire time, as well as our spectacular waiters, Eddie and Freddy.  The specials of the night  were incredibly fresh and reminded us of a farm to table experience.  We ordered the homemade fettuccine with burgundy truffles which melted in our mouths, only to be outdone by the Cold Zabaglione desert.  I can't say enough about the menu and all of the entrees we shared, but the service was out of this world and as it should be--as family.  Run...don't walk.  And make a reservation because a place like this will catch on quick!

Everything that can go right, did go right! The service, food and ambiance were exemplary. They were also properly staffed (unlike most New York restaurants) which made food service quick and pleasant. The pasta ragu was to die for, the Branzino sublime... everything was good in general. If you want a hipster Italian joint that plays Drake and does some truffle rendition of your Nonna's pasta - this place isn't for you. Barolo is something better. This restaurant is a reliable, high quality, no funny business amazing Italian restaurant - one you'll have on your roster on the weekly.

While visiting NYC we wanted to go to a nice restaurant, but that was close to our hotel after a long day of sight seeing. We looked on Yelp and found this place. The staff was amazing! They were polite, helpful, and checked on us through out our time there. They even have outside seating, which is where we chose. The food is amazing and you can tell everything is fresh. We will definitely return here when we come back to the city. I would highly recommend trying them.
EXCELLENT!!! The food! The service! The wine! Everything  was absolutely fantastic! It was truly nice to get hot food in a restaurant! Believe it or not, it's rather rare these days. THANK YOU!!

Had reservations here for my boyfriend's birthday. We went on a Saturday night, and decided to go for the prix fixe menu for restaurant week. The place was beautiful, and not overwhelmingly crowded. Located in a beautiful, quieter, part of the city. The exposed brick and wine cellars give you a very authentic and rustic feel. The three course meal was delicious, and table service was excellent. Food came out pretty quickly. The waiter was very attentive to detail and interacted with us to make the experience pleasant. Would give 5 stars however I felt like it was missing a little extra something to really give us an over the top experience. Otherwise, would highly recommend for a romantic date night.

Hands down, one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Midtown East!  The service was phenomenal (EDIN was our server) from the wine selection to the entrees (I asked for something off menu and they easily accommodated, no questions asked) to the dessert.  The manager and his staff were so friendly and hospitable, offering us tastings and port wine to finish our meals.  The ambiance was also amazing - warm and cozy, great lighting and easy to hear!  Wonderful, wonderful restaurant.  I will definitely be back and will recommend to my friends and colleagues.  Perfect for an after work dinner or drink.

Took my dad here for his birthday and we had a great time. The waiters and staff took care of us, including putting a birthday candle in tiramisu but thankfully agreeing not to sing, since my dad would have hated that! The food was delicious and well priced. We will definitely be going back.

I found this restaurant a year ago while visiting NYC and I am back in town went straight back. It does not disappoint highly recommend. My family is from Italy this is as good as any place I have eaten in Flore

I was there 2 nights ago with my friends we had some appetizers the tuna, burrata cheese.octopus    It was delicious the pastas and the Dover sole outstanding and wine too. The Service impeccable Thank you guys. All of as had a great time, see you soon
Great restaurant ! We had a wonderful experience. The service and food were amazing and very well priced for NYC. I believe the owner greeted us who was very nice. We will totally be back again!

I am surprised to be first to review this restaurant as I was only visiting from Miami and chose the restaurant based on location and menu. Anyway, if it's new, I am impressed. Beautiful ambiance inside, friendly service, and great food, specifically the pastas. My wife had Papardelli with chicken and I had fettuccine with veal bolognese sauce which was amazing. The fresh pastas were comparable to what I have eaten in Italy.
No comment

Excellent newcomer. Attractive, spotless restaurant with charming outdoor patio.  Attentive service, but most importantly, delicious food.  Have gone twice and everything ordered was fresh and on point.  Great Pre-fixe options to entice you into another visit, and it works! Enjoyed immensely and will be back for a third visit shortly!

We are absolutely thrilled that this new restaurant is in our neighborhood! My friends and I have been working our way through the menu since it opened and have had amazing meals every time. From the homemade soups to the fresh pastas, to the whole fish deboned table-side...the food is impeccable. Great for dates, brunch with friends or eating alone - the staff is warm, friendly and really cares about your experience.
A true neighborhood gem in midtown East. Excellent Italian food served in a comfortable setting by an outstanding team. My wife and I have dined here several times and always enjoy our experience.

I am afraid but I disagree with the other reviews. I found the place to be overpriced and the food was average. I had the veal saltimbocca, and the meat was hard. The tiramisu was bland. On the positive side, the bread was fresh and the mushroom appetizer was tasty. We ended up paying over 100 dollars each, for one main course, a shared appetizer and a shared dessert. Disappoiting.
If your hobby is trying different Italian restaurants as is mine, you'll realize quickly that this restaurant is mediocre. Many better options for the same price.

I was looking for a great Italian food, good atmosphere a friend advise me on this restaurant Barolo East excellent food very friendly excellent service A+.Food was amazing as well A+.I definitely recommend Barolo East.walk out very happy and contentl Definitely come here again real

This restaurant is AMAZING! From the moment you enter you'll be treated to top notch service, incredible food and a lovely atmosphere. I called for reservations and while the manager said they were booked at the time I requested, he'd fit us in which was no small task given we were a party of 8. We ALL thoroughly enjoyed our meals and will definitely return again and again! Thank you Barolo East for a truly terrific evening.

One of the best Italian restaurants in midtown Manhattan, I have been here a few times always enjoy the food and the service. I had another wonderful dinner with my wife and I'm coming back with my business association, really worth to try.
loved the ambiance. Not a lot of options on the menu. They need to come up with more items on the menu. I ordered the truffle risotto. It was ok not impressed.
Had a terrific meal. Everything that we ordered was prepared well, came to the table promptly and was as expected. Service is outstanding. Would highly recommend for any occasion.

I'm giving this place 2 stars because my meal was good. My husband's meal was horrendous however. I had the spinach ravioli with pink sauce from the dinner menu. There was a spinach ravioli on the regular menu with red sauce but this one had pink sauce and came with a salad and dessert and price was very good. I enjoyed it. Salad was fresh. I gave the dessert to my husband which was a Caramel ice cream of some sort. He said it was just ok. He ordered the special - Fresh Cavatelli pasta with filet mignon and a glob of ricotta on top in a marinara sauce. I also tasted it and agreed it was almost inedible. The supposed filet mignon tasted bad and I would've guessed that it was not beef or it was just bad meat. We didn't complain because we didn't have time to wait for another meal as we had to get to the Queen concert -my husband ended up just eating the cavatelli which also was not good. Flavorless and way too under-cooked. Cavatelli should be al dente but this was very under-cooked. Nevertheless, he was starving so he ate it. The atmosphere was very cozy and I ordered a California Cabernet which was delicious. The waiter rattled off the specials with a very strong accent and we couldn't understand hardly anything. If you're gonna have waiters with thick accents, then they should hand out a specials menu to read along. The owner walks around asking if everything is ok which is very professional however not a smile and very creepy. I even tried to get him to smile by smiling at him and he made me feel so uncomfortable. Very weird. The waiter smiled but was a bit rude when I asked a question. It's like they are robots and If you ask them to stray from their script, they get annoyed. Just didn't get a comfy welcome vibe from the staff. My guess is they are trying to come off as very elite and professional but instead they are coming off rude, stiff and robotic. I see others have reviews saying similar things. I wouldn't go back because of this. Even though my meal was good and price was decent. The fact that my husband's meal was bordering on inedible and the steak didn't taste like steak and the staff was so unfriendly makes me not want to return.
Fantastic food, excellent service, relaxing atmosphere - we had a delightful lunch at Barolo today. We were also pleasantly surprised by being offered dessert drinks "on the house" - very nice touch!

I'm in New York City for the week and staying at the Residence Inn. We were meeting up a long time family friend for dinner. After looking on Yelp for dining options we chose Barolo. And I am so glad we did! The restaurant is nicely decorated with a really nice bar at the entrance. The food was fantastic. Authentic Italian complete with homemade pasta. Great wine selection! The service matches the food in its excellence! If you're in the area, choose this place over the other Italian eateries nearby!

We walked in to this elegant and cozy east side restaurant as your typical out-of-town yokels whose idea of good italian is the mom-and-pop place near our home in the Texas suburbs. Barolo's blew us away. The bruschetta- like relish served with fresh bread was sublime. I had the summer dinner special, which was a 3 course option for $39. Each was superb! The Staff is especially warm and gracious with expert knowledge of the deep italian wine list. An absolutely wonderful evening.

We enjoyed a delicious lunch at Barolo- an excellent pear and Gorgonzola salad and scrumptious mushroom risotto. The ricotta cheesecake was light and not too sweet. The room is lovely and the tables are a nice distance apart. Also, I really enjoyed the wide variety of music they played.  And lastly, the service was excellent.

Great food, great service! I had the sage gnocchi, recommended by the server, which surpassed expectations. Pasta was done to perfection. Tiramisu was exceptional! Prices very responsible. We sat outside and enjoyed a perfect evening!
I had dinner alone on a business trip and it was lovely. Just what I was looking for. Wine was delicious and the restaurant had a nice buzz.

We stumbled upon this gem via Yelp. Super cute restaurant and back patio. Dinner was delicious. Dinner was slow but the server was very attentive and quick to refill our water and drinks as we waited for our entree's to arrive. There was a mixup with one of the meals but they quickly remedied the situation. I don't remember our servers name but he is from Kosovo and we had a connection back to my home state of IA and he was so fun to chat with. I would definitely recommend.
Great red sauce. Great ingredients.  Rest of food was mixed.  High cork fee ($50).

We recently celebrated a birthday here and had a lovely time.    We were met with a gracious welcome when we arrived and the service and attention to us throughout the meal was exceptional.  Everything we ordered was very delicious.  The fresh pasta dishes were "out of this world" good.  Highly recommended!

I recently ate out at this restaurant with two friends.  The dining room is lovely and the tables are spread out so you do not feel cramped.  The staff is friendly and very professional.  The food is delicious.  I had a wonderful pasta with zucchini.  It was so simple and yet so flavorful and the pasta was cooked perfectly.  The waiter overheard us trying to convince our friend to order dessert to celebrate her birthday and, before we knew it, they had brought a piece of cheesecake with a candle and three forks on the house.  That was such a lovely and generous thing to do.  We will definitely be returning to this restaurant.
We were looking for a good restaurant with a group of friends from Argentina. We found this amazing Italian restaurant on the east side. Food excellent as well as the service,,,,,

Loved this place! From waking in the door, we knew this place was going to be amazing. We shared several dishes and the waiter, Eddie, was accommodating and so sweet. The maître d' , Johnny, was friendly and attentive. The food was delicious. I had the homemade fettuccini with burgundy truffles-best ever! Highly recommend Barolo East!

Great Italian place in mid town! Food was wonderful and the staff very nice and friendly! I would really like to go back one day and the restaurant has a very nice atmosphere. The pasta we were served was very fresh and delicious! we had the tuna tower appetizer and veal chop Milanese. Very good.
Really nice restaurant the service is great everyone treat you with a personal touch.  If you want to splurge on Italian food that's the place to go.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here with a large group and was throughly impressed with their ability to serve us all so efficiently. Robin was our main server and cooked most of our meat. She made the experience 5 stars instead of 4 because she was so personable. She even threw some kimchi on the grill for us which I've never had. It was even better off the grill! We got one of the combos and tried multiple cuts of meat. The food was good and the ambiance was fun for the group. My favorite side was the soup with beef and tofu--great flavors. Only downfall (in my opinion) is every inch of my clothing smelling like Korean BBQ after. Wish there was a way to leave not smelling like the food.
No comment

Great kbbq in Fidi! Who would have thought? Great quality and selection of meats and the server cooks it for you to perfection so that's a nice touch. We ordered the pork belly and wagyu kalbi and I left full but also wanting to come back for more. If you're in Fidi and don't want to make the trek to koreatown this is a great spot!

Yummy kalbi tang and a good selection of appetizers. Seafood pancake is very doughy and not crunchy, even though it does have many ingredients in it. Not many good East Asian food available in Tribeca, so I'm glad @gunbaetribeca exists.
No comment
No comment

One of those places where the food was so good I forgot to take a picture until after eating! Coke here with a big appetite bc this place is extremely filling. I pretty much got one of everything and not a single dish disappointed. Seafood pancakes were soft and delicious. Ordered 3 different meats which were cooked by a staff member (best part is you don't cook your own meat). But my favorite dish was the kimchi fried rice. If you like spicy food, they add a spicy sauce which not only gave a nice kick but was also very tasty.

Dduk mandu guk (rice cake dumpling soup) was pretty solid. Slightly salty, but all around a good time. Surprisingly not crazy expensive for a restaurant in Tribeca.
No comment
The food was really good and the experience was fun. Ambiance was on point ! Cute place with great service

There are so many high points to this experience that I almost cannot articulate them! We had Kevin (if you go, please request him and tip this man WELL - he will treat you right!) as our waiter and he blessed us with potentially the best service we've ever had. My dad's side of the family is from Seoul Korea, and this is the closest thing to my grandmother's cooking I've had since I left home. The bulgogi, brisket, gratuitous steamed eggs and banchan, the kimchi, the soju, everything! It was simply immaculate and left me so sad that I will have to leave NYC in a few days. 10000/10 recommend trying this spot out for the best Korean food experience you'll have in your lifetime. As a bonus, my Mexican American partner is now a converted Korean food fan :) thank you Gunbae!

I came here with a group of friends for a quick dinner. Everyone loved the ambience and food. I didn't realize it, but there's also a super cool karaoke bar below the restaurant so this would be a great place for a group night out! 10/10 would come back :)
The Bulgogi was excellent and the sides were different but very tasty.  The kimchi pancake was thicker than what I'm accustomed to, but still crisp and tasty. Will definitely stop here again!
No comment
Delicious food, excellent staff, stuff drinks. Clever benches for your bloat so it doesn't end up smelling like BBQ! Will go back soon.

Been to Gunbae multiple times since it so close to home but this was first time this has happened. Waiter told us a party of 3 that we needed to order the barbeque for dinner.  This is the first time that we decided to just order the soup/and stew along with bulgogi japchae and 2 appetizers plus a bottle of soju. Waiter forgot about our soju and we had to remind him. Previous visits we always order korean bbq.  When the bill came a 20% percent gratuity was added on already so our bill.came to 140.00.  When I ask isn't it customary for party of 5 or more to add in gratuity and was told new policy in place 2 months ago to auto add it.  Just wondering has it happen to anyone else?

The food has lots of flavor and was so good. Very tiny place so it was hard bringing our 2 kids and squeezing my daughters car seat through the tiny entrance but definitely recommend for a date night spot.

Accommodating to birthday celebrations! They gave us beer and shots. The portions for Korean bbq were quite small for the prices. I've definitely had better. The yuzu lemonade was very refreshing and the new mango soju was delicious.  Their karaoke was decent for the price. $40 an hour for medium room.

This is my favorite Korean restaurant in NYC. I visit NYC 3-4 times a year and we eat here whenever we visit. The food here is perfectly delicious. The servers are always friendly, and attentive. Anyways, this place is great. I can't wait to go back.
Delicious barbecue! We tried most of the specialties and it was an amazing experience to watch them cook in front of us! (Brings in the hibachi vibe..)
randomly chose to eat at Gunbae & left with a happy tummy haha! Would definitely love to go back again, if time allowed. Nice place & friendly workers.
No comment

First time with my husband and 3 year old on a Friday night. Such a great experience! Everyone was super friendly and helpful. Food was delicious and reasonably priced. I will be coming back for the food and experience the karaoke downstairs.
I've probably already reviewed GunBae but it's just so good. Easily one of our favorite Korean restaurants in nyc. This time we tried their wings and we were not disappointed!!
Wonderful first experience for Korean BBQ. It was quiet and peaceful when we went (around 5pm). Loved the wagyu & tongue. Also loved they had good NA beers. Will definitely be back!
No comment

We've try the combo supposed for 3-4 person and we only have 3 person but round up have to order 2 more pancake and 1 order of beef tongue and 1 more order of ribeye so the combo portion are way too small for even 3 people and they charge 20% tips automaticity in the bill and taxes

Filing and great food. Did the four person prix fixe for 170 and shared a few bottles of soju for under $85 including 20% tip. Service was excellent, great atmosphere. Will make a staple on each NYC visit.
No comment

Was super impressed with the food at this little Korean spot. I went on a Thursday afternoon for lunch and had to wait about 10 minutes for a table, it was bumping! They have a lot of options on the menu, and someone that usually doesn't eat Korean food, I had no problem finding a delicious soup to order. The service was friendly and for the portions you get, the price point was right on. Will definitely be coming back soon!

Nice place and great service. Lots of other Korean BBQ places in the area too but we were happy here. Expensive tho

A bit disappointed with the food here, the wait is around 10-15 min during lunch hour. I was quite excited to try this place out since I love korean food and it's close to my office, but this one just wasn't that good. The seafood pancake is skippable, I wouldn't order that if I were to choose again, there was way too much dough and no flavor, even after adding the dipping sauce doesn't help. The wings are average and a bit dry, pricey too, won't recommend that. The bibimbap was ok. Overall I wouldn't recommend this place, I definitely won't be coming back and will save my korean food cravings for ktown or flushing/queens.

The service was okay, but the food and portions were not very good. The meat was okay but I'm not paying high dollar for just okay meat. We ended up paying about 100 for just two meats. At the end we still left hungry and had to go elsewhere. Definitely do not recommend coming here.  Unless your trying to blow money.

Good environment and nice restaurant overall, prices might not of matched the food but not necessarily bad
This is my favorite K-BBQ place in NYC. Their ribeye is simply amazing and the servers cook the meat to perfection.

Came here for an anniversary dinner with my partner. Ely was our waitress and she was incredibly sweet, professional, and attentive. The food was spectacular, the vibe was perfect, and we can't wait to come back!!
Went for karaoke and had so much fun! Bartender Danny was fantastic and a great time. Would definitely recommend for parties. We ordered food platters which were all fantastic.
Excellent Korean BBQ. Friendly  attentive service. Great karaoke. Party was a blast thanks to Gunbae.

You are treated like family here. Good quality meat. Full bar, karaoke and Korean BBQ is rare in this city! Trifecta in Tribeca.

I had such an amazing experience at GunBae. The servers were so nice, answered my questions, helped me navigate the menu. I was a KBBQ newbie. All of their recommendations were AMAZING. The sides, the meat, the rice and the bowls were all so fresh and flavorful.

Food and drinks was awesome!! Special shout out to Danny and Juan for providing amazing customer service. I will go back a lot!

Good place and with $60 each in a group of 5 we ate plenty and liked everything about it . The service was great, the space was nice and the food was delish! Loved the shareable combo and will be back.

Guys!!! Please don't ever drink the tap water. I seen alot of people get really drunk and putting their mouth on the tap water bottle they use to place it on every table as customers arrive and they never clean or replace the tap water within the bottle they just refill and that's it. Very unsanitary. All the workers are nice except this Jesse guy. I remember eating with my friends and he tried to fight this one worker that was working there and i overheard him asking his worker to fight him for real and i am very concerned about this one worker jesse. I have asked the bust boys and asked them what is wrong with that guy jesse and they complained saying he's always like that. It really ruined my appetite. I am definitely never coming back here again.

Delicious food and service was excellent!  Server recommended the combo and it was a great way to try several items!

I've ordered food for pickup from here a few times because I live really close by. I always get the same thing - the tofu bibimbap with brown rice and soy sauce. The taste and quality are great and there's nothing to complain about from that end, but portion size could be a bit more generous. I would also note that the takeout prices are a few dollars more expensive per dish than the eat-in prices, maybe because they need to cover for the fact that you're not tipping.
No comment
Delicious KBBQ. Got the prix fixe and the wings that came with it were amazing. Staff was kind too.

A wonderful experience to eat here. I tried the bibimbap for the first time. This dish was rice, meat of your choice and veggies served in a hot stone bowl with an egg on top. The stone bowl was so hot it was searing the rice in the bowl. The rice became crispy due to this and was by far the best part of the dish. They also give you this hot sauce for it that was incredible. It was an awesome experience.

The service was friendly, but the food and food portions where unkind. We paid a high dollar for mediocrity, unfortunately, and won't be returning.  They also took it upon themselves to add a 25% gratuity onto the bill and we were only a party of 2. The city has far better, more satisfying experiences to be had. Encouraging you to find those instead of wasting your time and dollar here.

The Food is tasty, the Korean Bbq experience was enjoyable. The portions are small for the price of the entrees. We had several selections and most of the meats do require use of the bean paste for salt. We tried a family style starting with the combo of Mini seafood pancake, fried dumplings veg. and pork served,  my guest loved the pork, the vegetable was chopped very fine and mushy inside,  gunbae wings were good, but our third order was just greasy lacking flavor, yes i said third order, you only get 5 for $9.00. Then we ordered the delicious Wagyu Kalbi for $41.00, small portions were disappointing. Then we added lamb chops, tiger shrimp needed zest, and for 3 to 4 we ventured to try the han sang combo, which includes Wagyu Kalbi, Yang-Nyum Kalbi, Bulgogi, Samgyup Pork Belly, Kale & Tofu Salad, Fried Dumplings, Banchans, Egg Hotpot, Lettuce, onions for 135.00. It sounds like a lot but not. I tried the spicy margarita which was great. The experience was wonderful with food grilled quickly before your eyes. The food lacks some flavor, and the portions are small. Family style was a great way to get to try it all. Karaoke was a blast with a two hour room rental, it goes by fast. $120. Pr hour. The song books were by title,  not artist and they have a big selection. Fun had by all,  it was all about the experience!

Good place for some tasty Korean food! It was a good solid meal - really the main mar is that I found a hair in my soup. They quickly replaced it with another boiling portion and comped it, but it definitely threw me off. The kimchi jeon was (as always) a highlight, and overall I'd consider coming back!

The manager of the restaurant reached out apologizing and giving me a full refund which was very nice of them. I suppose these mistakes happen anywhere, so I would still go back for good meals.

Probably one of the most spacious KBBQ restaurants I've been to. We came here on a Monday night with reservations- which we probably didn't need but service was on point. We got the Housemade Lychee Soju, and Apple soju- I highly recommend the lychee soju and it comes with actual lychee and probably the best soju I've ever tasted. My friends and I ordered the combination meat platter which was more than enough for 5 people. The waiter cooked for us which we were happy about- we didn't have to worry about burning the place down! This place has karaoke as well but it ends at 11 PM so we weren't able to participate. Would love to come back and join the karaoke party!

Nice atmosphere and convenient location for the downtown westsiders that don't have the time to head to another Korean spot (ie fort lee, flushing, ktown). The portions, selection, and quality are satisfactory at best.  The soups/stews are the best option when dining here.
Really great Korean food. I got the Jap Chae with ribeye, it was fantastic. Service was really good, and the little appetizers they bring everyone are perfect little teasers.
No comment

Went here with my girlfriend and her sister for dinner. Beautiful place was moderately busy at the time but not so busy that I expected to have such lousy service. As soon as we sit we get helped to order but after we get our food not more service. No body seemed to care to see if we needed refills or to ask how the food was. Had to stop a random waiter to get the check. Than we get the check only to wait longer expecting our original waiter to come pick up the card and charge us. But no luck so I nag another random waiter to finally charge our card so we can finally leave. Good food but not worth the service

This was SO delicious and the service was great. All the waiters were very friendly and answered all the questions I had (it was my first time at a Korean bbq place so I had a lot). I got the bulgogi Korean barbecue and the fried dumplings - both great choices. The bulgogi was cooked perfectly by our waiter and it came with delicious veggies

First time at Gunbae during lunch. Definitely a nice quiet place to get away from the work day. The bulgogi was pretty good along with the sides  that are presented prior to the meal. Also they have a happy hour special during the day if you would like to go that route.

This place was great. Took a few clients here for dinner when in NYC. I think only one had experienced Korean BBQ before, which made me a bit nervous about my choice. But GunBae delivered. Not only was everything delicious, but people are still talking about it. Highly recommend this place.

I enjoyed my time dinning here for many reasons. The staff was very welcoming, they checked our temperature first before even letting us in, the waiter (Danny) was very helpful, and finally the food was beyond amazing! I will definitely be eating here again. If you haven't checked this place out, you should!! Oh and you should order the chicken wings & their most popular meat for Korean BBQ, you will thank me later!

The Spicy Pork Kimchi was absolutely delicious. We ordered edamame and pork dumplings (which is a must) and it was phenomenal. Since entering the restaurant, the waiters were attentive and very accommodating. Next time I'll get BBQ!

I came with my colleagues for lunch around 12:15pm and it was pretty much full but we got the table easily. We ordered some beers and a Kimchi pancake and fried dumplings for the table. They arrived quickly and were delicious specially the kimchi pancake. I have never had a kimchi oancake before and I am glad that I tried it because it was amazing. For enteers, I had a chicken Bibimbap in hot stone bowl. It came with some sauce(I forgot to ask) but it was delicious. The egg on top of it was perfectly cooked and it was perfectly runny. My peers had  vegetables Jap che and seafood Jap che. They were quite happy with the food. It was only first time for me here at gunbae, all others in the group have been here before. They have always enjoyed the food here and I did as well.

A great traditional Korean bbq place in lower Manhattan! Their tabletop bbq never disappoints and their side dishes are great too. I've also ordered delivery through them countless times. They are always fast, order is on point. I highly recommend the kimchi chigae!

Came in again with co workers, but this time I sat down. Everything was really good and the staff was very friendly. They give you a lot of food and help you cook the meat. This was my first korean bbq experience. I would definitely come back for the korean bbq food/experience.

Glad that there was an authentic Korean restaurant in the lower Manhattan. I came here at least 3 times this year. I liked the bibimbap a lot even though it was a little pricey for a lunch. The pork was well marinated, which was sweet and spicy. The banchan dishes before the meal were great too. I would come here again to try the BBQ.

Not hating on this place but if you're looking for authentic korean taste this isn't the spot

10 ppl of us had dined at GunBae on the night of pork belly half price off day, and we really enjoyed it. The quality of pork belly was great, service is good and I had no problem changing our reservation (changed from 6 to 10 ppl). We are shocked & happy how reasonable our dining experience was, and we are so full had a food coma! 10 happy ppl!! We will be back!
Tasty food but...Too noisy. Overpriced . for the serving size. Good BBQ but short on the meat.

A good Korean restaurant that doesn't break the bank in this area is hard to find. We have tried many of their dishes and they are quite good. As with all KBBQ places, you come out smelling like barbecued meats, but they have cubbies under the seats that you can put your jackets into. The banchan variety isn't as good as the restaurants in K-town or in Seoul, but it is serviceable. It seems to be a family friendly restaurant and their food comes out very quick. Will definitely go back!

The establishment is really awesome. Really smooth atmosphere, good music, and the customer service is really on point. The food is also just as good and fresh. I'd recommend this place to anyone in the mood for good Korean food.
Delicious and close (I live in Fidi).  Will continue going here to get my kbbq fix!

Got delivery of glass noodles with beef, bibimbap, and kimchi pancakes. All amazing, would highly recommend!

Best authentic Korean bbq this part of town. Friendly, efficient, and sanitary take out service provided. The wagyu kalbi was soft and buttery and the kalbi tang was also to die for. The vegetarian and GF options are also plentiful. Can't wait to book the private karaoke rooms once this pandemic is over. Give this place a try and you won't regret it!
Great atmosphere and service, but taste wasn't quite as good as Five Senses in Koreatown. But still authentic and good for FiDi.

Decent Korean restaurant downtown with a good selection of stews, rice, bbq, etc.  I had the seafood soondubu, and the portion size was a bit on the small side, but as a sit down meal, there was a lot of banchan to help fill up.  Quality was fine but nothing too memorable.  Overall, a good option if you're craving Korean food and in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit.

I liked it enough but it didn't knock my socks off. Also the sides were minimal and I had to request lettuce and rice! What's up with that?

Solid Korean restaurant that is a welcome addition  to the Tribeca area. Great barbecue that they cook at your table (with the option for you to cook it yourself) and the servers were very friendly though a bit overwhelmed when it got busy the night that we were there.

It was a great experience, our waitress cooked our pork perfectly and on every side carefully which I thought was funny and awesome! Would recommend this place!

okay food! Had much better Korean in NYC for less the $$$. Service was so so. Had to ask for water twice. Overall an average experience

I went to this place a week or two before the pandemic and everything was shut down.  It wasn't crowded since it was between the lunch and dinner crowd and I was seated right away.  I had the mini kimchi pancakes, Gunbae wings, edamame and dumplings.  Everything came out quickly and was delicious. I would've done Korean BBQ if I wasn't by myself, but I saw what other people ordered and it all looked great - can't wait to return and try it when life returns to normal.  The waitress was patient as she explained the difference between the different kinds of sake - can't recall which one I had specifically, but I enjoyed it. Since the pandemic, I've been trying to continue to support Gunbae. I've ordered the bulgogi bibimpop, Hite, Kloud, and the mini kimchi pancake for delivery.  The order was correct, arrived on time and was pleasantly surprised it came with all these extras. I'll definitely continue to support them and hope to go there in person when this is all over.  There happened to be a bridal shower in the karaoke rooms downstairs when I was there in-person and the party sounded like they were having a really good time and they all looked really happy as they left. I like that even at the beginning of March they had a hand sanitizing station and hot wipes set up for their customers - it shows they care about their customers and their employees.

This is hit or miss. It's near the World Trade area and I went with a friend on a Friday evening. My daughter whose school is nearby also joined me. To be honest, i went to this place a couple months ago during a week night, it wasn't that busy and it was really good. This time, being Friday night, it was super crowded although getting a table wasn't a long wait. With that said, you'll get a table, but getting any service was as bad hailing a cab on a stormy night. The food was just okay this time. The panchan was so-so, and the stews we ordered were also 'meh'. As what usually i've noticed if the patrons become more and more mixed with non-korean, the dishes end up tasting farther from the authentic, which I totally understand, it's business..But important to know if you're Korean and craving that close to home-cooking meal...

The meats were pretty bland. There was no flavor at all and the dipping sauce was meh.. The only good point was service. All the waitresses were very attentive.

It was unexpected to find a korean Bbq place in this part of NY, and even more unexpected that the place is good. The pork belly bbq was amazing and juicy, the korean pancake was ok, and the side dishes was also pretty good. The waiters were really helpful and attenative, really great place to have dinner with your friends and family.

GunBae is a delicious and affordable lunch spot in the lower Manhattan area. Their bowls are consistently delicious (my favorite is the bulgogi bibimbap). They also offer a delicious tray of salads before the meal is served that is perfect for sharing. I have not tried the korean bbq yet but it looks and smells delicious whenever I visit. Staff are also extremely kind. Would definitely recommend.

We recieved our delivery order on time and the food was still hot when we got it. We ordered a kimchi stew and a bimbimbap and they were both delicious. Entree portion sizes are generous. My only slight slight wish is that there were more sides in addition to the kimchi!

I'm writing this review specifically for JASON, the bartender/karaoke host from Gunbae. He is THEE BEST!!! Friendly but stressed wait staff. At first we were sat by the door which was uncomfortable.
Jenna was great! She was super attentive and the quality of the meat was spot on. The soup was also very tasty. My party really enjoyed their visit!

Good service from a few of the guys working there.  The others seem to ignore.  That said the food is good.  Always a seat and always a crowd.  So I assume others feel good about this place too.  Saves a trip to k town for authentic food.

Just stopped in from the cold. Great restaurant idea. You can cook your own food which is very cool. Got a Brooklyn Lager and it was very good! I could see us visiting It to try It when we are hungrier.

One of my favorite Korean restaurants in NYC and a neighborhood gem in Tribeca. Clean decor, upbeat ambiance, highly attentive staff, flavorful Korean BBQ and sizable portions all at reasonable prices. I prefer this much more to Koreatown which is frequently crowded and noisy.

The food was excellent and plentiful. The only thing preventing a 5 star was that after our meal was done, I felt like the staff wanted us to leave. Not only do they not have dessert (only green tea or red bean ice cream!), they cleared the table, no coffee was offered, and there were plenty of empty tables that they weren't needing to seat other customers.

We eat here every time we are in town!   I love all the small sides they give with your meal.  The beef and pork are the best.  I let them cool for us for the extra few bucks it's worth it to make sure it's cooked perfectly.   Def make a reservation because they get packed.  It also gets pretty warm inside.  They have storage underneath the benches washing is great so your coats don't get too Smokey either. Very fun place for a different experience!

Very poor experience dinning here. Missing the key components of authentic Korean BBQ. You have to ask for lettuce that should come with BBQ by default, no green onions and garlic, and no marinated scallion. Expensive but far less fulfill than any other Korean BBQ place. Just like my wife said, BBQ is the hardest thing to mess up in Korean restaurant, and yes, I'm disappointed.
Excellent food and service - the wait staff was extremely nice and helpful, and the food was plenty for 4 people (combo deal). Would recommend.

4 stars because it is VERY pricey and not all you can eat. To their defense though, they don't lie about it and you kind of understand from the get go that it's Tribeca place more then K-town place. Everything else is perfect. The quality of the meat is heavenly, one of the best beef tongue I've ever eaten (and I've tried a lot of places!); I even liked that servers cook the meat for you because they did it very well and pretty fast. Service in general was awesome, we were seated right away despite not having a reservation on Friday night, servers were fast and courteous. They have a good choice of alcohol and plenty of side dishes to go with meat.
Terrific all-around, definitely try the Wagyu as it is as good as expected, but the bulgogi with lettuce wrap was surprisingly good as well.

Awesome, I've been here 3 times, I absolutely love this place. Great ambiance and decor, WONDERFUL service and friendly staff, and the food was delicious. Highly recommend the Waygu and the ribyeye - both means we're fantastic. So wonderful to have Korean BBQ in the neighborhood.

I'm Korean and pretty much a Korean food connoisseur!  I can honestly say this place is legit! Delicious food and super nice staff. Great ambiance! Definitely coming back and bringing friends next time!
