This place is the Best Korean BBQ in NY! Every meat were great!! You must try here before you die! Wagyu was super super amazing!!
The food was great, but the staff talks VERY loudly, it was kind of creepy. But great food
Everything I ordered was soOo flavorful & fresh!!!! I really wish I could order delivery for lunch here again!!!! Why did you guys changed your hours on me?!?!
An amazing complete meal. The veggies were very spicy and the broth soup was as well. The flavors were fantastic and a little sticky rice made the meal perfect.

What an amazing evening!! Thank you to Nancy & the staff!! The BBQ Hang-Sang combination was so delicious!! Add a few beers & Soju to compliment this incredible meal. Our favorite Korean dining experience in Manhattan!! We can't wait to return & and bring our friends the more the merrier! End the evening with Karaoke downstairs! Thank you again to all of staff at this TriBeCa Gem!!
I loved the place. Great atmosphere, perfect service from A to Z and food was amazing. They have all korean menus including rice wine(Makgulli).

Such an amazing experience! Went for my bday with some friends and it was all ours first time ever doing Korean BBQ and although I wish it was longer/more food.... it was unbelievably good. I will definitely be returning
Ordered kimchi Jji Gae and Kal Bi tang. Basically a bowl of boiled kimchi with 2 pieces of tofu and 3 pieces of pork. And another is a bowl of boiled scallions.
No comment
No comment

Very nice spot. Quiet, polish, professional and respectful staff. The food is good, fast served, and appropiate amount. Asian style no doubt. Theyy know how to get that point of accuracy in the restaurant. They may need some new faces, but in general a very recomended spot to hangout for a dinner or luch in a date, or to chat with a friend.

Quality ingredients, that's for sure! This place was nice and the food was good. My friend and I picked the grill yourself steak with the dozen garnishes and sides that you get. It was too pricey but we enjoyed it.
Yelp and website say it closes at 9PM on Sunday. We arrived at 8PM and were told the restaurant is closed. Please post correct information...
No comment

Legit Korean fare, reasonable prices, superior service, cool decor, comfortable vibe, DELICIOUS FOOD! Even on a Friday night, their service is stellar. Recommend the Wagyu Kalbi and jap jae noodle dish.

The BBQ brisket was very good. The tongue lacked flavor. The banchan selection was limited butvery fresh. The salad and sauces that came with the BBQ were especially flavorful. Service was excellent. Normally I would give only 3 stars but the ambience was unusually quiet and pleasant fora Korean BBQ place
No comment
No comment
I went there for BBQ several  times.... goOd Service ... especially the bbq beef was grilled into tender and yummy Love it I recommend the place to all my colleagues My office is near WTC!
No comment

Just want you want for Korean BBQ. Kalbi and other beef is perfectly marinated and tender, seafood pancake is light and crispy, kimchi soup is just the right amount of kick without overwhelming the other flavors. Try the pear juice while you're at it.

Unexpected. Superb service with a smile. I missed real Korean food. We were pleasantly excited to find this place. They conveniently called me to let me know they had available reservations earlier in the evening.
No comment

Oh the food was so delicious! Generous appetizers, yummy bimimbap and of course soju made it even better. We rented a norebang room and sang until closing time which is the only reason i hesitated giving 5stars. They closed at midnight.. Too early for us!:)

I won't go there during weekday lunch anymore. One time I got turned away because they now accept reservations and they are full seated. One time, my co worker and I waited when they told us about 10 mins and then 15 mins came around in which there was a table open for 4 ppl but they decided to let us wait for the smaller table for 2 so we left. It's the only Korean/Asian sit down restaurant in the area that's why I've been going there often but now that they are getting snob, I won't patron like I used to!!
Came for lunch with friends. Service was fairly quick. Food was great. Glad I won't have to rush up to 32nd street for Korean food anymore .

The wagyu is perfection - especially when the restaurant has cured jalapeños to go with it - cooked expertly by wonderful staff.  Great karaoke downstairs as well. I'm not a big fan of the eggs, which lack flavor. But the owners are exceptionally caring and attentive.

I have come here twice and I just love the food here. It is a nice place to come if you are really hungry and the food is spicy but not overpowering. I always get the vegetarian hot pot which is enough food for two meals and with the large plate of Korean starters the meal is well worth the price. Also I highly recommend paying the extra couple bucks for the stone pot. Good quick place for a longer lunch break

Pretty decent experience here. I came with my cousins because we wanted to eat Korean food. The prices are average for the area, so not too bad. After ordering, the waitress/waiter would bring in the little side dishes. Those were good appetizers. The portion for what we had ordered looked small, but it was actually really filling near half way through the meal! We left being full. There were staff in the restaurant but I felt service was lacking the day we went. I guess it was because they had delivery stock coming in and the items blocked the passageway, making it seem like no one was there to give us our check or give us a new bottle of water. For the area, this spot is pretty good. Authentic and affordable.
Excellent food and service. What I liked best was easy to reserve and they cook for you which is not common for KoreAn BBQ.

Ive been trying to find another go to korean place where i can enjoy some good kimchi jigae/soondooboo without traveling to ktown and ive finally found it!! The waiters are all so kind and the food was amazing. The choice in banchan was pretty standard but yummy and all of the food came out very quickly. Definitely will be coming here more often!
No comment
Arrived at the restaurant 10:54 pm asking if they were open. Business hour clearly shows the restaurant closes at midnight but apparently not!
Legit Korean food. I actually found their side dishes and entrees better than ktown food. I had the bibimbap and it was delicious. The veggies,rice and sauce was perfect.
Really good. Great food, good ambience and good crowd. I personally tried chicken and tofu bibimbap. Very good. Good price as well.
Excellent authentic Korean food. The service was also very good. We did the sharable meal with soup, meats, side dishes, etc. It was all excellent.

A very nice Korean restaurant in Tribeca and there's even a Karaoke underground. Maybe 6 oz. Yang Nyum Kalbi, 6 oz. Wagyu Kalbi and a mini seafood pancake were a bit too much for 2 girls so we had to pack the food. But the beef was so juicy and tender! We extremely like their egg tard soup served in the beginning. Definitely come back.

Everything is delicious and yummy. Their new "Han Sang" menu is great way to try different types of meat. Staff is always nice and friendly.  You don't have to go to crazy midtown to get fresh, authentic Korean food!
No comment
No comment
The staff was sweet, the food matched their attitude. I'm new to Korean food. Kind of bummed I didn't discover it sooner.
Really great Korean BBQ with excellent side dishes. Great atmosphere as well and karaoke in the basement.
No comment

My wife and I work down the block and love their lunch. We went for Valentine's Day dinner and was even better than we hoped. They're always so accommodating, prompt, and ready to serve. Management always has some way to make something complimentary as if we're VIP. For that alone, they make business personal which is always the best way to treat a costumer. That's why we chose them for VDay!

Fast delivery and food taste great! I love the Korean BBQ style, especially with delivery to your own house! The food does not taste bad or old, they taste fresh and hot. I recommend you try out the delivery, but also actually experience the fullness at their very restaurant.

the service was super rushed and our stone bowls were not crispy at all... probably bc they were rushing the food us even though we got there 45 minutes before closing and told them we weren't going to linger, and ordered immediately after sitting down. but over all pretty good. just kind of rude service.
Comfortable spot with large TVs for the game. Really tasty ! Juicy and flavorful. Noodles were very good too. good service but must be improved... nice staff....Will stop in again
No comment
No comment
Great place. Awesome food and a real awesome vibe!! Kimchi fried rice and kimchi soup is definitely worth a try!! Awesome just two people or a party of 7.

It's just another korean BBQ joint with overpriced meats. Cocktails are way more overpriced for even for manhattan standards. Really? Average side dishes and average quality of small portioned meats. Come on, you can do better than that to bust out from other K BBQ joints. Maybe, only make sense to eat here for lunch specials or corporate events. Good serving staffs, though. How are you distinguishing yourself from other Korean BBQ places in Manhattan?

Really enjoyed my experience here. Came for lunch late Sunday afternoon. The staff was very attentive. I have the plum mojito it was good. Then we started with the vege dumplings also very good. My boyfriend got the brisket Korean bbq. The cooked it for us and it comes with a lot of little sides like kimchi, broccoli, pickles veggies and more. I got the hot stone bibimbap with tofu. It was very good I was impressed with the flavor and size of the dish. I took about half home. Place has a great decor too.
Nothing was very good and it was quite overpriced. The place doesn't even look good that good for the price. Cheap mac salad, broccoli with sriracha, and the meat was just ok.

Amazing experience!  Knowledgeable, attentive, and engaged wait staff!  I had the pork jowl and pork belly - was impressed with the preparation and execution across the board.  Team did a great job pairing drinks options with my meal!  Definitely will be back!!!
No comment

Friends and I stopped by to get BBQ Sunday night. We normally go to Ktown, but decided to stay in lower Manhattan. I gave 3 stars only because I was comparing to the other KBBQ places in the city (Jongro, Miss Korea, Kanghodong,etc.). It's honestly convenient and pretty good food. The service was great and clean facilities. If you are going for taste/quality, I would go somewhere else. It's not to the point where it makes you crave and come back again.
No comment
No comment

Fun, fun, fun.  Plus good food.  If you're looking for a spot that can triple up on BBQ, Karaoke, and wings this is the place for you.  For more of places I've been to you could check my IG account: @gojomenu

We ordered the Kimchi and some special rice bowls. The food was amazing and the waiter was very helpful with what we should order. The food came out quickly and the prices were pretty reasonable for the beautiful ambience and the area we were in. Two thumbs up.
No comment
No comment
The worst karaoke experience I've ever had. Bad songs unless you only do Bieber or Queen. Terrible and confused service. Broken AC. Avoid. Go anywhere else.
Awesome place, wonderful service and professional staff. Food is good and plentiful. Definitely come back again and sure other as well.
No comment

Wow! Delicious food and wonderful service.  We had the grilled ribeye, pork bibimbap, and kale salad. The grilled meat was cooked to perfection, the kale salad a perfect blend of flavors, and the bibimbap simply scrumptious. So glad we stopped here for dinner!

Maybe not the cheapest place, but still a good value.  The one thing I can not rave about more is the fact that our waiter (wish I recalled his name) was above and beyond and just amazing!  Hands down some of the best service I can remember having in a while.  Super quick.  We ordered the Bibimbap in the stone pots with some other dishes and everything was delicious.  Next time we will be back for the actual Korean BBQ aspect but unfortunately did not think we'd have time to enjoy it that night before we had to meet some friends.  The meals next to us though just looked amazing.  Will be back for more!  Til next time GunBae!

If you are looking for Korean bbq with very attentive staff, go to GunBae. I am not a huge meat eater, however the meats here are all amazing! And they have a lot of other options as well. Very good sangria too!
The service is acceptable, the food is slightly above average.  The place was way too noisy on Friday with a birthday party in progress.

Came here a few weeks ago with two friends. The decorations is really on trend and even the seats have storage to store your bags. It's a little better than most Korean restaurant with BBQ and traditional Korean dishes. However, the wait staff seemed to be mad at the world and not very attentive. When asked about getting a bit of sesame oil, the waiter took forever to get it and then proceed to leave it at the side of the table without telling me, since the bottle was so small, I almost knocked it over without realizing it was there.  The cost was $65 for each person without drinks nor dessert which I find a bit expensive given nothing was spectacular or remembered by...
Overall good Korean food. Side dishes are included, tastes and feels like authentic. On the pricey side and service is good. Worth a try for quality BBQ and stews.
Great experience! Jenna, who took great care of us, was terrific.  Waygu beef, pork belly (barbecueand bibimbop were all delicious. Highly recommended!
Place was great! Me and a couple of friends came here for a quick bite so we didn't get the experience the whole Korean bbq experience. The server was lovely and food was great!
No comment

Ive came here for the fifth time the food is the best if u ever want to eat n feel satisfied ur best bet is to try this restaurant the service is awesome i would definitely give this place two thumbs up
Food was great.  Pricey but we are in Manhattan so you are paying Manhattan prices.  I will defiantly return again.

The food was not bad. The reason for the two stars is because the lack of honesty with the staff members. We had left some things by mistake and later when we called back, they said they found and collected the items for us, but we had one item still missing. I know it was a staff member because if it had been someone else, they would have just taken it all. The server was also very lazy and treat us like an inconvenience with a smile
Not overwhelmed with the food.  I have had better Korean BBQ in Ktown
No comment

The waitress dropped the salad on the desk and spilled on me. Then she just laughed. Later another waiter dropped a dirty spoon on my friend and stained his shirt. They opened the door for ten minutes and it was freezing inside. Then right after we finished, they said they have a reservation on the table and kind of kicked us out. There are only two tables that have customers. I think they might hate the owner...

I brought my team here for a late lunch, drinks and karaoke and we had a blast!! Food was tasty and fun to cook at table, drinks were delish and then topped It all off with karaoke downstairs in a private room... what's better than this! One stop shopping for a fun gathering or team building activity. Thanks Gunbae!

Korean bbq in downtown Manhattan finally. Excellent eatery with prime cuts for bbq. It comes at a premium price as a result, also from being in TriBeCa and the restaurant itself is very nice. My favorite however is the bar downstairs which is a nice addition to the neighborhood. Downstairs also has full size karaoke rooms to get your sing on without trekking to Ktown or St Marks. Always good to have that local option!

Dinner for four tonight. Nice but expensive. Very nice atmosphere and ambience. Cooking at tables etc. Just expensive for what we got. I would prefer a nice steak at a steak house.  The martini was very good though.
No comment
My best Korean barbecue experience ever.  We were four and ordered their all in one feast plus some bibimbop.  Our server was terrific and the food and drink a pleasure.

As a korean-argentine from battery park, i HAD to go try this place out and represent my country! My boyfriend and i loved the food, especially my childhood favorite, bugolgi. It was pretty crowded, for it being a friday. Only downside was the karaoke, 60$ for the two of us for an hour of singing from a very small selection of songs. Maybe the drive to KTown is worth it after our 200$ bill here :|
No comment

Was excited to find a Korean resto not in Ktown. Sadly despite great location the food was disappointing and definitely no par to the Korean restaurants in Ktown despite the hefty prices. The sound quality of the Karaoke was also pretty ropey.

Great food and awesome service. Our first time at a Korean BBQ spot and the waiter was really good at explaining the dishes and making honest recommendations. I would highly recommend this spot for a date night or special celebration.

Got the hot stone bulgogi bibimbap, seafood pancake, and the T-bone steak. The pancake was really good! The steak was good as well but I felt it was a little dry. I felt like the bibimbap could've had more flavor but other than that it was fine.

Came here for a colleagues after work birthday party. We had a blast. Great drinks. Attentive staff. Fun karaoke rooms with nice selections. It was a great time...looking forward to trying the food on my next visit.

This place is legitimately good Korean BBQ outside of K-town and Flushing.  I have been here several times and it is a solid choice. The service is excellent and the drinks are good.  The non-BBQ dishes are excellent, especially the spicy seafood, tofu hot pot.  They have nifty storage benches for coats, etc... so your coat doesn't smell of Korean BBQ afterwards.  The only thing a little lacking is the banchan, just a few dishes.  Also, it is a little pricier, but if you live in the area and factor in a cab back and forth, it is about even.
Not a very good in making bibibamp, K-town got better food.

This is more than just a restaurant--it's truly an experience. Everything about it was perfect--the service was some of the best I've had anywhere and the food was absolutely incredible. An absolute must if you are anywhere near Battery Park.
We went for Grand Opening party and love the place and the food! Way to go! Best!
No comment
Amazing food and really delightful staff. All around a good time with both the food and karaoke. I was really pleased with the customer service.
Excellent Korean food.. I had been here many times.. Spicy pork hotpot is my favorite. I recommend all to try this place.. Friday's are normally crowded.. mid week is better time to go here..

This is a fun place to go for Korean in the neighborhood. They give generous portions and do a nice presentation. Karaoke is downstairs if you are into it. Service is friendly and knowledgeable. Great choice for a casual night out.

Excellent location in Tribeca, within walking distance of the WTC area.   Went on a Monday night around 9 pm, i.e. no crowds.  Nice ambiance and décor. Prices are reasonable for the area.   Ordered the kalbi and pork belly.  Both were on delicious.  The seafood pancake was superb.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

Somehow, some way I find myself here after work. Do you know why? They have the best bar area downstairs with the best bartenders. It's a fun atmosphere with very good service. Shoutout to Isabella who keeps things running smooth in the bar area! They even have nice karaoke rooms and restrooms downstairs! Big plus for me!

A decent place for KKBQ downtown. The restaurant is clean and the staff are very attentive to  customers. Having said that, there are plenty of similar restaurants with similar quality of food for lower prices new york. While it is great to have a Gunbae in such a convenient location, there's nothing too special to write about.

yuck, the worst korean food anywhere - and completely inept service (had to wait for bill for 10 minutes after asking twice)  every dish was terrible, how on earth does this place not have 2 stars?  have these people had korean before - cherry on top the wagyu was not real wagyu
Great spicy galbi tang and fast delivery. Would recommend! Good quality for delivery as well.
Bibimbop in stone bowl was only ok.  Waiter stirred everything around, so rice never got crispy.  Service was uneven as waiter was not conversant in english.
Be careful they add tip on the bill even for three ppl.  We didn't notice and added tip separately.

The food was ok, the service was pretty good. The pork was a bit flavorless but I liked the eggs, seafood pancakes. The store got a bit crowded so we had to wait a long time for the check but over all not bad.

Celebrated my birthday here and it was spectacular!  We had a party of 10 and they were able to accommodate us at either 2 tables side by side or squeeze onto one table.  We choose to squeeze on one table and it was not a problem at all.  It was cozy and fun and easy to share all of the delicious food.  First, the restaurant is beautiful!  Brand new, CLEAN, stylish, great lighting and atmosphere.  Second, the food is wonderful.  Fresh, superb quality, beautiful presentation, proper food handling (sanitation) and they were able to accommodate my Celiac Disease with easy communication and minor adjustments to my food!  Third, the service was excellent!  Each staff member was kind, friendly, smiling and went out of their way to make sure we had what we needed.  Not one staff member passed a duty to the 'server' - no matter who was nearby, they cleared dishes, took an order, answered questions.  Fourth, we were able to bring a cake from an outside bakery (Gluten Free from Jennifer's Way Bakery!!!) with no extra charge.  They brought out the cake with lit candles and it was beautiful!  Fifth, we partied like rockstars in the Karaoke rooms downstairs.  Again, service was spectacular!  They brought the remainder of the cake down to us for late night sweet attack ;)  (The Karaoke system is a little confusing to navigate, but I suggest to just have one person figure it out and be in charge of loading your playlist)  Enjoy!!
Good food. Bad service. Been there three times and always the same story. Dinner goes well and then we get aggravated in the end by the bad service. Hopefully they can work on it.

Have only been for karaoke but highly recommend! We got out in this neighborhood after work a lot and it's great to have a karaoke stop without having to schlep to another neighborhood. Great staff, good drink selection, and pretty recent song catalogue. Will definitely go to eat next time!

Gunbae is a little more expensive than your normal K-town joint, but there is a reason.  The ambiance is so much better, the service much more accommodating and the meat quality noticeably better.  They cook each meat course one at a time, without rushing you while you eat.  To me this is a very important factor in dining - for any cuisine, and for Korean food in NYC this has always been my biggest complaint.  An added bonus is that there is a stand alone bar downstairs in case you have to wait (I hate waiting outside on 32nd Street) AND they have a karaoke bar!  Who needs K-town?
Absolutely love GunBae. The food is consistently terrific and the service is even better.
Food is very good, service outstanding. A touch  pricey though and a very limited menu.  Therefore 4 instead of 5
Great addition to Tribeca!  Bibimbap for lunch was just right.  The side dishes were good too.  I wish they had more vegetarian options but korean food in general is not vegetarian friendly.

Great food and service! Loved the interior and the atmosphere.. Friendly staff and good meat! Had the Sangria pitcher and it was really chill and really good. The marinated galbi was really good and not too sweet like the other korean bbq places. I forget the name of one of the type of meat that looks like sliced steak but really good marbling and nutty in flavor. And a must to say "gunbae" when clinking glasses as that's the korean way of "cheers". And a final stop at the basement karaoke is a good way to end the night.

Pretty good korean food! So happy I don't have to trek all the way to Ktown for some korean food. Not that much banchan but the kalbi and soondooboo was good. The drinks were not good though, would pass on cocktails in the future
very good place, downstair have karaoke rooms. the food is very good, can't wait to go back next time in town. will recommend to everyone!

Been here 2x so far and both times I've been happy with the food. I've tried 4 of the meat dishes. They're all tasty and if you need a little "something, something".. there's the many spices (salt, sesame oil, soybean paste, soy sauce, pepper paste) you can add on. Some have said the banchan isn't enough but quite frankly there's plenty of food that I leave stuffed. Service is fast and friendly. I don't leave smelling of smoke like K-Town. Prices aren't cheap but not overly expensive that you feel jipped. They don't have dessert yet but the manager was thinking of adding patsubing (sp) a shaved ice dessert with various toppings. I hope they get this going by the 3rd time I'm there.
Been to a lot of Korean restaurants but this places isn't really authentic Korean food. Food was alright, great drink specials for the area. Decent pricing on food and drinks for Tribeca area.
Food is great, have ben there 3 times since they have opened.  Mike has been our server and he is great.

Surpassed our expectations! Our group of 7 came in after our flight to NY and were seated almost immediately (no reservation). The Chaing Mai Lady cocktail is delicious - on the sweeter side with fruity notes (cranberry, citrus) and tartness from the Japanese plum. We also got the Golden Mushrooms, Golden Bags, Fried Pork Belly, and Chicken Satay. My personal favorite was the Golden Mushrooms, though I think you can skip the Golden Bags if you're not a fan of pasty textured fillings. Drunken Noodles are a must have, and the Green Curry is a great comfort dish. Service was lovely. Great way to start off our trip! :)
No comment
The food was delicious. Very chic area. The staff were very attentive. Cute place to take pics as well. The cocktails were delish also.
No comment
Delicious Thai food.  Ambience and service very good.  In had the spicy basil rice which included a salad.  Very yum
No comment
No comment
I found a great new lunch spot close to the South Street Seaport!  Beautiful interior decor & the food was absolutely delicious!

New Thai spot in fidi! The interior is very cute with a lot of plants and a couple water features. The people were soooo friendly!! The green curry was extremely yummy as well as the appetizer, however the drunken noodles were different than expected. Will definitely go again in the near future!!

They serve lunch from 11:30am to 3:30pm...this small bowl of fried pineapple rice with duck and "soup" if you want to call it that was almost 30 dollars! No delivery fee or anything..this was an in person order and pick up and I was charged 27.99. It was not worth 27.99..I won't be back for take out. This place isn't a 5 star restaurant..get a grip on your pricing.
No comment

Had the lunch special. Ordered the basil wok shrimp for 17$ the serving was size of an appetizer with only 4 shrimp! The salad in ginger dressing which came with the special was actually bigger than the entree Dish Was tasty but it was a child's portion. Space was very nicely done with 3 great banquets by the windows. Service excellent, also had a pineapple ginger drink very good. For the area Lil Mama by far better choice.
No comment

Love love love this place. The ambiance is gorgeous, excellent service and the food is great. The prices aren't too bad either, especially for the location. I would definitely recommend you try this spot. It's good for a date night out a night out with the girls.

I have ordered here for delivery a few times. The food is very good and always hot & fresh. Great packaging. Often they have deals. Pricing is very affordable. Inside is very nice ambiance too. I think it has a good amount of flavor, spice, & always more than I can eat with lots of meat!!
The menu is big lots of options and vegan options. Service is really good. The restaurants has a nice decor inside.

Excellent food, excellent service, and an excellent ambiance. Hey Thai is on the Far East side of the island but it has all the high end appeal you would want in Manhattan with the quality of food to back it. Enjoy!

My friend and I work around the area and wanted to grab dinner before heading home and stumbled upon Hey Thai. It was so cute inside, definitely picture friendly. We went around 6PM and it wasn't crowded at all, the waitress was also super friendly. We didn't know what to order so we asked for recommendations, and she was super helpful. She also told us about HH($10 drinks, $7 wines and beers). We ordered the chicken satay, spring rolls, Shrimp Musaman Curry and Chicken Pad thai. My favorite was definitely the Shrimp Musaman curry because it was so flavorful and so yummy with rice. I would definitely come back here again to try the other dishes. The prices are also pretty decent. 10/10 recommend!

An amazing Thai spot in Fidi! When it first opened, food took forever but it was amazing! Especially the papaya salad! Came back again and everything improved, speed and service! Definitely a go to Thai spot when I'm around the area! And they have this perfect Instagram photo spot by the front door, there's a swing that you can sit on, perfect for social media! Overall the decor and atmosphere is cozy and romantic, a great place for a quick drink afterwork or a lovely dinner!
No comment
No comment

Beautiful new place, replacing the hot table establishment that was there before. Has a bar, and pleasant staff.  But this new place needs to work on the food - the chicken curry  I had was over cooked dry chicken in a coconut curry sauce totally devoid of heat ( listed as a hot dish ).  It was edible, and i say that in order to make clear that the ingredients were good, just need a real chef to fix this problem.  I hope they will.
No comment
Stumbled upon this gem during lunch. Beautiful decor, soothing ambiance, inviting,  attentive staff, clean, not pricey and delicious food. Cannot wait to return.
Great service, excellent food. Had the curry roti app, chili salmon and broccoli. Perfect for our first night in NYC after long travel day.

This is a wonderful new financial district gem. Beautiful decor inside and the food was delicious! I especially enjoyed the bang bang shrimp and the chicken pad Thai. The service was great as well. Also, it wasn't very busy since not many people know about it yet. Highly recommend.
Outstanding Service, loved the ambience. Clean & welcoming. Attentive Servers. Food is delicious. Quantity + Quality + Right price. Must visit if you are a Thai fan.
No comment

Amazing spot in FiDi! Went in for the happy hour ($10 drinks, $7 wines and beers) and was blown away by the food and the atmosphere. Well-priced, attentive and kind staff. I'll be returning here for sure!

I got the pineapple fried rice and it was absolutely delicious! A lot of my coworkers go here for lunch and always rave about it so I had to give it a try and they were not wrong. Will become a regular spot for me.

We came when they first opened and the menu was limited so we decided to give it another try.  The Staff is just so nice, smiling and quick and accommodating!  The atmosphere is really pretty and comfortable, big tables, comfy booths, great lighting.  The food is delicious.  We ordered the Char Shrimp, Duck Tamarind and split drunken noodles.  I had wine and my Husband had a beer.  The duck was enough for two people and it was crispy and the sauce had a kick but not too spicy.  The shrimp was great except there were spicy peppercorns which caught my husband off guard and he must've drank 3 glasses of water, he wound up picking them out.  I had a good laugh!!  The drunken noodles were my favorite and would probably get as a main next time with beef or chicken.  It was a little expensive but then again we ordered the most expensive items on the menu, duck and shrimp.  The portions were generous and the service great.  We will be back and we are so happy since this is such a great addition the the neighborhood.
We had just arrived in New York and were very hungry. Being Thai nerds as we are, we ordered two shrimp pad Thai. A lot of shrimp, and it was good, a little bland but tasteful.

Very pretty, new Thai eatery near south street.   Red curry and pad see ewe were good.  Massaman. is very mild.   Shrimp fritter was very dry.  A little on the pricy side.  Descent place for Americanized Thai food.

Came across this cute Thai restaurant after a day in Battery Park.  Every dish we got was delicious and the happy hour drink (mango mojito) was fantastic.  Very fair prices for all dishes.  Friendly welcoming staff and clean restaurant.  Highly recommend this place!
I received a friendly greeting when I entered. The order took about 15 minutes as estimated. The drunken noodle I ordered was mild as ordered, but very flavorful.
No comment

I had the drunken noodles with chicken. The noodles were over cooked to the point they were falling apart. The sauce taste like it had a tomato base. This nothing like the Thai drunken noodles I've had before.

In my short visit in NYC I got to experience the most delicious Thai food I ever had.  We order several dishes and each and one of them gave us a taste of high cuisine of Thailand.  It was absolutely nice to have a quieter dinner in a family own business that is not a chain franchise.  The service was super friendly and attentive, nice atmosphere, nice place to come again, it just sad we don't have a place like this in California but for sure I recommend and will come again if I visit NYC in the near future.
Try the gooay teow cuo gai for sure. This place proves that you can find great food in the Financial District!
Food is delicious. Central location and many different mouth watering choices here. I would highly recommend Hey Thai. Service is great too!
No comment

Loved the atmosphere and service here. Great decor, very friendly and attentive staff all the way from the hostess to the bartender. Appetizer platter was phenomenal. Chicken satay, spring rolls, curry puff, shumai, scallion pancakes, all fantastic. The sake flight was also great. The coconut and yuzu sakes were my favorites. The chicken basil entree was also a highlight. Prices are good for the area. One star off for the pad Thai. This is something I order all the time and is a basic dish every Thai restaurant should master. Maybe they were just having an off day but the pad Thai was so soggy and flavorless. I took it home and re-sautéed it to crisp it up a bit and even that was just still okay. Everything else was great and we will give it another shot for sure
Really nice looking place - decor and cleanliness are great. Food came out pretty quickly and was extremely filling. Unassuming location as well. Highly recommend if you live in fidi.
Loved their Mango Mojito and green curry!
Beautiful decor, delicious food, and good service. A very Instagram-able reception area too! :)

such a cute place! i stopped in with my boyfriend for dinner and the ambiance was so romantic and pretty! they had a cute swing entrance for photos! the servers were sweet and the food was delicious i'm a huge fan of thai food and the drunken noodles and crab rangoon were delicious, highly recommend for anyone going :)
Great ambiance, amazing staff, and food! They have a lot of vegetarian and gluten free options as well.

This place is seriously amazing!!! Im so happy this opened in FIDI. The noodles and curry have sooo much flavour. My favourites are the drunken noodles and green curry and also the crab rangoon. The best thing is that the drunken noodles are not greasy. Prices are also extremely fair. Love!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: went here with my best friends for a celebration birthday dinner and the food was so good! The servers were sweet and the food came in a timely manner! The atmosphere is dim and candlelit during dinner time and it was such a vibe! Would def come back here again for lunch or dinner with friends!
Very good as the curry was nice and hot while the chicken satay had so much flavor. Atmosphere was very nice and had a comfortable v
Quality doesn't match the price point. I asked them if they could make my food spicy but everything tastes bland. Even the curry is watered down. I will not be ordering food from here again.
Awesome place, I order often. Very nice staff. Go to orders are basil fried rice and Penang Curry.

One of the best Chicken Pad Thai I had in a while! Inspired me to also try out the drunken noodle which is my new favorite and the tom yum soup! Perfect balance of lime and coconut! Also the service here is so nice. From hostess and waiter, always very accommodating. Feel really comfortable to dine in and bring friends along as my go to spot

Just discovered this new gem for Thai food in the financial district. We were missing Thai Farm Kitchen, which departed our neighborhood a few months ago, and were delighted to see a restaurant with top shelf Thai food at reasonable prices. We had the pork belly, red curry, fried bananas with ice cream (yum!), Pad See U (amazing!) , and the Thai shrimp dumplings (a revelation). Highly recommended for dine in and take out!
Ambiance, Food, Drinks, Service....Really 10/10. Pineapple Fried Rice, Drunken Noodles, and Mango Mojito....all my favorites I've ever had

column3: Sugar House, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: Incredible new restaurant in the heart of FiDi. We tried the Penang Curry and Drunken Noodles. The curry was creamy and beautifully complex and the the noodles were incredible. This restaurant is so cute and quaint, and the staff was attentive and polite. This is our new favorite neighborhood Thai place!

This is the best Thai restaurant that I have been searching for! They have great service, and the food is just as good, or even better! Make sure you drop by， because the place is awesome, so beautiful!
Enjoyable atmosphere...very friendly and patient staff. Fast service. One waiter with gray eyes gorgeous not bad with the meal...free walking dessert..lol.

We went here on the first night of our trip to NYC and it was so good, we came again on our last night. Best restaurant of our whole vacation, and that's saying something. The dishes were outstanding. The spicy dishes are done just right. Not just heat, but fantastic flavor of the Thai curry. The less spicy dishes are also very well seasoned and noticeably full of fresh ingredients. The cocktails are fun with sake used in lieu of the usual spirits. Our waiter, John, was a delight. Smart, kind, and a joy to talk to. If we are ever in NYC again, we will definitely come back.
Very beautiful ambiance and welcoming staff. The food was very delicious, it's a little pricey but still worth it. Will definitely go back again soon!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Overall great experience. Food was tasty, service was warm and attentive, ambitious was trendy. A perfect quick bite/drink place to start bar/appetizer hopping. Would love to see more items adding to the menu.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Incredible service and such different types of food. All tapas style and an awesome twist to Korean and southern food. We also got welcome shots which was fun! Our dessert was interactive and we got to make our own designs on it. Definitely get the chicken!
No comment
No comment
The food here is creative, interesting and flavorful.  It is the type of restaurant that you can only find in a town like NYC.  Creative cooking, concerned service, and a wonderful experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

A friend made a reservation for 6pm, we got their early and didn't know they opened at 6pm, but the staff was nice and not only greeted us but also seated us. Because this is tapas style, we ordered everything on the menu for our group of 3 with the exception of 2 dishes. Everything was a good tapas size and it was delicious. We also got a bottle of Wonmae to share (shoutout to our server who recommended it) and it went well with the food. And like everyone else said, go to the bathroom even if you don't have to pee - it's an experience in there!

Cute little tapa place in the LES! My friend and I wanted to check it out since it was new and all the rage. I like the concept of Southern style Korean food since it's unique. We came early on a Saturday and were seated pretty quick. Has a chill ambiance which would be great for a night out with friends. Staff is extremely polite and well versed on the menu. In my opinion, the food was okayy but I do appreciate how many options are available on the menu. Also, it is priced well for a tapas place which is rare to find in the city. Overall, I would recommend since it's an easy, no frills restaurant
No comment
No comment

This place was sooooooo great. Every dish was a winner but the favorites were definitely the ribs, the Seoulsbury steak and the fried chicken. The bagel dessert was also super unique and interesting. Going with a group of 4 was a great decision since we got to sample most of the menu and the general vibe of the restaurant is fun and cozy. Also, the service was incredible!! Super friendly and knowledgeable waiters that welcomed us with free drinks because our table took a few mins to clean when we got there! It took a few weeks to get a good reservation time, but I'm honestly shocked it was that easy in hindsight.

I've been to C as in Charlie theee times over the last month. Each time, the service, atmosphere and quality of food has been consistent and on point. The owners are friendly and outgoing, and are out in the service area working with the rest of their team. Reservations can be tough to score, so be sure to book early.
No comment
No comment

New addition to the neighborhood and I'm in love with this spot! Everything was delicious and the staff were all so kind! Meat was super tender and flavors were incredible for all the dishes. Would definitely come back to try the other items on their menu. Highly recommend getting the ribs!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Highly recommend this Korean tapas place. Perfect place for someone who likes sharing and trying a lot of different foods. It was our second dinner, which was why we only ordered 3 dishes. My favorite was Oxbone Cream Pasta - it tasted like Seolleongtang(Korean ox bone soup) but creamier! Our server (forgot her name) was super friendly and funny as well. By the time we leave, we became best friends! I also loved that they played old Korean songs. We'll definitely go back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

You can definitely go here and try a lot of things since everything is tapa style. Nothing was the best I've ever had in terms of food but the service was some of the best in town. Wait staff is very attentive and fun. It would be a good place to go to in a group
No comment

Five stars is just not enough for this place. Every single thing we ordered was delicious! They did run out of dessert but that will just bring us back. The ambience is amazing and the servers are all so kind. Love that the menu is short so got to try a lot of things. The popcorn chicken (10/10) mushroom bibimbap (9/10) oxbone cream pasta (11/10, the best) toast roll (7/10) seoul'sbury steak (11/10). We also had a sake recommended by our server and it was also really good. I've recommended C as in Charlie to literally everyone I know, it's so so good and I can't wait to go back!
No comment

The food was good, although the portions were rather small.  My problem with this restaurant is that they rush you from the minute you sit down.  The waiter began hovering when we arrived and kept pushing us to order right away.  Then he whisked away dishes wihout asking if we were through.   Overall it was a very disappointing experience.  If you have 30 minutes and want to grab a quick bite, you probably would be satisfied.  If you are looking to dine with friends and savor the food, this is the wrong restaurant.

Fun new place with Korean and southern fusion tapas. Staff was great- we got free shots. Tapas were small so we ordered almost everything off the menu. I enjoyed their oxbone cream pasta and the potato nugget with truffle mayo. Presentation was done nicely and the vibes were nice.

Yummy Korean tapas and with vibist ambiance! The shrimp toast served with sweet chili and onions was absolutely delicious and the effect way to start off. And don't skip the oxbone cream pasta, that's was so good! Also can't forget the friendly service, everything is so good here!
No comment

Not sure what the hype is about? It was lovely to get a complimentary shot of soju when we got seated. The dishes are mostly small and for sharing. Everything was fairly ordinary. My fav was probably the pasta. But nothing really stood out. So... I'm not sure why the hype!?

Had such a fun dinner here! Such a good vibe for a casual outing with a friend or two for some shareable creative bites. The servers are so kind and attentive. Got nearly everything on the menu. The tuna tartare, popcorn chicken, potatoes, and oxbone cream pasta were my fave. We received complimentary sweet tea and sake. It was great.
No comment
The food was amazing, service made you feel like they wanted you to come back. Ambiance was cute

Super tasty. Great service, friendly and attentive waiters. The complimentary sweet tea was delicious. Great vibes and delicious food. The ox bone pasta, tuna tartare, mushroom bibimbap, and popcorn chicken all so tasty. Plates are small though. 4 for 2 people was perfect but could've ordered more to be full

Looking for a place to get good eats before a night of drinks and debauchery? Look no further than C as in Charlie, the newest culinary hotspot in NoHo, serving Korean tapas with a southern twist. Walking in, there was disco music pumping thru the speakers and plenty of satisfied-looking patrons. The dishes that stood out to me were the fresh and delicious tuna tartare which paired well with the crispy/salty rice chips and the Seoul'sbury steak which had the sexiest glaze, oozing on to the cheesy grits. The winner for me though, was the mushroom bibimbap. The rice was perfectly fluffy and absorbed the umami flavor of the mushroom. The yolk of the poached egg acted as a glue, marrying all of these flavors and textures together, creating the perfect comfort meal. David, our server and one of the owners, was super cool and accommodating. It felt nice having that personal touch and insight on to the story of how the restaurant came about between 3 friends from Georgia . I was left satisfied and could clearly see connection between the southern comfort feel of the food and the Korean flavors. I ended it off with a misleading bagel and cream cheese with jelly, which was really icecream between a bagel shaped wafer. Please check this spot out, I loved it and will definitely be returning!!

The cutest experience!! Every dish was fire. We (party of three) ordered the mushroom bibimbap, popcorn chicken, persimmon salad, oxbone pasta, and - the star of the show! - the seoulsbury steak. The Korean and Southern flavors were balanced perfectly. Will definitely come back to try the other dishes. If you're lucky enough to have Sophie as a server, you'll experience Southern hospitality to the max!

Tried this new Korean spot in Soho New York where every item on the menu is a tapa and it was a pretty interesting experience! Let me start off by saying that the staff was extremely welcoming and made the entire experience so much better. The food was overall pretty good with the exception of the dessert. We started off with the Tuna Tartare which was very fresh and the flavors were delicious. The first entree to arrive eas the Oxbone Cream Pasta which was my favorite thing I ordered. Lots of flavor and was just overall so good. The Toast Roll was a recommendation of the staff but unfortunately it was a little disappointing. It was filled with shrimp paste and with the honey mustard sauce on the dish, overall tasted a little plain. The Mushroom Bibimbap was great too and any mushroom fan will appreciate this one. We ordered a total of 4 tapas for 2 people and it was a solid amount of food. The last thing we tried was the Charlie's Deli Bagel which was a bagel made of cone material instead of bread with sour cream yogurt and strawberry jelly filling. This one was a little disappointing in my opinion as it was a bit too tart for my liking and just didn't taste very unique although it looked pretty cool. Everything was very affordable which was a big plus to the good food.
This spot is just the spot simple. Go see for yourself popcorn chicken. The service was amazing as well. The Ambiance is like no other.

The food was amazing and incredible service. We got the popcorn chicken, seoulsbury steak, baby back rib, ox bone cream pasta - couldn't not recommend all of these more. It was perfect portions too! Great date spot. We will definitely be coming back!
No comment
No comment

This restaurant experience was completely and utterly superb. I came here for an event, and everyone had an amazing time. The owner, David, such a great guy personally delivered food to our tables and at the end we closed out the restaurant with some drinks and a final toast. The food here is exceptionally unique. Lots of dishes with their own twists that will keep your mouth watering and stomach full. There is no reason for this restaurant to have less than five stars as they go above and beyond in all aspects from service to food quality. Fun Tip: check out the bathroom. There are some creative pieces in there that feel like you stepped into a different restaurant, but in a cool and artsy way. Thanks y'all for such a great experience, I'll be sure to frequent this spot more often!!!
Everything was amazing! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The customer service was on point and the vibe is great. 10/10 would recommend! Our server Sam was very nice and hospitable

Great new spot! I found out about C as in Charlie on Thrillist and wanted to try it after seeing the cute pictures. The service was fantastic, and the food was delicious and instagrammable. The peach salad and mushroom bibimbap were incredible. Definitely get Charlie's Deli Bagel for dessert!
No comment

I like the food and the price and the setup is nice. Some local guys started smoking some weed while eating outside and the host quickly and respectfully asked them to leave immediately. The staff was great.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Me and a friend shared the edamame hummus, tuna tartare, popcorn chicken, ribs, and carbonara - we were happy with each dish!!! I think my favorite was the banana dessert. Can't wait to come back and try more. Our waiter Sam and the rest of the staff was friendly and attentive!
Food/ service everything top notch. Perfect spot for casual date night. Highly recommended

Second visit here, and now I know where to go when I need good food. We had hummus, popcorn chicken, steak, and mushroom bibimbap. Mushroom bibimbap was just such a heart-fulfilling taste and popcorn chicken was a soul food Hummus was just GREAT with warm pita breads (love how they drizzle olive oil ). And THE STEAK! The garnish went really well with the korean style steak (gulbi-jjim). It has that "umami" taste (flavor) with a touch of sweetness from the meat and the compound butter went great with it!! The vibe was great during the dinner time (around 7-8pm) with a cute aesthetic interior! I'm definitely going to go again to try rest of the menus

This place is amazing Korean style tapas. Everything we had was absolutely delicious full of flavor so innovative and interesting place are small but very filling so great to share. Interior is small but very cute. The staff was amazing especially our server Sophie, who is my new best friend I literally cannot say enough about this place everything from start to finish was top notch.
No comment
No comment
this is a place that I started planning mid meal when I could come back. the people here are the absolute nicest and the food is absurdly good!

This place was incredible! Definitely try and snag a res here while it's still possible because I have a feeling it won't be for long - we ordered the tuna tartare, popcorn chicken, seouls-bury steak, shrimp rolls, and oxbone pasta. Everything was perfect but standouts were definitely the steak and shrimp rolls. The service was what made this such a lovely experience that will have me coming back; each waiter took the time to walk us through every dish and its ingredients and we were even served a few free drinks! Will definitely be back soon
No comment

everything on the menu is delicious! especially loved the potatoes (too good didn't take a pic). the owners are great and gives you a free sake shot when you sit down and took one with us. the service was great, my boyfriend drinks A LOT of water and his cup was always full. they made great recommendations and staff was friendly. ambiance was trendy, modern and fun. had a great time and will be back again!
Great vibes, nice staff, and really good food! Especially loved the chicken . Will def be back to try some other items

My party of 4 ordered the entire menu and everything was delicious! We especially enjoyed the toast roll, oxbone cream pasta, and mushroom bibimbap. The service was outstanding - all of the hosts were incredibly courteous and helpful. They were also playing early '90s Korean music, which perfected the vibe. I would highly recommend!

Absolutely loved this place! Has been a while since I've felt this way about a restaurant. Very creative and thoughtful in their design & food. My favorites were the tuna tartar, mushroom bibimbap & seoulsbury steak. We met the owners as well who were incredibly kind. I came with a friend who'd been before & we ran into her friend she'd been with. They were dining with friends as well. And the table next to us had dined at the restaurant before as well. I always take that as a good sign. Seeing people come back. It was a good sign because the food was unique and delicious. Will def be back!

I took my girlfriend to C as in Charlie for her birthday. What a truly amazing experience. The food was all excellent, and the service was exceptional. A super fun vibe at very reasonable prices. I will absolutely be returning and would recommend this place to all my friends
Love this restaurant. Went there twice in a week, took my parents then my sister and her fiancé. Love it.

The only thing better than the incredible food is the incredible staff. Not only did my friends and I absolutely love every single thing we ordered, we were blown away by the kindness and attentiveness of every single staff member we encountered. If you're looking for some delicious, unique dishes; a super cool atmosphere; and outstanding service, I 10/10 recommend C as in Charlie!

Me and my boyfriend went here for his birthday and it was a lot of fun. We were so caught on what to get on the menu because it all sounded so good. Our favorite things were the popcorn chicken and the tuna tartare. The lightning and decorations at this restaurant made it feel so fun and modern. The bathroom in particular was full of creative decorations including a soap dispenser that puts out a foamy flower and blue lights. The servers were incredibly nice and helpful and gave us a sake sample at the end of our meal because of the birthday. This restaurant is so fun and cool and delicious and I can't wait to come back.
excellent food and incredible care from the owners. Make sure you get the toast rolls and the oxbone cream pasta. Finally, get the banana pudding!
I really enjoyed their food. Try their oxbone pasta and mushroom bowl. I've been going to many Korean fusion places, but these are extraordinary !

Interesting new restaurant unlike anything else in the neighborhood. Chef and owner are Korean Americans from Atlanta, so they combine both Korean and southern cuisine in tapas style. We ordered all the menus on the still growing menu. The ribs were great, as was the pasta. Even better is the service and hospitality. Super friendly staff, we got to chat it up with David (owners) and other folks to learn about their story. Give them a try

Cute aesthetics, authentic korean music was playing and most importantly, all of their dish were amazing. I just went passed this place and popped in there but the owners there were very nice and friendly. The foods are Korean-based and I can guarantee that everything we got were amazing. Crispy sweet and spicy popcorn chicken was one of the best fried chicken I've had in a while Bibimbap will be a great option for anyone who wants to try Korean food without the spicyness of it. Hummus was also great and the pita breads were warm (which I loved)! The price range was very very doable (as a college student thats pretty important) and in conclusion, I am definitely going to visit this place more than often!!

Amazing! I've been here with my family for New Year's eve and we were all so happy! The staff is what makes the difference, everyone is very kind and there Is a funny girl. They also cared for my brother lactose intolerance and my veganism so we were able to have different options. The dishes are super delicious, all of them. Such a nice experience!

Relatively new restaurant focused on Korean / Southern fusion. Not the easiest place to get a table at currently but still possible, although that may change due to recent hype from Michelin and Resy articles. This is a great restaurant with excellent service while remaining relatively affordable. We got 5 dishes total (2-3 dishes per person is recommended) and our favorites were the steak/grits, and the oxbone pasta. Everything was good though. We were given complimentary hot tea, without being prompted, due to our table which was by the entrance - we didn't feel cold at all though. It was a nice touch however. I've dined at a bunch of Michelin starred restaurants and while I am a complete food amateur I think the food and service here is better than some of the 1-starred places. I wouldn't be surprised to see this restaurant get a star on the next list, especially since it's already on Michelin's radar, publicly, now. It's a pretty small space so go now while the hype is still somewhat manageable.

Fun new restaurant in Noho with a limited menu but all delicious items. Favorite dishes were the ribs, toast roll, and mushroom bibimbap. We were three of us and we ordered everything on the menu besides the edamame hummus and two out of three of us wanted pizza after so I recommend ordering a couple of some dishes if you have a big appetite. The banana pudding was a huge skip for our group - it was super overly sweet and didn't have enough cream to balance it out, only more sweet marshmallow fluff. The servers were really nice but I sadly have to knock a star because the restaurant is so incredibly loud that I could not ever hear the server explain what the food was, and I could barely hear the people I was having dinner with which had a much bigger damper on the experience than I expected. The tables are so close together that there is no way to move around without bumping in to the back of someone's chair, and the noise makes it feel like you're in a really crowded bar trying to eat, but hey if that's your vibe then this is the place for you. Not recommended for taking your parents, a first date (unless you want to be yelling and potentially spitting on your date), or anyone you actually want to talk to!

Came last week and tried everything on the menu! The staff were all so nice- explained every dish and were very attentive. I'd say the mushroom bibimbap, pasta, riand smashed potatoes with truffle sauce are a must, but definitely try as many dishes as you can! They're all very unique.
Ate here last night and had a blast! Particularly enjoyed the peach salad, ribs and popcorn chicken. Would definitely come back!

Fabulous experience. The whole team behind this restaurant went above and beyond to give us a great evening. Food was so tasty! We shared the ribs, hummus, popcorn chicken and stone fruit salad and everything was lovely. Tried the "bagel" gelato for dessert and can't stop thinking about it. Loved how playful and flavorful everything was. Can't wait to come back!
New spot with absolutely unbelievable food - Seoul-sbury Steak is a must try. Owners are super friendly, definitely worth checking out!
Everything is good. Unfortunately, portion is small compared to traditional Korean food. But taste and service are still good.

Everything on the menu is good, and the staff are so wonderful! I had a party here and they stayed open late for us - so accommodating, kind and well organized. Small plates are the perfect size, 2 plates per person and a few of the dessert bagels to share and you're set.

AMAZING food with a fun atmosphere! We ordered every item on the menu and then ordered even more of about half of the items. There is nothing we didn't like, but our favorites were the potatoes and the shrimp rolls. I'm so full ugh but will be back soon
mushroom bibimbap and hummus were fire. ordered everything on the menu and every dish was solid/worth trying. shoutout steve.

The service here was amazing I had a very good conversation with the bartender and two old fashioneds were more than enough. I would go again. The view was also immaculate and an aside to wonderful service and welcoming staff.

The food is pretty good but I wouldn't say it's amazing. It's a bit weird that reservations are recommended because we came here and it was pretty quiet the entire time. I do wish they had a dress code though but I guess because it's attached to a tourist attraction, I can see why they wouldn't have one
No comment
