No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

A friend of mine had been here before and loved it so much, mostly because of the ambiance and the view, that she wanted to go back for her birthday. We arrived close to 10pm and we were seated on the balcony with an amazing view of the city. With upscale restaurants, the menus tend to more concise. I opted for a caesar salad with shrimp as it was cheaper than a lot of the other items and I wasn't in the mood for anything heavy. The salad alone was eighteen dollars, which is pricey, but it was delicious. One of my friends ordered the asparagus risotto and a side of herbed fries; both were phenomenal and worth visiting for those alone. None of us ordered cocktails but, I would definitely come back to try them.

This place is a jewel of a find.  I don't know how it is not super popular.  But we lucked out.  The food and service were very good, but the location is the star!  The view from the terrace is unbelievable.  You are looking over the 9/11 memorial and directly at Freedom Tower.  You can also see the river.  Just amazing.  We didn't want to leave.  If you are visiting the area, I highly recommend booking here.  We had lunch and it was very easy to walk to from the memorial and everything was great.

It was fun riding up in the elevator and the view was great, but unfortunately nobody came to our table for the longest time so we have up and left. What I can tell you is that this place is not for me.  They have no appetizers, it's all entrees, sandwiches and salads.  Hard to just have a snack and a drink.

We came here from 15 anniversary what a great choice! Super cool staff and I mean very polite and Courteous. We sat on the outside for dinner an what an amazing view of the 9/11 memorial! . We have the roasted chicken and it was not dry at all.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Came here afterwards with my girls friend and the food was great. The drinks were great along the view. Would definitely recommend here.
No comment
No comment
My best friend and his wife along with my wife decided to come get a few pre-dinner drinks here. The view is worth it alone as you can get amazing shots of the Freedom Tower and lower Manhattan!
No comment
This is seriously the best jerk chicken I've had in my life.. the jerk is under the skin and stuffed inside, and also amazing views.

My husband and I went here for happy hour! The view on the outdoor patio is phenomenal and the wine selection is on point. Being a rooftop bar, the prices are reasonable for the drinks but not for the food.

Found this quiet restaurant in NYC. It is located on the 20th floor of a hotel and you need a key from the front desk to access the restaurant. Beautiful views of the downtown area. Friendly staff and very helpful when selecting the food. Naomi has a great personality and ensured our had everything we needed. We sat outside on the balcony but it was a little breezy but we had no problems because the weather was great.
No comment

The only reason I am giving this 4 stars is due to the view and due to the kindness & hospitality of the wait staff. The bread was cold, stale, and hard.: terrible. I had the steak salad, and it was okay, but it didn't fit the price: 22$. I also paid 18$ for two scallops and two small roasted sweet potatoes which was insane. Please increase the portions if you charge that much. You are basically paying for a good view, friendly staff, and average food.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Not sure why people have posted negatively about this restaurant and bar, but I can only write about what my experience was and it was nothing short of spectacular during my 3 visits to this place while staying at the hotel. I was treated to perfectly blended drinks, a wonderful staff who ensured my girl and I were never without a cocktail, and the food was divine. Érica made the recommendation for dinner and we were not disappointed at all. A beautiful view of the 9-11 Memorial and the Freedom Tower only makes this place all the more desirable to visit, but stay for the food, drinks, and staff... they're wonderful!
No comment
No comment
Very good family style chicken!  delicious.  the view was fantastic. really enjoyed our dinner

Excellent view from the 20th floor!!!! We helped a lunch location and the views were great. The bread and olive oil was perfect and my martini was delish!!!! My friends chicken Ceasar salad was the best looking salad I've seen from a hotel restaurant. Our view was so amazing. The servers were so funny and helpful. The place is small but we  got in at a perfect time. There was no crowd on a Saturday at 6pm. The elevator takes a while to arrive and you do have to search for it but it's an amazing find for a casual or romantic lunch

Hidden gem in financial district. Everything great from beginning to end! Waiter was super attentive and friendly the entire time. The menu is not expansive but every item on it is tempting. As a non-meat eater I still had several options to choose from on both starters and entrees. The wine offerings were also pretty good. I rarely see south african offerings and the sauvignon selection was superb! The view is absolutely amazing with a small patio to step out into when the open air rooftop is closed. I will definitely be returning to this restaurant!

After being attacked by many fruit flies on the outdoor patio, we asked to be moved inside and after our nice server, Matt, placed us at a 2 top by the window, another waiter showed up at our table as we were eating to tell us we had to move because the table was "reserved."  The restaurant had 8 open tables and yet we were asked to leave during our meal, making us feel very uncomfortable.  I should also add we were given an option of sitting anywhere upon our arrival. The staff is clueless and rude.  If you enjoy fruit flies and/or awkward stares from management, please enjoy the view.

Came upon this hidden gem and had the wonderful experience of meeting Lenny. He has to be one of the best bartenders I have encountered. The drinks were phenomenal and the view is beautiful. You must come here!

We stayed at the word center hotel and this is the rooftop restaurant. I will say the view is spectacular but the food is just okay and the waiter wasn't on point. They have a BOGO happy hour from 4-7 and applies to tables and not just the bar which is great. They also bring one drink at a time for you. We were seated at a two top and ordered drinks. I asked about the Branzini dish which was a whole fish served with two sides. Opted against it because of the bones and didn't want to work for my meal. The whole roasted chicken would be 25 minutes to cook as our waiter informed us. We ordered that with garlic bread and Swiss chars as our sides. This meal is enough for 2-3 people to share. After 10 minutes a different waiter brought a shrimp app to our table which we told him we did not order. Mistake number one. It was supposed to go outside to a table on the terrace. After 20 minutes our ( wrong ) meal was delivered. It was the whole Branzini fish!!!!! Mistake number 2!! I told the waiter we had ordered the roasted chicken!! He seemed confused and said, no you didn't! I said yes we did! I said how much longer for the chicken? He said 20 minutes! He apologized and offered a free appetizer. We ordered the fig and cheese platter. It was very good! After about 20 minutes and two drinks in, our chicken dinner was delivered. Wait! It had the wrong sides with it! Grrrrr! Mistake number 3!! Waiter proceeded to bring the right sides after another 5-10 minutes. We were starved so carved up the chicken. While it was good, it was very spicy hot!!! I have never had roasted chicken be served spicy hot before! Needless to say, everything was taken off the menu except our drinks which made our bill 14.00. Total time sat was for 3 hours!!! At 9:00 many families started to come in and seated all with little kids and babies. I would suggest going to the bar during happy hour and ordering little plates as this restaurant doesn't have it together in my opinion. Again, the View is Spectacular!
No comment
No comment

Had an amazing time at the Top of Waikiki restaurant! My husband and I shared the goat cheese ragoons (delicious!), the pear salad (a must try! It's served with a cheese egg roll type thing) and the gnocchi! This is a must try! Plus the restaurant rotated so you see the entire city

Empty place and yet they would not sit the 7 of us because we just wanted drinks and dessert. Very bad management obviously . They even told us that they would have accommodated us if we were 2 or 3 . Absurd !!!! 1 star to the view .
No comment

This was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. Brian was our waiter and talk about someone who knows their stuff. My fiancée and I are not big wine drinkers, but Brian came to the rescue and delivered something we both liked. We got the burgers and it was cooked especially the way we wanted them and they were very juicy! The food was great and after we were finished, Brian recommended the dark chocolate lava cake. Talk about amazing. All in all, the price was very fair for the experience we got it of it. Would definitely come back next time we're in the area!
No comment
Excellent place with a great view of the WTC memorial fountains, they do lunch dinner and HH
No comment
No comment

This place has the best food,everything was just amazing. Haven't had anything like it.The customer service is just amazing everyone is just so nice, kind and warmhearted. 10 out of 10 would try again
No comment
No comment
Surprisingly inexpensive and the lasagna was delicious. The view is out this world. Will come again to both the hotel and restaurant
No comment
No comment

I found this place on yelp and really wanted to try because of the views. I went for happy hour and loved it. I brought my mom and she enjoyed as well. We tried the burger slides, fries and the steak and potato appetizers. For drinks we had wine. We had a great experience there and definetely will return when I'm back in nyc! Highly recommend this place for any meal, but happy hour is a great deal!
Awesome service, great food and drinks, and last but not least.... A bangin' view!

My boyfriend and I recently went for our anniversary, it was a beautiful restaurant with an amazing view of the city. The reason for the four stars is because of the service. Our waitress wasn't all that friendly. Overall, definitely recommend!
No comment

The view is what people are paying for. Service was terrible. My uncle waited over several minutes for a drink. The food was overpriced for the portion, and bland. My friend asked for a straw at the beginning of service and received it towards the end. If you want a subpar meal with the best view, then this is the spot for you!
Perfect view of WTC over wine and tasty sliders. Excellent service too.  Problem is it's not easy to find as it is located on top of a hotel next to Mortons restaurant.
One of the best rooftop views in the city. The waiter was really helpfull. Prices were affordable

This restaurant at the freedom tower was excellent. Went there for lunch I had the butternut squash soup and my husband had the arugula salad and we shared a Reuben sandwich. It was delicious and they were so kind to give us champagne for our fifth anniversary and also took our picture to commemorate the occasion. It was a wonderful experience.

column3: Bay Street Viaduct Area, Savannah, GA
column6: great view but awful breakfast.. would not recommend to anyone. Just a regular hotel buffet (actually subpar), but with a nice view.
No comment

Came here for a company holiday party. It's an amazing venue with a small terrace overlooking the WTC site. Loungey yet intimate, it's a good setting for mingling. The service is superb with coat check and quick bartenders. Pre set dinner menu was plain Italian American e.g. Pasta, chicken, and salad but cooked well. For a quick breather get a drink and head outside to take in the Reflecting Pools, One WTC, and skyline. Pricey venue so you get what you pay for.

Ate at the restaurant here as a surprise this past summer.. Such an incredible view of the Freedom Tower and the food was nothing short of amazing. I ordered the Pasta Primavera and it was surprisingly light - pasta cooked to perfection and the sauce extremely delicious. The servers were also very attentive. It was such a memorable experience, I would definitely go back.
Amazing view of the world trade center, especially if you get the terrace outside seating during the warmer months, entrees range from 20-35 dollars and everything was delicious.
Good food with fair prices. Not crowded at all when I was there in March 2016. Friendly staff and the view is just amazing! The restaurant is definitely worth a visit.
Views are a 5, Service is a 4, and food is a 3. The prices are toooooo high.  A $50 steak should be world class. We got a good steak at about 14-16 oz.   the night and views were great!

Great place. Beautiful view of the one World Trade Center & the 9/11 memorial. Not one but TWO terraces! Went here the night of New Years Eve with my best friend. The food was delicious. I enjoyed the butternut squash soup. I also ordered the filet mingon which was cooked exactly to my liking. Perfection if you ask me. Everything was a great compliment to one another. The service was great given the place was crowded because of the holiday. Overall an amazing dining experience. I would recommend you go here. The view itself will pull you in. Everything else added bonus. Enjoy.
No comment

Saw this restaurant on yelp and wanted to try it out. Didn't know it was inside the World Center hotel but I called the hotel to make sure. The gentleman on the phone was nice and gave me directions how to get to the restaurant. When we got there it was empty and my family and I were able to get a great view of the World Trade Center. Food was delicious and inexpensive happy hour wine is only 6.50! Definitely would stay at the hotel and come back to eat here again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

4 stars for the food. 0 stars for the service. We went there with a group for a birthday dinner, when we got there the place was not packed at all (given we went on a Wednesday). So we sat at the bar to wait for the rest of our party to arrive, the bar tender took forever to make our drinks even though all she needed to do was open a beer and pour it into the glass. So when our party arrived we were seated, this waitress comes over to our table not saying a word and slams a bottle of water in the table and just walks away. Long story short she made the whole experience terrible the whole time she was serving us she didn't say a word and had the bitch face on the whole night . only thing that made up for it was the food ( compliments to the chef)

The atmosphere was spectacular ask for a seat next to a window. I don't know how this place isn't packed, although it was pricy it was good food and a great view. I had the lamb with asparagus risotto and my husband had the steak.

The views were great and the food was pretty good. I think our server was a little slow and inattentive. Food portions were kind of small, but I guess that's to be expected for this type of restaurant. Definitely on the pricier side, but also, you're in the FiDi. I'd recommend coming for the bar and views.
Terrible food...sent back salad as greens were so old. Also playing heavy metal music which didn't help. View was great of Ground Zero.
No comment
No comment
Pricey but worth it. Risotto was a bit under cooked but nice flavor. Quiet atmosphere. Fast service very nice servers. I had a nice time by myself.
I truly agree with all the other reviews. The view is amazing but entry is only for hotel guests so be aware of this.
Beautiful view, not crowded early Sunday AM, good service. Small buffet bar-- underwhelming, but good omelets and coffee. Appropriate for kids and adults - - lots of tourists and hotel guests.
What a gem! The view is amazing and so is the happy hour! Excellent prices for NYC. Perfect for cocktails, didn't try any food but it looked good. Casual relaxed atmosphere with excellent service!

Great view. Food was okay, nothing fabulous or unique. Service was basic, nothing stood out or extraordinary. Gratuity is 18% and is already included in your bill regardless of the number of people. Drinks were nothing special. They weren't even strong :(
Excellent view, Bravos food, at reasonable price! Would definitely come back again next time give someone a tour at 911 memorial museum.

Bad service! They never refilled our drinks or bothered to take our meal order, so we ended up leaving after 40 minutes of waiting around. The staff was standing around chatting. Most of the options on the menu are a small appetizer size, so you need to order multiple plates. View is nice, but doesn't make up for the service.

Do yourself a favor and don't come here. The food and service is terrible. We waited over 45 minutes for 1 drink and the food wasn't good at all. The view is beautiful but don't be fooled. Over priced and portions are way too small.
The Food Is Delicious, The Staff Is Polite, They Have Delicious Drinks & An Amazing View! A Little Pricey For The Type Of Food But I'm Sure Its Because Of The View!
Went on the terrace side. The service was awesome. The food was perfect. I would definitely go back. Little bit pricey though: $77 (without tip) for two salads and a dessert.
Scores high for views and by NYC prices ok to look over World Trade Center complex. Did not eat as we had other plans. Reportedly need reservations

The 3 stars are for the customer service and the views. Otherwise, I'd give it 1/5. The customer service - wait staff and others were really amazing and too notch.  They are really accommodating and courteous.  I give them 5/5.  The food is more like 1 out of 5.  Horrible food. Basic hotel room service food and priced like it- high.    Very expensive bad food. The crab cakes were not too good and that was the best.  My burger meat was charred and burnt. The cod dish was tasteless. Everyone ate because we paid a lot for it and didn't want it to go to waste.   I think it's more of a place where you go for drinks and cocktail rather than go for a solid meal.   The balcony overlooking downtown is really nice and amazing.   Great for taking pics.
Scrumptious food, breathtaking views, friendly and prompt service. So glad we choose to have dinner here. Good wine menu, full bar. Good for drinks or a full meal. Enjoy!

Awesome view. Great happy hour! $5 beers, $6 wine and well drinks. Minus one star because the menu does not have many vegetarian options, not a big selection and it is slightly on the pricey side. The music level was great, soft, I can hear people speak clearly. Full bar. Not too crowded and good crowd -- Mostly business people and travelers.

This place made me so mad. I'm from Boston and two months ago (April) I planned a one day trip to New York for my boyfriends birthday in June. Part of the planning included making a late lunch reservation at this location. I called TWO months ago and made a reservation under my name and when I got there, they were setting up for a private event and denied me ever calling to make a reservation. They should have at least called and informed me that they would be hosting an event on that day so I could plan another place to eat, but they did not and we ended up having to walk to a resturaunt with food we dont even like because it was the only option. Very disappointed and will NEVER go back to this place again. They were so rude and inconsiderate.
Great place with a great view. If you want to escape from crowds in the downtown and see how beautiful the city is, place I would definitely recommend
The food selection is limited and not very good. Service is horrible you will seat with your empty glass for hours without the waitress checking on you. Lovely view terrible food and service.

I'm not even sure this is a real restaurant, they seemed completely unprepared to seat us, serve us or prepare food or drink. Waited 10 minutes for someone to greet us, then found they had lost our reservation which had been confirmed that day. 15 minute wait for the bartender to take drink orders and I thought she couldn't have been less friendly... But then I met our server, who neither smiled, spoke a pleasant word nor apologized for anything all the long, long night. Took 40 minutes to get wine. Lost track of how long to took to get the bland food, including a lamb dish that was seared on the outside and completely raw -- not rare, raw -- inside.

Love the view, love the food, love the staff... Will definitely be back! But only when the weather is nice, =) Agree with other reviewers about the hotel lady.. she needs a personality dialysis.. but that doesn't deter me from coming back.
Horrible service and food was meh. This is where you'd take your relatives who are visiting and want to go to a restaurant by their hotel to take selfies with nice "views"

The view is spectacular. We came here for mother's day brunch. The food was not bad tho a bit pricey. The location is hidden but very central if you want to be around Battery Park city area. A definite gem!
No comment

I enjoyed the food and the view is amazing! However, I am only rating this restaurant two stars due to the horrible service we were provided with. My fiancé & I were seated and waited about 10 minutes before I had to wave our waiter down for even a glass of water.  It was not a busy night so there was really no excuse.  He was way more attentive to the table seated next to us. He also did not come over once to ask if we needed anything else.  Very poor service at this establishment!!

Located in the top floor of the club quarters this restaurant and bar is a great place online or have dinner has a great view of the 9/11 memorial area and freedom Tower great waitstaff reasonable prices excellent food

If you are looking for the nice view Yes here it is. Facing to the new WTC and 9/11 museum. But if you are looking for nice breakfast. Definitely no recommend. Lack of choice of foods and the taste are awful. Suggest to try other restaurants nearby.
Food was delish, but portions small for the price. What you're paying for is the view, and it was spectacular.
One of my favorite place in downtown with breathtaking views of WTC.  Great for business dinner.
Cost me 15 min to get here only to find out it is a private club. Why do anyone even bother to put this place on Yelp?!
No comment

Great choice for weekday lunch. Food and service were excellent and the place was almost empty. We sat on the heated (it was 60, so a little heat was nice) outdoor patio overlooking the World Trade Memorial.

very slow kitchen took an hour to get our orders and then turned out they got my wife's order wrong. The portion sizes are too small and the food quality is sub par. So overpriced with lower quality and slower service
Great place to grab a cocktail in NYC! The view we had of the 9-11 memorial was breathtaking!! Our server Michael was fantastic and super friendly!!

This place is Awesome.. the food was beyond delicious and the crab cakes were to die for. Also the drinks and the view is amazing... also the staff like Michael Paula are beyond amazing..thank you again i will be definitely coming back here again
No comment

Decent but not extraordinary food. Outstanding view and could be the worst service we have had in three weeks in NYC. Watch out for the 18% gratuity they tack on to your meal regardless of how crappy the service is. Arrived in time for happy hour only to have the waiter take 20 min to serve the drinks and it wasn't even that busy.

Amazing service,  great happy hour for house cocktails from 4 to 7 every day! 6$..... I had excellent whiskey sours.  Pricey food,  I didn't have any.  Would return for drinks and the service.  Enjoyed the view,  sat on the enclosed patio
No comment

The food is good, but why does it take so long to get served ? I mean, time in a kitchen is very important but if something happened, the waiter should let us know. but it is good ! small portions, i agree but the flavor was there. the service might not be as good as other places... strange though...

Wow! On the 20th floor of the World Center Hotel, this quaint restaurant has a spectacular view of the 9/11 Memorial, One World Trade Center, and the Hudson River from its outdoor terrace - an absolutely breathtaking view of Manhattan!  And this was the cherry on top of the breakfast and dinner we had as World Center Hotel guests.  Omelettes made-to-order was a special touch to the small yet satisfying breakfast buffet.  This dinner was excellent, with a simple menu that satisfied everyone.  The burger with creamy remoulade and the wonderfully herbed pork loin were outstanding.  Special requests for each of the three pasta primaveras we ordered were happily delivered. The salads tasted as beautifully as they were plated.  The service was very upbeat all around. This place is absolutely a hidden gem!
Friendly staff, good food, amazing view. I got the shrimp pasta and chicken soup and my boyfriend got a salmon. The pasta was good and creamy and the shrimp was soft and  flavorful :)

Amazing view of the 9/11 memorial with outdoor seating. The staff was great, fair drink prices and the food was pretty good. My favs were the crab cake ($15) and the 3 mozzarella pesto sliders ($11) which are on the bar menu (but you can order it at the tables).  The sliders were better than the regular burger we all felt.  The watermelon panzanella ($16) was really good but a bit pricey for what it was. Scallop poppers ($15) were okay. Of all the apps I would def go for the crab cake again, for taste and price.  My pressed chicken and Brie sandwich was a little bland, I had I ask for that burger pesto sauce on the side to give it some more flavor. The fries were amazing though! Thin and crispy, shoestring-like.  My cousin's sage pork chop ($26) was a huge portion and really juicy. My other cousin's poached salmon salad ($18) was pretty bland and a bit dry, I'd skip it. My mom's shrimp Harissa pasta was a little under seasoned as well, but the ingredient combination tasted good together with some added salt. Unfortunately you can only eat here if you're a guest of the hotel. If you do stay here, I would def recommend having your meals here, for the view, the sliders, and the crab cake.

Recent dinner get together with friends for a first time visit. All of us enjoyed the magnificent view of downtown from our outside table on the terrace especially after sundown. Service was impeccable. Appetizer selections were all very good. However, I was slightly disappointed with my chicken entree. It was somewhat bland in taste. It is for that reason that I only gave 4 stars. But I would add that the lamb chops, pasta primavera and salmon entrees selected by my friends all got rave reviews from them. Based on our total dining experience we all agreed that we would definitely come back again.
I took my wife for dinner the food was good the view was amazing, service was excellent too.

Poor service, incorrect orders, expensive.  Am here for a retirement lunch. Waited an hour plus for our order from a prefixed menu of limited choices. Not many people in the party and they still got the orders wrong. Very poor service for high prices.

It was nice because we made a reservation so we got seated immediately. There wasnt a lot of people tho, so there was plenty of room. I went with a party of 8. We sat at the outside seats. The view was exactly outside of the 911 memorial. They first asked us for our drink and they never came back after like 15+ mins.Slow service. Then we ordered, the waiters were very nice. Then for the food tasted terrible the sand wich pressed chicken and brie ew its tasted like rotten stuff.The fries were good tho. Overall waiters and view was good but slow service and shitty food.

The View from the 20th floor of the World Center/Club Quarters (combined) hotels is certainly outstanding.  The surprise was that the food and service were also excellent.  The shrimp bisque, burgers, and crab cakes were all fresh and tasty.

Super-fun surprise find.  Outdoor views are stunning to the point of breathtaking.  I can't think of another restaurant where you can sit outdoors at the very edge of a skyscraper with nothing separating you from the view but a clear glass half-wall.  (Not to mention that the view is of the WTC pools and new tower).  Food and beer was excellent, as was the service.  The price was reasonable, especially for the view.  It doesn't seem like the secret is out yet, but I went early and will definitely be going back.

This place has such a beautiful view of the city. The staff was super friendly and funny. And the food was excellent. My girlfriends and I shared the ribeye, fish and chips, lamb chops, the tomato burrata salad and the watermelon salad. Everything including dessert was on point. The manager there, Chase, was knowledgeable and gave us great recommendations for the food and drinks. He was also attentive in making sure our table was served timely and with care. Awesome service overall!

Awesome place and an even more awesome view. I had an early Valentine's Day dinner here and the staff was excellent. Spencer who works there picked the perfect wine and took the time out to help me find a very refreshing bottle of sparkling water.
Everything was excellent. Atmosphere, staff, appetizers, entrees, desserts, drinks. No complaints, whatsoever.

I wish that I could give this beautiful restaurant a better rating but there was zero service. I waited 5 minutes and was acknowledged by the bar tender but eventually had to seat myself. I waited to be waited on and the waiter saw me but couldn't get to me because he was running around trying to tend to other customers who arrived before me. I ended up leaving unacknowledged. They need to hire more people.

Went here with our family for dinner and breakfast over the past weekend. The view and atmosphere are wonderful, especially on a beautiful night. However, the service was abysmal. For dinner, the service was lacking in attention. We had to wait long periods of time for drinks and assistance. The food was very good. Breakfast was extremely unsatisfactory. Once seated, we were told of the breakfast buffet options and then pretty much forgotten. After we returned from the buffet the first time, we found another family had been seated at our table on the veranda. The coffee we had asked for took three attempts to be served and two trips to the kitchen myself to remind the server. Then no cream or sugar and had to wait for those items. Many of the items on the buffet went unfilled throughout our meal including milk for cereal, juices, bacon and pancakes. At the end of our meal, it took so long to get the check that I left with our children back to our room while my wife stayed behind. Much of this appeared to be due to understaffing. There were only two servers on and they seemed responsible for all aspects of the restaurant. Despite the lack of timeliness and refills, the server was very personable, polite and very apologetic for the difficulties we experienced.

One hot sumer day...too hot to eat outside, I happened to find the restaurant was right here in my hotel. Simply delicious. Had the Caesar Salad first and since I'm not a big eater,  had the seared scallops. DELISH! Having the chocolate volcano cake for desert. Ask for Lenny.  He is an awesome server.

Absolutely atrocious. After being poured my wine never saw the waitress again until I asked the manager for the check. Therefore, I poured my own wine, no big deal. Then had to ask for bread which didn't arrive until my entrée. It arrived with butter rockhard. Fresh multigrain bread on top, stale white bread on bottom. Even if you try to hide it, it is still stale. Shrimp and lobster pasta adequate but lobster was previously frozen. Grand finale after giving my credit card had to wait 10 minutes then get up from table to find waitress. Great view though lol.  Oh yeah almost forgot to add insult to injury 18% gratuity added!

View was great. I dont recommend the 16.95 breakfast buffet. Continental is 11.95 coffee is extra on both. Buffet is marginal at best. But hey you get a view. If you consider price of admission (free) then there may be value. Otherwise look elsewhere for breakfast. OBTW there is no access without room key for elevator. No need to tip they add it to your bill automatically. Have fun.
No comment

No comment

Really amazing experience here. We got the yellowtail, beef tartare, mad toast, fried buhsut, grilled octopus, prime galbi, lobster with rice, mad hungry noodles, and two black sesame pate a choux. Every bite was great, with the absolute best ones being the prime galbi and the fried buhsut (basically fried mushrooms with an onion dip). But we really loved every dish, maybe other than the dessert. (They were out of the matcha version, and neither of us are crazy about black sesame.)

No comment

Went a little mad over this Earl grey bingsu! Instantly recognized @littlemadnyc is the team behind @atoboynyc not just the similar prix fixe flow but even the construction of the restaurant. Came here for a birthday celebration, recommend to come w 2 friends so you could try all the items on the menu. We really enjoyed the desserts and the Bershire bbq pork chop, perfectly charred! We also adds on shrimp uni, not worth it.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

No comment
This place is awesome. The music was great (hiphop), the service stellar, the food amazing. Highly recommend!

This is a korean tasting-menu restaurant at a reasonable price point. The place looked rusty and the lighting was not bad. We enjoyed all the chef's snack. For little cold, yellowtail was nice and i really enjoyed beef tartare. We also got the signature mad toast, but felt like it was a little bit underwhelming. For mad hot, we got fried buhsut (recommended by our waiter) and mandoo, both was fine and not too special. For the entree, we got the lobster, galbi, and noodles. They were decent, I did feel like there could be more lobster. We got two pate a choux for dessert, one matcha and one black sesame flavor. I wished the filling had stronger flavor. Overall, it was a nice meal, we really enjoyed the snack and cold appetizer.

Not even a little mad. Superb modern Korean tasting with warm and friendly service. My favorite was the amazing little scallion fish cakes with that rich umami bomb of a butter. Mandoo was also the agreed upon stand out along with the Arctic char. Such a delightful place to be and can't wait for a return visit!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We loved our experience at Little Mad. We were seated in a dimly lit industrial space. The food was really creative and the server gave good suggestions for which course to add extras to, although it would've been good without.  The noodle dish addition was amazing, I wouldn't skip it. Each dish was unique and we were able to share among the three of us (each person chooses one dish from the 3-4 options). Kitchen and front of house worked together to plan the timing of each dish. We were so full, it was tough enjoying the dessert. Would definitely get the shaved ice with fruit because it was light and fresh.

No comment

This place was really amazing, especially for the price.  The tasting menu was $75 per person, which I thought was a really good value given the food choices and excellent creative dishes.  We started off with 3 different amuse bouche items to eat in a specific order - i cant recall what it was , but I remember it was very tasty.  Then the yellow tail (amazing) and beef tartare for course 1, both really good.  then monkfish and shrimp for the second course, monkfish was really good. Then the lobster and galbi for the main entrees.  Lobster was really good, the galbi was just ok.  and then we got both desserts to try each.  Overall everything was at least good and some things were great, for $75 per person in NYC today that is really amazing, especially considering some of the premium ingredients in these dishes.
No comment

No comment

Decent food but terrible service. Had the tasting menu arrived at 8:15 and finished at 11:30. Mixed up our order multiple times. Food is nothing special and is very overpriced for what it is. Mad toast is disappointing however the yellow tail is very good.
No comment

No comment

Came here as a celebration for starting my move to NY after 9 years being away from home. All I can say is Chef Sol brought my fond childhood memories of grabbing some K food with my dad after playing basketball in the park, but somehow the food was more elevated while still feeling like home. The special noodles with fried duck was my favorite :)
No comment
No comment
No comment

Good atmosphere and waiters are attentive. When they serve each dish, they tell you the components/highlights. We ordered a cocktail each and shared all the dishes we ordered: beef tartare & scallops, signature mad toast (add on), tempura soft shell crab & "mandoo," lobster & galbi, earl grey shaved ice & sesame cream cream puff. Favorite was probably the tempura soft shell crab - the yuzu flavor added a nice touch to the salty seasoning. Disappointment was their signature mad toast. Maybe we had high expectations but it was basically just a hodgepodge of complex flavors/good ingredients and the buttered brioche toast was a bit overpowering. Overall great experience but I don't think I would come again unless the menu (pre fixe) changes drastically.

Amazing dinner! Every dish was very well made and the flavors complement each other. There was a good variety of meat, seafood and vegetables. Would recommend getting the mad toast as add on. Service was great too!

Oh baby,....this tiny little modern Korean restaurant hasn't been open for very long but they are already leaving a BIG MARK on the dining scene in NYC and we were fortunate to have visited during a recent trip from the Bay Area to NYC. Simply put, this is one of the more outstanding meals we have had in a long long time. The menu apparently changes regularly but there a few popular items like the crazy toast that appear often and for an important reason,...it is damn good ! The menu was small and the wine list also commensurate with the menu but a few tasty and well priced NYS bottles were available and matched the cuisine nicely. Take my advice, book a table soon before this place gets even busier due to solid word of mouth, high marks by restaurant critics and accolades by the Michelin's ! Some pics of meal highlights attached ! Everything was yummy !! Go Now !
No comment
No comment
No comment
This was one of the best meals I've had. Amazing service  and cocktails! The add ons are worth it too
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had a phenomenal dinner tonight at Little Mad. I appreciated the attention to detail and the thoughtfulness behind all of the dishes. The plates are on the smaller side, so plan on ordering 2-3 per person. The Mad Toast was one of the best things I've ever had, and the rice with bone marrow + mushrooms was fantastic. It's on the pricier side, but you're paying for quality ingredients (plus...I added caviar to everything)

Perfect for date night or dinner with a small group of friends. Love the open kitchen, feels like you are at someone's place. Very cozy and intimate setting. The menu has a good variety of options without being overwhelming, which I appreciate. You have the option to customize your choices with things like uni and caviar, and they recommend the best add ons for each dish. I love the fish-shaped amuse bouche, it comes to the table warm and with a aide of butter - could eat a ton of that! But make sure you save room for the rest. We did that with our tartare (added uni, which was so fresh and delicious). The plates are meant to be shared, so the best way to go is just to order a few things from the menu and have fun with it. I particularly enjoyed the king crab legs, rice and noodles, but honestly everything was amazing. The presentation is on point and the flavors are as described. Can't wait to come back!
Amazing meal from start to finish. So creative and the presentation was fabulous.  Have to thank our waiter for his great recommendations.

This place hit the spot- another gem from Hand Hospitality. The small dishes / tapas style really allow you to try many of their different items; each different but unique. Would definitely recommend the galbi & the cod.

Little Mad is a new Korean fusion small plates restaurant in Flatiron, NYC. Overall, great ambiance, excellent service, and a perfect place for a special occasion date. I mean, come on, the little scallion pancake fish ? And let's talk about the noodles, a truly nut worthy experience

this is the perfect kind of korean american fusion where it adds elements of american cuisine to korean food, but it still holds the authenticity of korean food. not only was it done well, but the food is just sooo delicious. 10/10 would recommend
No comment
Go here  food and service is amazing. Unique take on Korean food. Definitely worth the price and is quite affordable considering they gave us lobster and scallop dishes

So many options to choose from. The scallop and galbi are must-gets. The dessert donut was too hard but was too full to care. The price for the amount of food is worth it. The staff really made this experience wonderful. Our waiter explained the background of every dish. The venue is very cozy. The bar seating is amazing and would love to sit there next time.
No comment
No comment

I was more than just "a little mad" after my visit here. Almost every dish was either too salty, too sweet or too greasy. We ordered about 8 dishes between the 2 of us (portions are pretty small), and only 2 of them (both seafood) were good. The rice and noodle dish were particularly gross, it felt like i was chewing on salty brown sugar. And ironically other dishes made the toast taste like it basically had zero flavor. I'd recommend jua or atoboy for a similar price and much better set of flavors.

Last night we stopped by Little Mad for the first time and were totally blown away. The vibes and service were top notch. We sat at the bar area and were impressed by the entire experience beginning to end. Our drinks were delicious and very well made (especially the Yuzu one). Little Mad was very accommodating to my gluten allergy, and I was surprised to have so many options to choose from. The baby oksusu was my favorite dish, and I wish I would have ordered my own so I wouldn't have had to share with my husband haha. It was perfect. Our server was amazing, and every single dish was creative, delicious, and well curated. We will definitely be back! 10/10 across the board.
No comment
No comment

I took my boyfriend out to Little Mad for his birthday and I have no regrets. The restaurant was very aesthetic and everyone was very welcoming and kind. Justin was one of our servers and he was wonderful. He told us what was in our meal as he served it to us as well as telling us how everything was made. Great conversationalist too!! The food was delicious as well. I highly recommend the mad toast and beef tartare. *chefs kiss*
No comment
No comment
No comment

I very much enjoyed an extended evening here. The staff is wonderful and the food is incredible. In my opinion, the lighting fixtures are a little too close to the table (we kept hitting our heads on it), and there are too many tables (removing just one table would allow an extra few inches of space for enter and exiting, not to mention distance from chatter) which was a little uncomfortable for me (even pre-pandemic), but those are my only two grumbles. Next time I'll just go with an additional person, so we'll be sat at the bigger tables which thankfully are further apart from one another. Because, again, the food here is incredible, and just a bit more comfort would make everything that much more enjoyable, all things considered... I will be returning soon!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing. Totally surprised by the food, I knew very little about the concept of the restaurant. Every dish was beautifully presented and the flavors were very savory and just full of lovely ingredients. Every was very tasty and worth it. It is a place I would want to return.

Chef Sols restaurant is a masterpiece of fine dining and authentic Korean flavors mixed in with the flavors of New York. Even sitting at the bar was an amazing experience! I went last Saturday to a very packed restaurant. Mad toast was amazing, rice was amazing! Perfect mixture of rice and that bone marrow was absolutely to die for. Seeing all the chefs so passionate about food is why this restaurant is an absolute jewel

This place is a hidden gem. Very small restaurant with excellent, outside-the-box cuisine. I had excellent service and the atmosphere is warm and minimalist chic. I can't say enough good things about this place. I tried to come in a few nights ago but they had a James Beard foundation private event going on. Need I say more?
No comment

Little Mad is located in Nomad. You'll be mad about Korean fusion! Every dish is a hit. A note of caution for those with COVID-phobias: the staff wears no masks, and there are no partitions between tables. Music vibe is party mode. They recommend three dish to a person. I would recommend four. Will return for the rest of the menu which I haven't tried yet. ( I shared 9 photos. How many showed up??? I'm frustrated with Yelp!)
When it's busy you can't hear yourself think.  So much that it's difficult to order. The food is good but the room is so loud that it's uncomfortable, especially if you get some screaming people.

What a meal! First off, the space is fantastic: warm, inviting and sexy. The cocktails were amazing and original. We ordered everything on the menu, and It was all prepared absolutely perfectly. You can add truffles, caviar and uni to anything on the menu, which of course we did, and chef Sol came out personally to do the table side presentation. I can't recommend this place enough, it's only been open for a short time and it's already someplace really special. Definitely will be going back.

Best meal of the year. Yes I know what I said :) as an Asian American this wasn't only an amazing culinary experience but also little nostalgic. Have Asian pear paired with yellowtail standing up was a flavor texture combo of my dreams. There was no bad dish. Steak AMAZING. Match puff AMAZING. Rice with mushroom and bone marrow AMAZING.
No comment

Excellent food overall, with generous additional samplings in the tasting menu. Timing of the main and dessert was delayed and caused us concern about getting to our show on time, but otherwise very good.

Food was very yummy and interesting / creative but the atmosphere and service needs work. When the door opens half the restaurant is frozen cold because there isn't a curtain or entryway to help reduce cold air. We asked to be reseated because of this and were given a bit of a run around before being seated at the "bar" in the back - which is basically just a drink station for servers. The seats to the bar are poorly designed and u have to sit sideways to fit your feet. And there's no hooks for ur purse or coat - who designs a modern restaurant in 2021 without coat hooks? And we could hear the chef rudely yelling at his staff like a Gordon Ramsay wannabe. Won't go out of my way to come back.
Excellent food.  Not sure why this place isnt packed all the time.  This is michellin level restaurant, go try before they get too busy which is inevitable
No comment
Super amazing food and service. Chef Sol showed creativity. I liked the beed tartare and pig ear the best but other dishes were also great. Need to definitely try the soju-based Madgroni.

Food is mediocre for the size and price. The service and ambience is amazing though. I really wasn't blown away by anything. They suggest you get 4 plates for 2 people which ends up being over $100 and you leave hungry.
We had scallops, bone marrow / mushroom rice, yellowtail, and pig ear salad (least recommend). All were tasty and fresh, but portion was really small. Service was wonderful!

Service and staff were very pleasant. We were seated quickly, and each server was kind and took the time to explain all dishes to us. The ambiance of this restaurant is definitely not romantic- loud rap music playing and tight seating. It has a very modern and city vibe to it, which is fine, as long as that's  what you're looking for. That aside- food was atrocious. We had the steak and lobster as our hot dishes- the only edible portion of the meal. The cold dishes were grotesque- I was afraid to eat them. Admittedly, presentation was beautiful, but good lord, the food went down bad. Both my boyfriend and myself had stomach issues all night. Crab tempura was barely a whole bite, and honestly it tasted like low quality sushi crab. The complimentary snacks served at the beginning of the tasting were also insulting. One of the snacks is a poached egg with what tasted like stale dollar store croutons thrown on top. Disgusting. Somehow, the scallion pancake was worse. The cocktail wasn't terrible. It was strong and a good portion was served. The noodle tasted like spruced up ramen noodles also bought from dollar general, and the Mad Toast costs $25 and is about the size of a dollar bill folded in half. This whole meal with tip cost nearly $300, which makes the experience that much worse. I will never return to this place.

Conflicted to give only three stars because the service was warm and the dishes that were good were great but the dishes that weren't were so disappointing. First off, I ordered the honey cocktail and my friend ordered the yuzu one. The glasses came literally half full. Thought the serving size was odd. I had a second and it arrived full to the brim. Thanks. The amuse bouche were delicious and thoughtful. Great texture captured in those little fish. We LOVED the yellowtail starter, not too mention it's so stunning. Beef tartare was also delicious. Clam toast was literally what it was. Clams on bread. The flavor was not enhanced or masked by any other ingredients. Maybe we shouldn't have expected more? Had the noodles and the rice but unfortunately they were both incredibly under seasoned and the noodles were super oily. We both went home and ended up feeling quite sick after the meal. I may chalk up the not too impressive first impression to the restaurant still being in its infancy and wouldn't be opposed to going back in the future.
Delicious and inventive and pretty! It is tasty food art and the cocktail was great too! I am definitely recommending it to friends a d returning for more!
No comment

The appetizers are great but when it comes to the mains they are so clearly trying to give you as little as they can. The chicken is more breading than anything else. Basically anything you order is dominated by the least expensive ingredient. Wine pours are woefully small and the selection is sub par.
The service was great. But the food was salty and overcooked. Expect to spend $100+ pp if they order 2-3 dishes as they're very small.
Every dish was so delicious!!! Great ambience and excellent service!! Feels very modern yet welcoming! Highly recommend!!! Two thumbs up!!!!
No comment

Mediocre food and small portions. Wouldn't recommend the Korean Fried Chicken or the Noodle dish in particular. Oxtail Ravioli and Galbi were decent. Overall though the food just isn't worth what they charge.
Great place to order multiple dishes and share. Can come into have a full meal or just enough to have with your drinks. Great vibes!
One of the best meals I had! Everyone must try this place. I suspect this will soon be on Michelin.

Seriously top notch. Every dish we had was delicious, inventive, and unique. Service by Shanti was warm and not overbearing. She made great recommendations. Jean runs a tight ship. Impressive restaurant and look forward to returning.

Wow. I can't wait to come back before they become too hot with their Michelin stars. Dishes are super flavorful with creativity. Korean food with BAM! Server is super well trained and knowledgeable. I can't wait to come back!!

I came here a few nights ago with family and we had  the most WONDERFUL experience. The space and ambiance were super cool- exposed concrete, minimalist lighting, great music. Our server was the most bubbly, delightful person- so thorough, sincere and adamant about making sure that our meal was perfect. We tried nearly everything on the menu and it did not disappoint! Every dish was memorable - the flavors were so thoughtfully conceived and perfectly executed! From beautiful plating, to the unique seasonal imported and local ingredients list, to table side finishing by the chef himself, to the at once simple yet complex flavor and texture profiles- you get a top notch fine dining experience, but at a fraction of the cost and without the pomp and pretension.  I can't wait to go back!!

A well thought out play on Korean inspired food with a nice twist of French and Italian flare. Food was all done proper with good execution and the service was up to par with the food. Very impressed with everything considering they just opened.

Another 5-star dinner at Little Mad!  How nice to walk into a restaurant for your 2nd time and the Manager and Chef recognize you from your last visit about 5 months ago?!?!  Their team kills it with hospitality!  Food is just amazing and love menu changes often depending on seasonal ingredients.  Looking forward to our next visit!
No comment

I was invited to dinner at this new restaurant that opened up in Flatiron last month. The food was amazing. We ordered the oysters, beef tartar, mad toast, head cheese, soft shell crab, noodles, and the rice (almost half of the menu lol). My girlfriend was hesitant in trying the head cheese but surprisingly found the flavors to be very delicious. The chef even came out to greet us and scraped the bone marrow onto the rice dish. This place is definitely worth trying :)

I never review on yelp, but just had to for this place. Can't say enough good things about it from the food to the service to the cocktails. Super original. Had the yellowtail, the wagyu, and the sea bass. Can't wait to come back!
Cost/portion size/food quality proportionality is heavily distorted. Staff was nice. Seating on benches was uncomfortable. Plywood walls lacked ambiance.
Excellent food. Great ambience. The owner is very friendly. I highly recommend ordering one of their cocktails!

Had an amazing dining experience at Little Mad. The service was impeccable and our waitress and the whole crew were so nice to us. The chef even came out and chatted with us for a little while preparing one of our dishes. The food is also excellent and not only that, it was fun to eat. For example, the beef tartare came with a small hammer to break up the chips that accompanied it. In addition to the tartare, my favorites were the Yellowtail, the noodles with duck, and the bone marrow rice, but truly every dish I had was delicious. This is definitely a great new place in the city that should be checked out.

This is a really fun spot to eat in. The variety of the menu and restaurant interior are all great. I don't think there was anything I've tried that didn't taste  amazing here. With everything open, you can see the chefs do your cooking; they all seem really talented.
Can't wait to come back. Delicious Korean/French mashup. Fun and playful with great wait staff. But there is serious cooking going on here.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I was on a little adventure in Williamsburg and was looking for a spot to do work and have breakfast. They have Friday brunch! I had a Huevos con Chorizo! It was yummy! It comes with a free drip coffee which was some of the best drip I have had in awhile! Atmosphere was very cute which probably gets cuter in the evening! Will def come back when in Williamsburg!

Wow this place is amazing. I went there with an hour left before closing but the staff never made us feel like we needed to rush and leave. I ordered a tequila based drink with passionfruit. For app we got the elote and chicharrones. The corn was delicious but definitely not a big enough portion. the chicharrones were good but the pepita dip was really what made it. portion was also small though, 2-3 chunks. For meal, I ordered the carne asada tacos and they were amazing! so tasty. the tortilla was slightly crunchy with a nice layer of melted cheese. The meat was deliciously flavored. I also added some of the pepita dip and it brought a tasty balanced smokey kick. The staff was very nice and helpful. Im dreaming of going back again soon.
No comment
No comment

What a hidden gem! Been meaning to come here but wasn't expecting much. I kinda thought it was just a bar that served food it's hard to tell from the outside. Everything was so on point! We got the tuna tostadas, fish tacos and vegan chorizo potato tacos (the vegan "chorizo" was actually mushroom based was excellent). We'll be back looking forward to trying more things.
No comment
Delicious margaritas!!!! Very well made. Nice ambiance, still a fairly new place but hospitality is great here
This is one of the most amazing experiences of Mexican cuisine with an amazing view of nyc! LOVE IT!!
Getting our drink on and eat on. We samples everything guacamole, elote, fish, steak tacos, chicken milanesa, truffle fries and the most delicious arugula  thanks Gigi for accommodating us
Great food, service and ambiance. The tacos are great. Drinks are really tasty. Don't miss the ahi tuna tostada, carne asada tacos and the guac. Bonus, there's a cool lounge downstairs on weekends!

If you're looking to transport yourself to a different culture for an evening, look no further than this exquisite Mexican restaurant. From the moment you walk in, the festive atmosphere and warm welcome puts you right at ease. The flavorful enchiladas and spicy tacos can only be matched by the stunning presentation of the food. Don't even get me started on the refreshing and fruity margaritas! The friendly wait staff further enhances the experience, providing impeccable service. All in all, one of the best Mexican restaurants I have come across!

Great new spot near domino park!  Beautiful interior, very fun atmosphere, delicious food & drinks - the goat cheese balls were a stand out dish, definite must try!  Great service & friendly staff :) excited to come back and try the rest of the menu!
Fantastic neighborhood place - warm and welcoming....tamales are amazing....can't wait to come back and try more...

Xolo is a very welcome addition to the Domino Park neighborhood! The food is thoughtful, creative, and delicious. The cocktails look great - I love the Watermelon-Jalapeno Margarita so much, I've never ordered anything else - and the staff is so friendly! I would absolutely recommend the Fried Goat Cheese, the Stuffed Poblano, and any of the tacos. Don't miss their AMAZING desserts!
No comment
This is our new go-to Mexican spot in the neighborhood! Excellent, high-quality food; tasty drinks; great service and ambiance. Everyone should eat at Xolo!

Great food and service. Food is amazing the combination of flavors it was on point. A great place to enjoy good food and spend a great evening with friends. Love the location and the amazing view of the Williamsburg Bridge and the city lights makes this restaurant/bar the perfect spot.

This place is a gem! Wonderful food, staff, and space (including separate bar downstairs). We had the watermelon mezcal margaritas, breakfast tacos, flautas and it was all lovely! Staff was super courteous and inviting. 10/10 will be returning.

I absolutely love this restaurant. The staff is friendly and very welcoming from the second you step inside. The food is delicious and well portioned. The non happy hour margaritas are divine and perfectly prepared with more than enough tequila.  Love it! The only con is the happy hour margaritas lack enough tequila. The bar downstairs, Bar Milagros is a nice space and fun. The drinks are all good and strong. This restaurant and bar are definitely a great addition to the neighborhood. I will keep going back!!!
Great food! Great Cocktails! Go go go!!! Nice place, nice people. Fun time. We will be back for sure!
Their food is excellent, their vibe and service is also amazing!  We had an amazing time and will definitely come back!
The Thai Iced tea here is top tier. The interior is new to my eyes and such a compliment to the amazing service given. new fav spot:) :)
staffs are very nice & friendly, ramen is okay, interior design looks good and clean.
Great food, service and atmosphere! Had birthday dinner with friends and we would all come back.
No comment
