No comment
No comment

The best parts of our dinner were the appetizers. The popcorn chicken was delicious and the garlic chili edamame deliciously seasoned. The soft boiled egg was also perfectly cooked. Unfortunately, the mega ramen left something to be desired. The pork was on the dry side, and the broth was not flavorful enough.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here with my friend and decided to get the combination set which is perfect for 2 people and included 2 ramens, popcorn chicken and two desserts. We got lucky and were seated in the honey combs which made the experience 10x better. Food was delicious, really loved the Kyushu ramen. As for the desserts, they were light and not too sweet! Service was great, there was a call button on each table which made it easier to get the waiter.

New Kyuramen and matcha maiko. Cant believe there's a matcha maiko inside Kyuramen. The place itself is huge and spacious. Food wise, I love all their appetizers and their classic pork broth ramen. Overall it's a nice spot to grab quick lunch.
No comment

Make sure you make a reservation. I had one for 2 people at 7pm on a Friday, and there was still a long wait. It's so jammed pack inside too. The interior design is very nice though. I got to sit in one of those hexagon booths on top. Getting a staff to take my order was a little difficult since it was so busy. I had to ring the bell multiple times to get someone's attention. The popcorn chicken was juicy and crispy. I didn't like the ramen's broth that much. However, the toppings were great, especially the pork. It was very soft.
No comment

Clearly they win on creative seating and design.  Where they also excel is good food in large portions. The crispness of the flakes on the vegetable spring roll was amazing and filled with such flavor it was like biting into a buttery cloud. The juicy popcorn chicken bites were so delicious that they melt in your mouth. And the plates while small were enough for three people. I have tons of leftovers to devour. And before you leave they give you a towel and a mask. Lovely!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Super fast service. Really tasty broth. The noodle is on point not over cooked. The pork is nicely cooked and melts in your mouth.

Gorgeous new location with a cool bar area and honeycomb seating. Very clean and well cared for with super attentive staff. The ramen itself was a little disappointing, but not bad. Just not as flavorful as some kimchi ramen that I've had in a few other places.
No comment
Dinner here with friends tonight, yummy food, friendly service, and amazing ice cream! Love it!n

Came here with no reservation for a dinner and was seated in the honey comb seat. Loved the decor in the restaurant! I got white garlic kyushu tonkotsu shio ramen. The portion size is perfect for me! The meat is just the right size! Not too thin and not too thick and has just the right amount of slices! It is perfect for someone who couldn't eat a big portion at a time! The matcha pudding has just the right amount of sweetness and the sakura jelly tastes good! It wasn't tasteless at all

This new restaurant interior design is so cool !! The so called honeycomb is inane ! Atmosphere here is soooo awesome . Food is also nice , my favorite is number 6 , and fried oyster soooooo tender and crispy . Also the purple photo chips is my son's favorite ！ staff here are very friendly and welcoming too . They offered and handed us the little hand wipes right after we seat down . I feel a little surprised cuz I never got treated like this in any other restaurants. All in all the whole experience is great :) will definitely come back . Hope they will keep this good service standard and food standards !!!!

I have seen this place everywhere online but stumbled across this location randomly before they had their grand opening. Came back a week later to try it. The decor is very nice and cute. I ordered the combo meal; which comes with a side of Thai iced tea and a pork bao. The  ramen was great and not too salty, I wish they had more than one shrimp in it tho. Popcorn chicken was delish, can't really go wrong with popcorn chicken and I'm a sucker for Thai iced tea and it was very good. The service is good. There is a call button if you need assistance. 4/5 only because the pork bao took at least 10 mins to come out after all the food was dropped and the one piece of shrimp, other than that everything else was amazing.

It's a great and nice cozy ambiance.  Surprisingly enough it was crowded on Lunar New Year day, but wait time wasn't so bad.  The downsize the entrance hallway is pretty narrow which is a bit hard to get into if there's massive people just standing there. Highly recommend that you should reserve a table ahead of time.  The food and service was great.  I don't mind returning again.
Today was my daughter's birthday and I must say, the food was great and the customer service was even better! I will definitely recommend this place to anyone!
This place is so good! The ramen was great.  Even better when you get to sit in the fun booths!. Definitely check it out if you are in Chinatown.
Amazing! Very clean and great service. Highly recommend the hot ramen and the additional spices you can add.

We visited the Kyuramen in Chinatown last night. We walked in but It was about an hour wait for a table so we were able to get a seat at the bar. The menu is pretty self explanatory. We tried the Fried Oysters, the MEGA Ramen which was okay. We also tried the Chicken Ramen which was also good, the chicken was not dry. The Oysters were the selling point! Not many non-pork options or more seafood options. Majority of the menu was pork. We also tried Thai Tea which was okay nothing too fancy. We would go back but it would not be a regular ramen spot. Not bad, just not worth waiting more than 15 minutes for a table.

I really enjoyed kyuramen! Their interiors are so cute, and I love sitting in their honey comb booths. Their kimchi ramen is so good, and they have soooo many appetizers to choose from. I espcially love their popcorn chicken, purple sweet potato fries and takoyaki. If you're a fan of Thai iced tea, the one at kyuramen is so good!  Highly recommend checking them out :)

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Great food cute decor! Definitely recommend to anyone in the area. Came with family and loved it.
This place is super cute and the food is delicious. I came in a group of 4 and they sat us quickly. I would definitely come again!
Came here twice with friends and date. Super cute ambience and the service was good. Omurice 10/10! Karaage chicken was really crispy and flavorful too.
The decor is very stylish and very well put together. The food is decent. The fried oyster is a little on the filling side.
Very good service! I would definitely come back again. My favorite is the Spicy Ramen

Came after work in the middle of the week and was quickly seated. The staff was attentive and friendly. If its your first time here you don't feel pressure to order right away. Definitely a place to try either with a group of friends or an intimate date.

The ramen was decent. Service was unimpressive. It was not busy at all yet they were absent and absentminded. The host had no charm at all. Food was on the slow side. We ordered appetizers which never arrived. The ambience was cute but the lighting was painfully bright and the music was blasting.
No comment
Amazing atmosphere! Went in on a Monday afternoon and was seated promptly by the host. Good selection of food
Great food, Great Service. The decoration and designs of the dining space is not only full of antiques, and a large of space between the tables. We are feel so comfortable and will come back again.

The servers are super nice, they told us about their deals and specials while ordering. The restaurant is pretty and the music is nice. And we were offered a free drink for writing the review! The food looks delicious so far.
Service was excellent! The kimchi ramen #15 was delicious especially with the combo, the bao was great! Definitely going back!

We went here for lunch and ordered two different ramen so we could try different ones. We waited for 26 minutes and asked the waiter what was happening because we saw other people eating who had come in after us? The waiter said there was a problem with the order and said we could wait another 20 minutes or cancel the order and leave. We waited, the ramen came warm not hot, very bland soup and the same one even though we ordered different soups? Not good.
Amazing ambiance and great service. Very efficient service system - there is a button to call the server over on the wall
Delicious ramen and the ambience was super nice! Reasonable price as well and a wide variety to choose from

So i was going thru instagram and found this place. We went yesterday and it was packed. The waiter really nice and told us 30/45min but it was way quicker than that. The inside is really nice so we got sat in the wooden mural tables. Really cool and private. The thai iced tea and lemonade are pretty good. But if they had an alcohol license and serve alcohol would of been a major boost. Anyway onto the food. He started with the popcorn chicken really good only thing missing was any type of sauce to dip the chicken in. Then we got the omurice with the demi glazed sauce it was pretty good. And finally the ramen. This is why my 3 stars bc its a ramen spot and the ramen wasn't 5* worth. Missing something the broth was way too sweet missing salt and something else as well. We had the number1 and number2 ramen. The desert was delicious we had the mango mille crepe cake. Anyways I wouldn't go back for the ramen but if im ever around and want some finger picking food then it will do.
Great food and nice layout. Spicy tonkatsu ramen was good and had an unexpected peppercorn spice taste
The staff is very attentive and decent food selection. Wish they have some salad options. Love the cute design here.
No comment
So fire very fire customer service. The ramen was good and very fire. I really recommend getting the fried shrimp. Servers are very nice.
Legitimately one of the best ramens I've ever had! so flavorful! and the chili oil is fresh and delicious!
this place is soo cute and the seating area is unique. the staff were also very welcoming.

I feel like it's my duty to balance out the 4.8 star rating on Google and Yelp. For this price point, there are better ramen options in the city for food taste/quality (eg. menkoi sato, ichiran, toribro), but the vibe/ambiance here is more modern/trendy (if you're more interested in that than just food); definitely some cute seating! I sat at the bar which was spacious and nice for a party of 1. I ordered combo A (white garlic shoyu ramen) and found the noodles to be overcooked and the broth to be average (no special character/body); chasu was tender but nothing special. I also ordered fried oysters as an app and thought they were a great app, but they weren't a must-try item. I saved the bao to eat later (didn't really need it but it's the same price to order the pudding and ramen so thought i'd order the set since it's a better value). I'm glad I tried the matcha pudding, but note that it's small/personal-sized and it's definitely not concentrated with high quality matcha. If you want the latter, get a soft serve from the place attached T the front! Service was good until the end - had to wait more than 10 min for my card to be run, but the staff was really friendly. Overall, I think this is a decent spot for the neighborhood but don't expect it to blow your mind.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came here for the chicken sandwich special on Thursday for $8..fine print u have to buy a cocktail..really wasn't expecting that, but no biggie. Ordered the sandwich with a margarita came out to $22. The sandwich was so delicious, it was kinda on the sweet side, wish it had more spicy..but never the less..I called myself trying to eat half and save the rest for later..I ate the whole thing ..the absolute perfect crunch..loved the flavor..sooooo goooood, I almost bit my finger. I'm looking forward going back Wednesday for trivia night..and karaoke..
No comment

We stopped in for dinner. The bartender was new, so he didn't know how to make any of the drinks; we ordered beer instead. Our friend ordered a cocktail and it had at least twice the amount of liquor in it. My fiancé and I split the Big Mek ($24). It was delicious and perfectly cooked to order. I ordered an extra side of sauce to dip the fries into and it was the perfect accompaniment. A good time.
No comment
The sandwich in that article looks nothing like what they served me. Must have been many years ago. Even so, $20 for a meatloaf (meatball) sandwich filled with breadcrumbs is a shame.
No comment

Closer to 3.5. Came for brunch. Got the latke tostada and the burrito. The tostada was decent but the latke was a bit burnt. The burrito had very delicious potatoes in it. I thought each dish was a bit pricy for what you got, but it did the job.

column3: Huntingdon Valley, Lower Moreland Township, PA
column6: No comment
No comment

If you're in the Domino Park area and feigning for some gastropub then Mekelburg's is for you. They offer a weekly $5 mekelburger special every Tuesday. Yes, you heard that right. $5! The limit is two per order and you must order a drink. I ordered a mekelburger and a basket of fries. The burger was well done yet juicy and satisfying. And the fried onions were a great topper. Be forewarned that the basket of fries is massive; it's large enough for 2-3 people. There's ample indoor and covered outdoor seating on the sidewalk/street. Staff enforces social distancing and Covid prevention regulations by wearing masks and requiring guest to show ID and proof of vaccinations for indoor dining.
Huge local beer selections. Grimm, Other Half, Evil Twin get your empanadas in the morning though!
No comment
No comment

Love it here! Every dish I've had has been consistently really good! The grocery store inside is amazing for kind of expensive but unique items. The best deal is going on Monday wings for $0.25 (only for first four and have to buy a drink) and they are huge and really excellent! Also loved the creamy Mac and cheese and half salad half soup combo.

I have lived in Williamsburg for 14 years now and am so glad this wonderful restaurant is part of the new Domino Park area.  Anyone who reads my reviews here knows I'm a fan of french toast, and Mekelberg's babka french toast is one of the most delightful (and delectable) items you can find.  The vibe is always fun, the staff is always nice, and the owners are a LOT of fun to talk with when you can catch them.  Highly recommended for anyone living or visiting this revitalized part of town.
No comment

Another awesome meal at Mekelburgs. Ate too much! But it was worth it. I love the duck banh mi. I've gotten it a few times now and the bread is delicious, the duck flavorful, and the toppings add a perfect balance. Finally tried the Buffalo wings this time and they are to die for! Such a thick crunchy exterior with a perfectly moist flavorful interior, and they're very big. I just wish wing night was actually a deal. You have to buy so much beer, its not a good deal unless you were already planning on getting drunk on a Monday. We even scored free donuts because we were there when the cafe was closing up. The guava donut was amazing!
No comment
I love the unique selection of beer, groceries and cheese! Mekelburgs has a fun atmosphere, friendly staff and a delicious menu.
No comment

Great burgers! Amazing staff! I came in during one of their games nights. As such I sat outside since the seating inside was full. Had an amazing time and the cocktails were great too! I had some sort of pina colada - I was pleasantly surprised.
No comment
My 2nd favorite spot in BK.... After Mekelburgs on Grand! Love the food, the vibe, the people!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Since it's on the way to the Domino Park dog run, I've here 2-3x a week. They have basically everything you need for all times of the day between the cafe window, market, and the restaurant/bar. The only section I'd avoid is the prepared deli sandwiches and sides, which have been rather disappointing. I'm here most frequently for the chai lattes, which is some of the best and spiciest I've had in the city (I've heard they make the concentrate in-house). Inside, they have allllll the gourmet snacks, charcuterie, and chocolates, as well as some not-so-basic (think: Carbone's pasta sauce) pantry staples. Their huge fridge of craft/local beers sticks out as well. I've also enjoyed their chicken wings (although the Nashville hot isn't very hot) and huge breakfast burrito. The porchetta sandwich got a meh from my family for being too greasy.

If there are chicken wings in heaven, I hope they are half as good as Mekelburg's. The breaded wings are crispy, juicy, and massive. Probably my favorite wings in NYC. And this is from a couple who prefer naked, not breaded wings. The blue cheese is the standard for which all other blue cheese dips should be measured.  Also, this is sacrilege but the Mek & cheese may be the best pasta dish in NYC. A million other good things to say about this place from the store, the beer selection, and the sandwiches. Everyone must go here!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: West New Haven, New Haven, CT
column6: Absolute mouthwatering deliciousness. From the unbelievable sandwiches to the decadent babka... yes please! We will be back!!
Food is delicious. Owners are lovely. Always try to stop by when I am in the neighborhood.
Everything is amazing. But order the Porchetta sandwich. Just do it. And that salt baked potato with the caviar. Oh yeah. And the meatloaf. And the duck bahn mi. So good.
No comment

Manager and staff was rude.  I went there off of reference giving from a friend of mine and I have to say I would never go to this place again.  For the money I spent I expect to be at least treated with respect.
No comment

I had high hopes and was disappointed by the food. The fries were easily the best part, crispy and flavorful. The burger had a solid sauce, but it was very greasy. It left me feeling nauseous from the grease.
Literally my favorite place in Brooklyn. Mouth waters thinking about every item. Incredible creativity and quality from the mekelberg crew
No comment
No comment

Mekelburg's is so great. I used to be a regular at the Clinton hill location 5+ years ago and was so thrilled that they opened this Mekelburg's location which is a bit easier to visit from Manhattan when I am in town. The meatloaf sandwich is literally the greatest thing ever, and the coffee situation at this location is a major bonus compared to the more limited options back in the day at the grand location (not sure if that location updated to a full coffee bar since I moved). Definitely the "order every sandwich" type of place, and I appreciate their inclusive hiring policies.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Love the fried chicken sandwiches here! And market is awesome too - tons of delicious (if somewhat pricy) items
I ordered the ducka, ducka sandwich. Absolutely hands down delicious.  Would order again daily if I could!
No comment
No comment
No comment

A grocery store lunch counter and bar? Yes, yes it is. And it's amazing. Breakfast through late night, the place is great. The MekChicken fried sandwich is the peak of the menu. But the real money is the beer selection. 20 on tap. Lots of small breweries. Great variety. From a lovely German Pilsner to a 13% strawberry stout (I definitely ignored that one). Any who, really under appreciated spot with excellent food, service and brews.
Food and beer is delicious. Staff is really friendly. Saturday night karaoke is a lot of fun!
No comment
Love this location and the one in Clinton Hill. The sandwiches are all very good and so are wings!
No comment
I ordered through caviar and during a time where we are supposed to be cautious, they were not. I just found a piece of paper in my sandwich. So gross! Never ordering from you again

Cool store, awesome bar/restaurant, and genuinely nice people working there. Order Opehlia's Downfall to drink and a Slab Baked Potato with bacon (pork belly). Specialty cocktails are pricey, but definitely worth it and made with love. Lots of comfort food here. I never thought I would pay $12 for a baked potato, but the pork belly on top made it worth it. Nom nom.

Hot chicken sandwich was delicious but puny for what they are charging. Ive been to their other location and I thought the sandwich size there was more respectable from what I remember. Fries were terrible. They tasted like they had been either sitting under a heat lamp for days or microwaved. Too dry, barely salted and needed a lot of ketchup to make them taste good. Also why can't they offer a small size? For one person the side portion is gigantic. I had to throw away most of them.

Come here every so often for overpriced groceries. As a pregnant woman, I have to use the restroom often. Today, I was told that despite buying $40 worth of groceries I was not allowed to use the restroom - that it is only for dine in customers. Not a single person dining in in sight. Abysmal service, will never go back- surely I can find $19 babka elsewhere.

Foods great, people are fine, deals are deceiving. Good wings and sandwiches, if you go dine in you'll be confused before you sit down, over or under order, and be at the mercy of the unpleasant outdoor staff. Good luck.
No comment
No comment

i repeat do NOT order the "mek and cheese" it is absolutely the most disgusting meal i've ever had. $17 down the drain! it tasted like a bunch of random  smelly cheeses with a hint of buffalo ranch sauce. i am so upset with my order and will never ever try any other food there. if you're craving mac and cheese please for the love of God , go elsewhere.
No comment
Babka! Did I say babka? They have both! And lots of other fun things here too. From fresh breads to great pastas!
I'm so glad there's a Williamsburg location now! Hands down some of the best sandwiches I've ever had, plus they have tons of specialty snacks in the store and yummy cocktails (rosé sangria anyone?).
read the owners comments on other reviews if you want a taste of this store's character
No comment

OMG, Mekelburg's was truly spectacular. It was perfect. Impressive menu and wonderful Mekelburger. The service was also perfect and everybody was nice. Amazing! Will return and recommend this spot always.

We ordered our food at 6:55PM on July 4th.  After checking on the food a half hour later, we were told that they were particularly busy and a bit behind but the food should be coming soon.  We went to cancel our order by 7:45PM.  Before we could say that to the hostess, she said, "Sorry, the food's not ready yet".  So who knows how much longer we would have been waiting.  During the painful 50-minute wait, nobody came by to apologize, offer an appetizer on the house while we waited, or asked if we had the time to stay longer.  We left hungry, frustrated, and completely disregarded by the staff.
No comment

There isn't much I could say that I haven't already said about Mekelburg's in the Clinton Hill location review. This place is a little more roomy. They deliver in customer service, solid beer selection, and food. I had their Croque Meksieur. Crispy, crunchy, creamy, salty, and all other kinds of delicious. This hit the spot. I highly recommend it. My lady had the spicy fried chicken and waffles. Her dish was well prepared and tasty, HOWEVER, it can't stand next to that sandwich of mine. Go, get a big beer, the Croque Meksieur, and ENJOY!!!
No comment

Mekelburg's has such a crazy delicious and creative menu. The latke tostada was filled with lox (though could have had some more caviar) and pickled onions. The potato was definitely my favorite part and that slab bacon- wow. The prices are a little steep for the portion size, but overall flavor was spectacular. Would definitely go back!

The menu at mekelburgs was really appealing for my husband and I and we were looking forward to sampling their fare.  We were unfortunately very disappointed with the nannas meatloaf sandwich it was completely burned along the bottom and ruined the entire sandwich, it wasn't even like we could remove the burned meat because it was such a small portion.    The highlight was the Porchetta Sandwich crispy and salty delicious (personally I would have like more broccoli raab), lentil soup was just ok, to bland for my tastes.   I would dine again but probably at the location for quality control since we wound up having to share a sosandwich for lunch

Great spot to have a pre-dinner beer, if you're chronically early for dinner at Misi's next door (like I was, twice). I'll have to return to sample some of their food for a more well-rounded yelp review!
No comment

Went here as couldn't get into freehold. The service is really bad. We had to stand around for a while until someone finally came outside to seat us after walking in and out of the store until someone finally noticed. 3 stars because the Mac n cheese was good. The water tasted awful - and this is nyc so this is hard to mess up. The frose was fine - nothing special. When they delivered the rose they spilled it all over my friend. There are no bathrooms here so even if you drink your alcohol and naturally have to go to the bathroom, you have to go to the public restroom in the park. Overall not going back and not going to recommend it to anyone.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Super cute, roomy ( indoor & outside seating ) and right across from the new Domino Park if you prefer to take food to go ..... what more could you ask for!  Local heavy rotating taps ( currently 6/20 are Grimm). Sandwiches and small bites for any palate. A repeater ( especially when the summer weather is back )
No comment

This is a true gem. This place came highly recomended and I am so happy we choose the location that we did. Planted right in front of the new domino park this is a great place to pop in after a adventourous day enjoying brooklyns newest joyous destination. The look is easily dismissed as a neighborhood bodega or grocery/cafe. But really it was super accomedating for many of customers. From the gourmet grocer on the go to the happy hour wine enthusiast meckelburgs has a smorgasbord of fun for your hungry mouth hole!  We got there right at sunset and enjoyed a bottle of rose and watched the sun dissapeer into the skyline all while enjoying the cutest named burger ever. The mekelburger with an additional burger. The staff was so kind and accomedating. The staff brought out our meal and assisted us with the logistics and decisions. The mekelburger was perfectly assembled and deliscious. I love when a burger comes out perfectly sauced with mega savory yummers. The fries were so yummy made me wanna POP MY BOOTY! Speaking of popping after our mekelburger we enjoyed the cinnamon babka popper with cream cheese sauce. If only i could maintain a attractive figure and only eat this indefinitly. It was bu far superior to any donut ever.crispy creamy cinnamoney and addictive. With a nice reasonable price this was a huge highlight during my 2019 trip to NYC. Afterwards we went back to the park and investigated the fountains. I cant say kind enough things about the staff! BRAVO MEKELBURGS
No comment

This is such a great spot, they have a variety of artisanal meats/cheeses, groceries and made to order dishes that are all fantastic. Porchetta sandwich is a must have, I also recommend the frozen ravioli for a quick dinner. Staff is cool and helpful, they have trivia on Wednesday nights and a $10 lunch special that can't be beat. An overall great place to hang out and indulge.
Very happy that they opened in Williamsburg! Haven't been disappointed with anything on the menu. The sambal roasted oysters are a must-try. Also, an amazing selection of interesting craft beers.

I am absolutely blown away by the babka at Mekelburgs! It is so delicious. Especially when it comes out fresh from the ovens. Looking forward to trying the babka poppers and babka ice cream sundae. I only wish they were a little cheaper which is the reason they get 4 stars instead of 5. I'm sure I would be here every day if things were a bit more affordable. Overall, delicious baked goods and good coffee. Love that you can order from the window. This is extremely helpful when you have a dog and can't go into the store.
All my favorite people from the Clinton hill spot are now here. Will definitely keep coming back, hot chicken, tell me what you're missing.
No comment
Josie and Alex are the absolute best! They were so helpful this beautiful Fourth of July helping me stay nourished with a salad that was off the menu. I'm so grateful for them, I love this place!
I'm just going to provide 1 picture and the price of this egg sandwich. $9.00. Shoutout to the chocolate Babka tho.
Walked by and decided to walk into this market  / restaurant. Great sandwiches and lentil aoup is delicious. Definitely recommend for a quick bite and  a beer or glass of wine.

I accidentally ran into this place because I was thirsty and wanted to purchase a water. Never did I think that I would stumble upon the most amazing Charcoal beauty water. The ingredients in this water mesh so beautiful in my mouth I can't believe charcoal could taste this good. Shout-out to whoever came up with this brilliant idea. Can't wait to stop buy again and try their other options, really looking forward to this. I highly recommend this to everyone!
No comment

Great pastries, selection of products, and coffee! However, the service at the coffee bar is a little slow, especially for how few customers they get, and one of the baristas never really even acknowledges me every time I come in and every time I pay (not a huge deal, just a pet peeve and as someone in the hospitality industry, I take it as bit disrespectful) she doesn't hand my card or change back to me, just slaps it on the counter. Whatever. I get it, I was a barista; it can be a miserable job. But at least act a little friendly to customers.

The whitefish tartine, while unbelievably tasty, was the thinnest, smallest piece of baguette I've yet to see in my life. Why so small? All of their other dishes look to be of reasonable if not, larger than necessary portions. And for $10, its not the most expensive but 100% overpriced for what I received. I would have gladly paid another $3 for a larger slice of baguette or at least more whitefish slathered on it. There were parts of the bread that I could see, underneath a very thin schmear of spread. Otherwise, the place is super cute, the specialty grocery is like a condensed version of everything you'd ever want in your kitchen. The whitefish tartine needs some work or width though..
Overpriced -- a 3 ounce chicken sandwich costs $13+ with tax. Service was t bad and did not take very long, however.
Took our toddler to the 10 AM music class at Mekelburg's this morning. It was adorable and he loved it!!! The sandwiches, coffee and beer were absolutely fantastic!! Service was exceptional as well.

I went to the latest iteration of Mekelburg's the week after it opened. It was great, even better than the original one on Grand Avenue. There was more space and the food was just as delicious. Since Domino has gas stoves, I suspect there will be an even greater or different variety of food. On this visit, I ate the butternut squash-apple soup, the cracklings and pistachio cream amuse(?), the baked potato with pork belly (which I prefer to the cod), and the ducka ducka sandwich. The all were wonderful, just as good as they are at the Grand Avenue bar. The next time I'm in the city (in December), I'll be going again.
Everything we ate was delicious! The prep is so great that my husband who doesn't like anything with fish, loved the whitefish crostini. And the beer selection at the bar is any beer lovers paradise.

Mek's is amazing! The food, the drink options, the service and the store! Stop in for the most amazing sandwich of your life and leave with some bacon jam to go home and put on just about anything. I mean, it's bacon jam. Who else carries that?!

I don't need to say anything, but I will. HOLY LUNCH SPECIAL.  As someone who works in the neighborhood, and has to travel there for short afternoon work meetings, this place is perfect to work and reflect.  The beer selection is so on point. The food is so tasty, and the menu has something for everyone.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My shrimp and grits were so good! I mean what could go wrong when you serve something on a skillet? I loved the cheesy grits and the deliciously flavored shrimps. The place was very nicely decorated. The staff was friendly, and I think the owner even came out to talk to customers a couple of times. I would give them five stars if it wasn't for the cold breeze coming in every time someone opened the door. Try sitting further in to be more comfortable. I also appreciate that there were some street parking in this area. I will definitely be back for more!

Came for a weekday lunch with a friend. We knew they were new so we made reservations ahead of time. They were pretty empty at lunch and we were seated immediately. I got the Mac and cheese with chicken added and it was good, not great. The chicken didn't go well with the Mac and cheese flavor wise. Also one of us got pancakes and wasn't offered any syrup. I think they're still getting their feet under them and will figure that out.

Fast and delicious. We had the blt, avocado toast, French onion soup, and pretzel. Everything was fresh and delicious. The coffee mocha and latte was okay, good but small. Very glad they had oat milk. Would definitely go back for another lunch!
One of the best breakfast plates I've had in recent memory. The setup of the place is thoughtful and cozy, absolutely worth a stop.

I've always wanted to check this place out because I have a crush on one of the servers I don't know his name but my intuition is telling me it's Darius (i'm psychic) and my friends an i had like a really nice time eating the delicious food. Overall safe experience in a lovely neighborhood. Price reasonable, good deli cous and it gives the dimes quart neighbor hood a run for its money. Everyone who works here is east on the eyes. The clientele is stylish and down to earths. best place to take boomerangs on jnstagram and definitely taking my daughter here this week for her 18th birthdays

Comfortable, easy, delicious, and--when I came for brunch at least--uncrowded! Yes that rarest of birds, a walk-in-sit-down NYC brunch with great entrees at very fair prices. We had the shrimp & grits and breakfast special (two eggs, bacon or sausage, toast, potatoes and coffee or tea for $13!), really satisfying. Looking forward to trying dinner!
No comment
No comment
No comment
We found this great new spot in the hood. The place was clean, service was fast and the food was delicious!
Just wow! Absolutely amazing food. Chef Abby is really great as well. Definitely recommend!!
This place is so cute!! A friend and I had breakfast in here recently. We ordered BLTs and a side of steel oats and they were delicious and the restaurant had such a cute vibe! Love the decor.

Before realizing the place I was looking for was a culinary school in the back. I found this place to be a dope surprise. Had the cucumber margarita, a couple of them a breakfast sandwich and the grilled cheese. All items I recommend.

I'm so happy to have this restaurant in the Two Bridges/LES neighborhood. This has been my go-to oasis lunch spot. It's very chill here and the staff are great. I love how each table is nicely adorned with a small jar of lovely fresh flowers. Everything they serve here is delicious. I've had their Breakfast Special that comes with coffee, Passionfruit Toast, Full English dish, Steak-n-Eggs, and I always order a side of Avocado to go with every meal. Super yummy! Did I mention it's breakfast and dinner all day?!

I heard this place was fire but let me tell you... fire is an understatement. We had the baked eggs, the BEC and the French toast. All we bussing bussing differently. This place is the best breakfast in the world no kizzy
A great new addition to the neighborhood. Great prices and the coolest of vibes abound.

Bustling energy, young-ish crowd, good food, and friendly service! The tartine was a crowd favorite. The burger was delish, as were the chicken and shrimp meals. They apologized about the long wait for our food (before we even brought it up), explained how it is only their third week open, and generously waived our drink tab. I cannot wait to go back for brunch!

FANTASTIC new place! it is a little hidden, but look for the small neon "betty" sign in the window. The food was off the charts and reasonably priced. We had the baked eggs (both vegan and with bacon), the breakfast sandwich, and a gin gimlet. The baked eggs were perfectly seasoned with a tiny bit of kick and not too tomato-y, ordered an extra egg with the bfast sandwich which had gruyère, bacon and some delicious yellow sauce - totally filling - and the gimlet was the right balance, and not too sweet, perfect for a summer afternoon. The wait staff were so happy to be there and to be waiting on us! The place has great energy. The prices are low and the foodie enjoyment high. We went for brunch, but they have a bar in the back, so they will prob turn into the quaint local hangout in the evenings. GREAT new addition to the neighborhood.

column3: North San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: I just moved to the Lower East side and I have to say that the breakfast and coffee a Betty is some of the best that I've ever experienced in my entire life. I also have to say that the ambience and interior are incredibly modern and classic, not to mention that the staff is so incredibly kind (and very good-looking). You are missing out if you're not coming here for breakfast lunch and dinner and coming for drinks at night on the weekends.

Lovely spot with a nice calm atmosphere and amazing food. Really easy to share plates and feel satisfied while getting a great array of the menu. Breakfast all day for people that are into that. Our server Matt was super nice and accommodating. Great for a date night or dinner with a big group.

This place is so great we went back a second time! The staff is super friendly and accommodating and the food is incredibly delicious! Traveled with a vegan friend and we were both very happy with the vegan and carnivore options on their menu. Highly recommend!

Our family of 9, ranging in age from 13 to 75 had the most wonderful meal on Saturday, March 11, 2023.  The staff and service were wonderful, attentive, friendly and available.  Could not have asked for any better service. The menu was extensive with something appealing to all ages and paletes. My Berkshire Pork Chop was a definite winner as was the very unusual Banana Split. Others had filet mignon, shrimp cocktail, fresh fish of the day entree, burgers, pizza of the day and multiple chocolate cakes. Everyone was delighted with their meals!  Will most definitely return soon!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Excellent pre-theater dinner spot in the heart of Time Square. The decor is fun and classy, making the experience feel special. They serve fresh focaccia when you sit down, which is fluffy and delicious. I loved the duck carbonara - it was full of rich flavors. The creme brulee was also a tasty way to end the meal. If that weren't enough, our server was delightful. We'll definitely be back pre-show.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We had a day trip to NYC and were so happy to find gatsbys! What incredible atmosphere and service/staff! The food was incredible!!! We did the cheese tray and oysters to start; my husband had the lamb and I did seafood pasta; also he had a mocktail from the bar. We had JENNA as our sever, she was the SWEETEST and so knowledgeable of the menu and surrounding areas! She Had answers for all of our questions and was incredibly kind the whole time! Even when we were asking many many questions! If you go, definitely ask for Jenna, she is a hidden gem in that city!  Also the s'mores dessert, do not pass on it. Incredible, I'm still thinking about it!
No comment
I came here for a company dinner - we had our own private room. The waiters were so attentive and the drinks and food were abundant. I love the decor!
No comment
No comment

The service was GREAT. They even gave us free dessert which was the chocolate cake and was DELICIOUS . Furthermore the margarhita was alright I've definitely had better but the seafood pasta was delicious.

Decent food good atmosphere although a bit quieter than expected great service but food didn't really stand out.  The spring lasagna was good, but the broccolini was quite salty.   The eggplant was nice too. It's a decent pre-theater option in an area with not very many standouts.
No comment

Great restaurant with amazing food and service. Came here for dinner and was so pleased with everything. My friend has celiac disease and she had so many options, they should really brag about how GF they are we were so impressed. Highly recommend.
No comment

We came here on Christmas for the lamb chops. They ran out  just when we got there but the food was amazing. We started with the Crispy Calamari which was delicious. My daughter ordered the Pork Chop. My husband had the chicken and I got the king salmon. We had no complaints. The ambiance was beautiful, service was top tier and the food was really good.
No comment
No comment

OUTSTANDING!! Where to begin! First off our server was amazing. She was very knowledgeable and friendly. Our daughter is gluten free and come to find out there were plenty of options for her. The calamari was made with rice flour so this is her first in 2 years! She was beyond excited. Have to say it was some of the best I have eaten. She had the GF pasta and said was fantastic! I had the pork chop- so juicy. My other daughter had the Duck which was outstanding. Hubby had the rigatoni they make the pasta in house! Highly recommend! A must stop when in NYC! Very close to all the action but off the side street for a little calming moment! Beautiful Decor that made you feel right at home. Will be back!

My boyfriend and I had the most delightful time here. We are from Los Angeles and this was by far our favorite restaurant we visited on our trip. Everyone from Danny (I think the manager?) to Joey our INCREDIBLE server was so smiley and accommodating. We felt so comfortable and right at home. I have never felt more welcomed. The food. The food!!!! It made me feel LOVED. My boyfriend is so picky and he said the sliders changed his entire opinion on food in general. What a statement! I adore this place and we will be regulars when we return. We love you, Joey! Thanks for being a down to earth, cool guy. Cheers!
Excellent spot in Times Square. Great pizza, try the clam pie for sure! Food, drinks, location, service, all 5 stars!
No comment

Perfect meal beginning to end. Calamari and bread to start, pasta and branzino, burrata beet salad just yummy. Just off of Times Square with great ambiance nice decor and reasonable prices. I will go back.

My friends and I went here for dinner the other night. I loved how it was in Times Square and the menu had a little bit of everything. I'm so glad we went. The restaurant was lovely and I loved the Christmas decorations. I ordered the lamb which was perfectly cooked and very flavorful. Though we were all jealous of our friend who ordered the duck which was absolutely delicious. The staff was very friendly since we walked in and we loved our server Charity who was very kind and attentive. We were out celebrating my birthday and we all had an amazing time. Next time we're in New York we will definitely be back!
Drew and Lauren were absolutely phenomenal. We came for cocktails before our dinner and they were so attentive, and the drinks were delicious. I can't wait to come back. 100/10

seriously the best cocktails ever!!!! The limoncello French martini is by far the best drink anywhere. If you there, you need to have Lauren & Drew!!!! They are fun and fun free great recommendations.

Beautiful place with lovely decor and vibe! Food was delicious and large portions. Drinks are well made and tasty - grapefruit martini was so good! The best part was the service - every single person working was so kind and our server, Abbey, was delightful and helpful. She is a true gem! Can't wait to come back!

Wonderful service, Dianieri and else everyone was fantastic accommodating our late night post play arrival. We arrived in 2 groups, but we were welcomed with open arms. Great post Broadway spot with wonderful drinks!
Marcus was awesome. As a New Yorker he really made our night. He was attentive and most importantly he was honest. The food was awesome the cocktails were fantastic. 5 stars

It's pleasing to the eye, I liked the booths and the glass enclosed room. Excellent service by Bonnie, the managing staff is also very attentive. As for the food, it was just ok. The appetizer was a bit over fried, my main lamb ravioli, flavorful but a bit too al dente for me & needed to be warmer, the Bronzino dish was very good, deconstructed s'mores had interesting flavors and the Natella bombolini should be served warm.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Small and quaint. In the middle of the theatre district which is convenient. I was hesitant due to the fact is in a touristy part but was pleasantly surprised. The food was fabulous. Creative cocktails and beautiful space. Would definitely return.
Great food and ambiance! Best thing is that it is out of the way but still close enough to everything. We will definitely be back next year for our annual city outing.

Found this wonderful new place right off Broadway that just opened. Great bar, Fantastic staff that is just the nicest!! And the food - oh my!! Everything we had was phenomenal! We were in the city for 4 days and we kept coming back to Gatsby's Landing it was that good!!! Do yourself a favor and try it!
No comment
No comment

This is the perfect place to go if you like bland cold overpriced pasta. It's embarrassingly bad food considering the reputation of New York for having great Italian food. I would not be the last bit surprised if they are reselling frozen food at a huge markup to the tourists who don't know any better. The staff was friendly though so they deserve 1 star for that.
Loved the ambiance here. Cute place with a great menu. Service was great and we have an overall good time here.
No comment
Customer service is 5 stars. Wait staff and host were very attentive. Spring lasagne was delicious. My squid ink pasta smelled a little fishy, but tasted good. The cauliflower tabouleh was good.
No comment
Gorgeous atmosphere, delicious food, great cocktails and friendly service. Our new favorite place!
No comment

We had an amazing meal at Gatsby's landing Saturday night. The entire staff was so friendly. The host greeted us like old friends. Our waiter George was excellent. The food and drinks were delicious! The Gatsby Cosmopolitan and the Branzino were both excellent. My mom had the pork chop. It was huge and cooked perfectly! I had the espresso martini for dessert. So good! The interior of the restaurant is beautiful and not over crowded, like many restaurants in NYC. I would love to return the next time I am in the city!

Recently this month on a Saturday afternoon we came into Gatsby Landings to have a drink and appetizer before seeing a Broadway play.  We were cheerfully greeted at the door immediately and shown to a nice window table in the bar area.  Menus were provided and the bartender quickly came to take our drink orders as we looked the menu.  The restaurant has a nice classy feel inside and all of the staff were great.  The main event for the appetizers was the Crispy Calamari.  Not a crumb was remaining on the platter when we were finished.  The other appetizer ordered was the Zucchini Blossoms which was lightly breaded zucchini covered in a lightly whipped ricotta with a touch of honey, it was full of flavor.  Everything was so delicious that we decided to come back to the restaurant after the show for dinner.  Before leaving for our show, we made an evening reservation so we would know a table would be available.  When we arrived and sat at our table for dinner, the first thing we did (before looking at the dinner menu choices) was order the Crispy Calamari!  The menu items are very unique here, so don't expect this to be your typical dining experience.  For instance, I had the Spring Lasagna which was made with homemade lasagna pasta vegetarian style with a delicious creamy white pesto sauce.  The Spring Lasagna portion was just right but by the time I had my last bite I felt the fullness in my stomach.  Another dinner order from our group was the Branzino, a pan seared sea bass served with spinach and a wonderful sauce.  The food presentations on all of our dinners were top notch.  A Chef's Pasta of that day was a simple spaghetti and meatball dinner.  It was nothing simple, the homemade pasta was cooked to perfection and the fresh tomato sauce and huge meatballs were beautifully arranged in the bowl with fresh basil leaves arranged on top for decoration.  This perfectly located restaurant in the theater district is well worth a visit.  You will be greeted and served with a smile some delicious food and drinks.  We will be back!

While the space is nice, the service and food are not good. We spoke with the manager, who was friendly and wanted honest feedback. Unless they make significant changes to the kitchen and wait staff, I would not return.

Drew and Lauren ARE THE BEST bartenders IN NYC! They're kind, they suggested very good cocktails (the limoncello French martini is SPECTACULAR), and they were very attentive and amazing!!! Give them both a raise!

Disappointing and seriously overpriced. $45 for pasta-of-the-day that didn't didn't have any meat or fish is ridiculous, even for NYC standards. It cost the same as the lamb chops! It cost more than literally everything on the menu except the filet mignon and porterhouse for two!! That's absurd! Food was generally mediocre, the expensive pasta with mushrooms did not have many mushrooms and didn't taste like much, lamb needed seasoning, the squash blossoms were flat fried things that sound better than they were. The decor and ambiance were very nice, and the staff attentive, but with so many good places in NYC, I'd skip this one. Update to respond to the restaurant's comment below: there was NO STEAK on my pasta special. The dish he described was not at all what I got. My pasta was JUST MUSHROOMS and pasta.

Fantastic spot in Times Square! My wife and I found this place serendipitously during an afternoon visit to NYC. We loved everything! The Art Deco design and vibe are delightful and very relaxing, especially after experiencing the chaos of Times Square. The food and service were both top-notch. The best beef ragu I have had in a long time. We found this place by accident but next time in the city we will make a point to go back!

I must say I don't have high hopes for restaurants in the Times Square area but this place was a beautiful surprise! The food was amazing, beautiful decor and the service was just perfect. The staff were so friendly and helpful.  Just an amazing overall dinner and would highly recommend this place! This is my new go to place in Times Square!

The food, service and ambiance of this restaurant is phenomenal. Really enjoyed their pasta calamari and my friends loved their specials... the jalapeno margarita and espresso martini are a must try! A total gem if you're in Times Square area and want to have a lux dining experience.
Great food, service was very friendly and efficient. Food is expensive but nothing shocking for NYC. Enjoyed the pork chop and my sister loved the lamb chops. Also love the ambiance

Nice lunch here. Charred cauliflower was the special appetizer. It was good but very small for the price and it was just barely warm. Gnudi was the highlight here and duck carbonara was good but not as creamy as I had expected.
Five of us went last night. We had five different entrees. All excellent. Outstanding service. But pricey.

Gatsby's Landing is a beautiful space with a very relaxing feel.  The staff is happy to please and I had wonderful conversation with the owner and my server, Samantha.  She was very sweet and helpful.  The food was delicious and the drink was one of the best I ever had.  Absolutely will go back many times!

I can't believe this place has perfect ratings. I was hesitant to come here at first because of it, and have been fooled to before. We came here before a show at MSG and it was not worth 1 penny of our spent. The food was horrible for the price, no flavor. The place probably has good potential, but it's a fraud.
Lovely evening with fabulous service and delicious food! The bartender was also wonderful!

Really great food and service!! I was skeptical that a mid town tourist trap would be worth it and was very pleased to be proven wrong. The wait staff were very helpful and professional. We had the scallop special and it was amazing! Great cocktails too!
What a cute new spot! A must try. Went for lunch and had multiple small plates to share. Everything was excellent. The decor is also fitting for the name. Check it out.

What a wonderful meal and what great service! I don't think we have been served by a most attentive and friendly staff in a long time.  Excellent cocktails, and really good appetizers.  The fish -- salmon and sea bass -- was perfectly cooked.  We'll be back again soon -- these folks know what superb food and hospitality is all about!

Place just opened, but I took a chance and I am glad I did.  Very smart, sophisticated decor.  The staff was so friendly and attentive.  I had the fried calamari appetizer and the pasta special of the day, which was rigatoni with a spicy red sauce and broccoli.  They were both wonderful. The portions were large and I couldn't quite finish either.  If I hadn't been from out of town, I would definitely would have brunch the rest home.

The ambiance and attention to detail is top notch. From the minute you walk in, the staff shows their appreciation for the choice to dine with them. The market salad presentation was beyond and the spring lasagna was one of the most unique things I have ever eaten. I look forward to trying this place (or the Roslyn location) again soon!

The best service ever!!! Everyone in there was sure to check in on you and get you anything you need ASAP. Not to mention the food was unreal. Homemade pasta we got Cacio e pepe and the Rigatoni absolutely delicious. For an appetizer we got the special which was prosciutto and melon and the burrata both amazing. The chocolate salami dessert was very good. I highly recommend they had just opened but we had better service than we would have at any restaurant in the city.

I don't usually write reviews, but we had such a lovely time at Gatsby's Landing! They've just opened up this new location, and it is beautifully decorated inside. The service was incredible - every single person was so kind and attentive. Our server Christian was super sweet, and Danny (the manager/host?) came over to check in on us multiple times and gave us an overview of the restaurant. The food was all delicious - we had the burrata and the asparagus for the table, I can personally say the cacio e pepe was great, and my friends enjoyed their duck carbonara and special avocado pesto rigatoni. The drinks were super yummy (loved the Black Widow) and so were the bomboloni. Overall it was such a lovely experience, and we are rooting for Gatsby's to succeed. Can't wait to return to NY so we can come back. :) thanks for such a nice dinner!

Great place, just re-opened.  Had the rigatoni as recommended by Mohammad and it was delicious.  Good menu variety and quality at a decent price especially this close to time square.  Everything I saw on other tables looked good.  Will be back.
No comment

The food here was great! We sat outside in the heated tents and the temperature was wonderful. The food tasted so flavorful and the staff was so kind to us -- we actually had a reservation at the West Village location but accidentally went to the Williamsburg location. They were still able to seat us! I would definitely recommend coming here if you're looking for good sushi!!

Great spot for lunch! I recommend the furikake fries and the coconut shrimp temaki - both were delicious!! The signature set is a decent starter set for temaki, but honestly some of the pieces did not stand out like the tuna poke one. I would say to pass on the calamari too.

One of the best meals I've ever had. The hand rolls are fantastic. So clean, flavorful, and delicious. The restaurant itself is beautiful and provides such a great ambiance. A fantastic meal in the city and will definitely be coming back and try all the other rolls they have.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Finally got to try Nami Nori after it's been in my bookmarks for forever and definitely can see why all my friends hype it up. Such a solid temaki spot that isn't overly priced for the quality. My favorite one was surprisingly the Coconut Shrimp. It came out pipping hot and super crispy and even though it's not a traditional "sushi" piece, I loved the modern twist they put on it and that they included it in the menu. The XO Scallop and Aka Ebi were standouts as well.

Pricey spot, but absolutely worth the treat! Every single roll was a completely new mix of flavors and textures. As for the cocktails, the Strawberry Sting ($12) was my favorite, with the Cherry Bomb ($12) second. The clam soup appetizer ($8) is a MUST TRY; I've never had a miso soup so flavorful and rich before. The tuna dip ($16) was tasty, but not mindblowing. We tried the signature set ($28) and an additional set of 5, with the spicy lobster ($12), avocado toast ($8), spicy crab dynamite ($8), spicy tuna ($7), and crispy salmon skin ($8). The spicy lobster and spicy crab dynamite were absolutely amazing and definitely must-haves. We came right at opening time on Saturday and were able to walk in and sit at the counter, but make sure you make reservations if you want a table!
No comment

Overpriced and for what? I came to Nami Nori because I was recommended this restaurant. I wasn't wowed (mostly because of the slow service to be frank). We ordered the signature set for 2, and it was the slowest service I've experienced. We sat at the bar (literally right in front of the chef) and each temaki came out 20 minutes apart--until I complained. To be frank, it was quite delicious, and I enjoyed some temakis more than the other. Our waitress was nice. Overpriced and slow service. I don't plan on coming back.
No comment

I've heard so much about this place, and finally tried it! Started off with the crispy calamari, the sauce was delicious and the squid was super crispy! The temaki were like little sushi tacos which were very delicious! The toro scallion is my favorite, but ultimately it was quite expensive. $7-$20+ per taco, our entire bill ended up to be over $160 for 3 people for lunch. So despite it being yummy, I probably won't be going back anytime soon. The dessert was yummy too, the churros were meh, but the highlight was the lemon curd cream.

Super rude, agro, and proud. Wouldn't give them my business if you care about kind human nature. They lack the empathy we all deserve. Don't show up at 9:30 - they stop seating at 9 despite what they tell you

No comment

Absolutely love this place! Took myself on a date here and it was amazing. Nice place for solo dining as they offer the bar seats! Did the miso shishito peppers and the signature set plus a toro scallion at the end because everything was delicious. Definitely would be back.
No comment

Yummy place to try for lunch. Had a few of their appetizers and the original classic 5 hand roll. Get the fries for sure. The 5 set was good! Best piece was the coconut shrimp. Inside is very clean and spacious.

Excellent food, excellent service. They're able to cater to many dietary restrictions (allergies, vegetarian) without compromising on taste or experience. We enjoyed all the food we tried, but stand-out favorites were definitely the miso soup, tofu chimichuri temaki, and mochurros! Didn't love the Strawberry Sling drink though

No comment

Loved Nami Nori! I would go back again and again. I ordered the signature set on my first visit and I enjoyed 3 out of the 5 rolls. All were still very tasty but if I could go back, I wouldn't order the signature set again.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

The hand rolls were outstanding & pretty good for the price! I also recommend trying their yuzu sake if you like cold sweet drinks!
No comment

came here for an early dinner spontaneously with my friend and sister. they didn't have any actual tables available at 530p - they stated the only time they have left is at 930p and we didn't want to wait, so we sat at the bar table which wasn't bad at all. very clean aesthetic. we didn't get anything to drink but the "roll" sets were absolutely delicious and super cheap. i got the classic set for $28 where they give you 5 different "rolls", basically buy 4 get the cucumber one for free. the quantity is just enough to make you not feel hungry but not 100% full - so you have room for dessert haha. they have so many different roll options and they ALL are *chef kiss*. highly recommend. can't wait to come back and try more~

column3: North San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: We went to Nami Nori as a recommendation from a friend. Luckily we were able to grab at seat at the bar inside because it was pretty hot that day. The hand rolls all sounded so good and the ones we ordered did not disappoint. Would definitely come back to try more rolls.

Came here with a friend and made a reservation about 4 days in advance and saw there were still some decent times on there! Ended up sharing the nami nori salad and we both got the signature set, which felt very worth the price compared to ordering each temaki on its own. Each in the set were very good but definitely loved the x.o. scallop one the most. Each temaki is already flavored with soy sauce and wasabi, so you do not have to do it yourself, but you can request for it to be separate. The salad was delightful and would definitely recommend if you want to add some veggies in your meal.
No comment

So so good! I can't recommend this place enough. Really delicious and unique twist on Japanese food. Everything is so deeply rich and flavorful. I got the temaki set and was thoroughly impressed by each one. There's also a salad with nori dressing that is just out of this world. Truly can't wait to go back.
No comment
No comment

Hands down the best sushi I've ever had. Unique, fresh, extremely flavorful. Amazing combinations in the hand rolls that I will forever think about. I will 100% go back as many times as possible. A little pricey but absolutely worth it.

Came to the Williamsburg location and it was my first time trying. (They have another location in Manhattan as well) the rolls were fresh and good for the price you pay! Def check it out if you're in around and would recommend to get a counter seat for the full experience (:
Ambiance is nice, food is expensive and you walk out hungry.  It's boojee sushi totally prefer Burger King sushi

Nami Nori serves decent nori rolls, but it's a matter of taste, as everything is heavily seasoned, dressed, and drenched in sauces. For those looking for a more fish-centric bite, this might not be your cup of tea. The appetizers are decent, would recommend the clams. The cocktails were also not our cup of tea... they were creative, yes, but tasted like a juice cleanse. Otherwise, service was nice.
Best sushi ever!!  Wish I could give it 10 stars.  Loved the food, the tea and the ambiance (very sleek and modern).  I will return.
Super delicious! Service was great, very friendly. The rolls were perfect and loved the cocktails!

Would never recommend this place. I've never had ikura and ginger as salty as this place. The sushi rice and seaweed had no flavor. The sauce heavily coats the fish to cover up the quality and taste. Honestly the fish quality is worst than the supermarkets. The color of the salmon I got wasn't even pink, almost white. The uni piece I ordered already went bad but was served to us. I think the only good thing I can say is the service. Really friendly staff and good atmosphere.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: This is our 3rd time at the Williamsburg location (have also been to the West Village one too).  Never disappoints!  The space is pretty, and the staff is nice/attentive.  Each roll is delicious, and the entire meal is spaced out nicely.  We ordered the signature set.   For an additional roll, the uni is excellent.  Aside from the rolls, the calamari appetizer and mochi churros dessert are really good!  I also enjoyed the Strawberry cocktail.

Everything about this restaurant was amazing. From the simple clean decor, the fresh food! Omg every single piece of food was fresh! The drinks were great! And lastly the service was amazing. They were so welcoming and accommodating!
Highly recommended. Suggest seating at the counter. Great staff and service. Exceptional choices for vegetarians and non vegetarians.
The place is really chic and the sushi is delicious. The staff is really nice and I definitely recommend it
Its pretty solid; love the way the menu works - they basically keep the food comin' right outta the chefs hand and into your miuth. Great cockail with saki.

Really solid and enjoyable food experience.  Ordered a bunch of temaki and the calamari app. This was my first time eating temaki and this was certainly a good first impression. The spicy crab dynamite and toro really stood out. Also their matcharita was unique and flavorful.

I was super excited for a hand roll place to open in the neighborhood, but this just isn't it. First of all the rolls are wrapped in "plant" plastic, which still takes a ton of energy to make and is unnecessary given that they're bite size. The rice isn't even warm so the nori melting or sagging shouldn't be an issue. Sauces were bland and fish was more like a "smash" than fresh pieces. Wait staff was super attentive and the decor is well thought out (although a bit too "Manhattan" for my taste and the area). I got a glass of delicious sake, the calamari which was lovely and four hand rolls but I don't think I'd go back...
Amazing atmosphere and even better food. Great staff & the coconut shrimp is other worldly. Will be back

first of all the place is so beautiful. second of all the food was amazing. did the signature set. also loved the clams, crispy rice with tuna and mushroom. furikake fries were also delish. don't forget the churros. will def be coming back
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The best breakfast BURRITO I have ever had!!! And the Mexican latte was delicious and flavorful. The ambience was very warm and inviting as well. Good date breakfast spot on a rainy day.

To die for! I love chilaqueles it's my go to! Authentic without a doubt. I had the chilaquiles with steak and they were the best I've ever had. Salsa on chilaqueles is authentic and tasteful with a good kick. Everything was very flavorful. My husband had the chorizo burrito and it was very good. Sister had chilaqueles burrito with chorizo and that was my fav. 10/10. My husband got Café de la olla which is also a must and chai latte was really good as well. Owners are so nice and humble. Don't think twice just go!

Our initial dining experience in New York led us to this restaurant, which exceeded our expectations. The food was delightful, and the coffee was exceptional. While my fiancé craved the torta of chilaquiles, which could easily satisfy two individuals, I savored the green chilaquiles, complete with a fried egg, which was nothing short of delectable. Regrettably, seating was constrained, and there were no in-house restroom facilities, prompting us to deduct one star. Fortunately, our hotel was conveniently nearby, alleviating any inconvenience caused.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great place for a casual breakfast/lunch/brunch. It's small but nicely decorated and with a few tables indoors and out front. We were greeted by the owner, who was very welcoming and helpful. We had the torta with chorizo and the chilaquiles with cecina. They were both delicious, but my favorite was the torta, super flavorful and an interesting mix of textures. The latte 'cafe de olla' was also very tasty - creamy, not too sweet, and flavored with spices. I would definitely recommend checking it out!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing amazing amazing food. We got the avocado sandwich. I think it's called the Chilaquiles Sandwich. We also got two chai tea lattes and everything was amazing. Sorry for the picture. It was so good we ate it first. lol
No comment
No comment

A restaurant that just does Chilaquiles? I had to try it out when I heard about this place and it was all I'd hoped it would be. My son tried the Chilaquiles with red and green sauces and i had the torta - both of which were fantastic! The Mexican latte was super creamy and just the right amount of sweetness too. Might have to try the burrito next time.
No comment
Great service and vibes. Awesome casual a lunch spot. The food itself was OK though. Seems very authentic but it's very heavy on tortilla chips. Good new spot to try out
No comment

I had lunch here recently based upon the excellent reviews, sadly I came away completely unimpressed. The staff is very nice, the space is very clean and well set up, it was the food where they lost me. I got their namesake bowl for lunch. The sauce was quite tasty, but the problem was that almost all it was was tortilla chips drowned in the sauce. There was very little of the meat protein I had chosen, barely a couple of small bites in the entire bowl. I would equate it to a serving the size of a single slice of bacon, and maybe not even that.  I came away still hungry for some protein.

This place is cute and yummy. It is a small restuarant owned by a young friendly couple. The staff is nice, the space is lovely and the food feels homemade. Unfortunately, it is all super heavy so you can't eat here too often which is sad because it is a nice place. I wish they had some small lighter things and I would go all the time!  The coffee is good! Expensive but good.
This place is delicious! A little expensive but definitely worth it. The salsa in the chilaquiles divorciados is a little spicy but not overwhelming. The latte Mexicano is delicious, not too sweet.
Best mexican breakfast in the city, hands down! The owner and staff are also super friendly! Can't wait to come back here
Attn: Vegetarians of NYC!!! Do yourself a favor & stop by. You won't be disappointed!

Nice place. The staff was very friendly and the service was good.  The neighborhood is safe. I had the chilaquiles with salsa verde.  They were good but average.  I would recommend this place but it's not amazing. So 3.5 stars
Great food and lovely people! Had Chilaquiles divorciados, café de la Hoya latte and orange juice! Muy delicioso

I went here on September 15th because I heard they were doing a party for Mexican Independence Day. I got the chilaquila torta because I wanted to try something new. Wow it was great and just the right amount of spice. Will definitely come back for Sunday brunch
No comment
Cafe de Olla and chilaquiles omg this place is delicious and I want to now live on this block
Loved this place!! Poncho and Susana offer the best service. Don't overlook the arroz con leche and make sure to try the Mexican latte.
Chilaquiles divorciados are delicious!! My café de olla latte so good! Definitely recommend and will come back.

Finally some good and legitimate chilaquiles in NYC. I had the chilaquiles divorciados and they were amazing. Latte de olla is a must!! Will definitely be back to try their burritos and tortas! Staff is so friendly and the place is so cute and welcoming.

Mexico born and I just moved here from Texas. I have been searching for something that tasted like home. This was it. So good . I had the chilaquiles divorciados with chicharrón and egg. Will definitely be back again! The owners were attentive and so kind. 10 out of 10 for Authenticity and taste!
Amazing authentic Mexican food. Delicious! Owners are so nice! Places to sit indoors and outdoors. Would definitely come back. Highly recommend!!!
Delicious Chilaquiles! Café latte mexicano is so good highly recommend you try this place out
The chilaquiles and café de olla of my dreams! So delicious, fresh, and made with care
It was amagazin! I love the chilaquiles divorciados! please you need try the bread! It was delicious! real Mexican food
Super cute spot for a quick lunch. The torta chilaquiles was very good and filling! Mexican owned so you know it's going to be good. Will definitely be back to try more stuff from the menu!
Excellent!!  Both red and green sauces are tasty and have a great depth of flavor.  Portions are much bigger than they look in the pics.

Amazing service! The Food is delicious but the café de la olla is the point to get! I come to get that everyday! I love this place I really recommend it for people who loves Mexican coffe and food go to La Chilaqueria!
Excellent burrito. I've been living in San Diego for years and this is the closest I've had.
